Hebrew: וְהַמֶּ֤לֶךְ דָּוִד֙ זָקֵ֔ן בָּ֖א בַּיָּמִ֑ים וַיְכַסֻּ֙הוּ֙ בַּבְּגָדִ֔ים וְלֹ֥א יִחַ֖ם לֽוֹ׃
Translated: King David was now old, advanced in years; and though they covered him with bedclothes, he never felt warm.
Transliteration: vehamelekhe david zaken va vayamiym vayekhasuhu vavegadiym velo yicham lvo

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֧אמְרוּ ל֣וֹ עֲבָדָ֗יו יְבַקְשׁ֞וּ לַאדֹנִ֤י הַמֶּ֙לֶךְ֙ נַעֲרָ֣ה בְתוּלָ֔ה וְעָֽמְדָה֙ לִפְנֵ֣י הַמֶּ֔לֶךְ וּתְהִי־ל֖וֹ סֹכֶ֑נֶת וְשָׁכְבָ֣ה בְחֵיקֶ֔ךָ וְחַ֖ם לַאדֹנִ֥י הַמֶּֽלֶךְ׃
Translated: His courtiers said to him, “Let a young virgin be sought for my lord the king, to wait upon Your Majesty and be his attendant; and let her lie in your bosom, and my lord the king will be warm.”
Transliteration: vayomeru lvo avadayv yevakeshu ladoniy hamelekhe naarah vetulah veamedah lifeney hamelekhe utehiy-lvo sokhenet veshakhevah vecheykekha vecham ladoniy hamelekhe

Hebrew: וַיְבַקְשׁוּ֙ נַעֲרָ֣ה יָפָ֔ה בְּכֹ֖ל גְּב֣וּל יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל וַֽיִּמְצְא֗וּ אֶת־אֲבִישַׁג֙ הַשּׁ֣וּנַמִּ֔ית וַיָּבִ֥אוּ אֹתָ֖הּ לַמֶּֽלֶךְ׃
Translated: So they looked for a beautiful young woman throughout the territory of Israel. They found Abishag the Shunammite and brought her to the king.
Transliteration: vayevakeshu naarah yafah vekhol gevul yisherael vayimetseu et-aviyshag hashunamiyt vayaviu otah lamelekhe

Hebrew: וְהַֽנַּעֲרָ֖ה יָפָ֣ה עַד־מְאֹ֑ד וַתְּהִ֨י לַמֶּ֤לֶךְ סֹכֶ֙נֶת֙ וַתְּשָׁ֣רְתֵ֔הוּ וְהַמֶּ֖לֶךְ לֹ֥א יְדָעָֽהּ׃
Translated: This young woman was exceedingly beautiful. She became the king’s attendant and waited upon him; but the king was not intimate with her.
Transliteration: vehanaarah yafah ad-meod vatehiy lamelekhe sokhenet vatesharetehu vehamelekhe lo yedaah

Hebrew: וַאֲדֹנִיָּ֧ה בֶן־חַגִּ֛ית מִתְנַשֵּׂ֥א לֵאמֹ֖ר אֲנִ֣י אֶמְלֹ֑ךְ וַיַּ֣עַשׂ ל֗וֹ רֶ֚כֶב וּפָ֣רָשִׁ֔ים וַחֲמִשִּׁ֥ים אִ֖ישׁ רָצִ֥ים לְפָנָֽיו׃
Translated: Now Adonijah son of Haggith went about boasting, “I will be king!” He provided himself with chariots and horses, and an escort of fifty outrunners.
Transliteration: vaadoniyah ven-chagiyt mitenashe lemor aniy emelokhe vayaash lvo rekhev ufarashiym vachamishiym iysh ratsiym lefanayv

Hebrew: וְלֹֽא־עֲצָב֨וֹ אָבִ֤יו מִיָּמָיו֙ לֵאמֹ֔ר מַדּ֖וּעַ כָּ֣כָה עָשִׂ֑יתָ וְגַם־ה֤וּא טֽוֹב־תֹּ֙אַר֙ מְאֹ֔ד וְאֹת֥וֹ יָלְדָ֖ה אַחֲרֵ֥י אַבְשָׁלֽוֹם׃
Translated: His father had never scolded him: “Why did you do that?” He was the one born after Absalom and, like him, was very handsome.
Transliteration: velo-atsavvo aviyv miyamayv lemor madua khakhah ashiyta vegam-hu tvov-toar meod veotvo yaledah acharey aveshalvom

Hebrew: וַיִּהְי֣וּ דְבָרָ֔יו עִ֚ם יוֹאָ֣ב בֶּן־צְרוּיָ֔ה וְעִ֖ם אֶבְיָתָ֣ר הַכֹּהֵ֑ן וַֽיַּעְזְר֔וּ אַחֲרֵ֖י אֲדֹנִיָּֽה׃
Translated: He conferred with Joab son of Zeruiah and with the priest Abiathar, and they supported Adonijah;
Transliteration: vayiheyu devarayv im yvoav ven-tseruyah veim eveyatar hakhohen vayaezeru acharey adoniyah

Hebrew: וְצָד֣וֹק הַ֠כֹּהֵ֠ן וּבְנָיָ֨הוּ בֶן־יְהוֹיָדָ֜ע וְנָתָ֤ן הַנָּבִיא֙ וְשִׁמְעִ֣י וְרֵעִ֔י וְהַגִּבּוֹרִ֖ים אֲשֶׁ֣ר לְדָוִ֑ד לֹ֥א הָי֖וּ עִם־אֲדֹנִיָּֽהוּ׃
Translated: but the priest Zadok, Benaiah son of Jehoiada, the prophet Nathan, Shimei and Rei, and David’s own warriors did not side with Adonijah.
Transliteration: vetsadvok hakhohen uvenayahu ven-yehvoyada venatan hanaviy veshimeiy vereiy vehagivvoriym asher ledavid lo hayu im-adoniyahu

Hebrew: וַיִּזְבַּ֣ח אֲדֹנִיָּ֗הוּ צֹ֤אן וּבָקָר֙ וּמְרִ֔יא עִ֚ם אֶ֣בֶן הַזֹּחֶ֔לֶת אֲשֶׁר־אֵ֖צֶל עֵ֣ין רֹגֵ֑ל וַיִּקְרָ֗א אֶת־כׇּל־אֶחָיו֙ בְּנֵ֣י הַמֶּ֔לֶךְ וּלְכׇל־אַנְשֵׁ֥י יְהוּדָ֖ה עַבְדֵ֥י הַמֶּֽלֶךְ׃
Translated: Adonijah made a sacrificial feast of sheep, oxen, and fatlings at the Zoheleth stone that is near En-rogel; he invited all his brother princes and all the king’s courtiers of the tribe of Judah;
Transliteration: vayizevach adoniyahu tson uvakar umeriy im even hazochelet asher-etsel eyn rogel vayikera et-khׇl-echayv veney hamelekhe ulekhׇl-aneshey yehudah avedey hamelekhe

Hebrew: וְֽאֶת־נָתָן֩ הַנָּבִ֨יא וּבְנָיָ֜הוּ וְֽאֶת־הַגִּבּוֹרִ֛ים וְאֶת־שְׁלֹמֹ֥ה אָחִ֖יו לֹ֥א קָרָֽא׃
Translated: but he did not invite the prophet Nathan, or Benaiah, or the warriors, or his brother Solomon.
Transliteration: veet-natan hanaviy uvenayahu veet-hagivvoriym veet-shelomoh achiyv lo kara

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר נָתָ֗ן אֶל־בַּת־שֶׁ֤בַע אֵם־שְׁלֹמֹה֙ לֵאמֹ֔ר הֲל֣וֹא שָׁמַ֔עַתְּ כִּ֥י מָלַ֖ךְ אֲדֹנִיָּ֣הוּ בֶן־חַגִּ֑ית וַאֲדֹנֵ֥ינוּ דָוִ֖ד לֹ֥א יָדָֽע׃
Translated: Then Nathan said to Bathsheba, Solomon’s mother, “You must have heard that Adonijah son of Haggith has assumed the kingship without the knowledge of our lord David.
Transliteration: vayomer natan el-vat-sheva em-shelomoh lemor halvo shamaate khiy malakhe adoniyahu ven-chagiyt vaadoneynu david lo yada

Hebrew: וְעַתָּ֕ה לְכִ֛י אִיעָצֵ֥ךְ נָ֖א עֵצָ֑ה וּמַלְּטִי֙ אֶת־נַפְשֵׁ֔ךְ וְאֶת־נֶ֥פֶשׁ בְּנֵ֖ךְ שְׁלֹמֹֽה׃
Translated: Now take my advice, so that you may save your life and the life of your son Solomon.
Transliteration: veatah lekhiy iyatsekhe na etsah umaletiy et-nafeshekhe veet-nefesh venekhe shelomoh

Hebrew: לְכִ֞י וּבֹ֣אִי ׀ אֶל־הַמֶּ֣לֶךְ דָּוִ֗ד וְאָמַ֤רְתְּ אֵלָיו֙ הֲלֹֽא־אַתָּ֞ה אֲדֹנִ֣י הַמֶּ֗לֶךְ נִשְׁבַּ֤עְתָּ לַאֲמָֽתְךָ֙ לֵאמֹ֔ר כִּֽי־שְׁלֹמֹ֤ה בְנֵךְ֙ יִמְלֹ֣ךְ אַחֲרַ֔י וְה֖וּא יֵשֵׁ֣ב עַל־כִּסְאִ֑י וּמַדּ֖וּעַ מָלַ֥ךְ אֲדֹנִיָּֽהוּ׃
Translated: Go immediately to King David and say to him, ‘Did not you, O lord king, swear to your maidservant: “Your son Solomon shall succeed me as king, and he shall sit upon my throne”? Then why has Adonijah become king?’
Transliteration: lekhiy uvoiy el-hamelekhe david veamarete elayv halo-atah adoniy hamelekhe nishevaeta laamatekha lemor khiy-shelomoh venekhe yimelokhe acharay vehu eishev al-khiseiy umadua malakhe adoniyahu

Hebrew: הִנֵּ֗ה עוֹדָ֛ךְ מְדַבֶּ֥רֶת שָׁ֖ם עִם־הַמֶּ֑לֶךְ וַֽאֲנִי֙ אָב֣וֹא אַחֲרַ֔יִךְ וּמִלֵּאתִ֖י אֶת־דְּבָרָֽיִךְ׃
Translated: While you are still there talking with the king, I will come in after you and confirm your words.”
Transliteration: hineh vodakhe medaveret sham im-hamelekhe vaaniy avvo acharayiikhe umiletiy et-devarayiikhe

Hebrew: וַתָּבֹ֨א בַת־שֶׁ֤בַע אֶל־הַמֶּ֙לֶךְ֙ הַחַ֔דְרָה וְהַמֶּ֖לֶךְ זָקֵ֣ן מְאֹ֑ד וַאֲבִישַׁג֙ הַשּׁ֣וּנַמִּ֔ית מְשָׁרַ֖ת אֶת־הַמֶּֽלֶךְ׃
Translated: So Bathsheba went to the king in his chamber.—The king was very old, and Abishag the Shunammite was waiting on the king.—
Transliteration: vatavo vat-sheva el-hamelekhe hachaderah vehamelekhe zaken meod vaaviyshag hashunamiyt mesharat et-hamelekhe

Hebrew: וַתִּקֹּ֣ד בַּת־שֶׁ֔בַע וַתִּשְׁתַּ֖חוּ לַמֶּ֑לֶךְ וַיֹּ֥אמֶר הַמֶּ֖לֶךְ מַה־לָּֽךְ׃
Translated: Bathsheba bowed low in homage to the king; and the king asked, “What troubles you?”
Transliteration: vatikod vat-sheva vatishetachu lamelekhe vayomer hamelekhe mah-lakhe

Hebrew: וַתֹּ֣אמֶר ל֗וֹ אֲדֹנִי֙ אַתָּ֨ה נִשְׁבַּ֜עְתָּ בַּיהֹוָ֤ה אֱלֹהֶ֙יךָ֙ לַאֲמָתֶ֔ךָ כִּֽי־שְׁלֹמֹ֥ה בְנֵ֖ךְ יִמְלֹ֣ךְ אַחֲרָ֑י וְה֖וּא יֵשֵׁ֥ב עַל־כִּסְאִֽי׃
Translated: She answered him, “My lord, you yourself swore to your maidservant by the E<small>TERNAL</small> your God: ‘Your son Solomon shall succeed me as king, and he shall sit upon my throne.’
Transliteration: vatomer lvo adoniy atah nishevaeta vayhovah eloheykha laamatekha khiy-shelomoh venekhe yimelokhe acharay vehu eishev al-khiseiy

Hebrew: וְעַתָּ֕ה הִנֵּ֥ה אֲדֹנִיָּ֖ה מָלָ֑ךְ וְעַתָּ֛ה אֲדֹנִ֥י הַמֶּ֖לֶךְ לֹ֥א יָדָֽעְתָּ׃
Translated: Yet now Adonijah has become king, and you, my lord the king, know nothing about it.
Transliteration: veatah hineh adoniyah malakhe veatah adoniy hamelekhe lo yadaeta

Hebrew:
וַ֠יִּזְבַּ֠ח שׁ֥וֹר וּֽמְרִיא־וְצֹאן֮ לָרֹב֒ {פ}
וַיִּקְרָא֙ לְכׇל־בְּנֵ֣י הַמֶּ֔לֶךְ וּלְאֶבְיָתָר֙ הַכֹּהֵ֔ן וּלְיֹאָ֖ב שַׂ֣ר הַצָּבָ֑א וְלִשְׁלֹמֹ֥ה עַבְדְּךָ֖ לֹ֥א קָרָֽא׃
Translated: He has prepared a sacrificial feast of a great many oxen, fatlings, and sheep, and he has invited all the king’s sons and Abiathar the priest and Joab commander of the army; but he has not invited your servant Solomon.
Transliteration:
vayizevach shvor umeriy-vetson larov {f}
vayikera lekhׇl-veney hamelekhe uleeveyatar hakhohen uleyoav shar hatsava velishelomoh avedekha lo kara

Hebrew: וְאַתָּה֙ אֲדֹנִ֣י הַמֶּ֔לֶךְ עֵינֵ֥י כׇל־יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל עָלֶ֑יךָ לְהַגִּ֣יד לָהֶ֔ם מִ֗י יֵשֵׁ֛ב עַל־כִּסֵּ֥א אֲדֹנִֽי־הַמֶּ֖לֶךְ אַחֲרָֽיו׃
Translated: And so the eyes of all Israel are upon you, O lord king, to tell them who shall succeed my lord the king on the throne.
Transliteration: veatah adoniy hamelekhe eyney khׇl-yisherael aleykha lehagiyd lahem miy eishev al-khise adoniy-hamelekhe acharayv

Hebrew: וְהָיָ֕ה כִּשְׁכַ֥ב אֲדֹנִֽי־הַמֶּ֖לֶךְ עִם־אֲבֹתָ֑יו וְהָיִ֗יתִי אֲנִ֛י וּבְנִ֥י שְׁלֹמֹ֖ה חַטָּאִֽים׃
Translated: Otherwise, when my lord the king rests with his ancestors, my son Solomon and I will be regarded as traitors.”
Transliteration: vehayah khishekhav adoniy-hamelekhe im-avotayv vehayiytiy aniy uveniy shelomoh chataiym

Hebrew: וְהִנֵּ֛ה עוֹדֶ֥נָּה מְדַבֶּ֖רֶת עִם־הַמֶּ֑לֶךְ וְנָתָ֥ן הַנָּבִ֖יא בָּֽא׃
Translated: She was still talking to the king when the prophet Nathan arrived.
Transliteration: vehineh vodenah medaveret im-hamelekhe venatan hanaviy va

Hebrew: וַיַּגִּ֤ידוּ לַמֶּ֙לֶךְ֙ לֵאמֹ֔ר הִנֵּ֖ה נָתָ֣ן הַנָּבִ֑יא וַיָּבֹא֙ לִפְנֵ֣י הַמֶּ֔לֶךְ וַיִּשְׁתַּ֧חוּ לַמֶּ֛לֶךְ עַל־אַפָּ֖יו אָֽרְצָה׃
Translated: They announced to the king, “The prophet Nathan is here,” and he entered the king’s presence. Bowing low to the king with his face to the ground,
Transliteration: vayagiydu lamelekhe lemor hineh natan hanaviy vayavo lifeney hamelekhe vayishetachu lamelekhe al-afayv aretsah

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֘אמֶר֮ נָתָן֒ אֲדֹנִ֣י הַמֶּ֔לֶךְ אַתָּ֣ה אָמַ֔רְתָּ אֲדֹנִיָּ֖הוּ יִמְלֹ֣ךְ אַחֲרָ֑י וְה֖וּא יֵשֵׁ֥ב עַל־כִּסְאִֽי׃
Translated: Nathan said, “O lord king, you must have said, ‘Adonijah shall succeed me as king and he shall sit upon my throne.’
Transliteration: vayomer natan adoniy hamelekhe atah amareta adoniyahu yimelokhe acharay vehu eishev al-khiseiy

Hebrew: כִּ֣י ׀ יָרַ֣ד הַיּ֗וֹם וַ֠יִּזְבַּ֠ח שׁ֥וֹר וּֽמְרִיא־וְצֹאן֮ לָרֹב֒ וַיִּקְרָא֩ לְכׇל־בְּנֵ֨י הַמֶּ֜לֶךְ וּלְשָׂרֵ֤י הַצָּבָא֙ וּלְאֶבְיָתָ֣ר הַכֹּהֵ֔ן וְהִנָּ֛ם אֹכְלִ֥ים וְשֹׁתִ֖ים לְפָנָ֑יו וַיֹּ֣אמְר֔וּ יְחִ֖י הַמֶּ֥לֶךְ אֲדֹנִיָּֽהוּ׃
Translated: For he has gone down today and prepared a sacrificial feast of a great many oxen, fatlings, and sheep. He invited all the king’s sons and the army officers and Abiathar the priest. At this very moment they are eating and drinking with him, and they are shouting, ‘Long live King Adonijah!’
Transliteration: khiy yarad hayyvom vayizevach shvor umeriy-vetson larov vayikera lekhׇl-veney hamelekhe ulesharey hatsava uleeveyatar hakhohen vehinam okheliym veshotiym lefanayv vayomeru yechiy hamelekhe adoniyahu

Hebrew: וְלִ֣י אֲנִֽי־עַ֠בְדֶּ֠ךָ וּלְצָדֹ֨ק הַכֹּהֵ֜ן וְלִבְנָיָ֧הוּ בֶן־יְהוֹיָדָ֛ע וְלִשְׁלֹמֹ֥ה עַבְדְּךָ֖ לֹ֥א קָרָֽא׃
Translated: But he did not invite me your servant, or the priest Zadok, or Benaiah son of Jehoiada, or your servant Solomon.
Transliteration: veliy aniy-avedekha uletsadok hakhohen velivenayahu ven-yehvoyada velishelomoh avedekha lo kara

Hebrew: אִ֗ם מֵאֵת֙ אֲדֹנִ֣י הַמֶּ֔לֶךְ נִֽהְיָ֖ה הַדָּבָ֣ר הַזֶּ֑ה וְלֹ֤א הוֹדַ֙עְתָּ֙ אֶֽת־[עַבְדְּךָ֔] (עבדיך) מִ֗י יֵשֵׁ֛ב עַל־כִּסֵּ֥א אֲדֹנִֽי־הַמֶּ֖לֶךְ אַחֲרָֽיו׃ {ס}
Translated: Can this decision have come from my lord the king, without your telling your servant who is to succeed to the throne of my lord the king?”
Transliteration: im meet adoniy hamelekhe niheyah hadavar hazeh velo hvodaeta et-[avedekha] (vdykh) miy eishev al-khise adoniy-hamelekhe acharayv {s}

Hebrew: וַיַּ֨עַן הַמֶּ֤לֶךְ דָּוִד֙ וַיֹּ֔אמֶר קִרְאוּ־לִ֖י לְבַת־שָׁ֑בַע וַתָּבֹא֙ לִפְנֵ֣י הַמֶּ֔לֶךְ וַֽתַּעֲמֹ֖ד לִפְנֵ֥י הַמֶּֽלֶךְ׃
Translated: King David’s response was: “Summon Bathsheba!” She entered the king’s presence and stood before the king.
Transliteration: vayaan hamelekhe david vayomer kireu-liy levat-shava vatavo lifeney hamelekhe vataamod lifeney hamelekhe

Hebrew: וַיִּשָּׁבַ֥ע הַמֶּ֖לֶךְ וַיֹּאמַ֑ר חַי־יְהֹוָ֕ה אֲשֶׁר־פָּדָ֥ה אֶת־נַפְשִׁ֖י מִכׇּל־צָרָֽה׃
Translated: And the king took an oath, saying, “As G<small>OD</small> lives, who has rescued me from every trouble:
Transliteration: vayishava hamelekhe vayomar chay-yehovah asher-fadah et-nafeshiy mikhׇl-tsarah

Hebrew: כִּ֡י כַּאֲשֶׁר֩ נִשְׁבַּ֨עְתִּי לָ֜ךְ בַּיהֹוָ֨ה אֱלֹהֵ֤י יִשְׂרָאֵל֙ לֵאמֹ֔ר כִּֽי־שְׁלֹמֹ֤ה בְנֵךְ֙ יִמְלֹ֣ךְ אַחֲרַ֔י וְה֛וּא יֵשֵׁ֥ב עַל־כִּסְאִ֖י תַּחְתָּ֑י כִּ֛י כֵּ֥ן אֶעֱשֶׂ֖ה הַיּ֥וֹם הַזֶּֽה׃
Translated: The oath I swore to you by the E<small>TERNAL</small>, the God of Israel, that your son Solomon should succeed me as king and that he should sit upon my throne in my stead, I will fulfill this very day!”
Transliteration: khiy khaasher nishevaetiy lakhe vayhovah elohey yisherael lemor khiy-shelomoh venekhe yimelokhe acharay vehu eishev al-khiseiy tachetay khiy khen eesheh hayyvom hazeh

Hebrew: וַתִּקֹּ֨ד בַּת־שֶׁ֤בַע אַפַּ֙יִם֙ אֶ֔רֶץ וַתִּשְׁתַּ֖חוּ לַמֶּ֑לֶךְ וַתֹּ֕אמֶר יְחִ֗י אֲדֹנִ֛י הַמֶּ֥לֶךְ דָּוִ֖ד לְעֹלָֽם׃ {פ}
Translated: Bathsheba bowed low in homage to the king with her face to the ground, and she said, “May my lord King David live forever!”
Transliteration: vatikod vat-sheva afayiim erets vatishetachu lamelekhe vatomer yechiy adoniy hamelekhe david leolam {f}

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר ׀ הַמֶּ֣לֶךְ דָּוִ֗ד קִרְאוּ־לִ֞י לְצָד֤וֹק הַכֹּהֵן֙ וּלְנָתָ֣ן הַנָּבִ֔יא וְלִבְנָיָ֖הוּ בֶּן־יְהוֹיָדָ֑ע וַיָּבֹ֖אוּ לִפְנֵ֥י הַמֶּֽלֶךְ׃
Translated: Then King David said, “Summon to me the priest Zadok, the prophet Nathan, and Benaiah son of Jehoiada.” When they came before the king,
Transliteration: vayomer hamelekhe david kireu-liy letsadvok hakhohen ulenatan hanaviy velivenayahu ven-yehvoyada vayavou lifeney hamelekhe

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר הַמֶּ֜לֶךְ לָהֶ֗ם קְח֤וּ עִמָּכֶם֙ אֶת־עַבְדֵ֣י אֲדֹנֵיכֶ֔ם וְהִרְכַּבְתֶּם֙ אֶת־שְׁלֹמֹ֣ה בְנִ֔י עַל־הַפִּרְדָּ֖ה אֲשֶׁר־לִ֑י וְהוֹרַדְתֶּ֥ם אֹת֖וֹ אֶל־גִּחֽוֹן׃
Translated: the king said to them, “Take my loyal soldiers, and have my son Solomon ride on my mule and bring him down to Gihon.
Transliteration: vayomer hamelekhe lahem kechu imakhem et-avedey adoneykhem vehirekhavetem et-shelomoh veniy al-hafiredah asher-liy vehvoradetem otvo el-gichvon

Hebrew: וּמָשַׁ֣ח אֹת֣וֹ שָׁ֠ם צָד֨וֹק הַכֹּהֵ֜ן וְנָתָ֧ן הַנָּבִ֛יא לְמֶ֖לֶךְ עַל־יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל וּתְקַעְתֶּם֙ בַּשּׁוֹפָ֔ר וַאֲמַרְתֶּ֕ם יְחִ֖י הַמֶּ֥לֶךְ שְׁלֹמֹֽה׃
Translated: Let the priest Zadok and the prophet Nathan anoint him there king over Israel, whereupon you shall sound the horn and shout, ‘Long live King Solomon!’
Transliteration: umashach otvo sham tsadvok hakhohen venatan hanaviy lemelekhe al-yisherael utekaetem vashvofar vaamaretem yechiy hamelekhe shelomoh

Hebrew: וַעֲלִיתֶ֣ם אַחֲרָ֗יו וּבָא֙ וְיָשַׁ֣ב עַל־כִּסְאִ֔י וְה֥וּא יִמְלֹ֖ךְ תַּחְתָּ֑י וְאֹת֤וֹ צִוִּ֙יתִי֙ לִֽהְי֣וֹת נָגִ֔יד עַל־יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל וְעַל־יְהוּדָֽה׃
Translated: Then march up after him, and let him come in and sit on my throne. For he shall succeed me as king; him I designate to be ruler of Israel and Judah.”
Transliteration: vaaliytem acharayv uva veyashav al-khiseiy vehu yimelokhe tachetay veotvo tsiviytiy liheyvot nagiyd al-yisherael veal-yehudah

Hebrew: וַיַּ֨עַן בְּנָיָ֧הוּ בֶן־יְהוֹיָדָ֛ע אֶת־הַמֶּ֖לֶךְ וַיֹּ֣אמֶר <small>׀</small> אָמֵ֑ן כֵּ֚ן יֹאמַ֣ר יְהֹוָ֔ה אֱלֹהֵ֖י אֲדֹנִ֥י הַמֶּֽלֶךְ׃
Translated: Benaiah son of Jehoiada spoke up and said to the king, “Amen! And may the E<small>TERNAL</small>, the God of my lord the king, so ordain.
Transliteration: vayaan venayahu ven-yehvoyada et-hamelekhe vayomer <small></small> amen khen yomar yehovah elohey adoniy hamelekhe

Hebrew: כַּאֲשֶׁ֨ר הָיָ֤ה יְהֹוָה֙ עִם־אֲדֹנִ֣י הַמֶּ֔לֶךְ כֵּ֖ן (יהי) [יִהְיֶ֣ה] עִם־שְׁלֹמֹ֑ה וִֽיגַדֵּל֙ אֶת־כִּסְא֔וֹ מִ֨כִּסֵּ֔א אֲדֹנִ֖י הַמֶּ֥לֶךְ דָּוִֽד׃
Translated: As G<small>OD</small> was with my lord the king, so may it be with Solomon; and may his throne be exalted even higher than the throne of my lord King David.”
Transliteration: khaasher hayah yehovah im-adoniy hamelekhe khen (yhy) [yiheyeh] im-shelomoh viygadel et-khisevo mikhise adoniy hamelekhe david

Hebrew: וַיֵּ֣רֶד צָד֣וֹק הַ֠כֹּהֵ֠ן וְנָתָ֨ן הַנָּבִ֜יא וּבְנָיָ֣הוּ בֶן־יְהוֹיָדָ֗ע וְהַכְּרֵתִי֙ וְהַפְּלֵתִ֔י וַיַּרְכִּ֙בוּ֙ אֶת־שְׁלֹמֹ֔ה עַל־פִּרְדַּ֖ת הַמֶּ֣לֶךְ דָּוִ֑ד וַיֹּלִ֥כוּ אֹת֖וֹ עַל־גִּחֽוֹן׃
Translated: Then the priest Zadok, and the prophet Nathan, and Benaiah son of Jehoiada went down with the Cherethites and the Pelethites. They had Solomon ride on King David’s mule and they led him to Gihon.
Transliteration: vayered tsadvok hakhohen venatan hanaviy uvenayahu ven-yehvoyada vehakheretiy vehafeletiy vayarekhivu et-shelomoh al-firedat hamelekhe david vayolikhu otvo al-gichvon

Hebrew: וַיִּקַּח֩ צָד֨וֹק הַכֹּהֵ֜ן אֶת־קֶ֤רֶן הַשֶּׁ֙מֶן֙ מִן־הָאֹ֔הֶל וַיִּמְשַׁ֖ח אֶת־שְׁלֹמֹ֑ה וַֽיִּתְקְעוּ֙ בַּשּׁוֹפָ֔ר וַיֹּֽאמְרוּ֙ כׇּל־הָעָ֔ם יְחִ֖י הַמֶּ֥לֶךְ שְׁלֹמֹֽה׃
Translated: The priest Zadok took the horn of oil from the Tent and anointed Solomon. They sounded the horn and all the people shouted, “Long live King Solomon!”
Transliteration: vayikach tsadvok hakhohen et-keren hashemen min-haohel vayimeshach et-shelomoh vayitekeu vashvofar vayomeru khׇl-haam yechiy hamelekhe shelomoh

Hebrew: וַיַּעֲל֤וּ כׇל־הָעָם֙ אַחֲרָ֔יו וְהָעָם֙ מְחַלְּלִ֣ים בַּחֲלִלִ֔ים וּשְׂמֵחִ֖ים שִׂמְחָ֣ה גְדוֹלָ֑ה וַתִּבָּקַ֥ע הָאָ֖רֶץ בְּקוֹלָֽם׃
Translated: All the people then marched up behind him, playing on flutes and making merry till the earth was split open by the uproar.
Transliteration: vayaalu khׇl-haam acharayv vehaam mechaleliym vachaliliym ushemechiym shimechah gedvolah vativaka haarets vekvolam

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׁמַ֣ע אֲדֹנִיָּ֗הוּ וְכׇל־הַקְּרֻאִים֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר אִתּ֔וֹ וְהֵ֖ם כִּלּ֣וּ לֶאֱכֹ֑ל וַיִּשְׁמַ֤ע יוֹאָב֙ אֶת־ק֣וֹל הַשּׁוֹפָ֔ר וַיֹּ֕אמֶר מַדּ֥וּעַ קֽוֹל־הַקִּרְיָ֖ה הוֹמָֽה׃
Translated: Adonijah and all the guests who were with him, who had just finished eating, heard it. When Joab heard the sound of the horn, he said, “Why is the city in such an uproar?”
Transliteration: vayishema adoniyahu vekhׇl-hakeruiym asher itvo vehem khilu leekhol vayishema yvoav et-kvol hashvofar vayomer madua kvol-hakireyah hvomah

Hebrew: עוֹדֶ֣נּוּ מְדַבֵּ֔ר וְהִנֵּ֧ה יוֹנָתָ֛ן בֶּן־אֶבְיָתָ֥ר הַכֹּהֵ֖ן בָּ֑א וַיֹּ֤אמֶר אֲדֹנִיָּ֙הוּ֙ בֹּ֔א כִּ֣י אִ֥ישׁ חַ֛יִל אַ֖תָּה וְט֥וֹב תְּבַשֵּֽׂר׃
Translated: He was still speaking when the priest Jonathan son of Abiathar arrived. “Come in,” said Adonijah. “You are a worthy man, and you surely bring good news.”
Transliteration: vodenu medaver vehineh yvonatan ven-eveyatar hakhohen va vayomer adoniyahu vo khiy iysh chayiil atah vetvov tevasher

Hebrew: וַיַּ֙עַן֙ יֽוֹנָתָ֔ן וַיֹּ֖אמֶר לַאֲדֹנִיָּ֑הוּ אֲבָ֕ל אֲדֹנֵ֥ינוּ הַמֶּלֶךְ־דָּוִ֖ד הִמְלִ֥יךְ אֶת־שְׁלֹמֹֽה׃
Translated: But Jonathan replied to Adonijah, “Alas, our lord King David has made Solomon king!
Transliteration: vayaan yvonatan vayomer laadoniyahu aval adoneynu hamelekhe-david himeliykhe et-shelomoh

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׁלַ֣ח אִתּֽוֹ־הַ֠מֶּ֠לֶךְ אֶת־צָד֨וֹק הַכֹּהֵ֜ן וְאֶת־נָתָ֣ן הַנָּבִ֗יא וּבְנָיָ֙הוּ֙ בֶּן־יְה֣וֹיָדָ֔ע וְהַכְּרֵתִ֖י וְהַפְּלֵתִ֑י וַיַּרְכִּ֣בוּ אֹת֔וֹ עַ֖ל פִּרְדַּ֥ת הַמֶּֽלֶךְ׃
Translated: The king sent with him the priest Zadok and the prophet Nathan and Benaiah son of Jehoiada, and the Cherethites and Pelethites. They had him ride on the king’s mule,
Transliteration: vayishelach itvo-hamelekhe et-tsadvok hakhohen veet-natan hanaviy uvenayahu ven-yehvoyada vehakheretiy vehafeletiy vayarekhivu otvo al firedat hamelekhe

Hebrew: וַיִּמְשְׁח֣וּ אֹת֡וֹ צָד֣וֹק הַכֹּהֵ֣ן וְנָתָן֩ הַנָּבִ֨יא <small>׀</small> לְמֶ֜לֶךְ בְּגִח֗וֹן וַיַּעֲל֤וּ מִשָּׁם֙ שְׂמֵחִ֔ים וַתֵּהֹ֖ם הַקִּרְיָ֑ה ה֥וּא הַקּ֖וֹל אֲשֶׁ֥ר שְׁמַעְתֶּֽם׃
Translated: and the priest Zadok and the prophet Nathan anointed him king at Gihon. Then they came up from there making merry, and the city went into an uproar. That’s the noise you heard.
Transliteration: vayimeshechu otvo tsadvok hakhohen venatan hanaviy <small></small> lemelekhe vegichvon vayaalu misham shemechiym vatehom hakireyah hu hakvol asher shemaetem

Hebrew: וְגַם֙ יָשַׁ֣ב שְׁלֹמֹ֔ה עַ֖ל כִּסֵּ֥א הַמְּלוּכָֽה׃
Translated: Further, Solomon seated himself on the royal throne;
Transliteration: vegam yashav shelomoh al khise hamelukhah

Hebrew: וְגַם־בָּ֜אוּ עַבְדֵ֣י הַמֶּ֗לֶךְ לְ֠בָרֵ֠ךְ אֶת־אֲדֹנֵ֜ינוּ הַמֶּ֣לֶךְ דָּוִד֮ לֵאמֹר֒ יֵיטֵ֨ב (אלהיך) [אֱלֹהִ֜ים] אֶת־שֵׁ֤ם שְׁלֹמֹה֙ מִשְּׁמֶ֔ךָ וִיגַדֵּ֥ל אֶת־כִּסְא֖וֹ מִכִּסְאֶ֑ךָ וַיִּשְׁתַּ֥חוּ הַמֶּ֖לֶךְ עַל־הַמִּשְׁכָּֽב׃
Translated: further, the king’s courtiers came to congratulate our lord King David, saying, ‘May God make the renown of Solomon even greater than yours, and may his throne be exalted even higher than yours!’ And the king bowed low on his couch.
Transliteration: vegam-vau avedey hamelekhe levarekhe et-adoneynu hamelekhe david lemor eiytev (lhykh) [Elohim] et-shem shelomoh mishemekha viygadel et-khisevo mikhiseekha vayishetachu hamelekhe al-hamishekhav

Hebrew: וְגַם־כָּ֖כָה אָמַ֣ר הַמֶּ֑לֶךְ בָּר֨וּךְ יְהֹוָ֜ה אֱלֹהֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֗ל אֲשֶׁ֨ר נָתַ֥ן הַיּ֛וֹם יֹשֵׁ֥ב עַל־כִּסְאִ֖י וְעֵינַ֥י רֹאֽוֹת׃
Translated: And further, this is what the king said, ‘Praised be the E<small>TERNAL</small>, the God of Israel who has this day provided a successor to my throne, while my own eyes can see it.’”
Transliteration: vegam-khakhah amar hamelekhe varukhe yehovah elohey yisherael asher natan hayyvom yoshev al-khiseiy veeynay rovot

Hebrew: וַיֶּֽחֶרְדוּ֙ וַיָּקֻ֔מוּ כׇּ֨ל־הַקְּרֻאִ֔ים אֲשֶׁ֖ר לַאֲדֹנִיָּ֑הוּ וַיֵּלְכ֖וּ אִ֥ישׁ לְדַרְכּֽוֹ׃
Translated: Thereupon, all of Adonijah’s guests rose in alarm and went off in every direction.
Transliteration: vayecheredu vayakumu khׇl-hakeruiym asher laadoniyahu vayelekhu iysh ledarekhvo

Hebrew: וַאֲדֹ֣נִיָּ֔הוּ יָרֵ֖א מִפְּנֵ֣י שְׁלֹמֹ֑ה וַיָּ֣קׇם וַיֵּ֔לֶךְ וַֽיַּחֲזֵ֖ק בְּקַרְנ֥וֹת הַמִּזְבֵּֽחַ׃
Translated: Adonijah, in fear of Solomon, went at once [to the Tent] and grasped the horns of the altar.
Transliteration: vaadoniyahu yare mifeney shelomoh vayakׇm vayelekhe vayachazek vekarenvot hamizevecha

Hebrew: וַיֻּגַּ֤ד לִשְׁלֹמֹה֙ לֵאמֹ֔ר הִנֵּה֙ אֲדֹ֣נִיָּ֔הוּ יָרֵ֖א אֶת־הַמֶּ֣לֶךְ שְׁלֹמֹ֑ה וְ֠הִנֵּ֠ה אָחַ֞ז בְּקַרְנ֤וֹת הַמִּזְבֵּ֙חַ֙ לֵאמֹ֔ר יִשָּׁבַֽע־לִ֤י כַיּוֹם֙ הַמֶּ֣לֶךְ שְׁלֹמֹ֔ה אִם־יָמִ֥ית אֶת־עַבְדּ֖וֹ בֶּחָֽרֶב׃
Translated: It was reported to Solomon: “Adonijah is in fear of King Solomon and has grasped the horns of the altar, saying, ‘Let King Solomon first swear to me that he will not put his servant to the sword.’”
Transliteration: vayugad lishelomoh lemor hineh adoniyahu yare et-hamelekhe shelomoh vehineh achaz vekarenvot hamizevecha lemor yishava-liy khayyvom hamelekhe shelomoh im-yamiyt et-avedvo vecharev

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר שְׁלֹמֹ֔ה אִ֚ם יִהְיֶ֣ה לְבֶן־חַ֔יִל לֹא־יִפֹּ֥ל מִשַּׂעֲרָת֖וֹ אָ֑רְצָה וְאִם־רָעָ֥ה תִמָּֽצֵא־ב֖וֹ וָמֵֽת׃
Translated: Solomon said, “If he behaves worthily, not a hair of his head shall fall to the ground; but if he is caught in any offense, he shall die.”
Transliteration: vayomer shelomoh im yiheyeh leven-chayiil lo-yifol mishaaratvo aretsah veim-raah timatse-vvo vamet

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׁלַ֞ח הַמֶּ֣לֶךְ שְׁלֹמֹ֗ה וַיּוֹרִדֻ֙הוּ֙ מֵעַ֣ל הַמִּזְבֵּ֔חַ וַיָּבֹ֕א וַיִּשְׁתַּ֖חוּ לַמֶּ֣לֶךְ שְׁלֹמֹ֑ה וַיֹּאמֶר־ל֥וֹ שְׁלֹמֹ֖ה לֵ֥ךְ לְבֵיתֶֽךָ׃ {פ}
Translated: So King Solomon sent and had him taken down from the altar. He came and bowed before King Solomon, and Solomon said to him, “Go home.”
Transliteration: vayishelach hamelekhe shelomoh vayyvoriduhu meal hamizevecha vayavo vayishetachu lamelekhe shelomoh vayomer-lvo shelomoh lekhe leveytekha {f}

Hebrew: וַיִּקְרְב֥וּ יְמֵֽי־דָוִ֖ד לָמ֑וּת וַיְצַ֛ו אֶת־שְׁלֹמֹ֥ה בְנ֖וֹ לֵאמֹֽר׃
Translated: When David’s life was drawing to a close, he instructed his son Solomon as follows:
Transliteration: vayikerevu yemey-david lamut vayetsav et-shelomoh venvo lemor

Hebrew: אָנֹכִ֣י הֹלֵ֔ךְ בְּדֶ֖רֶךְ כׇּל־הָאָ֑רֶץ וְחָזַקְתָּ֖ וְהָיִ֥יתָֽ לְאִֽישׁ׃
Translated: “I am going the way of all the earth; you will be the man in charge—if you act with determination.
Transliteration: anokhiy holekhe vederekhe khׇl-haarets vechazaketa vehayiyta leiysh

Hebrew: וְשָׁמַרְתָּ֞ אֶת־מִשְׁמֶ֣רֶת ׀ יְהֹוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֶ֗יךָ לָלֶ֤כֶת בִּדְרָכָיו֙ לִשְׁמֹ֨ר חֻקֹּתָ֤יו מִצְוֺתָיו֙ וּמִשְׁפָּטָ֣יו וְעֵדְוֺתָ֔יו כַּכָּת֖וּב בְּתוֹרַ֣ת מֹשֶׁ֑ה לְמַ֣עַן תַּשְׂכִּ֗יל אֵ֚ת כׇּל־אֲשֶׁ֣ר תַּעֲשֶׂ֔ה וְאֵ֛ת כׇּל־אֲשֶׁ֥ר תִּפְנֶ֖ה שָֽׁם׃
Translated: Keep the charge of the E<small>TERNAL</small> your God, walking in God’s ways and following God’s laws, commandments, rules, and admonitions as recorded in the Teaching of Moses, in order that you may succeed in whatever you undertake and wherever you turn.
Transliteration: veshamareta et-mishemeret yehovah eloheykha lalekhet viderakhayv lishemor chukotayv mitsevotayv umishefatayv veedevotayv khakhatuv vetvorat mosheh lemaan tashekhiyl et khׇl-asher taasheh veet khׇl-asher tifeneh sham

Hebrew: לְמַ֩עַן֩ יָקִ֨ים יְהֹוָ֜ה אֶת־דְּבָר֗וֹ אֲשֶׁ֨ר דִּבֶּ֣ר עָלַי֮ לֵאמֹר֒ אִם־יִשְׁמְר֨וּ בָנֶ֜יךָ אֶת־דַּרְכָּ֗ם לָלֶ֤כֶת לְפָנַי֙ בֶּאֱמֶ֔ת בְּכׇל־לְבָבָ֖ם וּבְכׇל־נַפְשָׁ֑ם לֵאמֹ֕ר לֹֽא־יִכָּרֵ֤ת לְךָ֙ אִ֔ישׁ מֵעַ֖ל כִּסֵּ֥א יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated: Then G<small>OD</small> will fulfill the promise that was made concerning me: ‘If your descendants are scrupulous in their conduct, and walk before Me faithfully, with all their heart and soul, your line on the throne of Israel shall never end!’
Transliteration: lemaan yakiym yehovah et-devarvo asher diver alay lemor im-yishemeru vaneykha et-darekham lalekhet lefanay veemet vekhׇl-levavam uvekhׇl-nafesham lemor lo-yikharet lekha iysh meal khise yisherael

Hebrew: וְגַ֣ם אַתָּ֣ה יָדַ֡עְתָּ אֵת֩ אֲשֶׁר־עָ֨שָׂה לִ֜י יוֹאָ֣ב בֶּן־צְרוּיָ֗ה אֲשֶׁ֣ר עָשָׂ֣ה לִשְׁנֵֽי־שָׂרֵ֣י צִבְא֣וֹת יִ֠שְׂרָאֵ֠ל לְאַבְנֵ֨ר בֶּן־נֵ֜ר וְלַעֲמָשָׂ֤א בֶן־יֶ֙תֶר֙ וַיַּ֣הַרְגֵ֔ם וַיָּ֥שֶׂם דְּמֵֽי־מִלְחָמָ֖ה בְּשָׁלֹ֑ם וַיִּתֵּ֞ן דְּמֵ֣י מִלְחָמָ֗ה בַּחֲגֹֽרָתוֹ֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר בְּמׇתְנָ֔יו וּֽבְנַעֲל֖וֹ אֲשֶׁ֥ר בְּרַגְלָֽיו׃
Translated: “Further, you know what Joab son of Zeruiah did to me, what he did to the two commanders of Israel’s forces, Abner son of Ner and Amasa son of Jether: he killed them, shedding blood of war in peacetime, staining the girdle of his loins and the sandals on his feet with blood of war.
Transliteration: vegam atah yadaeta et asher-ashah liy yvoav ven-tseruyah asher ashah lisheney-sharey tsivevot yisherael leavener ven-ner velaamasha ven-yeter vayaharegem vayashem demey-milechamah veshalom vayiten demey milechamah vachagoratvo asher vemׇtenayv uvenaalvo asher veragelayv

Hebrew: וְעָשִׂ֖יתָ כְּחׇכְמָתֶ֑ךָ וְלֹֽא־תוֹרֵ֧ד שֵׂיבָת֛וֹ בְּשָׁלֹ֖ם שְׁאֹֽל׃
Translated: So act in accordance with your wisdom, and see that his white hair does not go down to Sheol in peace.
Transliteration: veashiyta khechׇkhematekha velo-tvored sheyvatvo veshalom sheol

Hebrew: וְלִבְנֵ֨י בַרְזִלַּ֤י הַגִּלְעָדִי֙ תַּֽעֲשֶׂה־חֶ֔סֶד וְהָי֖וּ בְּאֹכְלֵ֣י שֻׁלְחָנֶ֑ךָ כִּי־כֵן֙ קָרְב֣וּ אֵלַ֔י בְּבׇרְחִ֕י מִפְּנֵ֖י אַבְשָׁל֥וֹם אָחִֽיךָ׃
Translated: “But deal graciously with the sons of Barzillai the Gileadite, for they befriended me when I fled from your brother Absalom; let them be among those that eat at your table.
Transliteration: veliveney varezilay hagileadiy taasheh-chesed vehayu veokheley shulechanekha khiy-khen karevu elay vevׇrechiy mifeney aveshalvom achiykha

Hebrew: וְהִנֵּ֣ה עִ֠מְּךָ֠ שִֽׁמְעִ֨י בֶן־גֵּרָ֥א בֶֽן־הַיְמִינִי֮ מִבַּחֻרִים֒ וְה֤וּא קִֽלְלַ֙נִי֙ קְלָלָ֣ה נִמְרֶ֔צֶת בְּי֖וֹם לֶכְתִּ֣י מַחֲנָ֑יִם וְהֽוּא־יָרַ֤ד לִקְרָאתִי֙ הַיַּרְדֵּ֔ן וָאֶשָּׁ֨בַֽע ל֤וֹ בַֽיהֹוָה֙ לֵאמֹ֔ר אִם־אֲמִֽיתְךָ֖ בֶּחָֽרֶב׃
Translated: “You must also deal with Shimei son of Gera, the Benjaminite from Bahurim. He insulted me outrageously when I was on my way to Mahanaim; but he came down to meet me at the Jordan, and I swore to him by G<small>OD</small>: ‘I will not put you to the sword.’
Transliteration: vehineh imekha shimeiy ven-gera ven-hayemiyniy mivachuriym vehu kilelaniy kelalah nimeretset veyvom lekhetiy machanayiim vehu-yarad likeratiy hayareden vaeshava lvo vayhovah lemor im-amiytekha vecharev

Hebrew: וְעַתָּה֙ אַל־תְּנַקֵּ֔הוּ כִּ֛י אִ֥ישׁ חָכָ֖ם אָ֑תָּה וְיָֽדַעְתָּ֙ אֵ֣ת אֲשֶׁ֣ר תַּֽעֲשֶׂה־לּ֔וֹ וְהוֹרַדְתָּ֧ אֶת־שֵׂיבָת֛וֹ בְּדָ֖ם שְׁאֽוֹל׃
Translated: So do not let him go unpunished; for you are a shrewd man and you will know how to deal with him and send his gray hair down to Sheol in blood.”
Transliteration: veatah al-tenakehu khiy iysh chakham atah veyadaeta et asher taasheh-lvo vehvoradeta et-sheyvatvo vedam shevol

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׁכַּ֥ב דָּוִ֖ד עִם־אֲבֹתָ֑יו וַיִּקָּבֵ֖ר בְּעִ֥יר דָּוִֽד׃ {פ}
Translated: So David rested with his ancestors, and he was buried in the City of David.
Transliteration: vayishekhav david im-avotayv vayikaver veiyr david {f}

Hebrew: וְהַיָּמִ֗ים אֲשֶׁ֨ר מָלַ֤ךְ דָּוִד֙ עַל־יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל אַרְבָּעִ֖ים שָׁנָ֑ה בְּחֶבְר֤וֹן מָלַךְ֙ שֶׁ֣בַע שָׁנִ֔ים וּבִירוּשָׁלַ֣͏ִם מָלַ֔ךְ שְׁלֹשִׁ֥ים וְשָׁלֹ֖שׁ שָׁנִֽים׃
Translated: The length of David’s reign over Israel was forty years: he reigned seven years in Hebron, and he reigned thirty-three years in Jerusalem.
Transliteration: vehayamiym asher malakhe david al-yisherael arevaiym shanah vechevervon malakhe sheva shaniym uviyrushala͏im malakhe sheloshiym veshalosh shaniym

Hebrew: וּשְׁלֹמֹ֕ה יָשַׁ֕ב עַל־כִּסֵּ֖א דָּוִ֣ד אָבִ֑יו וַתִּכֹּ֥ן מַלְכֻת֖וֹ מְאֹֽד׃ {ס}
Translated: And Solomon sat upon the throne of his father David, and his rule was firmly established.
Transliteration: ushelomoh yashav al-khise david aviyv vatikhon malekhutvo meod {s}

Hebrew: וַיָּבֹ֞א אֲדֹנִיָּ֣הוּ בֶן־חַגִּ֗ית אֶל־בַּת־שֶׁ֙בַע֙ אֵם־שְׁלֹמֹ֔ה וַתֹּ֖אמֶר הֲשָׁל֣וֹם בֹּאֶ֑ךָ וַיֹּ֖אמֶר שָׁלֽוֹם׃
Translated: Adonijah son of Haggith came to see Bathsheba, Solomon’s mother. She said, “Do you come with friendly intent?” “Yes,” he replied;
Transliteration: vayavo adoniyahu ven-chagiyt el-vat-sheva em-shelomoh vatomer hashalvom voekha vayomer shalvom

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֕אמֶר דָּבָ֥ר לִ֖י אֵלָ֑יִךְ וַתֹּ֖אמֶר דַּבֵּֽר׃
Translated: and he continued, “I would like to have a word with you.” “Speak up,” she said.
Transliteration: vayomer davar liy elayiikhe vatomer daver

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֗אמֶר אַ֤תְּ יָדַ֙עַתְּ֙ כִּי־לִי֙ הָיְתָ֣ה הַמְּלוּכָ֔ה וְעָלַ֞י שָׂ֧מוּ כׇֽל־יִשְׂרָאֵ֛ל פְּנֵיהֶ֖ם לִמְלֹ֑ךְ וַתִּסֹּ֤ב הַמְּלוּכָה֙ וַתְּהִ֣י לְאָחִ֔י כִּ֥י מֵיְהֹוָ֖ה הָ֥יְתָה לּֽוֹ׃
Translated: Then he said, “You know that the kingship was rightly mine and that all Israel wanted me to reign. But the kingship passed on to my brother; it came to him by G<small>OD</small>’s will.
Transliteration: vayomer ate yadaate khiy-liy hayetah hamelukhah vealay shamu khׇl-yisherael feneyhem limelokhe vatisov hamelukhah vatehiy leachiy khiy meyehovah hayetah lvo

Hebrew: וְעַתָּ֗ה שְׁאֵלָ֤ה אַחַת֙ אָֽנֹכִי֙ שֹׁאֵ֣ל מֵֽאִתָּ֔ךְ אַל־תָּשִׁ֖בִי אֶת־פָּנָ֑י וַתֹּ֥אמֶר אֵלָ֖יו דַּבֵּֽר׃
Translated: And now I have one request to make of you; do not refuse me.” She said, “Speak up.”
Transliteration: veatah sheelah achat anokhiy shoel meitakhe al-tashiviy et-fanay vatomer elayv daver

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֗אמֶר אִמְרִי־נָא֙ לִשְׁלֹמֹ֣ה הַמֶּ֔לֶךְ כִּ֥י לֹֽא־יָשִׁ֖יב אֶת־פָּנָ֑יִךְ וְיִתֶּן־לִ֛י אֶת־אֲבִישַׁ֥ג הַשּׁוּנַמִּ֖ית לְאִשָּֽׁה׃
Translated: He replied, “Please ask King Solomon—for he won’t refuse you—to give me Abishag the Shunammite as wife.”
Transliteration: vayomer imeriy-na lishelomoh hamelekhe khiy lo-yashiyv et-fanayiikhe veyiten-liy et-aviyshag hashunamiyt leishah

Hebrew: וַתֹּ֥אמֶר בַּת־שֶׁ֖בַע ט֑וֹב אָנֹכִ֕י אֲדַבֵּ֥ר עָלֶ֖יךָ אֶל־הַמֶּֽלֶךְ׃
Translated: “Very well,” said Bathsheba, “I will speak to the king in your behalf.”
Transliteration: vatomer vat-sheva tvov anokhiy adaver aleykha el-hamelekhe

Hebrew: וַתָּבֹ֤א בַת־שֶׁ֙בַע֙ אֶל־הַמֶּ֣לֶךְ שְׁלֹמֹ֔ה לְדַבֶּר־ל֖וֹ עַל־אֲדֹנִיָּ֑הוּ וַיָּ֩קׇם֩ הַמֶּ֨לֶךְ לִקְרָאתָ֜הּ וַיִּשְׁתַּ֣חוּ לָ֗הּ וַיֵּ֙שֶׁב֙ עַל־כִּסְא֔וֹ וַיָּ֤שֶׂם כִּסֵּא֙ לְאֵ֣ם הַמֶּ֔לֶךְ וַתֵּ֖שֶׁב לִימִינֽוֹ׃
Translated: So Bathsheba went to King Solomon to speak to him about Adonijah. The king rose to greet her and bowed down to her. He sat on his throne; and he had a throne placed for the queen mother, and she sat on his right.
Transliteration: vatavo vat-sheva el-hamelekhe shelomoh ledaver-lvo al-adoniyahu vayakׇm hamelekhe likeratah vayishetachu lah vayeshev al-khisevo vayashem khise leem hamelekhe vateshev liymiynvo

Hebrew: וַתֹּ֗אמֶר שְׁאֵלָ֨ה אַחַ֤ת קְטַנָּה֙ אָֽנֹכִי֙ שֹׁאֶ֣לֶת מֵֽאִתָּ֔ךְ אַל־תָּ֖שֶׁב אֶת־פָּנָ֑י וַיֹּֽאמֶר־לָ֤הּ הַמֶּ֙לֶךְ֙ שַׁאֲלִ֣י אִמִּ֔י כִּ֥י לֹא־אָשִׁ֖יב אֶת־פָּנָֽיִךְ׃
Translated: She said, “I have one small request to make of you, do not refuse me.” He responded, “Ask, Mother; I shall not refuse you.”
Transliteration: vatomer sheelah achat ketanah anokhiy shoelet meitakhe al-tashev et-fanay vayomer-lah hamelekhe shaaliy imiy khiy lo-ashiyv et-fanayiikhe

Hebrew: וַתֹּ֕אמֶר יֻתַּ֖ן אֶת־אֲבִישַׁ֣ג הַשֻּׁנַמִּ֑ית לַאֲדֹנִיָּ֥הוּ אָחִ֖יךָ לְאִשָּֽׁה׃
Translated: Then she said, “Let Abishag the Shunammite be given to your brother Adonijah as wife.”
Transliteration: vatomer yutan et-aviyshag hashunamiyt laadoniyahu achiykha leishah

Hebrew: וַיַּ֩עַן֩ הַמֶּ֨לֶךְ שְׁלֹמֹ֜ה וַיֹּ֣אמֶר לְאִמּ֗וֹ וְלָמָה֩ אַ֨תְּ שֹׁאֶ֜לֶת אֶת־אֲבִישַׁ֤ג הַשֻּֽׁנַמִּית֙ לַאֲדֹ֣נִיָּ֔הוּ וְשַֽׁאֲלִי־לוֹ֙ אֶת־הַמְּלוּכָ֔ה כִּ֛י ה֥וּא אָחִ֖י הַגָּד֣וֹל מִמֶּ֑נִּי וְלוֹ֙ וּלְאֶבְיָתָ֣ר הַכֹּהֵ֔ן וּלְיוֹאָ֖ב בֶּן־צְרוּיָֽה׃ {פ}
Translated: The king replied to his mother, “Why request Abishag the Shunammite for Adonijah? Request the kingship for him! For he is my older brother, and the priest Abiathar and Joab son of Zeruiah are on his side.”
Transliteration: vayaan hamelekhe shelomoh vayomer leimvo velamah ate shoelet et-aviyshag hashunamiyt laadoniyahu veshaaliy-lvo et-hamelukhah khiy hu achiy hagadvol mimeniy velvo uleeveyatar hakhohen uleyvoav ven-tseruyah {f}

Hebrew: וַיִּשָּׁבַע֙ הַמֶּ֣לֶךְ שְׁלֹמֹ֔ה בַּיהֹוָ֖ה לֵאמֹ֑ר כֹּ֣ה יַֽעֲשֶׂה־לִּ֤י אֱלֹהִים֙ וְכֹ֣ה יוֹסִ֔יף כִּ֣י בְנַפְשׁ֔וֹ דִּבֶּר֙ אֲדֹ֣נִיָּ֔הוּ אֶת־הַדָּבָ֖ר הַזֶּֽה׃
Translated: Thereupon, King Solomon swore by G<small>OD</small>, saying, “So may God do to me and even more, if broaching this matter does not cost Adonijah his life!
Transliteration: vayishava hamelekhe shelomoh vayhovah lemor khoh yaasheh-liy Elohim vekhoh yvosiyf khiy venafeshvo diver adoniyahu et-hadavar hazeh

Hebrew: וְעַתָּ֗ה חַי־יְהֹוָה֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר הֱכִינַ֗נִי (ויושיביני) [וַיּֽוֹשִׁיבַ֙נִי֙] עַל־כִּסֵּא֙ דָּוִ֣ד אָבִ֔י וַאֲשֶׁ֧ר עָשָׂה־לִ֛י בַּ֖יִת כַּאֲשֶׁ֣ר דִּבֵּ֑ר כִּ֣י הַיּ֔וֹם יוּמַ֖ת אֲדֹנִיָּֽהוּ׃
Translated: Now, as G<small>OD</small> lives, who has established me and set me on the throne of my father David and who has provided him with a house, as he promised, Adonijah shall be put to death this very day!”
Transliteration: veatah chay-yehovah asher hekhiynaniy (vyvshyvyny) [vayyvoshiyvaniy] al-khise david aviy vaasher ashah-liy vayiit khaasher diver khiy hayyvom yumat adoniyahu

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׁלַח֙ הַמֶּ֣לֶךְ שְׁלֹמֹ֔ה בְּיַ֖ד בְּנָיָ֣הוּ בֶן־יְהוֹיָדָ֑ע וַיִּפְגַּע־בּ֖וֹ וַיָּמֹֽת׃ {ס}
Translated: And Solomon instructed Benaiah son of Jehoiada, who struck Adonijah down; and so he died.
Transliteration: vayishelach hamelekhe shelomoh veyad venayahu ven-yehvoyada vayifega-vvo vayamot {s}

Hebrew: וּלְאֶבְיָתָ֨ר הַכֹּהֵ֜ן אָמַ֣ר הַמֶּ֗לֶךְ עֲנָתֹת֙ לֵ֣ךְ עַל־שָׂדֶ֔יךָ כִּ֛י אִ֥ישׁ מָ֖וֶת אָ֑תָּה וּבַיּ֨וֹם הַזֶּ֜ה לֹ֣א אֲמִיתֶ֗ךָ כִּֽי־נָשָׂ֜אתָ אֶת־אֲר֨וֹן אֲדֹנָ֤י יֱהֹוִה֙ לִפְנֵי֙ דָּוִ֣ד אָבִ֔י וְכִ֣י הִתְעַנִּ֔יתָ בְּכֹ֥ל אֲשֶֽׁר־הִתְעַנָּ֖ה אָבִֽי׃
Translated: To the priest Abiathar, the king said, “Go to your estate at Anathoth! You deserve to die, but I shall not put you to death at this time, because you carried the Ark of my Sovereign G<small>OD</small> before my father David and because you shared all the hardships that my father endured.”
Transliteration: uleeveyatar hakhohen amar hamelekhe anatot lekhe al-shadeykha khiy iysh mavet atah uvayyvom hazeh lo amiytekha khiy-nashata et-arvon adonay yehovih lifeney david aviy vekhiy hiteaniyta vekhol asher-hiteanah aviy

Hebrew: וַיְגָ֤רֶשׁ שְׁלֹמֹה֙ אֶת־אֶבְיָתָ֔ר מִֽהְי֥וֹת כֹּהֵ֖ן לַיהֹוָ֑ה לְמַלֵּא֙ אֶת־דְּבַ֣ר יְהֹוָ֔ה אֲשֶׁ֥ר דִּבֶּ֛ר עַל־בֵּ֥ית עֵלִ֖י בְּשִׁלֹֽה׃ {פ}
Translated: So Solomon dismissed Abiathar from his office of priest of G<small>OD</small>—thus fulfilling what G<small>OD</small> had spoken at Shiloh regarding the house of Eli.
Transliteration: vayegaresh shelomoh et-eveyatar miheyvot khohen layhovah lemale et-devar yehovah asher diver al-veyt eliy veshiloh {f}

Hebrew: וְהַשְּׁמֻעָה֙ בָּ֣אָה עַד־יוֹאָ֔ב כִּ֣י יוֹאָ֗ב נָטָה֙ אַחֲרֵ֣י אֲדֹנִיָּ֔ה וְאַחֲרֵ֥י אַבְשָׁל֖וֹם לֹ֣א נָטָ֑ה וַיָּ֤נׇס יוֹאָב֙ אֶל־אֹ֣הֶל יְהֹוָ֔ה וַֽיַּחֲזֵ֖ק בְּקַרְנ֥וֹת הַמִּזְבֵּֽחַ׃
Translated: When the news reached Joab, he fled to the Tent of G<small>OD</small> and grasped the horns of the altar—for Joab had sided with Adonijah, though he had not sided with Absalom.
Transliteration: vehashemuah vaah ad-yvoav khiy yvoav natah acharey adoniyah veacharey aveshalvom lo natah vayanׇs yvoav el-ohel yehovah vayachazek vekarenvot hamizevecha

Hebrew: וַיֻּגַּ֞ד לַמֶּ֣לֶךְ שְׁלֹמֹ֗ה כִּ֣י נָ֤ס יוֹאָב֙ אֶל־אֹ֣הֶל יְהֹוָ֔ה וְהִנֵּ֖ה אֵ֣צֶל הַמִּזְבֵּ֑חַ וַיִּשְׁלַ֨ח שְׁלֹמֹ֜ה אֶת־בְּנָיָ֧הוּ בֶן־יְהוֹיָדָ֛ע לֵאמֹ֖ר לֵ֥ךְ פְּגַע־בּֽוֹ׃
Translated: King Solomon was told that Joab had fled to the Tent of G<small>OD</small> and that he was there by the altar; so Solomon sent Benaiah son of Jehoiada, saying, “Go and strike him down.”
Transliteration: vayugad lamelekhe shelomoh khiy nas yvoav el-ohel yehovah vehineh etsel hamizevecha vayishelach shelomoh et-venayahu ven-yehvoyada lemor lekhe fega-vvo

Hebrew: וַיָּבֹ֨א בְנָיָ֜הוּ אֶל־אֹ֣הֶל יְהֹוָ֗ה וַיֹּ֨אמֶר אֵלָ֜יו כֹּֽה־אָמַ֤ר הַמֶּ֙לֶךְ֙ צֵ֔א וַיֹּ֥אמֶֽר <small>׀</small> לֹ֖א כִּ֣י פֹ֣ה אָמ֑וּת וַיָּ֨שֶׁב בְּנָיָ֤הוּ אֶת־הַמֶּ֙לֶךְ֙ דָּבָ֣ר לֵאמֹ֔ר כֹּֽה־דִבֶּ֥ר יוֹאָ֖ב וְכֹ֥ה עָנָֽנִי׃
Translated: Benaiah went to the Tent of G<small>OD</small> and said to him, “Thus said the king: Come out!” “No!” he replied; “I will die here.” Benaiah reported back to the king that Joab had answered thus and thus,
Transliteration: vayavo venayahu el-ohel yehovah vayomer elayv khoh-amar hamelekhe tse vayomer <small></small> lo khiy foh amut vayashev venayahu et-hamelekhe davar lemor khoh-diver yvoav vekhoh ananiy

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֧אמֶר ל֣וֹ הַמֶּ֗לֶךְ עֲשֵׂה֙ כַּאֲשֶׁ֣ר דִּבֶּ֔ר וּפְגַע־בּ֖וֹ וּקְבַרְתּ֑וֹ וַהֲסִירֹ֣תָ ׀ דְּמֵ֣י חִנָּ֗ם אֲשֶׁר֙ שָׁפַ֣ךְ יוֹאָ֔ב מֵעָלַ֕י וּמֵעַ֖ל בֵּ֥ית אָבִֽי׃
Translated: and the king said, “Do just as he said; strike him down and bury him, and remove guilt from me and my father’s house for the blood of the innocent that Joab has shed.
Transliteration: vayomer lvo hamelekhe asheh khaasher diver ufega-vvo ukevaretvo vahasiyrota demey chinam asher shafakhe yvoav mealay umeal veyt aviy

Hebrew: וְהֵשִׁיב֩ יְהֹוָ֨ה אֶת־דָּמ֜וֹ עַל־רֹאשׁ֗וֹ אֲשֶׁ֣ר פָּגַ֣ע בִּשְׁנֵֽי־אֲ֠נָשִׁ֠ים צַדִּקִ֨ים וְטֹבִ֤ים מִמֶּ֙נּוּ֙ וַיַּהַרְגֵ֣ם בַּחֶ֔רֶב וְאָבִ֥י דָוִ֖ד לֹ֣א יָדָ֑ע אֶת־אַבְנֵ֤ר בֶּן־נֵר֙ שַׂר־צְבָ֣א יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל וְאֶת־עֲמָשָׂ֥א בֶן־יֶ֖תֶר שַׂר־צְבָ֥א יְהוּדָֽה׃
Translated: Thus G<small>OD</small> will bring his blood guilt down upon his own head, because, unbeknown to my father, he struck down with the sword two men more righteous and honorable than he—Abner son of Ner, the army commander of Israel, and Amasa son of Jether, the army commander of Judah.
Transliteration: veheshiyv yehovah et-damvo al-roshvo asher faga visheney-anashiym tsadikiym vetoviym mimenu vayaharegem vacherev veaviy david lo yada et-avener ven-ner shar-tseva yisherael veet-amasha ven-yeter shar-tseva yehudah

Hebrew: וְשָׁ֤בוּ דְמֵיהֶם֙ בְּרֹ֣אשׁ יוֹאָ֔ב וּבְרֹ֥אשׁ זַרְע֖וֹ לְעֹלָ֑ם וּלְדָוִ֡ד וּ֠לְזַרְע֠וֹ וּלְבֵית֨וֹ וּלְכִסְא֜וֹ יִהְיֶ֥ה שָׁל֛וֹם עַד־עוֹלָ֖ם מֵעִ֥ם יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: May the guilt for their blood come down upon the head of Joab and his descendants forever, and may good fortune from G<small>OD</small> be granted forever to David and his descendants, his house and his throne.”
Transliteration: veshavu demeyhem verosh yvoav uverosh zarevo leolam uledavid ulezarevo uleveytvo ulekhisevo yiheyeh shalvom ad-volam meim yehovah

Hebrew: וַיַּ֗עַל בְּנָיָ֙הוּ֙ בֶּן־יְה֣וֹיָדָ֔ע וַיִּפְגַּע־בּ֖וֹ וַיְמִתֵ֑הוּ וַיִּקָּבֵ֥ר בְּבֵית֖וֹ בַּמִּדְבָּֽר׃
Translated: So Benaiah son of Jehoiada went up and struck him down. And he was buried at his home in the wilderness.
Transliteration: vayaal venayahu ven-yehvoyada vayifega-vvo vayemitehu vayikaver veveytvo vamidevar

Hebrew: וַיִּתֵּ֨ן הַמֶּ֜לֶךְ אֶת־בְּנָיָ֧הוּ בֶן־יְהוֹיָדָ֛ע תַּחְתָּ֖יו עַל־הַצָּבָ֑א וְאֶת־צָד֤וֹק הַכֹּהֵן֙ נָתַ֣ן הַמֶּ֔לֶךְ תַּ֖חַת אֶבְיָתָֽר׃
Translated: In his place, the king appointed Benaiah son of Jehoiada over the army, and in place of Abiathar, the king appointed the priest Zadok.
Transliteration: vayiten hamelekhe et-venayahu ven-yehvoyada tachetayv al-hatsava veet-tsadvok hakhohen natan hamelekhe tachat eveyatar

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׁלַ֤ח הַמֶּ֙לֶךְ֙ וַיִּקְרָ֣א לְשִׁמְעִ֔י וַיֹּ֣אמֶר ל֗וֹ בְּֽנֵה־לְךָ֥ בַ֙יִת֙ בִּיר֣וּשָׁלַ֔͏ִם וְיָשַׁבְתָּ֖ שָׁ֑ם וְלֹא־תֵצֵ֥א מִשָּׁ֖ם אָ֥נֶה וָאָֽנָה׃
Translated: Then the king summoned Shimei and said to him, “Build yourself a house in Jerusalem and stay there—do not ever go out from there anywhere else.
Transliteration: vayishelach hamelekhe vayikera leshimeiy vayomer lvo veneh-lekha vayiit viyrushala͏im veyashaveta sham velo-tetse misham aneh vaanah

Hebrew: וְהָיָ֣ה ׀ בְּי֣וֹם צֵאתְךָ֗ וְעָֽבַרְתָּ֙ אֶת־נַ֣חַל קִדְר֔וֹן יָדֹ֥עַ תֵּדַ֖ע כִּ֣י מ֣וֹת תָּמ֑וּת דָּמְךָ֖ יִהְיֶ֥ה בְרֹאשֶֽׁךָ׃
Translated: On the very day that you go out and cross the Wadi Kidron, you can be sure that you will die; your blood shall be on your own head.”
Transliteration: vehayah veyvom tsetekha veavareta et-nachal kidervon yadoa teda khiy mvot tamut damekha yiheyeh veroshekha

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר שִׁמְעִ֤י לַמֶּ֙לֶךְ֙ ט֣וֹב הַדָּבָ֔ר כַּאֲשֶׁ֤ר דִּבֶּר֙ אֲדֹנִ֣י הַמֶּ֔לֶךְ כֵּ֖ן יַעֲשֶׂ֣ה עַבְדֶּ֑ךָ וַיֵּ֧שֶׁב שִׁמְעִ֛י בִּירוּשָׁלַ֖͏ִם יָמִ֥ים רַבִּֽים׃ {ס}
Translated: “That is fair,” said Shimei to the king, “your servant will do just as my lord the king has spoken.” And for a long time, Shimei remained in Jerusalem.
Transliteration: vayomer shimeiy lamelekhe tvov hadavar khaasher diver adoniy hamelekhe khen yaasheh avedekha vayeshev shimeiy viyrushala͏im yamiym raviym {s}

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֗י מִקֵּץ֙ שָׁלֹ֣שׁ שָׁנִ֔ים וַיִּבְרְח֤וּ שְׁנֵֽי־עֲבָדִים֙ לְשִׁמְעִ֔י אֶל־אָכִ֥ישׁ בֶּֽן־מַעֲכָ֖ה מֶ֣לֶךְ גַּ֑ת וַיַּגִּ֤ידוּ לְשִׁמְעִי֙ לֵאמֹ֔ר הִנֵּ֥ה עֲבָדֶ֖יךָ בְּגַֽת׃
Translated: Three years later, two slaves of Shimei ran away to King Achish son of Maacah of Gath. Shimei was told, “Your slaves are in Gath.”
Transliteration: vayehiy mikets shalosh shaniym vayiverechu sheney-avadiym leshimeiy el-akhiysh ven-maakhah melekhe gat vayagiydu leshimeiy lemor hineh avadeykha vegat

Hebrew: וַיָּ֣קׇם שִׁמְעִ֗י וַֽיַּחֲבֹשׁ֙ אֶת־חֲמֹר֔וֹ וַיֵּ֤לֶךְ גַּ֙תָה֙ אֶל־אָכִ֔ישׁ לְבַקֵּ֖שׁ אֶת־עֲבָדָ֑יו וַיֵּ֣לֶךְ שִׁמְעִ֔י וַיָּבֵ֥א אֶת־עֲבָדָ֖יו מִגַּֽת׃ {ס}
Translated: Shimei thereupon saddled his donkey and went to Achish in Gath to claim his slaves; and Shimei returned from Gath with his slaves.
Transliteration: vayakׇm shimeiy vayachavosh et-chamorvo vayelekhe gatah el-akhiysh levakesh et-avadayv vayelekhe shimeiy vayave et-avadayv migat {s}

Hebrew: וַיֻּגַּ֖ד לִשְׁלֹמֹ֑ה כִּי־הָלַ֨ךְ שִׁמְעִ֧י מִירוּשָׁלַ֛͏ִם גַּ֖ת וַיָּשֹֽׁב׃
Translated: Solomon was told that Shimei had gone from Jerusalem to Gath and back,
Transliteration: vayugad lishelomoh khiy-halakhe shimeiy miyrushala͏im gat vayashov

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׁלַ֨ח הַמֶּ֜לֶךְ וַיִּקְרָ֣א לְשִׁמְעִ֗י וַיֹּ֨אמֶר אֵלָ֜יו הֲל֧וֹא הִשְׁבַּעְתִּ֣יךָ בַיהֹוָ֗ה וָאָעִ֤ד בְּךָ֙ לֵאמֹ֔ר בְּי֣וֹם צֵאתְךָ֗ וְהָֽלַכְתָּ֙ אָ֣נֶה וָאָ֔נָה יָדֹ֥עַ תֵּדַ֖ע כִּ֣י מ֣וֹת תָּמ֑וּת וַתֹּ֧אמֶר אֵלַ֛י ט֥וֹב הַדָּבָ֖ר שָׁמָֽעְתִּי׃
Translated: and the king summoned Shimei and said to him, “Did I not adjure you by G<small>OD</small> and warn you, ‘On the very day that you leave and go anywhere else, you can be sure that you will die,’ and did you not say to me, ‘It is fair; I accept’?
Transliteration: vayishelach hamelekhe vayikera leshimeiy vayomer elayv halvo hishevaetiykha vayhovah vaaid vekha lemor veyvom tsetekha vehalakheta aneh vaanah yadoa teda khiy mvot tamut vatomer elay tvov hadavar shamaetiy

Hebrew: וּמַדּ֕וּעַ לֹ֣א שָׁמַ֔רְתָּ אֵ֖ת שְׁבֻעַ֣ת יְהֹוָ֑ה וְאֶת־הַמִּצְוָ֖ה אֲשֶׁר־צִוִּ֥יתִי עָלֶֽיךָ׃
Translated: Why did you not abide by the oath before G<small>OD</small> and by the orders that I gave you?”
Transliteration: umadua lo shamareta et shevuat yehovah veet-hamitsevah asher-tsiviytiy aleykha

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר הַמֶּ֜לֶךְ אֶל־שִׁמְעִ֗י אַתָּ֤ה יָדַ֙עְתָּ֙ אֵ֣ת כׇּל־הָרָעָ֗ה אֲשֶׁ֤ר יָדַע֙ לְבָ֣בְךָ֔ אֲשֶׁ֥ר עָשִׂ֖יתָ לְדָוִ֣ד אָבִ֑י וְהֵשִׁ֧יב יְהֹוָ֛ה אֶת־רָעָתְךָ֖ בְּרֹאשֶֽׁךָ׃
Translated: The king said further to Shimei, “You know all the wrong, which you remember very well, that you did to my father David. Now G<small>OD</small> brings down your wrongdoing upon your own head.
Transliteration: vayomer hamelekhe el-shimeiy atah yadaeta et khׇl-haraah asher yada levavekha asher ashiyta ledavid aviy veheshiyv yehovah et-raatekha veroshekha

Hebrew: וְהַמֶּ֥לֶךְ שְׁלֹמֹ֖ה בָּר֑וּךְ וְכִסֵּ֣א דָוִ֗ד יִהְיֶ֥ה נָכ֛וֹן לִפְנֵ֥י יְהֹוָ֖ה עַד־עוֹלָֽם׃
Translated: But King Solomon shall be blessed, and the throne of David shall be established before G<small>OD</small> forever.”
Transliteration: vehamelekhe shelomoh varukhe vekhise david yiheyeh nakhvon lifeney yehovah ad-volam

Hebrew: וַיְצַ֣ו הַמֶּ֗לֶךְ אֶת־בְּנָיָ֙הוּ֙ בֶּן־יְה֣וֹיָדָ֔ע וַיֵּצֵ֕א וַיִּפְגַּע־בּ֖וֹ וַיָּמֹ֑ת וְהַמַּמְלָכָ֥ה נָכ֖וֹנָה בְּיַד־שְׁלֹמֹֽה׃
Translated:
The king gave orders to Benaiah son of Jehoiada and he went out and struck Shimei down; and so he died.
Thus the kingdom was secured in Solomon’s hands.
Transliteration: vayetsav hamelekhe et-venayahu ven-yehvoyada vayetse vayifega-vvo vayamot vehamamelakhah nakhvonah veyad-shelomoh

Hebrew: וַיִּתְחַתֵּ֣ן שְׁלֹמֹ֔ה אֶת־פַּרְעֹ֖ה מֶ֣לֶךְ מִצְרָ֑יִם וַיִּקַּ֣ח אֶת־בַּת־פַּרְעֹ֗ה וַיְבִיאֶ֙הָ֙ אֶל־עִ֣יר דָּוִ֔ד עַ֣ד כַּלֹּת֗וֹ לִבְנ֤וֹת אֶת־בֵּיתוֹ֙ וְאֶת־בֵּ֣ית יְהֹוָ֔ה וְאֶת־חוֹמַ֥ת יְרוּשָׁלַ֖͏ִם סָבִֽיב׃
Translated: Solomon allied himself by marriage with Pharaoh king of Egypt. He married Pharaoh’s daughter and brought her to the City of David [to live there] until he had finished building his palace, and the House of G<small>OD</small>, and the walls around Jerusalem.
Transliteration: vayitechaten shelomoh et-fareoh melekhe mitserayiim vayikach et-vat-fareoh vayeviyeha el-iyr david ad khalotvo livenvot et-veytvo veet-veyt yehovah veet-chvomat yerushala͏im saviyv

Hebrew: רַ֣ק הָעָ֔ם מְזַבְּחִ֖ים בַּבָּמ֑וֹת כִּ֠י לֹֽא־נִבְנָ֥ה בַ֙יִת֙ לְשֵׁ֣ם יְהֹוָ֔ה עַ֖ד הַיָּמִ֥ים הָהֵֽם׃ {פ}
Translated: The people, however, continued to offer sacrifices at the open shrines, because up to that time no house had been built for G<small>OD</small>’s name.
Transliteration: rak haam mezavechiym vavamvot khiy lo-nivenah vayiit leshem yehovah ad hayamiym hahem {f}

Hebrew: וַיֶּאֱהַ֤ב שְׁלֹמֹה֙ אֶת־יְהֹוָ֔ה לָלֶ֕כֶת בְּחֻקּ֖וֹת דָּוִ֣ד אָבִ֑יו רַ֚ק בַּבָּמ֔וֹת ה֥וּא מְזַבֵּ֖חַ וּמַקְטִֽיר׃
Translated: And Solomon, though he loved G<small>OD</small> and followed the practices of his father David, also sacrificed and offered at the shrines.
Transliteration: vayeehav shelomoh et-yehovah lalekhet vechukvot david aviyv rak vavamvot hu mezavecha umaketiyr

Hebrew: וַיֵּ֨לֶךְ הַמֶּ֤לֶךְ גִּבְעֹ֙נָה֙ לִזְבֹּ֣חַ שָׁ֔ם כִּי־הִ֖יא הַבָּמָ֣ה הַגְּדוֹלָ֑ה אֶ֤לֶף עֹלוֹת֙ יַעֲלֶ֣ה שְׁלֹמֹ֔ה עַ֖ל הַמִּזְבֵּ֥חַ הַהֽוּא׃
Translated: The king went to Gibeon to sacrifice there, for that was the largest shrine; on that altar Solomon presented a thousand burnt offerings.
Transliteration: vayelekhe hamelekhe giveonah lizevocha sham khiy-hiy havamah hagedvolah elef olvot yaaleh shelomoh al hamizevecha hahu

Hebrew: בְּגִבְע֗וֹן נִרְאָ֧ה יְהֹוָ֛ה אֶל־שְׁלֹמֹ֖ה בַּחֲל֣וֹם הַלָּ֑יְלָה וַיֹּ֣אמֶר אֱלֹהִ֔ים שְׁאַ֖ל מָ֥ה אֶתֶּן־לָֽךְ׃
Translated: At Gibeon G<small>OD</small> appeared to Solomon in a dream by night; and God said, “Ask, what shall I grant you?”
Transliteration: vegivevon nireah yehovah el-shelomoh vachalvom halayelah vayomer Elohim sheal mah eten-lakhe

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר שְׁלֹמֹ֗ה אַתָּ֨ה עָשִׂ֜יתָ עִם־עַבְדְּךָ֨ דָוִ֣ד אָבִי֮ חֶ֣סֶד גָּדוֹל֒ כַּאֲשֶׁר֩ הָלַ֨ךְ לְפָנֶ֜יךָ בֶּאֱמֶ֧ת וּבִצְדָקָ֛ה וּבְיִשְׁרַ֥ת לֵבָ֖ב עִמָּ֑ךְ וַתִּשְׁמׇר־ל֗וֹ אֶת־הַחֶ֤סֶד הַגָּדוֹל֙ הַזֶּ֔ה וַתִּתֶּן־ל֥וֹ בֵ֛ן יֹשֵׁ֥ב עַל־כִּסְא֖וֹ כַּיּ֥וֹם הַזֶּֽה׃
Translated: Solomon said, “You dealt most graciously with Your servant my father David, because he walked before You in faithfulness and righteousness and in integrity of heart. You have continued this great kindness to him by giving him a son to occupy his throne, as is now the case.
Transliteration: vayomer shelomoh atah ashiyta im-avedekha david aviy chesed gadvol khaasher halakhe lefaneykha veemet uvitsedakah uveyisherat levav imakhe vatishemׇr-lvo et-hachesed hagadvol hazeh vatiten-lvo ven yoshev al-khisevo khayyvom hazeh

Hebrew: וְעַתָּה֙ יְהֹוָ֣ה אֱלֹהָ֔י אַתָּה֙ הִמְלַ֣כְתָּ אֶֽת־עַבְדְּךָ֔ תַּ֖חַת דָּוִ֣ד אָבִ֑י וְאָֽנֹכִי֙ נַ֣עַר קָטֹ֔ן לֹ֥א אֵדַ֖ע צֵ֥את וָבֹֽא׃
Translated: And now, my E<small>TERNAL</small> God, You have made Your servant king in place of my father David; but I am a young lad, with no experience in leadership.
Transliteration: veatah yehovah elohay atah himelakheta et-avedekha tachat david aviy veanokhiy naar katon lo eda tset vavo

Hebrew: וְעַ֨בְדְּךָ֔ בְּת֥וֹךְ עַמְּךָ֖ אֲשֶׁ֣ר בָּחָ֑רְתָּ עַם־רָ֕ב אֲשֶׁ֧ר לֹֽא־יִמָּנֶ֛ה וְלֹ֥א יִסָּפֵ֖ר מֵרֹֽב׃
Translated: Your servant finds himself in the midst of the people You have chosen, a people too numerous to be numbered or counted.
Transliteration: veavedekha vetvokhe amekha asher vachareta am-rav asher lo-yimaneh velo yisafer merov

Hebrew: וְנָתַתָּ֨ לְעַבְדְּךָ֜ לֵ֤ב שֹׁמֵ֙עַ֙ לִשְׁפֹּ֣ט אֶֽת־עַמְּךָ֔ לְהָבִ֖ין בֵּֽין־ט֣וֹב לְרָ֑ע כִּ֣י מִ֤י יוּכַל֙ לִשְׁפֹּ֔ט אֶת־עַמְּךָ֥ הַכָּבֵ֖ד הַזֶּֽה׃
Translated: Grant, then, Your servant an understanding mind to judge Your people, to distinguish between good and bad; for who can judge this vast people of Yours?”
Transliteration: venatata leavedekha lev shomea lishefot et-amekha lehaviyn veyn-tvov lera khiy miy yukhal lishefot et-amekha hakhaved hazeh

Hebrew: וַיִּיטַ֥ב הַדָּבָ֖ר בְּעֵינֵ֣י אֲדֹנָ֑י כִּ֚י שָׁאַ֣ל שְׁלֹמֹ֔ה אֶת־הַדָּבָ֖ר הַזֶּֽה׃
Translated: Pleased that Solomon had asked for this,
Transliteration: vayiytav hadavar veeyney adonay khiy shaal shelomoh et-hadavar hazeh

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר אֱלֹהִ֜ים אֵלָ֗יו יַ֩עַן֩ אֲשֶׁ֨ר שָׁאַ֜לְתָּ אֶת־הַדָּבָ֣ר הַזֶּ֗ה וְלֹא־שָׁאַ֨לְתָּ לְּךָ֜ יָמִ֣ים רַבִּ֗ים וְלֹֽא־שָׁאַ֤לְתָּ לְּךָ֙ עֹ֔שֶׁר וְלֹ֥א שָׁאַ֖לְתָּ נֶ֣פֶשׁ אֹיְבֶ֑יךָ וְשָׁאַ֧לְתָּ לְּךָ֛ הָבִ֖ין לִשְׁמֹ֥עַ מִשְׁפָּֽט׃
Translated: God said to him, “Because you asked for this—you did not ask for long life, you did not ask for riches, you did not ask for the life of your enemies, but you asked for discernment in dispensing justice—
Transliteration: vayomer Elohim elayv yaan asher shaaleta et-hadavar hazeh velo-shaaleta lekha yamiym raviym velo-shaaleta lekha osher velo shaaleta nefesh oyeveykha veshaaleta lekha haviyn lishemoa mishefat

Hebrew: הִנֵּ֥ה עָשִׂ֖יתִי כִּדְבָרֶ֑יךָ הִנֵּ֣ה ׀ נָתַ֣תִּֽי לְךָ֗ לֵ֚ב חָכָ֣ם וְנָב֔וֹן אֲשֶׁ֤ר כָּמ֙וֹךָ֙ לֹא־הָיָ֣ה לְפָנֶ֔יךָ וְאַחֲרֶ֖יךָ לֹא־יָק֥וּם כָּמֽוֹךָ׃
Translated: I now do as you have spoken. I grant you a wise and discerning mind; there has never been anyone like you before, nor will anyone like you arise again.
Transliteration: hineh ashiytiy khidevareykha hineh natatiy lekha lev chakham venavvon asher khamvokha lo-hayah lefaneykha veachareykha lo-yakum khamvokha

Hebrew: וְגַ֨ם אֲשֶׁ֤ר לֹֽא־שָׁאַ֙לְתָּ֙ נָתַ֣תִּי לָ֔ךְ גַּם־עֹ֖שֶׁר גַּם־כָּב֑וֹד אֲ֠שֶׁ֠ר לֹא־הָיָ֨ה כָמ֥וֹךָֽ אִ֛ישׁ בַּמְּלָכִ֖ים כׇּל־יָמֶֽיךָ׃
Translated: And I also grant you what you did not ask for—both riches and glory all your life—the like of which no king has ever had.
Transliteration: vegam asher lo-shaaleta natatiy lakhe gam-osher gam-khavvod asher lo-hayah khamvokha iysh vamelakhiym khׇl-yameykha

Hebrew: וְאִ֣ם ׀ תֵּלֵ֣ךְ בִּדְרָכַ֗י לִשְׁמֹ֤ר חֻקַּי֙ וּמִצְוֺתַ֔י כַּאֲשֶׁ֥ר הָלַ֖ךְ דָּוִ֣יד אָבִ֑יךָ וְהַאֲרַכְתִּ֖י אֶת־יָמֶֽיךָ׃ {ס}
Translated: And I will further grant you long life, if you will walk in My ways and observe My laws and commandments, as did your father David.”
Transliteration: veim telekhe viderakhay lishemor chukay umitsevotay khaasher halakhe daviyd aviykha vehaarakhetiy et-yameykha {s}

Hebrew: וַיִּקַ֥ץ שְׁלֹמֹ֖ה וְהִנֵּ֣ה חֲל֑וֹם וַיָּב֨וֹא יְרוּשָׁלַ֜͏ִם וַֽיַּעֲמֹ֣ד ׀ לִפְנֵ֣י ׀ אֲר֣וֹן בְּרִית־אֲדֹנָ֗י וַיַּ֤עַל עֹלוֹת֙ וַיַּ֣עַשׂ שְׁלָמִ֔ים וַיַּ֥עַשׂ מִשְׁתֶּ֖ה לְכׇל־עֲבָדָֽיו׃ {פ}
Translated: Then Solomon awoke: it was a dream! He went to Jerusalem, stood before the Ark of the Covenant of the Sovereign One, and sacrificed burnt offerings and presented offerings of well-being; and he made a banquet for all his courtiers.
Transliteration: vayikats shelomoh vehineh chalvom vayavvo yerushala͏im vayaamod lifeney arvon veriyt-adonay vayaal olvot vayaash shelamiym vayaash misheteh lekhׇl-avadayv {f}

Hebrew: אָ֣ז תָּבֹ֗אנָה שְׁתַּ֛יִם נָשִׁ֥ים זֹנ֖וֹת אֶל־הַמֶּ֑לֶךְ וַֽתַּעֲמֹ֖דְנָה לְפָנָֽיו׃
Translated: Later two prostitutes came to the king and stood before him.
Transliteration: az tavonah shetayiim nashiym zonvot el-hamelekhe vataamodenah lefanayv

Hebrew: וַתֹּ֜אמֶר הָאִשָּׁ֤ה הָאַחַת֙ בִּ֣י אֲדֹנִ֔י אֲנִי֙ וְהָאִשָּׁ֣ה הַזֹּ֔את יֹשְׁבֹ֖ת בְּבַ֣יִת אֶחָ֑ד וָאֵלֵ֥ד עִמָּ֖הּ בַּבָּֽיִת׃
Translated: The first woman said, “Please, my lord! This woman and I live in the same house; and I gave birth to a child while she was in the house.
Transliteration: vatomer haishah haachat viy adoniy aniy vehaishah hazot yoshevot vevayiit echad vaeled imah vavayiit

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֞י בַּיּ֤וֹם הַשְּׁלִישִׁי֙ לְלִדְתִּ֔י וַתֵּ֖לֶד גַּם־הָאִשָּׁ֣ה הַזֹּ֑את וַאֲנַ֣חְנוּ יַחְדָּ֗ו אֵֽין־זָ֤ר אִתָּ֙נוּ֙ בַּבַּ֔יִת זוּלָתִ֥י שְׁתַּֽיִם־אֲנַ֖חְנוּ בַּבָּֽיִת׃
Translated: On the third day after I was delivered, this woman also gave birth to a child. We were alone; there was no one else with us in the house, just the two of us in the house.
Transliteration: vayehiy vayyvom hasheliyshiy lelidetiy vateled gam-haishah hazot vaanachenu yachedav eyn-zar itanu vavayiit zulatiy shetayiim-anachenu vavayiit

Hebrew: וַיָּ֛מׇת בֶּן־הָאִשָּׁ֥ה הַזֹּ֖את לָ֑יְלָה אֲשֶׁ֥ר שָׁכְבָ֖ה עָלָֽיו׃
Translated: During the night this woman’s child died, because she lay on it.
Transliteration: vayamׇt ven-haishah hazot layelah asher shakhevah alayv

Hebrew: וַתָּ֩קׇם֩ בְּת֨וֹךְ הַלַּ֜יְלָה וַתִּקַּ֧ח אֶת־בְּנִ֣י מֵאֶצְלִ֗י וַאֲמָֽתְךָ֙ יְשֵׁנָ֔ה וַתַּשְׁכִּיבֵ֖הוּ בְּחֵיקָ֑הּ וְאֶת־בְּנָ֥הּ הַמֵּ֖ת הִשְׁכִּ֥יבָה בְחֵיקִֽי׃
Translated: She arose in the night and took my son from my side while your maidservant was asleep, and laid him in her bosom; and she laid her dead son in my bosom.
Transliteration: vatakׇm vetvokhe halayelah vatikach et-veniy meetseliy vaamatekha yeshenah vatashekhiyvehu vecheykah veet-venah hamet hishekhiyvah vecheykiy

Hebrew: וָאָקֻ֥ם בַּבֹּ֛קֶר לְהֵינִ֥יק אֶת־בְּנִ֖י וְהִנֵּה־מֵ֑ת וָאֶתְבּוֹנֵ֤ן אֵלָיו֙ בַּבֹּ֔קֶר וְהִנֵּ֛ה לֹא־הָיָ֥ה בְנִ֖י אֲשֶׁ֥ר יָלָֽדְתִּי׃
Translated: When I arose in the morning to nurse my son, there he was, dead; but when I looked at him closely in the morning, it was not the son I had borne.”
Transliteration: vaakum vavoker leheyniyk et-veniy vehineh-met vaetevvonen elayv vavoker vehineh lo-hayah veniy asher yaladetiy

Hebrew: וַתֹּ֩אמֶר֩ הָאִשָּׁ֨ה הָאַחֶ֜רֶת לֹ֣א כִ֗י בְּנִ֤י הַחַי֙ וּבְנֵ֣ךְ הַמֵּ֔ת וְזֹ֤את אֹמֶ֙רֶת֙ לֹ֣א כִ֔י בְּנֵ֥ךְ הַמֵּ֖ת וּבְנִ֣י הֶחָ֑י וַתְּדַבֵּ֖רְנָה לִפְנֵ֥י הַמֶּֽלֶךְ׃
Translated: The other woman spoke up, “No, the live one is my son, and the dead one is yours!” But the first insisted, “No, the dead boy is yours; mine is the live one!” And they went on arguing before the king.
Transliteration: vatomer haishah haacheret lo khiy veniy hachay uvenekhe hamet vezot omeret lo khiy venekhe hamet uveniy hechay vatedaverenah lifeney hamelekhe

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר הַמֶּ֔לֶךְ זֹ֣את אֹמֶ֔רֶת זֶה־בְּנִ֥י הַחַ֖י וּבְנֵ֣ךְ הַמֵּ֑ת וְזֹ֤את אֹמֶ֙רֶת֙ לֹ֣א כִ֔י בְּנֵ֥ךְ הַמֵּ֖ת וּבְנִ֥י הֶחָֽי׃ {פ}
Translated: The king said, “One says, ‘This is my son, the live one, and the dead one is yours’; and the other says, ‘No, the dead boy is yours, mine is the live one.’”
Transliteration: vayomer hamelekhe zot omeret zeh-veniy hachay uvenekhe hamet vezot omeret lo khiy venekhe hamet uveniy hechay {f}

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֥אמֶר הַמֶּ֖לֶךְ קְח֣וּ לִי־חָ֑רֶב וַיָּבִ֥אוּ הַחֶ֖רֶב לִפְנֵ֥י הַמֶּֽלֶךְ׃
Translated: So the king gave the order, “Fetch me a sword.” A sword was brought before the king,
Transliteration: vayomer hamelekhe kechu liy-charev vayaviu hacherev lifeney hamelekhe

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר הַמֶּ֔לֶךְ גִּזְר֛וּ אֶת־הַיֶּ֥לֶד הַחַ֖י לִשְׁנָ֑יִם וּתְנ֤וּ אֶֽת־הַחֲצִי֙ לְאַחַ֔ת וְאֶֽת־הַחֲצִ֖י לְאֶחָֽת׃
Translated: and the king said, “Cut the live child in two, and give half to one and half to the other.”
Transliteration: vayomer hamelekhe gizeru et-hayeled hachay lishenayiim utenu et-hachatsiy leachat veet-hachatsiy leechat

Hebrew: וַתֹּ֣אמֶר הָאִשָּׁה֩ אֲשֶׁר־בְּנָ֨הּ הַחַ֜י אֶל־הַמֶּ֗לֶךְ כִּֽי־נִכְמְר֣וּ רַחֲמֶ֘יהָ֮ עַל־בְּנָהּ֒ וַתֹּ֣אמֶר ׀ בִּ֣י אֲדֹנִ֗י תְּנוּ־לָהּ֙ אֶת־הַיָּל֣וּד הַחַ֔י וְהָמֵ֖ת אַל־תְּמִיתֻ֑הוּ וְזֹ֣את אֹמֶ֗רֶת גַּם־לִ֥י גַם־לָ֛ךְ לֹ֥א יִהְיֶ֖ה גְּזֹֽרוּ׃
Translated: But the woman whose son was the live one pleaded with the king, for she was overcome with compassion for her son. “Please, my lord,” she cried, “give her the live child; only don’t kill it!” The other insisted, “It shall be neither yours nor mine; cut it in two!”
Transliteration: vatomer haishah asher-venah hachay el-hamelekhe khiy-nikhemeru rachameyha al-venah vatomer viy adoniy tenu-lah et-hayalud hachay vehamet al-temiytuhu vezot omeret gam-liy gam-lakhe lo yiheyeh gezoru

Hebrew: וַיַּ֨עַן הַמֶּ֜לֶךְ וַיֹּ֗אמֶר תְּנוּ־לָהּ֙ אֶת־הַיָּל֣וּד הַחַ֔י וְהָמֵ֖ת לֹ֣א תְמִיתֻ֑הוּ הִ֖יא אִמּֽוֹ׃ {ס}
Translated: Then the king spoke up. “Give the live child to her,” he said, “and do not put it to death; she is its mother.”
Transliteration: vayaan hamelekhe vayomer tenu-lah et-hayalud hachay vehamet lo temiytuhu hiy imvo {s}

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׁמְע֣וּ כׇל־יִשְׂרָאֵ֗ל אֶת־הַמִּשְׁפָּט֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר שָׁפַ֣ט הַמֶּ֔לֶךְ וַיִּֽרְא֖וּ מִפְּנֵ֣י הַמֶּ֑לֶךְ כִּ֣י רָא֔וּ כִּֽי־חׇכְמַ֧ת אֱלֹהִ֛ים בְּקִרְבּ֖וֹ לַעֲשׂ֥וֹת מִשְׁפָּֽט׃ {ס}
Translated: When all Israel heard the decision that the king had rendered, they stood in awe of the king; for they saw that he possessed divine wisdom to execute justice.
Transliteration: vayishemeu khׇl-yisherael et-hamishefat asher shafat hamelekhe vayireu mifeney hamelekhe khiy rau khiy-chׇkhemat Elohim vekirevvo laashvot mishefat {s}

Hebrew: וַֽיְהִי֙ הַמֶּ֣לֶךְ שְׁלֹמֹ֔ה מֶ֖לֶךְ עַל־כׇּל־יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃ {ס}
Translated: King Solomon was now king over all Israel.
Transliteration: vayehiy hamelekhe shelomoh melekhe al-khׇl-yisherael {s}

Hebrew: וְאֵ֥לֶּה הַשָּׂרִ֖ים אֲשֶׁר־ל֑וֹ עֲזַרְיָ֥הוּ בֶן־צָד֖וֹק הַכֹּהֵֽן׃ {ס}
Translated: These were his officials:Azariah son of Zadok—the priest;
Transliteration: veeleh hashariym asher-lvo azareyahu ven-tsadvok hakhohen {s}

Hebrew: אֱלִיחֹ֧רֶף וַאֲחִיָּ֛ה בְּנֵ֥י שִׁישָׁ֖א סֹפְרִ֑ים {ס} יְהוֹשָׁפָ֥ט בֶּן־אֲחִיל֖וּד הַמַּזְכִּֽיר׃ {ס}
Translated: Elihoreph and Ahijah sons of Shisha—scribes;Jehoshaphat son of Ahilud—recorder;
Transliteration: eliychoref vaachiyah veney shiysha soferiym {s} yehvoshafat ven-achiylud hamazekhiyr {s}

Hebrew: וּבְנָיָ֥הוּ בֶן־יְהוֹיָדָ֖ע עַל־הַצָּבָ֑א {ס} וְצָד֥וֹק וְאֶבְיָתָ֖ר כֹּהֲנִֽים׃ {ס}
Translated: Benaiah son of Jehoiada—over the army;Zadok and Abiathar—priests;
Transliteration: uvenayahu ven-yehvoyada al-hatsava {s} vetsadvok veeveyatar khohaniym {s}

Hebrew: וַעֲזַרְיָ֥הוּ בֶן־נָתָ֖ן עַל־הַנִּצָּבִ֑ים {ס} וְזָב֧וּד בֶּן־נָתָ֛ן כֹּהֵ֖ן רֵעֶ֥ה הַמֶּֽלֶךְ׃ {ס}
Translated: Azariah son of Nathan—in charge of the prefects;Zabud son of Nathan the priest—companion of the king;
Transliteration: vaazareyahu ven-natan al-hanitsaviym {s} vezavud ven-natan khohen reeh hamelekhe {s}

Hebrew: וַאֲחִישָׁ֖ר עַל־הַבָּ֑יִת {ס} וַאֲדֹנִירָ֥ם בֶּן־עַבְדָּ֖א עַל־הַמַּֽס׃ {ס}
Translated: Ahishar—in charge of the palace; andAdoniram son of Abda—in charge of the forced labor.
Transliteration: vaachiyshar al-havayiit {s} vaadoniyram ven-aveda al-hamas {s}

Hebrew: וְלִשְׁלֹמֹ֞ה שְׁנֵים־עָשָׂ֤ר נִצָּבִים֙ עַל־כׇּל־יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל וְכִלְכְּל֥וּ אֶת־הַמֶּ֖לֶךְ וְאֶת־בֵּית֑וֹ חֹ֧דֶשׁ בַּשָּׁנָ֛ה יִהְיֶ֥ה עַל־[הָאֶחָ֖ד] (אחד) לְכַלְכֵּֽל׃ {ס}
Translated: Solomon had twelve prefects governing all Israel, who provided food for the king and his household; each had to provide food for one month in the year.
Transliteration: velishelomoh sheneym-ashar nitsaviym al-khׇl-yisherael vekhilekhelu et-hamelekhe veet-veytvo chodesh vashanah yiheyeh al-[haechad] (chd) lekhalekhel {s}

Hebrew: וְאֵ֣לֶּה שְׁמוֹתָ֔ם בֶּן־ח֖וּר בְּהַ֥ר אֶפְרָֽיִם׃ {ס}
Translated: And these were their names: Ben-hur, in the hill country of Ephraim;
Transliteration: veeleh shemvotam ven-chur vehar eferayiim {s}

Hebrew: בֶּן־דֶּ֛קֶר בְּמָקַ֥ץ וּבְשַׁעַלְבִ֖ים וּבֵ֣ית שָׁ֑מֶשׁ וְאֵיל֖וֹן בֵּ֥ית חָנָֽן׃ {ס}
Translated: Ben-deker, in Makaz, Shaalbim, Beth-shemesh, and Elon-beth-hanan;
Transliteration: ven-deker vemakats uveshaaleviym uveyt shamesh veeylvon veyt chanan {s}

Hebrew: בֶּן־חֶ֖סֶד בָּאֲרֻבּ֑וֹת ל֥וֹ שֹׂכֹ֖ה וְכׇל־אֶ֥רֶץ חֵֽפֶר׃ {ס}
Translated: Ben-hesed in Arubboth—he governed Socho and all the Hepher area;
Transliteration: ven-chesed vaaruvvot lvo shokhoh vekhׇl-erets chefer {s}

Hebrew: בֶּן־אֲבִינָדָ֖ב כׇּל־נָ֣פַת דֹּ֑אר טָפַת֙ בַּת־שְׁלֹמֹ֔ה הָ֥יְתָה לּ֖וֹ לְאִשָּֽׁה׃ {ס}
Translated: Ben-abinadab, [in] all of Naphath-dor (Solomon’s daughter Taphath was his wife);
Transliteration: ven-aviynadav khׇl-nafat dor tafat vat-shelomoh hayetah lvo leishah {s}

Hebrew: בַּֽעֲנָא֙ בֶּן־אֲחִיל֔וּד תַּעְנַ֖ךְ וּמְגִדּ֑וֹ וְכׇל־בֵּ֣ית שְׁאָ֡ן אֲשֶׁר֩ אֵ֨צֶל צָרְתַ֜נָה מִתַּ֣חַת לְיִזְרְעֶ֗אל מִבֵּ֤ית שְׁאָן֙ עַ֚ד אָבֵ֣ל מְחוֹלָ֔ה עַ֖ד מֵעֵ֥בֶר לְיׇקְמְעָֽם׃ {ס}
Translated: Baana son of Ahilud [in] Taanach and Megiddo and all Beth-shean, which is beside Zarethan, below Jezreel—from Beth-shean to Abel-meholah as far as the other side of Jokmeam;
Transliteration: vaana ven-achiylud taenakhe umegidvo vekhׇl-veyt shean asher etsel tsaretanah mitachat leyizereel miveyt shean ad avel mechvolah ad meever leyׇkemeam {s}

Hebrew: בֶּן־גֶּ֖בֶר בְּרָמֹ֣ת גִּלְעָ֑ד ל֡וֹ חַוֺּת֩ יָאִ֨יר בֶּן־מְנַשֶּׁ֜ה אֲשֶׁ֣ר בַּגִּלְעָ֗ד ל֚וֹ חֶ֤בֶל אַרְגֹּב֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר בַּבָּשָׁ֔ן שִׁשִּׁים֙ עָרִ֣ים גְּדֹל֔וֹת חוֹמָ֖ה וּבְרִ֥יחַ נְחֹֽשֶׁת׃ {ס}
Translated: Ben-geber, in Ramoth-gilead—he governed the villages of Jair son of Manasseh that are in Gilead, and he also governed the district of Argob that is in Bashan, sixty large towns with walls and bronze bars;
Transliteration: ven-gever veramot gilead lvo chavot yaiyr ven-menasheh asher vagilead lvo chevel aregov asher vavashan shishiym ariym gedolvot chvomah uveriycha nechoshet {s}

Hebrew: אֲחִינָדָ֥ב בֶּן־עִדֹּ֖א מַחֲנָֽיְמָה׃ {ס}
Translated: Ahinadab son of Iddo, in Mahanaim;
Transliteration: achiynadav ven-ido machanayemah {s}

Hebrew: אֲחִימַ֖עַץ בְּנַפְתָּלִ֑י גַּם־ה֗וּא לָקַ֛ח אֶת־בָּשְׂמַ֥ת בַּת־שְׁלֹמֹ֖ה לְאִשָּֽׁה׃ {ס}
Translated: Ahimaaz, in Naphtali (he too took a daughter of Solomon—Basemath—to wife);
Transliteration: achiymaats venafetaliy gam-hu lakach et-vashemat vat-shelomoh leishah {s}

Hebrew: בַּֽעֲנָא֙ בֶּן־חוּשָׁ֔י בְּאָשֵׁ֖ר וּבְעָלֽוֹת׃ {ס}
Translated: Baanah son of Hushi, in Asher and Bealoth;
Transliteration: vaana ven-chushay veasher uvealvot {s}

Hebrew: יְהוֹשָׁפָ֥ט בֶּן־פָּר֖וּחַ בְּיִשָּׂשכָֽר׃ {ס}
Translated: Jehoshaphat son of Paruah, in Issachar;
Transliteration: yehvoshafat ven-farucha veyishashkhar {s}

Hebrew: שִׁמְעִ֥י בֶן־אֵלָ֖א בְּבִנְיָמִֽן׃ {ס}
Translated: Shimei son of Ela, in Benjamin;
Transliteration: shimeiy ven-ela vevineyamin {s}

Hebrew: גֶּ֥בֶר בֶּן־אֻרִ֖י בְּאֶ֣רֶץ גִּלְעָ֑ד אֶ֜רֶץ סִיח֣וֹן ׀ מֶ֣לֶךְ הָאֱמֹרִ֗י וְעֹג֙ מֶ֣לֶךְ הַבָּשָׁ֔ן וּנְצִ֥יב אֶחָ֖ד אֲשֶׁ֥ר בָּאָֽרֶץ׃
Translated: Geber son of Uri, in the region of Gilead, the country of Sihon, king of the Amorites, and Og, king of Bashan; and one prefect who was in the land.
Transliteration: gever ven-uriy veerets gilead erets siychvon melekhe haemoriy veog melekhe havashan unetsiyv echad asher vaarets

Hebrew: יְהוּדָ֤ה וְיִשְׂרָאֵל֙ רַבִּ֔ים כַּח֥וֹל אֲשֶׁר־עַל־הַיָּ֖ם לָרֹ֑ב אֹכְלִ֥ים וְשֹׁתִ֖ים וּשְׂמֵחִֽים׃
Translated: Judah and Israel were as numerous as the sands of the sea; they ate and drank and were content.
Transliteration: yehudah veyisherael raviym khachvol asher-al-hayam larov okheliym veshotiym ushemechiym

Hebrew: וּשְׁלֹמֹ֗ה הָיָ֤ה מוֹשֵׁל֙ בְּכׇל־הַמַּמְלָכ֔וֹת מִן־הַנָּהָר֙ אֶ֣רֶץ פְּלִשְׁתִּ֔ים וְעַ֖ד גְּב֣וּל מִצְרָ֑יִם מַגִּשִׁ֥ים מִנְחָ֛ה וְעֹבְדִ֥ים אֶת־שְׁלֹמֹ֖ה כׇּל־יְמֵ֥י חַיָּֽיו׃ {פ}
Translated: Solomon’s rule extended over all the kingdoms from the Euphrates to the land of the Philistines and the boundary of Egypt. They brought Solomon tribute and were subject to him all his life.
Transliteration: ushelomoh hayah mvoshel vekhׇl-hamamelakhvot min-hanahar erets felishetiym vead gevul mitserayiim magishiym minechah veovediym et-shelomoh khׇl-yemey chayayv {f}

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֥י לֶֽחֶם־שְׁלֹמֹ֖ה לְי֣וֹם אֶחָ֑ד שְׁלֹשִׁ֥ים כֹּר֙ סֹ֔לֶת וְשִׁשִּׁ֥ים כֹּ֖ר קָֽמַח׃
Translated: Solomon’s daily provisions consisted of 30 kors of semolina, and 60 kors of [ordinary] flour,
Transliteration: vayehiy lechem-shelomoh leyvom echad sheloshiym khor solet veshishiym khor kamach

Hebrew: עֲשָׂרָ֨ה בָקָ֜ר בְּרִאִ֗ים וְעֶשְׂרִ֥ים בָּקָ֛ר רְעִ֖י וּמֵ֣אָה צֹ֑אן לְ֠בַ֠ד מֵאַיָּ֤ל וּצְבִי֙ וְיַחְמ֔וּר וּבַרְבֻּרִ֖ים אֲבוּסִֽים׃
Translated: 10 fattened oxen, 20 pasture-fed oxen, and 100 sheep and goats, besides deer and gazelles, roebucks and fatted geese.
Transliteration: asharah vakar veriiym veesheriym vakar reiy umeah tson levad meayal utseviy veyachemur uvarevuriym avusiym

Hebrew: כִּי־ה֞וּא רֹדֶ֣ה ׀ בְּכׇל־עֵ֣בֶר הַנָּהָ֗ר מִתִּפְסַח֙ וְעַד־עַזָּ֔ה בְּכׇל־מַלְכֵ֖י עֵ֣בֶר הַנָּהָ֑ר וְשָׁל֗וֹם הָ֥יָה ל֛וֹ מִכׇּל־עֲבָרָ֖יו מִסָּבִֽיב׃
Translated: For he controlled the whole region west of the Euphrates—all the kings west of the Euphrates, from Tiphsah to Gaza—and he had peace on all his borders round about.
Transliteration: khiy-hu rodeh vekhׇl-ever hanahar mitifesach vead-azah vekhׇl-malekhey ever hanahar veshalvom hayah lvo mikhׇl-avarayv misaviyv

Hebrew: וַיֵּ֩שֶׁב֩ יְהוּדָ֨ה וְיִשְׂרָאֵ֜ל לָבֶ֗טַח אִ֣ישׁ תַּ֤חַת גַּפְנוֹ֙ וְתַ֣חַת תְּאֵנָת֔וֹ מִדָּ֖ן וְעַד־בְּאֵ֣ר שָׁ֑בַע כֹּ֖ל יְמֵ֥י שְׁלֹמֹֽה׃ {ס}
Translated: All the days of Solomon, Judah and Israel from Dan to Beer-sheba dwelt in safety, every family under its own vine and fig tree.
Transliteration: vayeshev yehudah veyisherael lavetach iysh tachat gafenvo vetachat teenatvo midan vead-veer shava khol yemey shelomoh {s}

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֣י לִשְׁלֹמֹ֗ה אַרְבָּעִ֥ים אֶ֛לֶף אֻֽרְוֺ֥ת סוּסִ֖ים לְמֶרְכָּב֑וֹ וּשְׁנֵים־עָשָׂ֥ר אֶ֖לֶף פָּרָשִֽׁים׃
Translated: Solomon had 40,000 stalls of horses for his chariotry and 12,000 riders.
Transliteration: vayehiy lishelomoh arevaiym elef urevot susiym lemerekhavvo usheneym-ashar elef farashiym

Hebrew: וְכִלְכְּלוּ֩ הַנִּצָּבִ֨ים הָאֵ֜לֶּה אֶת־הַמֶּ֣לֶךְ שְׁלֹמֹ֗ה וְאֵ֧ת כׇּל־הַקָּרֵ֛ב אֶל־שֻׁלְחַ֥ן הַמֶּלֶךְ־שְׁלֹמֹ֖ה אִ֣ישׁ חׇדְשׁ֑וֹ לֹ֥א יְעַדְּר֖וּ דָּבָֽר׃
Translated: All those prefects, each during his month, would furnish provisions for King Solomon and for all who were admitted to King Solomon’s table; they did not fall short in anything.
Transliteration: vekhilekhelu hanitsaviym haeleh et-hamelekhe shelomoh veet khׇl-hakarev el-shulechan hamelekhe-shelomoh iysh chׇdeshvo lo yeaderu davar

Hebrew: וְהַשְּׂעֹרִ֣ים וְהַתֶּ֔בֶן לַסּוּסִ֖ים וְלָרָ֑כֶשׁ יָבִ֗אוּ אֶל־הַמָּקוֹם֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר יִֽהְיֶה־שָּׁ֔ם אִ֖ישׁ כְּמִשְׁפָּטֽוֹ׃ {ס}
Translated: They would also, each in his turn, deliver barley and straw for the horses and the swift steeds to the places where they were stationed.
Transliteration: vehasheoriym vehateven lasusiym velarakhesh yaviu el-hamakvom asher yiheyeh-sham iysh khemishefatvo {s}

Hebrew: וַיִּתֵּן֩ אֱלֹהִ֨ים חׇכְמָ֧ה לִשְׁלֹמֹ֛ה וּתְבוּנָ֖ה הַרְבֵּ֣ה מְאֹ֑ד וְרֹ֣חַב לֵ֔ב כַּח֕וֹל אֲשֶׁ֖ר עַל־שְׂפַ֥ת הַיָּֽם׃
Translated: God endowed Solomon with wisdom and discernment in great measure, with understanding as vast as the sands on the seashore.
Transliteration: vayiten Elohim chׇkhemah lishelomoh utevunah hareveh meod verochav lev khachvol asher al-shefat hayam

Hebrew: וַתֵּ֙רֶב֙ חׇכְמַ֣ת שְׁלֹמֹ֔ה מֵחׇכְמַ֖ת כׇּל־בְּנֵי־קֶ֑דֶם וּמִכֹּ֖ל חׇכְמַ֥ת מִצְרָֽיִם׃
Translated: Solomon’s wisdom was greater than the wisdom of all the Kedemites and than all the wisdom of the Egyptians.
Transliteration: vaterev chׇkhemat shelomoh mechׇkhemat khׇl-veney-kedem umikhol chׇkhemat mitserayiim

Hebrew: וַיֶּחְכַּם֮ מִכׇּל־הָאָדָם֒ מֵאֵיתָ֣ן הָאֶזְרָחִ֗י וְהֵימָ֧ן וְכַלְכֹּ֛ל וְדַרְדַּ֖ע בְּנֵ֣י מָח֑וֹל וַיְהִֽי־שְׁמ֥וֹ בְכׇֽל־הַגּוֹיִ֖ם סָבִֽיב׃
Translated: He was wiser than anybody else—including Ethan the Ezrahite, and Heman, Chalkol, and Darda the sons of Mahol. His fame spread among all the surrounding nations.
Transliteration: vayechekham mikhׇl-haadam meeytan haezerachiy veheyman vekhalekhol vedareda veney machvol vayehiy-shemvo vekhׇl-hagvoyim saviyv

Hebrew: וַיְדַבֵּ֕ר שְׁלֹ֥שֶׁת אֲלָפִ֖ים מָשָׁ֑ל וַיְהִ֥י שִׁיר֖וֹ חֲמִשָּׁ֥ה וָאָֽלֶף׃
Translated: He composed three thousand proverbs, and his songs numbered one thousand and five.
Transliteration: vayedaver sheloshet alafiym mashal vayehiy shiyrvo chamishah vaalef

Hebrew: וַיְדַבֵּר֮ עַל־הָעֵצִים֒ מִן־הָאֶ֙רֶז֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר בַּלְּבָנ֔וֹן וְעַד֙ הָאֵז֔וֹב אֲשֶׁ֥ר יֹצֵ֖א בַּקִּ֑יר וַיְדַבֵּר֙ עַל־הַבְּהֵמָ֣ה וְעַל־הָע֔וֹף וְעַל־הָרֶ֖מֶשׂ וְעַל־הַדָּגִֽים׃
Translated: He discoursed about trees, from the cedar in Lebanon to the hyssop that grows out of the wall; and he discoursed about beasts, birds, creeping things, and fishes.
Transliteration: vayedaver al-haetsiym min-haerez asher valevanvon vead haezvov asher yotse vakiyr vayedaver al-havehemah veal-havof veal-haremesh veal-hadagiym

Hebrew: וַיָּבֹ֙אוּ֙ מִכׇּל־הָ֣עַמִּ֔ים לִשְׁמֹ֕עַ אֵ֖ת חׇכְמַ֣ת שְׁלֹמֹ֑ה מֵאֵת֙ כׇּל־מַלְכֵ֣י הָאָ֔רֶץ אֲשֶׁ֥ר שָׁמְע֖וּ אֶת־חׇכְמָתֽוֹ׃ {ס}
Translated: Envoys came from all peoples to hear Solomon’s wisdom, [sent] by all the monarchs of the earth who had heard of his wisdom.
Transliteration: vayavou mikhׇl-haamiym lishemoa et chׇkhemat shelomoh meet khׇl-malekhey haarets asher shameu et-chׇkhematvo {s}

Hebrew: וַ֠יִּשְׁלַ֠ח חִירָ֨ם מֶלֶךְ־צ֤וֹר אֶת־עֲבָדָיו֙ אֶל־שְׁלֹמֹ֔ה כִּ֣י שָׁמַ֔ע כִּ֥י אֹת֛וֹ מָשְׁח֥וּ לְמֶ֖לֶךְ תַּ֣חַת אָבִ֑יהוּ כִּ֣י אֹהֵ֗ב הָיָ֥ה חִירָ֛ם לְדָוִ֖ד כׇּל־הַיָּמִֽים׃ {ס}
Translated: King Hiram of Tyre sent his officials to Solomon when he heard that he had been anointed king in place of his father; for Hiram had always been a friend of David.
Transliteration: vayishelach chiyram melekhe-tsvor et-avadayv el-shelomoh khiy shama khiy otvo mashechu lemelekhe tachat aviyhu khiy ohev hayah chiyram ledavid khׇl-hayamiym {s}

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׁלַ֣ח שְׁלֹמֹ֔ה אֶל־חִירָ֖ם לֵאמֹֽר׃
Translated: Solomon sent this message to Hiram:
Transliteration: vayishelach shelomoh el-chiyram lemor

Hebrew: אַתָּ֨ה יָדַ֜עְתָּ אֶת־דָּוִ֣ד אָבִ֗י כִּ֣י לֹ֤א יָכֹל֙ לִבְנ֣וֹת בַּ֗יִת לְשֵׁם֙ יְהֹוָ֣ה אֱלֹהָ֔יו מִפְּנֵ֥י הַמִּלְחָמָ֖ה אֲשֶׁ֣ר סְבָבֻ֑הוּ עַ֤ד תֵּת־יְהֹוָה֙ אֹתָ֔ם תַּ֖חַת כַּפּ֥וֹת (רגלו) [רַגְלָֽי]׃
Translated: “You know that my father David could not build a house for the name of the E<small>TERNAL</small> his God because of the enemies that encompassed him, until G<small>OD</small> had placed them under the soles of his feet.
Transliteration: atah yadaeta et-david aviy khiy lo yakhol livenvot vayiit leshem yehovah elohayv mifeney hamilechamah asher sevavuhu ad tet-yehovah otam tachat khafvot (rglv) [ragelay]

Hebrew: וְעַתָּ֕ה הֵנִ֨יחַ יְהֹוָ֧ה אֱלֹהַ֛י לִ֖י מִסָּבִ֑יב אֵ֣ין שָׂטָ֔ן וְאֵ֖ין פֶּ֥גַע רָֽע׃
Translated: But now the E<small>TERNAL</small> my God has given me respite all around; there is no adversary and no mischance.
Transliteration: veatah heniycha yehovah elohay liy misaviyv eyn shatan veeyn fega ra

Hebrew: וְהִנְנִ֣י אֹמֵ֔ר לִבְנ֣וֹת בַּ֔יִת לְשֵׁ֖ם יְהֹוָ֣ה אֱלֹהָ֑י כַּאֲשֶׁ֣ר ׀ דִּבֶּ֣ר יְהֹוָ֗ה אֶל־דָּוִ֤ד אָבִי֙ לֵאמֹ֔ר בִּנְךָ֗ אֲשֶׁ֨ר אֶתֵּ֤ן תַּחְתֶּ֙יךָ֙ עַל־כִּסְאֶ֔ךָ הוּא־יִבְנֶ֥ה הַבַּ֖יִת לִשְׁמִֽי׃
Translated: And so I propose to build a house for the name of the E<small>TERNAL</small> my God, as the E<small>TERNAL</small> promised my father David, saying, ‘Your son, whom I will set on your throne in your place, shall build the house for My name.’
Transliteration: vehineniy omer livenvot vayiit leshem yehovah elohay khaasher diver yehovah el-david aviy lemor vinekha asher eten tacheteykha al-khiseekha hu-yiveneh havayiit lishemiy

Hebrew: וְעַתָּ֡ה צַוֵּה֩ וְיִכְרְתוּ־לִ֨י אֲרָזִ֜ים מִן־הַלְּבָנ֗וֹן וַעֲבָדַי֙ יִהְי֣וּ עִם־עֲבָדֶ֔יךָ וּשְׂכַ֤ר עֲבָדֶ֙יךָ֙ אֶתֵּ֣ן לְךָ֔ כְּכֹ֖ל אֲשֶׁ֣ר תֹּאמֵ֑ר כִּ֣י ׀ אַתָּ֣ה יָדַ֗עְתָּ כִּ֣י אֵ֥ין בָּ֛נוּ אִ֛ישׁ יֹדֵ֥עַ לִכְרׇת־עֵצִ֖ים כַּצִּדֹנִֽים׃
Translated: Please, then, give orders for cedars to be cut for me in the Lebanon. My servants will work with yours, and I will pay you any wages you may ask for your servants; for as you know, there is none among us who knows how to cut timber like the Sidonians.”
Transliteration: veatah tsaveh veyikheretu-liy araziym min-halevanvon vaavaday yiheyu im-avadeykha ushekhar avadeykha eten lekha khekhol asher tomer khiy atah yadaeta khiy eyn vanu iysh yodea likherׇt-etsiym khatsidoniym

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֞י כִּשְׁמֹ֧עַ חִירָ֛ם אֶת־דִּבְרֵ֥י שְׁלֹמֹ֖ה וַיִּשְׂמַ֣ח מְאֹ֑ד וַיֹּ֗אמֶר בָּר֤וּךְ יְהֹוָה֙ הַיּ֔וֹם אֲשֶׁ֨ר נָתַ֤ן לְדָוִד֙ בֵּ֣ן חָכָ֔ם עַל־הָעָ֥ם הָרָ֖ב הַזֶּֽה׃
Translated: When Hiram heard Solomon’s message, he was overjoyed. “Praised be G<small>OD</small> this day,” he said, “for granting David a wise son to govern this great people.”
Transliteration: vayehiy khishemoa chiyram et-diverey shelomoh vayishemach meod vayomer varukhe yehovah hayyvom asher natan ledavid ven chakham al-haam harav hazeh

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׁלַ֤ח חִירָם֙ אֶל־שְׁלֹמֹ֣ה לֵאמֹ֔ר שָׁמַ֕עְתִּי אֵ֥ת אֲשֶׁר־שָׁלַ֖חְתָּ אֵלָ֑י אֲנִ֤י אֶֽעֱשֶׂה֙ אֶת־כׇּל־חֶפְצְךָ֔ בַּעֲצֵ֥י אֲרָזִ֖ים וּבַעֲצֵ֥י בְרוֹשִֽׁים׃
Translated: So Hiram sent word to Solomon: “I have your message; I will supply all the cedar and cypress logs you require.
Transliteration: vayishelach chiyram el-shelomoh lemor shamaetiy et asher-shalacheta elay aniy eesheh et-khׇl-chefetsekha vaatsey araziym uvaatsey vervoshiym

Hebrew: עֲ֠בָדַ֠י יֹרִ֨דוּ מִן־הַלְּבָנ֜וֹן יָ֗מָּה וַ֠אֲנִ֠י אֲשִׂימֵ֨ם דֹּבְר֤וֹת בַּיָּם֙ עַֽד־הַמָּק֞וֹם אֲשֶׁר־תִּשְׁלַ֥ח אֵלַ֛י וְנִפַּצְתִּ֥ים שָׁ֖ם וְאַתָּ֣ה תִשָּׂ֑א וְאַתָּה֙ תַּעֲשֶׂ֣ה אֶת־חֶפְצִ֔י לָתֵ֖ת לֶ֥חֶם בֵּיתִֽי׃
Translated: My servants will bring them down to the sea from the Lebanon; and at the sea I will make them into floats and [deliver them] to any place that you designate to me. There I shall break them up for you to carry away. You, in turn, will supply the food I require for my household.”
Transliteration: avaday yoridu min-halevanvon yamah vaaniy ashiymem dovervot vayam ad-hamakvom asher-tishelach elay venifatsetiym sham veatah tisha veatah taasheh et-chefetsiy latet lechem veytiy

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֨י חִיר֜וֹם נֹתֵ֣ן לִשְׁלֹמֹ֗ה עֲצֵ֧י אֲרָזִ֛ים וַעֲצֵ֥י בְרוֹשִׁ֖ים כׇּל־חֶפְצֽוֹ׃
Translated: So Hiram kept Solomon provided with all the cedar and cypress wood he required,
Transliteration: vayehiy chiyrvom noten lishelomoh atsey araziym vaatsey vervoshiym khׇl-chefetsvo

Hebrew: וּשְׁלֹמֹה֩ נָתַ֨ן לְחִירָ֜ם עֶשְׂרִים֩ אֶ֨לֶף כֹּ֤ר חִטִּים֙ מַכֹּ֣לֶת לְבֵית֔וֹ וְעֶשְׂרִ֥ים כֹּ֖ר שֶׁ֣מֶן כָּתִ֑ית כֹּֽה־יִתֵּ֧ן שְׁלֹמֹ֛ה לְחִירָ֖ם שָׁנָ֥ה בְשָׁנָֽה׃ {פ}
Translated: and Solomon delivered to Hiram 20,000 kors of wheat as provisions for his household and 20 kors of beaten oil. Such was Solomon’s annual payment to Hiram.
Transliteration: ushelomoh natan lechiyram esheriym elef khor chitiym makholet leveytvo veesheriym khor shemen khatiyt khoh-yiten shelomoh lechiyram shanah veshanah {f}

Hebrew: וַֽיהֹוָ֗ה נָתַ֤ן חׇכְמָה֙ לִשְׁלֹמֹ֔ה כַּאֲשֶׁ֖ר דִּבֶּר־ל֑וֹ וַיְהִ֣י שָׁלֹ֗ם בֵּ֤ין חִירָם֙ וּבֵ֣ין שְׁלֹמֹ֔ה וַיִּכְרְת֥וּ בְרִ֖ית שְׁנֵיהֶֽם׃
Translated: G<small>OD</small> had given Solomon wisdom, just as promised. There was friendship between Hiram and Solomon, and the two of them made a treaty.
Transliteration: vayhovah natan chׇkhemah lishelomoh khaasher diver-lvo vayehiy shalom veyn chiyram uveyn shelomoh vayikheretu veriyt sheneyhem

Hebrew: וַיַּ֨עַל הַמֶּ֧לֶךְ שְׁלֹמֹ֛ה מַ֖ס מִכׇּל־יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל וַיְהִ֣י הַמַּ֔ס שְׁלֹשִׁ֥ים אֶ֖לֶף אִֽישׁ׃
Translated: King Solomon imposed forced labor on all Israel; the levy came to 30,000 men.
Transliteration: vayaal hamelekhe shelomoh mas mikhׇl-yisherael vayehiy hamas sheloshiym elef iysh

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׁלָחֵ֣ם לְבָנ֗וֹנָה עֲשֶׂ֨רֶת אֲלָפִ֤ים בַּחֹ֙דֶשׁ֙ חֲלִיפ֔וֹת חֹ֚דֶשׁ יִהְי֣וּ בַלְּבָנ֔וֹן שְׁנַ֥יִם חֳדָשִׁ֖ים בְּבֵית֑וֹ וַאֲדֹנִירָ֖ם עַל־הַמַּֽס׃ {ס}
Translated: He sent them to the Lebanon in shifts of 10,000 a month: they would spend one month in the Lebanon and two months at home. Adoniram was in charge of the forced labor.
Transliteration: vayishelachem levanvonah asheret alafiym vachodesh chaliyfvot chodesh yiheyu valevanvon shenayiim chodashiym veveytvo vaadoniyram al-hamas {s}

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֧י לִשְׁלֹמֹ֛ה שִׁבְעִ֥ים אֶ֖לֶף נֹשֵׂ֣א סַבָּ֑ל וּשְׁמֹנִ֥ים אֶ֖לֶף חֹצֵ֥ב בָּהָֽר׃
Translated: Solomon also had 70,000 porters and 80,000 quarriers in the hills,
Transliteration: vayehiy lishelomoh shiveiym elef noshe saval ushemoniym elef chotsev vahar

Hebrew: לְ֠בַ֠ד מִשָּׂרֵ֨י הַנִּצָּבִ֤ים לִשְׁלֹמֹה֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר עַל־הַמְּלָאכָ֔ה שְׁלֹ֥שֶׁת אֲלָפִ֖ים וּשְׁלֹ֣שׁ מֵא֑וֹת הָרֹדִ֣ים בָּעָ֔ם הָעֹשִׂ֖ים בַּמְּלָאכָֽה׃ {ס}
Translated: apart from Solomon’s 3,300 officials who were in charge of the work and supervised the gangs doing the work.
Transliteration: levad misharey hanitsaviym lishelomoh asher al-hamelakhah sheloshet alafiym ushelosh mevot harodiym vaam haoshiym vamelakhah {s}

Hebrew: וַיְצַ֣ו הַמֶּ֡לֶךְ וַיַּסִּ֩עוּ֩ אֲבָנִ֨ים גְּדֹל֜וֹת אֲבָנִ֧ים יְקָר֛וֹת לְיַסֵּ֥ד הַבָּ֖יִת אַבְנֵ֥י גָזִֽית׃
Translated: The king ordered huge blocks of choice stone to be quarried, so that the foundations of the house might be laid with hewn stones.
Transliteration: vayetsav hamelekhe vayasiu avaniym gedolvot avaniym yekarvot leyased havayiit aveney gaziyt

Hebrew: וַֽיִּפְסְל֞וּ בֹּנֵ֧י שְׁלֹמֹ֛ה וּבֹנֵ֥י חִיר֖וֹם וְהַגִּבְלִ֑ים וַיָּכִ֛ינוּ הָעֵצִ֥ים וְהָאֲבָנִ֖ים לִבְנ֥וֹת הַבָּֽיִת׃ {פ}
Translated: Solomon’s masons, Hiram’s masons, and those from Gebal shaped them. Thus the timber and the stones for building the house were made ready.
Transliteration: vayifeselu voney shelomoh uvoney chiyrvom vehagiveliym vayakhiynu haetsiym vehaavaniym livenvot havayiit {f}

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֣י בִשְׁמוֹנִ֣ים שָׁנָ֣ה וְאַרְבַּ֣ע מֵא֣וֹת שָׁנָ֡ה לְצֵ֣את בְּנֵֽי־יִשְׂרָאֵ֣ל מֵאֶֽרֶץ־מִצְרַ֩יִם֩ בַּשָּׁנָ֨ה הָרְבִיעִ֜ית בְּחֹ֣דֶשׁ זִ֗ו ה֚וּא הַחֹ֣דֶשׁ הַשֵּׁנִ֔י לִמְלֹ֥ךְ שְׁלֹמֹ֖ה עַל־יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל וַיִּ֥בֶן הַבַּ֖יִת לַיהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: In the four hundred and eightieth year after the Israelites left the land of Egypt, in the month of Ziv—that is, the second month—in the fourth year of his reign over Israel, Solomon began to build the House of G<small>OD</small>.
Transliteration: vayehiy vishemvoniym shanah veareva mevot shanah letset veney-yisherael meerets-mitserayiim vashanah hareviyiyt vechodesh ziv hu hachodesh hasheniy limelokhe shelomoh al-yisherael vayiven havayiit layhovah

Hebrew: וְהַבַּ֗יִת אֲשֶׁ֨ר בָּנָ֜ה הַמֶּ֤לֶךְ שְׁלֹמֹה֙ לַיהֹוָ֔ה שִׁשִּׁים־אַמָּ֥ה אׇרְכּ֖וֹ וְעֶשְׂרִ֣ים רׇחְבּ֑וֹ וּשְׁלֹשִׁ֥ים אַמָּ֖ה קוֹמָתֽוֹ׃
Translated: The House that King Solomon built for G<small>OD</small> was 60 cubits long, 20 cubits wide, and 30 cubits high.
Transliteration: vehavayiit asher vanah hamelekhe shelomoh layhovah shishiym-amah ׇrekhvo veesheriym rׇchevvo usheloshiym amah kvomatvo

Hebrew: וְהָאוּלָ֗ם עַל־פְּנֵי֙ הֵיכַ֣ל הַבַּ֔יִת עֶשְׂרִ֤ים אַמָּה֙ אׇרְכּ֔וֹ עַל־פְּנֵ֖י רֹ֣חַב הַבָּ֑יִת עֶ֧שֶׂר בָּאַמָּ֛ה רׇחְבּ֖וֹ עַל־פְּנֵ֥י הַבָּֽיִת׃
