Translated: The portico in front of the Great Hall of the House was 20 cubits long—along the width of the House—and 10 cubits deep to the front of the House.
Transliteration: vehaulam al-feney heykhal havayiit esheriym amah ׇrekhvo al-feney rochav havayiit esher vaamah rׇchevvo al-feney havayiit

Hebrew: וַיַּ֣עַשׂ לַבָּ֔יִת חַלּוֹנֵ֖י שְׁקֻפִ֥ים אֲטוּמִֽים׃
Translated: He made windows for the House, recessed and latticed.
Transliteration: vayaash lavayiit chalvoney shekufiym atumiym

Hebrew: וַיִּ֩בֶן֩ עַל־קִ֨יר הַבַּ֤יִת (יצוע) [יָצִ֙יעַ֙] סָבִ֔יב אֶת־קִיר֤וֹת הַבַּ֙יִת֙ סָבִ֔יב לַהֵיכָ֖ל וְלַדְּבִ֑יר וַיַּ֥עַשׂ צְלָע֖וֹת סָבִֽיב׃
Translated: Against the outside wall of the House—the outside walls of the House enclosing the Great Hall and the Shrine—he built a storied structure; and he made side chambers all around.
Transliteration: vayiven al-kiyr havayiit (ytsv) [yatsiya] saviyv et-kiyrvot havayiit saviyv laheykhal veladeviyr vayaash tselavot saviyv

Hebrew: (היצוע) [הַיָּצִ֨יעַ] הַתַּחְתֹּנָ֜ה חָמֵ֧שׁ בָּאַמָּ֣ה רׇחְבָּ֗הּ וְהַתִּֽיכֹנָה֙ שֵׁ֤שׁ בָּאַמָּה֙ רׇחְבָּ֔הּ וְהַ֨שְּׁלִישִׁ֔ית שֶׁ֥בַע בָּאַמָּ֖ה רׇחְבָּ֑הּ כִּ֡י מִגְרָעוֹת֩ נָתַ֨ן לַבַּ֤יִת סָבִיב֙ ח֔וּצָה לְבִלְתִּ֖י אֲחֹ֥ז בְּקִירוֹת־הַבָּֽיִת׃
Translated: The lowest story was 5 cubits wide, the middle one 6 cubits wide, and the third 7 cubits wide; for he had provided recesses around the outside of the House so as not to penetrate the walls of the House.
Transliteration: (hytsv) [hayatsiya] hatachetonah chamesh vaamah rׇchevah vehatiykhonah shesh vaamah rׇchevah vehasheliyshiyt sheva vaamah rׇchevah khiy migeravot natan lavayiit saviyv chutsah leviletiy achoz vekiyrvot-havayiit

Hebrew: וְהַבַּ֙יִת֙ בְּהִבָּ֣נֹת֔וֹ אֶבֶן־שְׁלֵמָ֥ה מַסָּ֖ע נִבְנָ֑ה וּמַקָּב֤וֹת וְהַגַּרְזֶן֙ כׇּל־כְּלִ֣י בַרְזֶ֔ל לֹֽא־נִשְׁמַ֥ע בַּבַּ֖יִת בְּהִבָּנֹתֽוֹ׃
Translated: When the House was built, only finished stones cut at the quarry were used, so that no hammer or ax or any iron tool was heard in the House while it was being built.
Transliteration: vehavayiit vehivanotvo even-shelemah masa nivenah umakavvot vehagarezen khׇl-kheliy varezel lo-nishema vavayiit vehivanotvo

Hebrew: פֶּ֗תַח הַצֵּלָע֙ הַתִּ֣יכֹנָ֔ה אֶל־כֶּ֥תֶף הַבַּ֖יִת הַיְמָנִ֑ית וּבְלוּלִּ֗ים יַֽעֲלוּ֙ עַל־הַתִּ֣יכֹנָ֔ה וּמִן־הַתִּיכֹנָ֖ה אֶל־הַשְּׁלִשִֽׁים׃
Translated: The entrance to the middle [story of] the side chambers was on the right side of the House; and winding stairs led up to the middle chambers, and from the middle chambers to the third story.
Transliteration: fetach hatsela hatiykhonah el-khetef havayiit hayemaniyt uveluliym yaalu al-hatiykhonah umin-hatiykhonah el-hashelishiym

Hebrew: וַיִּ֥בֶן אֶת־הַבַּ֖יִת וַיְכַלֵּ֑הוּ וַיִּסְפֹּ֤ן אֶת־הַבַּ֙יִת֙ גֵּבִ֔ים וּשְׂדֵרֹ֖ת בָּאֲרָזִֽים׃
Translated: When he finished building the House, he paneled the House with beams and planks of cedar.
Transliteration: vayiven et-havayiit vayekhalehu vayisefon et-havayiit geviym ushederot vaaraziym

Hebrew: וַיִּ֤בֶן אֶת־[הַיָּצִ֙יעַ֙] (היצוע) עַל־כׇּל־הַבַּ֔יִת חָמֵ֥שׁ אַמּ֖וֹת קוֹמָת֑וֹ וַיֶּאֱחֹ֥ז אֶת־הַבַּ֖יִת בַּעֲצֵ֥י אֲרָזִֽים׃ {פ}
Translated: He built the storied structure against the entire House—each story 5 cubits high, so that it encased the House with timbers of cedar.
Transliteration: vayiven et-[hayatsiya] (hytsv) al-khׇl-havayiit chamesh amvot kvomatvo vayeechoz et-havayiit vaatsey araziym {f}

Hebrew: וַֽיְהִי֙ דְּבַר־יְהֹוָ֔ה אֶל־שְׁלֹמֹ֖ה לֵאמֹֽר׃
Translated: Then the word of G<small>OD</small> came to Solomon,
Transliteration: vayehiy devar-yehovah el-shelomoh lemor

Hebrew: הַבַּ֨יִת הַזֶּ֜ה אֲשֶׁר־אַתָּ֣ה בֹנֶ֗ה אִם־תֵּלֵ֤ךְ בְּחֻקֹּתַי֙ וְאֶת־מִשְׁפָּטַ֣י תַּֽעֲשֶׂ֔ה וְשָׁמַרְתָּ֥ אֶת־כׇּל־מִצְוֺתַ֖י לָלֶ֣כֶת בָּהֶ֑ם וַהֲקִמֹתִ֤י אֶת־דְּבָרִי֙ אִתָּ֔ךְ אֲשֶׁ֥ר דִּבַּ֖רְתִּי אֶל־דָּוִ֥ד אָבִֽיךָ׃
Translated: “With regard to this House you are building—if you follow My laws and observe My rules and faithfully keep My commandments, I will fulfill for you the promise that I gave to your father David:
Transliteration: havayiit hazeh asher-atah voneh im-telekhe vechukotay veet-mishefatay taasheh veshamareta et-khׇl-mitsevotay lalekhet vahem vahakimotiy et-devariy itakhe asher divaretiy el-david aviykha

Hebrew: וְשָׁ֣כַנְתִּ֔י בְּת֖וֹךְ בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל וְלֹ֥א אֶעֱזֹ֖ב אֶת־עַמִּ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃ {פ}
Translated: I will abide among the children of Israel, and I will never forsake My people Israel.”
Transliteration: veshakhanetiy vetvokhe veney yisherael velo eezov et-amiy yisherael {f}

Hebrew: וַיִּ֧בֶן שְׁלֹמֹ֛ה אֶת־הַבַּ֖יִת וַיְכַלֵּֽהוּ׃
Translated: When Solomon had completed the construction of the House,
Transliteration: vayiven shelomoh et-havayiit vayekhalehu

Hebrew: וַיִּ֩בֶן֩ אֶת־קִיר֨וֹת הַבַּ֤יִת מִבַּ֙יְתָה֙ בְּצַלְע֣וֹת אֲרָזִ֔ים מִקַּרְקַ֤ע הַבַּ֙יִת֙ עַד־קִיר֣וֹת הַסִּפֻּ֔ן צִפָּ֥ה עֵ֖ץ מִבָּ֑יִת וַיְצַ֛ף אֶת־קַרְקַ֥ע הַבַּ֖יִת בְּצַלְע֥וֹת בְּרוֹשִֽׁים׃
Translated: he paneled the walls of the House on the inside with planks of cedar. He also overlaid the walls on the inside with wood, from the floor of the House to the ceiling. And he overlaid the floor of the House with planks of cypress.
Transliteration: vayiven et-kiyrvot havayiit mivayetah vetsalevot araziym mikareka havayiit ad-kiyrvot hasifun tsifah ets mivayiit vayetsaf et-kareka havayiit vetsalevot vervoshiym

Hebrew: וַיִּ֩בֶן֩ אֶת־עֶשְׂרִ֨ים אַמָּ֜ה (מירכותי) [מִֽיַּרְכְּתֵ֤י] הַבַּ֙יִת֙ בְּצַלְע֣וֹת אֲרָזִ֔ים מִן־הַקַּרְקַ֖ע עַד־הַקִּיר֑וֹת וַיִּ֤בֶן לוֹ֙ מִבַּ֣יִת לִדְבִ֔יר לְקֹ֖דֶשׁ הַקֳּדָשִֽׁים׃
Translated: Twenty cubits from the rear of the House, he built [a partition] of cedar planks from the floor to the walls; he furnished its interior to serve as a shrine, as the Holy of Holies.
Transliteration: vayiven et-esheriym amah (myrkhvty) [miyarekhetey] havayiit vetsalevot araziym min-hakareka ad-hakiyrvot vayiven lvo mivayiit lideviyr lekodesh hakodashiym

Hebrew: וְאַרְבָּעִ֥ים בָּאַמָּ֖ה הָיָ֣ה הַבָּ֑יִת ה֖וּא הַהֵיכָ֥ל לִפְנָֽי׃
Translated: The front part of the House, that is, the Great Hall, measured 40 cubits.
Transliteration: vearevaiym vaamah hayah havayiit hu haheykhal lifenay

Hebrew: וְאֶ֤רֶז אֶל־הַבַּ֙יִת֙ פְּנִ֔ימָה מִקְלַ֣עַת פְּקָעִ֔ים וּפְטוּרֵ֖י צִצִּ֑ים הַכֹּ֣ל אֶ֔רֶז אֵ֥ין אֶ֖בֶן נִרְאָֽה׃
Translated: The cedar of the interior of the House had carvings of gourds and calyxes; it was all cedar, no stone was exposed.
Transliteration: veerez el-havayiit feniymah mikelaat fekaiym ufeturey tsitsiym hakhol erez eyn even nireah

Hebrew: וּדְבִ֧יר בְּתוֹךְ־הַבַּ֛יִת מִפְּנִ֖ימָה הֵכִ֑ין לְתִתֵּ֣ן שָׁ֔ם אֶת־אֲר֖וֹן בְּרִ֥ית יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: In the innermost part of the House, he fixed a Shrine in which to place the Ark of G<small>OD</small>’s Covenant.
Transliteration: udeviyr vetvokhe-havayiit mifeniymah hekhiyn letiten sham et-arvon veriyt yehovah

Hebrew: וְלִפְנֵ֣י הַדְּבִ֡יר עֶשְׂרִים֩ אַמָּ֨ה אֹ֜רֶךְ וְעֶשְׂרִ֧ים אַמָּ֣ה רֹ֗חַב וְעֶשְׂרִ֤ים אַמָּה֙ קוֹמָת֔וֹ וַיְצַפֵּ֖הוּ זָהָ֣ב סָג֑וּר וַיְצַ֥ף מִזְבֵּ֖חַ אָֽרֶז׃
Translated: The interior of the Shrine was 20 cubits long, 20 cubits wide, and 20 cubits high. He overlaid it with solid gold; he similarly overlaid [its] cedar altar.
Transliteration: velifeney hadeviyr esheriym amah orekhe veesheriym amah rochav veesheriym amah kvomatvo vayetsafehu zahav sagur vayetsaf mizevecha arez

Hebrew: וַיְצַ֨ף שְׁלֹמֹ֧ה אֶת־הַבַּ֛יִת מִפְּנִ֖ימָה זָהָ֣ב סָג֑וּר וַיְעַבֵּ֞ר (ברתיקות) [בְּרַתּוּק֤וֹת] זָהָב֙ לִפְנֵ֣י הַדְּבִ֔יר וַיְצַפֵּ֖הוּ זָהָֽב׃
Translated: Solomon overlaid the interior of the House with solid gold; and he inserted golden chains into the door of the Shrine. He overlaid [the Shrine] with gold,
Transliteration: vayetsaf shelomoh et-havayiit mifeniymah zahav sagur vayeaver (vrtykvt) [veratukvot] zahav lifeney hadeviyr vayetsafehu zahav

Hebrew: וְאֶת־כׇּל־הַבַּ֛יִת צִפָּ֥ה זָהָ֖ב עַד־תֹּ֣ם כׇּל־הַבָּ֑יִת וְכׇל־הַמִּזְבֵּ֥חַ אֲֽשֶׁר־לַדְּבִ֖יר צִפָּ֥ה זָהָֽב׃
Translated: so that the entire House was overlaid with gold; he even overlaid with gold the entire altar of the Shrine. And so the entire House was completed.
Transliteration: veet-khׇl-havayiit tsifah zahav ad-tom khׇl-havayiit vekhׇl-hamizevecha asher-ladeviyr tsifah zahav

Hebrew: וַיַּ֣עַשׂ בַּדְּבִ֔יר שְׁנֵ֥י כְרוּבִ֖ים עֲצֵי־שָׁ֑מֶן עֶ֥שֶׂר אַמּ֖וֹת קוֹמָתֽוֹ׃
Translated: In the Shrine he made two cherubim of olive wood, each 10 cubits high.
Transliteration: vayaash vadeviyr sheney kheruviym atsey-shamen esher amvot kvomatvo

Hebrew: וְחָמֵ֣שׁ אַמּ֗וֹת כְּנַ֤ף הַכְּרוּב֙ הָאֶחָ֔ת וְחָמֵ֣שׁ אַמּ֔וֹת כְּנַ֥ף הַכְּר֖וּב הַשֵּׁנִ֑ית עֶ֣שֶׂר אַמּ֔וֹת מִקְצ֥וֹת כְּנָפָ֖יו וְעַד־קְצ֥וֹת כְּנָפָֽיו׃
Translated: [One] had a wing measuring 5 cubits and another wing measuring 5 cubits, so that the spread from wingtip to wingtip was 10 cubits;
Transliteration: vechamesh amvot khenaf hakheruv haechat vechamesh amvot khenaf hakheruv hasheniyt esher amvot miketsvot khenafayv vead-ketsvot khenafayv

Hebrew: וְעֶ֙שֶׂר֙ בָּֽאַמָּ֔ה הַכְּר֖וּב הַשֵּׁנִ֑י מִדָּ֥ה אַחַ֛ת וְקֶ֥צֶב אֶחָ֖ד לִשְׁנֵ֥י הַכְּרֻבִֽים׃
Translated: and the wingspread of the other cherub was also 10 cubits. The two cherubim had the same measurements and proportions:
Transliteration: veesher vaamah hakheruv hasheniy midah achat veketsev echad lisheney hakheruviym

Hebrew: קוֹמַת֙ הַכְּר֣וּב הָאֶחָ֔ד עֶ֖שֶׂר בָּאַמָּ֑ה וְכֵ֖ן הַכְּר֥וּב הַשֵּׁנִֽי׃
Translated: the height of the one cherub was 10 cubits, and so was that of the other cherub.
Transliteration: kvomat hakheruv haechad esher vaamah vekhen hakheruv hasheniy

Hebrew: וַיִּתֵּ֨ן אֶת־הַכְּרוּבִ֜ים בְּת֣וֹךְ ׀ הַבַּ֣יִת הַפְּנִימִ֗י וַֽיִּפְרְשׂוּ֮ אֶת־כַּנְפֵ֣י הַכְּרֻבִים֒ וַתִּגַּ֤ע כְּנַף־הָאֶחָד֙ בַּקִּ֔יר וּכְנַף֙ הַכְּר֣וּב הַשֵּׁנִ֔י נֹגַ֖עַת בַּקִּ֣יר הַשֵּׁנִ֑י וְכַנְפֵיהֶם֙ אֶל־תּ֣וֹךְ הַבַּ֔יִת נֹגְעֹ֖ת כָּנָ֥ף אֶל־כָּנָֽף׃
Translated: He placed the cherubim inside the inner chamber. Since the wings of the cherubim were extended, a wing of the one touched one wall and a wing of the other touched the other wall, while their wings in the center of the chamber touched each other.
Transliteration: vayiten et-hakheruviym vetvokhe havayiit hafeniymiy vayifereshu et-khanefey hakheruviym vatiga khenaf-haechad vakiyr ukhenaf hakheruv hasheniy nogaat vakiyr hasheniy vekhanefeyhem el-tvokhe havayiit nogeot khanaf el-khanaf

Hebrew: וַיְצַ֥ף אֶת־הַכְּרוּבִ֖ים זָהָֽב׃
Translated: He overlaid the cherubim with gold.
Transliteration: vayetsaf et-hakheruviym zahav

Hebrew: וְאֵת֩ כׇּל־קִיר֨וֹת הַבַּ֜יִת מֵסַ֣ב ׀ קָלַ֗ע פִּתּוּחֵי֙ מִקְלְעוֹת֙ כְּרוּבִ֣ים וְתִמֹרֹ֔ת וּפְטוּרֵ֖י צִצִּ֑ים מִלִּפְנִ֖ים וְלַחִיצֽוֹן׃
Translated: All over the walls of the House, of both the inner area and the outer area, he carved reliefs of cherubim, palms, and calyxes,
Transliteration: veet khׇl-kiyrvot havayiit mesav kala fituchey mikelevot kheruviym vetimorot ufeturey tsitsiym milifeniym velachiytsvon

Hebrew: וְאֶת־קַרְקַ֥ע הַבַּ֖יִת צִפָּ֣ה זָהָ֑ב לִפְנִ֖ימָה וְלַחִיצֽוֹן׃
Translated: and he overlaid the floor of the House with gold, both the inner and the outer areas.
Transliteration: veet-kareka havayiit tsifah zahav lifeniymah velachiytsvon

Hebrew: וְאֵת֙ פֶּ֣תַח הַדְּבִ֔יר עָשָׂ֖ה דַּלְת֣וֹת עֲצֵי־שָׁ֑מֶן הָאַ֥יִל מְזוּז֖וֹת חֲמִשִֽׁית׃
Translated: For the entrance of the Shrine he made doors of olive wood, the pilasters and the doorposts having five sides.
Transliteration: veet fetach hadeviyr ashah daletvot atsey-shamen haayiil mezuzvot chamishiyt

Hebrew: וּשְׁתֵּי֮ דַּלְת֣וֹת עֲצֵי־שֶׁ֒מֶן֒ וְקָלַ֣ע עֲ֠לֵיהֶ֠ם מִקְלְע֞וֹת כְּרוּבִ֧ים וְתִמֹרֹ֛ת וּפְטוּרֵ֥י צִצִּ֖ים וְצִפָּ֣ה זָהָ֑ב וַיָּ֛רֶד עַל־הַכְּרוּבִ֥ים וְעַל־הַתִּמֹר֖וֹת אֶת־הַזָּהָֽב׃
Translated: The double doors were of olive wood, and on them he carved reliefs of cherubim, palms, and calyxes. He overlaid them with gold, hammering the gold onto the cherubim and the palms.
Transliteration: ushetey daletvot atsey-shemen vekala aleyhem mikelevot kheruviym vetimorot ufeturey tsitsiym vetsifah zahav vayared al-hakheruviym veal-hatimorvot et-hazahav

Hebrew: וְכֵ֥ן עָשָׂ֛ה לְפֶ֥תַח הַהֵיכָ֖ל מְזוּז֣וֹת עֲצֵי־שָׁ֑מֶן מֵאֵ֖ת רְבִעִֽית׃
Translated: For the entrance of the Great Hall, too, he made doorposts of oleaster wood, having four sides,
Transliteration: vekhen ashah lefetach haheykhal mezuzvot atsey-shamen meet reviiyt

Hebrew: וּשְׁתֵּ֥י דַלְת֖וֹת עֲצֵ֣י בְרוֹשִׁ֑ים שְׁנֵ֨י צְלָעִ֜ים הַדֶּ֤לֶת הָאַחַת֙ גְּלִילִ֔ים וּשְׁנֵ֧י קְלָעִ֛ים הַדֶּ֥לֶת הַשֵּׁנִ֖ית גְּלִילִֽים׃
Translated: and the double doors of cypress wood, each door consisting of two rounded planks.
Transliteration: ushetey daletvot atsey vervoshiym sheney tselaiym hadelet haachat geliyliym usheney kelaiym hadelet hasheniyt geliyliym

Hebrew: וְקָלַ֤ע כְּרוּבִים֙ וְתִ֣מֹר֔וֹת וּפְטֻרֵ֖י צִצִּ֑ים וְצִפָּ֣ה זָהָ֔ב מְיֻשָּׁ֖ר עַל־הַמְּחֻקֶּֽה׃
Translated: On them he carved cherubim, palms, and calyxes, overlaying them with gold applied evenly over the carvings.
Transliteration: vekala kheruviym vetimorvot ufeturey tsitsiym vetsifah zahav meyushar al-hamechukeh

Hebrew: וַיִּ֙בֶן֙ אֶת־הֶחָצֵ֣ר הַפְּנִימִ֔ית שְׁלֹשָׁ֖ה טוּרֵ֣י גָזִ֑ית וְט֖וּר כְּרֻתֹ֥ת אֲרָזִֽים׃
Translated: He built the inner enclosure of three courses of hewn stones and one course of cedar beams.
Transliteration: vayiven et-hechatser hafeniymiyt sheloshah turey gaziyt vetur kherutot araziym

Hebrew: בַּשָּׁנָה֙ הָרְבִיעִ֔ית יֻסַּ֖ד בֵּ֣ית יְהֹוָ֑ה בְּיֶ֖רַח זִֽו׃
Translated: In the fourth year, in the month of Ziv, the foundations of the House of G<small>OD</small> were laid;
Transliteration: vashanah hareviyiyt yusad veyt yehovah veyerach ziv

Hebrew: וּבַשָּׁנָה֩ הָאַחַ֨ת עֶשְׂרֵ֜ה בְּיֶ֣רַח בּ֗וּל ה֚וּא הַחֹ֣דֶשׁ הַשְּׁמִינִ֔י כָּלָ֣ה הַבַּ֔יִת לְכׇל־דְּבָרָ֖יו וּלְכׇל־מִשְׁפָּטָ֑ו וַיִּבְנֵ֖הוּ שֶׁ֥בַע שָׁנִֽים׃
Translated: and in the eleventh year, in the month of Bul—that is, the eighth month—the House was completed according to all its details and all its specifications. It took him seven years to build it.
Transliteration: uvashanah haachat eshereh veyerach vul hu hachodesh hashemiyniy khalah havayiit lekhׇl-devarayv ulekhׇl-mishefatav vayivenehu sheva shaniym

Hebrew: וְאֶת־בֵּיתוֹ֙ בָּנָ֣ה שְׁלֹמֹ֔ה שְׁלֹ֥שׁ עֶשְׂרֵ֖ה שָׁנָ֑ה וַיְכַ֖ל אֶת־כׇּל־בֵּיתֽוֹ׃
Translated: And it took Solomon thirteen years to build his palace, until his whole palace was completed.
Transliteration: veet-veytvo vanah shelomoh shelosh eshereh shanah vayekhal et-khׇl-veytvo

Hebrew: וַיִּ֜בֶן אֶת־בֵּ֣ית ׀ יַ֣עַר הַלְּבָנ֗וֹן מֵאָ֨ה אַמָּ֤ה אׇרְכּוֹ֙ וַחֲמִשִּׁ֤ים אַמָּה֙ רׇחְבּ֔וֹ וּשְׁלֹשִׁ֥ים אַמָּ֖ה קוֹמָת֑וֹ עַ֗ל אַרְבָּעָה֙ טוּרֵי֙ עַמּוּדֵ֣י אֲרָזִ֔ים וּכְרֻת֥וֹת אֲרָזִ֖ים עַל־הָעַמּוּדִֽים׃
Translated: He built the Lebanon Forest House with four rows of cedar columns, and with hewn cedar beams above the columns. Its length was 100 cubits, its breadth 50 cubits, and its height 30 cubits.
Transliteration: vayiven et-veyt yaar halevanvon meah amah ׇrekhvo vachamishiym amah rׇchevvo usheloshiym amah kvomatvo al arevaah turey amudey araziym ukherutvot araziym al-haamudiym

Hebrew: וְסָפֻ֣ן בָּאֶ֗רֶז מִמַּ֙עַל֙ עַל־הַצְּלָעוֹת֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר עַל־הָעַמּוּדִ֔ים אַרְבָּעִ֖ים וַחֲמִשָּׁ֑ה חֲמִשָּׁ֥ה עָשָׂ֖ר הַטּֽוּר׃
Translated: It was paneled above with cedar, with the planks that were above on the 45 columns—15 in each row.
Transliteration: vesafun vaerez mimaal al-hatselavot asher al-haamudiym arevaiym vachamishah chamishah ashar hatur

Hebrew: וּשְׁקֻפִ֖ים שְׁלֹשָׁ֣ה טוּרִ֑ים וּמֶחֱזָ֥ה אֶל־מֶחֱזָ֖ה שָׁלֹ֥שׁ פְּעָמִֽים׃
Translated: And there were three rows of window frames, with three tiers of windows facing each other.
Transliteration: ushekufiym sheloshah turiym umechezah el-mechezah shalosh feamiym

Hebrew: וְכׇל־הַפְּתָחִ֥ים וְהַמְּזוּז֖וֹת רְבֻעִ֣ים שָׁ֑קֶף וּמ֧וּל מֶחֱזָ֛ה אֶל־מֶחֱזָ֖ה שָׁלֹ֥שׁ פְּעָמִֽים׃
Translated: All the doorways and doorposts had square frames—with three tiers of windows facing each other.
Transliteration: vekhׇl-hafetachiym vehamezuzvot revuiym shakef umul mechezah el-mechezah shalosh feamiym

Hebrew: וְאֵ֨ת אוּלָ֤ם הָֽעַמּוּדִים֙ עָשָׂ֔ה חֲמִשִּׁ֤ים אַמָּה֙ אׇרְכּ֔וֹ וּשְׁלֹשִׁ֥ים אַמָּ֖ה רׇחְבּ֑וֹ וְאוּלָם֙ עַל־פְּנֵיהֶ֔ם וְעַמֻּדִ֥ים וְעָ֖ב עַל־פְּנֵיהֶֽם׃
Translated: He made the portico of columns 50 cubits long and 30 cubits wide; the portico was in front of [the columns], and there were columns with a canopy in front of them.
Transliteration: veet ulam haamudiym ashah chamishiym amah ׇrekhvo usheloshiym amah rׇchevvo veulam al-feneyhem veamudiym veav al-feneyhem

Hebrew: וְאוּלָ֤ם הַכִּסֵּא֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר יִשְׁפׇּט־שָׁ֔ם אֻלָ֥ם הַמִּשְׁפָּ֖ט עָשָׂ֑ה וְסָפ֣וּן בָּאֶ֔רֶז מֵהַקַּרְקַ֖ע עַד־הַקַּרְקָֽע׃
Translated: He made the throne portico, where he was to pronounce judgment—the Hall of Judgment. It was paneled with cedar from floor to floor.
Transliteration: veulam hakhise asher yishefׇt-sham ulam hamishefat ashah vesafun vaerez mehakareka ad-hakareka

Hebrew: וּבֵיתוֹ֩ אֲשֶׁר־יֵ֨שֶׁב שָׁ֜ם חָצֵ֣ר הָאַחֶ֗רֶת מִבֵּית֙ לָאוּלָ֔ם כַּמַּעֲשֶׂ֥ה הַזֶּ֖ה הָיָ֑ה וּבַ֜יִת יַעֲשֶׂ֤ה לְבַת־פַּרְעֹה֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר לָקַ֣ח שְׁלֹמֹ֔ה כָּאוּלָ֖ם הַזֶּֽה׃
Translated: The house that he used as a residence, in the rear courtyard, back of the portico, was of the same construction. Solomon also constructed a palace like that portico for the daughter of Pharaoh, whom he had married.
Transliteration: uveytvo asher-eishev sham chatser haacheret miveyt laulam khamaasheh hazeh hayah uvayiit yaasheh levat-fareoh asher lakach shelomoh khaulam hazeh

Hebrew: כׇּל־אֵ֜לֶּה אֲבָנִ֤ים יְקָרֹת֙ כְּמִדּ֣וֹת גָּזִ֔ית מְגֹרָר֥וֹת בַּמְּגֵרָ֖ה מִבַּ֣יִת וּמִח֑וּץ וּמִמַּסָּד֙ עַד־הַטְּפָח֔וֹת וּמִח֖וּץ עַד־הֶחָצֵ֥ר הַגְּדוֹלָֽה׃
Translated: All these buildings, from foundation to coping and all the way out to the great courtyard, were of choice stones, hewn according to measure, smooth on all sides.
Transliteration: khׇl-eleh avaniym yekarot khemidvot gaziyt megorarvot vamegerah mivayiit umichuts umimasad ad-hatefachvot umichuts ad-hechatser hagedvolah

Hebrew: וּמְיֻסָּ֕ד אֲבָנִ֥ים יְקָר֖וֹת אֲבָנִ֣ים גְּדֹל֑וֹת אַבְנֵי֙ עֶ֣שֶׂר אַמּ֔וֹת וְאַבְנֵ֖י שְׁמֹנֶ֥ה אַמּֽוֹת׃
Translated: The foundations were huge blocks of choice stone, stones of 10 cubits and stones of 8 cubits;
Transliteration: umeyusad avaniym yekarvot avaniym gedolvot aveney esher amvot veaveney shemoneh amvot

Hebrew: וּמִלְמַ֗עְלָה אֲבָנִ֧ים יְקָר֛וֹת כְּמִדּ֥וֹת גָּזִ֖ית וָאָֽרֶז׃
Translated: and above were choice stones, hewn according to measure, and cedar wood.
Transliteration: umilemaelah avaniym yekarvot khemidvot gaziyt vaarez

Hebrew: וְחָצֵ֨ר הַגְּדוֹלָ֜ה סָבִ֗יב שְׁלֹשָׁה֙ טוּרִ֣ים גָּזִ֔ית וְט֖וּר כְּרֻתֹ֣ת אֲרָזִ֑ים וְלַחֲצַ֧ר בֵּית־יְהֹוָ֛ה הַפְּנִימִ֖ית וּלְאֻלָ֥ם הַבָּֽיִת׃ {פ}
Translated: The large surrounding courtyard had three tiers of hewn stone and a row of cedar beams, the same as for the inner court of the House of G<small>OD</small>, and for the portico of the House.
Transliteration: vechatser hagedvolah saviyv sheloshah turiym gaziyt vetur kherutot araziym velachatsar veyt-yehovah hafeniymiyt uleulam havayiit {f}

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׁלַח֙ הַמֶּ֣לֶךְ שְׁלֹמֹ֔ה וַיִּקַּ֥ח אֶת־חִירָ֖ם מִצֹּֽר׃
Translated: King Solomon sent for Hiram and brought him down from Tyre.
Transliteration: vayishelach hamelekhe shelomoh vayikach et-chiyram mitsor

Hebrew: בֶּן־אִשָּׁה֩ אַלְמָנָ֨ה ה֜וּא מִמַּטֵּ֣ה נַפְתָּלִ֗י וְאָבִ֣יו אִישׁ־צֹרִי֮ חֹרֵ֣שׁ נְחֹ֒שֶׁת֒ וַ֠יִּמָּלֵ֠א אֶת־הַחׇכְמָ֤ה וְאֶת־הַתְּבוּנָה֙ וְאֶת־הַדַּ֔עַת לַעֲשׂ֥וֹת כׇּל־מְלָאכָ֖ה בַּנְּחֹ֑שֶׁת וַיָּבוֹא֙ אֶל־הַמֶּ֣לֶךְ שְׁלֹמֹ֔ה וַיַּ֖עַשׂ אֶת־כׇּל־מְלַאכְתּֽוֹ׃
Translated: He was the son of a widow from the tribe of Naphtali, and his father had been a Tyrian, a coppersmith. He was endowed with skill, ability, and talent for executing all work in bronze. He came to King Solomon and executed all his work.
Transliteration: ven-ishah alemanah hu mimateh nafetaliy veaviyv iysh-tsoriy choresh nechoshet vayimale et-hachׇkhemah veet-hatevunah veet-hadaat laashvot khׇl-melakhah vanechoshet vayavvo el-hamelekhe shelomoh vayaash et-khׇl-melakhetvo

Hebrew: וַיָּ֛צַר אֶת־שְׁנֵ֥י הָעַמּוּדִ֖ים נְחֹ֑שֶׁת שְׁמֹנֶ֨ה עֶשְׂרֵ֜ה אַמָּ֗ה קוֹמַת֙ הָעַמּ֣וּד הָאֶחָ֔ד וְחוּט֙ שְׁתֵּים־עֶשְׂרֵ֣ה אַמָּ֔ה יָסֹ֖ב אֶת־הָעַמּ֥וּד הַשֵּׁנִֽי׃
Translated: He cast two columns of bronze; one column was 18 cubits high and measured 12 cubits in circumference, [and similarly] the other column.
Transliteration: vayatsar et-sheney haamudiym nechoshet shemoneh eshereh amah kvomat haamud haechad vechut sheteym-eshereh amah yasov et-haamud hasheniy

Hebrew: וּשְׁתֵּ֨י כֹתָרֹ֜ת עָשָׂ֗ה לָתֵ֛ת עַל־רָאשֵׁ֥י הָעַמּוּדִ֖ים מֻצַ֣ק נְחֹ֑שֶׁת חָמֵ֣שׁ אַמּ֗וֹת קוֹמַת֙ הַכֹּתֶ֣רֶת הָאֶחָ֔ת וְחָמֵ֣שׁ אַמּ֔וֹת קוֹמַ֖ת הַכֹּתֶ֥רֶת הַשֵּׁנִֽית׃
Translated: He made two capitals, cast in bronze, to be set upon the two columns, the height of each of the two capitals being 5 cubits;
Transliteration: ushetey khotarot ashah latet al-rashey haamudiym mutsak nechoshet chamesh amvot kvomat hakhoteret haechat vechamesh amvot kvomat hakhoteret hasheniyt

Hebrew: שְׂבָכִ֞ים מַעֲשֵׂ֣ה שְׂבָכָ֗ה גְּדִלִים֙ מַעֲשֵׂ֣ה שַׁרְשְׁר֔וֹת לַכֹּ֣תָרֹ֔ת אֲשֶׁ֖ר עַל־רֹ֣אשׁ הָעַמּוּדִ֑ים שִׁבְעָה֙ לַכֹּתֶ֣רֶת הָאֶחָ֔ת וְשִׁבְעָ֖ה לַכֹּתֶ֥רֶת הַשֵּׁנִֽית׃
Translated: also nets of meshwork with festoons of chainwork for the capitals that were on the top of the columns, seven for each of the two capitals.
Transliteration: shevakhiym maasheh shevakhah gediliym maasheh shareshervot lakhotarot asher al-rosh haamudiym shiveah lakhoteret haechat veshiveah lakhoteret hasheniyt

Hebrew: וַיַּ֖עַשׂ אֶת־הָעַמּוּדִ֑ים וּשְׁנֵי֩ טוּרִ֨ים סָבִ֜יב עַל־הַשְּׂבָכָ֣ה הָאֶחָ֗ת לְכַסּ֤וֹת אֶת־הַכֹּֽתָרֹת֙ אֲשֶׁר֙ עַל־רֹ֣אשׁ הָרִמֹּנִ֔ים וְכֵ֣ן עָשָׂ֔ה לַכֹּתֶ֖רֶת הַשֵּׁנִֽית׃
Translated: He made the columns so that there were two rows [of pomegranates] encircling the top of the one network, to cover the capitals that were on the top of the pomegranates; and he did the same for [the network on] the second capital.
Transliteration: vayaash et-haamudiym usheney turiym saviyv al-hashevakhah haechat lekhasvot et-hakhotarot asher al-rosh harimoniym vekhen ashah lakhoteret hasheniyt

Hebrew: וְכֹתָרֹ֗ת אֲשֶׁר֙ עַל־רֹ֣אשׁ הָעַמּוּדִ֔ים מַעֲשֵׂ֖ה שׁוּשַׁ֣ן בָּאוּלָ֑ם אַרְבַּ֖ע אַמּֽוֹת׃
Translated: The capitals upon the columns of the portico were of lily design, 4 cubits high;
Transliteration: vekhotarot asher al-rosh haamudiym maasheh shushan vaulam areva amvot

Hebrew: וְכֹתָרֹ֗ת עַל־שְׁנֵי֙ הָעַמּוּדִ֔ים גַּם־מִמַּ֙עַל֙ מִלְּעֻמַּ֣ת הַבֶּ֔טֶן אֲשֶׁ֖ר לְעֵ֣בֶר (שבכה) [הַשְּׂבָכָ֑ה] וְהָרִמּוֹנִ֤ים מָאתַ֙יִם֙ טֻרִ֣ים סָבִ֔יב עַ֖ל הַכֹּתֶ֥רֶת הַשֵּׁנִֽית׃
Translated: so also the capitals upon the two columns extended above and next to the bulge that was beside the network. There were 200 pomegranates in rows around the top of the second capital.
Transliteration: vekhotarot al-sheney haamudiym gam-mimaal mileumat haveten asher leever (shvkhh) [hashevakhah] veharimvoniym matayiim turiym saviyv al hakhoteret hasheniyt

Hebrew: וַיָּ֙קֶם֙ אֶת־הָֽעַמֻּדִ֔ים לְאֻלָ֖ם הַהֵיכָ֑ל וַיָּ֜קֶם אֶת־הָעַמּ֣וּד הַיְמָנִ֗י וַיִּקְרָ֤א אֶת־שְׁמוֹ֙ יָכִ֔ין וַיָּ֙קֶם֙ אֶת־הָעַמּ֣וּד הַשְּׂמָאלִ֔י וַיִּקְרָ֥א אֶת־שְׁמ֖וֹ בֹּֽעַז׃
Translated: He set up the columns at the portico of the Great Hall; he set up one column on the right and named it Jachin, and he set up the other column on the left and named it Boaz.
Transliteration: vayakem et-haamudiym leulam haheykhal vayakem et-haamud hayemaniy vayikera et-shemvo yakhiyn vayakem et-haamud hashemaliy vayikera et-shemvo voaz

Hebrew: וְעַ֛ל רֹ֥אשׁ הָעַמּוּדִ֖ים מַעֲשֵׂ֣ה שׁוֹשָׁ֑ן וַתִּתֹּ֖ם מְלֶ֥אכֶת הָעַמּוּדִֽים׃
Translated: Upon the top of the columns there was a lily design. Thus the work of the columns was completed.
Transliteration: veal rosh haamudiym maasheh shvoshan vatitom melekhet haamudiym

Hebrew: וַיַּ֥עַשׂ אֶת־הַיָּ֖ם מוּצָ֑ק עֶ֣שֶׂר בָּ֠אַמָּ֠ה מִשְּׂפָת֨וֹ עַד־שְׂפָת֜וֹ עָגֹ֣ל ׀ סָבִ֗יב וְחָמֵ֤שׁ בָּֽאַמָּה֙ קוֹמָת֔וֹ (וקוה) [וְקָו֙] שְׁלֹשִׁ֣ים בָּאַמָּ֔ה יָסֹ֥ב אֹת֖וֹ סָבִֽיב׃
Translated: Then he made the tank of cast metal, 10 cubits across from brim to brim, completely round; it was 5 cubits high, and it measured 30 cubits in circumference.
Transliteration: vayaash et-hayam mutsak esher vaamah mishefatvo ad-shefatvo agol saviyv vechamesh vaamah kvomatvo (vkvh) [vekav] sheloshiym vaamah yasov otvo saviyv

Hebrew: וּפְקָעִים֩ מִתַּ֨חַת לִשְׂפָת֤וֹ <small>׀</small> סָבִיב֙ סֹבְבִ֣ים אֹת֔וֹ עֶ֚שֶׂר בָּאַמָּ֔ה מַקִּפִ֥ים אֶת־הַיָּ֖ם סָבִ֑יב שְׁנֵ֤י טוּרִים֙ הַפְּקָעִ֔ים יְצֻקִ֖ים בִּיצֻֽקָתֽוֹ׃
Translated: There were gourds below the brim completely encircling it—ten to a cubit, encircling the tank; the gourds were in two rows, cast in one piece with it.
Transliteration: ufekaiym mitachat lishefatvo <small></small> saviyv soveviym otvo esher vaamah makifiym et-hayam saviyv sheney turiym hafekaiym yetsukiym viytsukatvo

Hebrew: עֹמֵ֞ד עַל־שְׁנֵ֧י עָשָׂ֣ר בָּקָ֗ר שְׁלֹשָׁ֣ה פֹנִ֣ים ׀ צָפ֡וֹנָה וּשְׁלֹשָׁה֩ פֹנִ֨ים ׀ יָ֜מָּה וּשְׁלֹשָׁ֣ה ׀ פֹּנִ֣ים נֶ֗גְבָּה וּשְׁלֹשָׁה֙ פֹּנִ֣ים מִזְרָ֔חָה וְהַיָּ֥ם עֲלֵיהֶ֖ם מִלְמָ֑עְלָה וְכׇל־אֲחֹרֵיהֶ֖ם בָּֽיְתָה׃
Translated: It stood upon twelve oxen: three facing north, three facing west, three facing south, and three facing east, with the tank resting upon them; their haunches were all turned inward.
Transliteration: omed al-sheney ashar vakar sheloshah foniym tsafvonah usheloshah foniym yamah usheloshah foniym negevah usheloshah foniym mizerachah vehayam aleyhem milemaelah vekhׇl-achoreyhem vayetah

Hebrew: וְעׇבְי֣וֹ טֶ֔פַח וּשְׂפָת֛וֹ כְּמַעֲשֵׂ֥ה שְׂפַת־כּ֖וֹס פֶּ֣רַח שׁוֹשָׁ֑ן אַלְפַּ֥יִם בַּ֖ת יָכִֽיל׃ {פ}
Translated: It was a handbreadth thick, and its brim was made like that of a cup, like the petals of a lily. Its capacity was 2,000 baths.
Transliteration: veׇveyvo tefach ushefatvo khemaasheh shefat-khvos ferach shvoshan alefayiim vat yakhiyl {f}

Hebrew: וַיַּ֧עַשׂ אֶת־הַמְּכֹנ֛וֹת עֶ֖שֶׂר נְחֹ֑שֶׁת אַרְבַּ֣ע בָּאַמָּ֗ה אֹ֚רֶךְ הַמְּכוֹנָ֣ה הָאֶחָ֔ת וְאַרְבַּ֤ע בָּֽאַמָּה֙ רׇחְבָּ֔הּ וְשָׁלֹ֥שׁ בָּאַמָּ֖ה קוֹמָתָֽהּ׃
Translated: He made the ten laver stands of bronze. The length of each laver stand was 4 cubits and the width 4 cubits, and the height was 3 cubits.
Transliteration: vayaash et-hamekhonvot esher nechoshet areva vaamah orekhe hamekhvonah haechat veareva vaamah rׇchevah veshalosh vaamah kvomatah

Hebrew: וְזֶ֛ה מַעֲשֵׂ֥ה הַמְּכוֹנָ֖ה מִסְגְּרֹ֣ת לָהֶ֑ם וּמִסְגְּרֹ֖ת בֵּ֥ין הַשְׁלַבִּֽים׃
Translated: The structure of the laver stands was as follows: They had insets, and there were insets within the frames;
Transliteration: vezeh maasheh hamekhvonah misegerot lahem umisegerot veyn hashelaviym

Hebrew: וְעַֽל־הַמִּסְגְּר֞וֹת אֲשֶׁ֣ר ׀ בֵּ֣ין הַשְׁלַבִּ֗ים אֲרָי֤וֹת ׀ בָּקָר֙ וּכְרוּבִ֔ים וְעַל־הַשְׁלַבִּ֖ים כֵּ֣ן מִמָּ֑עַל וּמִתַּ֙חַת֙ לַאֲרָי֣וֹת וְלַבָּקָ֔ר לֹי֖וֹת מַעֲשֵׂ֥ה מוֹרָֽד׃
Translated: and on the insets within the frames were lions, oxen, and cherubim. Above the frames was a stand; and both above and below the lions and the oxen were spirals of hammered metal.
Transliteration: veal-hamisegervot asher veyn hashelaviym arayvot vakar ukheruviym veal-hashelaviym khen mimaal umitachat laarayvot velavakar loyvot maasheh mvorad

Hebrew: וְאַרְבָּעָה֩ אוֹפַנֵּ֨י נְחֹ֜שֶׁת לַמְּכוֹנָ֤ה הָאַחַת֙ וְסַרְנֵ֣י נְחֹ֔שֶׁת וְאַרְבָּעָ֥ה פַעֲמֹתָ֖יו כְּתֵפֹ֣ת לָהֶ֑ם מִתַּ֤חַת לַכִּיֹּר֙ הַכְּתֵפ֣וֹת יְצֻק֔וֹת מֵעֵ֥בֶר אִ֖ישׁ לֹיֽוֹת׃
Translated: Each laver stand had four bronze wheels and [two] bronze axletrees. Its four legs had brackets; the brackets were under the laver, cast with spirals beyond each.
Transliteration: vearevaah vofaney nechoshet lamekhvonah haachat vesareney nechoshet vearevaah faamotayv khetefot lahem mitachat lakhiyor hakhetefvot yetsukvot meever iysh loyvot

Hebrew: וּ֠פִ֠יהוּ מִבֵּ֨ית לַכֹּתֶ֤רֶת וָמַ֙עְלָה֙ בָּֽאַמָּ֔ה וּפִ֙יהָ֙ עָגֹ֣ל מַעֲשֵׂה־כֵ֔ן אַמָּ֖ה וַחֲצִ֣י הָאַמָּ֑ה וְגַם־עַל־פִּ֙יהָ֙ מִקְלָע֔וֹת וּמִסְגְּרֹתֵיהֶ֥ם מְרֻבָּע֖וֹת לֹ֥א עֲגֻלּֽוֹת׃
Translated:
Its funnel, within the crown, rose a cubit above it; this funnel was round, in the fashion of a stand, a cubit and a half in diameter. On the funnel too there were carvings.
But the insets were square, not round.
Transliteration: ufiyhu miveyt lakhoteret vamaelah vaamah ufiyha agol maasheh-khen amah vachatsiy haamah vegam-al-fiyha mikelavot umisegeroteyhem meruvavot lo agulvot

Hebrew: וְאַרְבַּ֣עַת הָאוֹפַנִּ֗ים לְמִתַּ֙חַת֙ לַֽמִּסְגְּר֔וֹת וִיד֥וֹת הָאוֹפַנִּ֖ים בַּמְּכוֹנָ֑ה וְקוֹמַת֙ הָאוֹפַ֣ן הָאֶחָ֔ד אַמָּ֖ה וַחֲצִ֥י הָאַמָּֽה׃
Translated: And below the insets were the four wheels. The axletrees of the wheels were [fixed] in the laver stand, and the height of each wheel was a cubit and a half.
Transliteration: vearevaat havofaniym lemitachat lamisegervot viydvot havofaniym vamekhvonah vekvomat havofan haechad amah vachatsiy haamah

Hebrew: וּמַֽעֲשֵׂה֙ הָא֣וֹפַנִּ֔ים כְּמַעֲשֵׂ֖ה אוֹפַ֣ן הַמֶּרְכָּבָ֑ה יְדוֹתָ֣ם וְגַבֵּיהֶ֗ם וְחִשֻּׁקֵיהֶ֛ם וְחִשֻּׁרֵיהֶ֖ם הַכֹּ֥ל מוּצָֽק׃
Translated: The structure of the wheels was like the structure of chariot wheels; and their axletrees, their rims, their spokes, and their hubs were all of cast metal.
Transliteration: umaasheh havofaniym khemaasheh vofan hamerekhavah yedvotam vegaveyhem vechishukeyhem vechishureyhem hakhol mutsak

Hebrew: וְאַרְבַּ֣ע כְּתֵפ֔וֹת אֶ֚ל אַרְבַּ֣ע פִּנּ֔וֹת הַמְּכֹנָ֖ה הָאֶחָ֑ת מִן־הַמְּכֹנָ֖ה כְּתֵפֶֽיהָ׃
Translated: Four brackets ran to the four corners of each laver stand; the brackets were of a piece with the laver stand.
Transliteration: veareva khetefvot el areva finvot hamekhonah haechat min-hamekhonah khetefeyha

Hebrew: וּבְרֹ֣אשׁ הַמְּכוֹנָ֗ה חֲצִ֧י הָאַמָּ֛ה קוֹמָ֖ה עָגֹ֣ל <small>׀</small> סָבִ֑יב וְעַ֨ל רֹ֤אשׁ הַמְּכֹנָה֙ יְדֹתֶ֔יהָ וּמִסְגְּרֹתֶ֖יהָ מִמֶּֽנָּה׃
Translated: At the top of the laver stand was a round band half a cubit high, and together with the top of the laver stand; its sides and its insets were of one piece with it.
Transliteration: uverosh hamekhvonah chatsiy haamah kvomah agol <small></small> saviyv veal rosh hamekhonah yedoteyha umisegeroteyha mimenah

Hebrew: וַיְפַתַּ֤ח עַל־הַלֻּחֹת֙ יְדֹתֶ֔יהָ וְעַל֙ (ומסגרתיה) [מִסְגְּרֹתֶ֔יהָ] כְּרוּבִ֖ים אֲרָי֣וֹת וְתִמֹרֹ֑ת כְּמַעַר־אִ֥ישׁ וְלֹי֖וֹת סָבִֽיב׃
Translated: On its surface—on its sides—and on its insets [Hiram] engraved cherubim, lions, and palms, as the clear space on each allowed, with spirals round about.
Transliteration: vayefatach al-haluchot yedoteyha veal (vmsgrtyh) [misegeroteyha] kheruviym arayvot vetimorot khemaar-iysh veloyvot saviyv

Hebrew: כָּזֹ֣את עָשָׂ֔ה אֵ֖ת עֶ֣שֶׂר הַמְּכֹנ֑וֹת מוּצָ֨ק אֶחָ֜ד מִדָּ֥ה אַחַ֛ת קֶ֥צֶב אֶחָ֖ד לְכֻלָּֽהְנָֽה׃ {ס}
Translated: It was after this manner that he made the ten laver stands, all of them cast alike, of the same measure and the same form.
Transliteration: khazot ashah et esher hamekhonvot mutsak echad midah achat ketsev echad lekhulahenah {s}

Hebrew: וַיַּ֛עַשׂ עֲשָׂרָ֥ה כִיֹּר֖וֹת נְחֹ֑שֶׁת אַרְבָּעִ֨ים בַּ֜ת יָכִ֣יל ׀ הַכִּיּ֣וֹר הָאֶחָ֗ד אַרְבַּ֤ע בָּֽאַמָּה֙ הַכִּיּ֣וֹר הָאֶחָ֔ד כִּיּ֤וֹר אֶחָד֙ עַל־הַמְּכוֹנָ֣ה הָאַחַ֔ת לְעֶ֖שֶׂר הַמְּכֹנֽוֹת׃
Translated: Then he made ten bronze lavers, one laver on each of the ten laver stands, each laver measuring 4 cubits and each laver containing forty baths.
Transliteration: vayaash asharah khiyorvot nechoshet arevaiym vat yakhiyl hakhiyyvor haechad areva vaamah hakhiyyvor haechad khiyyvor echad al-hamekhvonah haachat leesher hamekhonvot

Hebrew: וַיִּתֵּן֙ אֶת־הַמְּכֹנ֔וֹת חָמֵ֞שׁ עַל־כֶּ֤תֶף הַבַּ֙יִת֙ מִיָּמִ֔ין וְחָמֵ֛שׁ עַל־כֶּ֥תֶף הַבַּ֖יִת מִשְּׂמֹאל֑וֹ וְאֶת־הַיָּ֗ם נָתַ֞ן מִכֶּ֨תֶף הַבַּ֧יִת הַיְמָנִ֛ית קֵ֖דְמָה מִמּ֥וּל נֶֽגֶב׃ {ס}
Translated: He disposed the laver stands, five at the right side of the House and five at its left side; and the tank he placed on the right side of the House, at the southeast [corner].
Transliteration: vayiten et-hamekhonvot chamesh al-khetef havayiit miyamiyn vechamesh al-khetef havayiit mishemolvo veet-hayam natan mikhetef havayiit hayemaniyt kedemah mimul negev {s}

Hebrew: וַיַּ֣עַשׂ חִיר֔וֹם אֶ֨ת־הַכִּיֹּר֔וֹת וְאֶת־הַיָּעִ֖ים וְאֶת־הַמִּזְרָק֑וֹת וַיְכַ֣ל חִירָ֗ם לַֽעֲשׂוֹת֙ אֶת־כׇּל־הַמְּלָאכָ֔ה אֲשֶׁ֥ר עָשָׂ֛ה לַמֶּ֥לֶךְ שְׁלֹמֹ֖ה בֵּ֥ית יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated:
Hiram also made the lavers, the scrapers, and the sprinkling bowls.
So Hiram finished all the work that he had been doing for King Solomon on the House of GOD:
Transliteration: vayaash chiyrvom et-hakhiyorvot veet-hayaiym veet-hamizerakvot vayekhal chiyram laashvot et-khׇl-hamelakhah asher ashah lamelekhe shelomoh veyt yehovah

Hebrew: עַמֻּדִ֣ים שְׁנַ֔יִם וְגֻלֹּ֧ת הַכֹּתָרֹ֛ת אֲשֶׁר־עַל־רֹ֥אשׁ הָעַמּוּדִ֖ים שְׁתָּ֑יִם וְהַשְּׂבָכ֣וֹת שְׁתַּ֔יִם לְכַסּ֗וֹת אֶת־שְׁתֵּי֙ גֻּלּ֣וֹת הַכֹּתָרֹ֔ת אֲשֶׁ֖ר עַל־רֹ֥אשׁ הָעַמּוּדִֽים׃
Translated: the two columns, the two globes of the capitals upon the columns; and the two pieces of network to cover the two globes of the capitals upon the columns;
Transliteration: amudiym shenayiim vegulot hakhotarot asher-al-rosh haamudiym shetayiim vehashevakhvot shetayiim lekhasvot et-shetey gulvot hakhotarot asher al-rosh haamudiym

Hebrew: וְאֶת־הָרִמֹּנִ֛ים אַרְבַּ֥ע מֵא֖וֹת לִשְׁתֵּ֣י הַשְּׂבָכ֑וֹת שְׁנֵֽי־טוּרִ֤ים רִמֹּנִים֙ לַשְּׂבָכָ֣ה הָאֶחָ֔ת לְכַסּ֗וֹת אֶת־שְׁתֵּי֙ גֻּלּ֣וֹת הַכֹּתָרֹ֔ת אֲשֶׁ֖ר עַל־פְּנֵ֥י הָעַמּוּדִֽים׃
Translated: the four hundred pomegranates for the two pieces of network, two rows of pomegranates for each network, to cover the two globes of the capitals upon the columns;
Transliteration: veet-harimoniym areva mevot lishetey hashevakhvot sheney-turiym rimoniym lashevakhah haechat lekhasvot et-shetey gulvot hakhotarot asher al-feney haamudiym

Hebrew: וְאֶת־הַמְּכֹנ֖וֹת עָ֑שֶׂר וְאֶת־הַכִּיֹּרֹ֥ת עֲשָׂרָ֖ה עַל־הַמְּכֹנֽוֹת׃
Translated: the ten stands and the ten lavers upon the stands;
Transliteration: veet-hamekhonvot asher veet-hakhiyorot asharah al-hamekhonvot

Hebrew: וְאֶת־הַיָּ֖ם הָאֶחָ֑ד וְאֶת־הַבָּקָ֥ר שְׁנֵים־עָשָׂ֖ר תַּ֥חַת הַיָּֽם׃
Translated: the one tank with the twelve oxen underneath the tank;
Transliteration: veet-hayam haechad veet-havakar sheneym-ashar tachat hayam

Hebrew: וְאֶת־הַסִּיר֨וֹת וְאֶת־הַיָּעִ֜ים וְאֶת־הַמִּזְרָק֗וֹת וְאֵת֙ כׇּל־הַכֵּלִ֣ים (האהל) [הָאֵ֔לֶּה] אֲשֶׁ֨ר עָשָׂ֥ה חִירָ֛ם לַמֶּ֥לֶךְ שְׁלֹמֹ֖ה בֵּ֣ית יְהֹוָ֑ה נְחֹ֖שֶׁת מְמֹרָֽט׃
Translated: the pails, the scrapers, and the sprinkling bowls. All those vessels in the House of G<small>OD</small> that Hiram made for King Solomon were of burnished bronze.
Transliteration: veet-hasiyrvot veet-hayaiym veet-hamizerakvot veet khׇl-hakheliym (hhl) [haeleh] asher ashah chiyram lamelekhe shelomoh veyt yehovah nechoshet memorat

Hebrew: בְּכִכַּ֤ר הַיַּרְדֵּן֙ יְצָקָ֣ם הַמֶּ֔לֶךְ בְּמַעֲבֵ֖ה הָאֲדָמָ֑ה בֵּ֥ין סֻכּ֖וֹת וּבֵ֥ין צָרְתָֽן׃
Translated: The king had them cast in earthen molds, in the plain of the Jordan between Succoth and Zarethan.
Transliteration: vekhikhar hayareden yetsakam hamelekhe vemaaveh haadamah veyn sukhvot uveyn tsaretan

Hebrew: וַיַּנַּ֤ח שְׁלֹמֹה֙ אֶת־כׇּל־הַכֵּלִ֔ים מֵרֹ֖ב מְאֹ֣ד מְאֹ֑ד לֹ֥א נֶחְקַ֖ר מִשְׁקַ֥ל הַנְּחֹֽשֶׁת׃
Translated: Solomon left all the vessels [unweighed] because of their very great quantity; the weight of the bronze was not reckoned.
Transliteration: vayanach shelomoh et-khׇl-hakheliym merov meod meod lo nechekar mishekal hanechoshet

Hebrew: וַיַּ֣עַשׂ שְׁלֹמֹ֔ה אֵ֚ת כׇּל־הַכֵּלִ֔ים אֲשֶׁ֖ר בֵּ֣ית יְהֹוָ֑ה אֵ֚ת מִזְבַּ֣ח הַזָּהָ֔ב וְאֶת־הַשֻּׁלְחָ֗ן אֲשֶׁ֥ר עָלָ֛יו לֶ֥חֶם הַפָּנִ֖ים זָהָֽב׃
Translated: And Solomon made all the furnishings that were in the House of G<small>OD</small>: the altar, of gold; the table for the bread of display, of gold;
Transliteration: vayaash shelomoh et khׇl-hakheliym asher veyt yehovah et mizevach hazahav veet-hashulechan asher alayv lechem hafaniym zahav

Hebrew: וְאֶת־הַ֠מְּנֹר֠וֹת חָמֵ֨שׁ מִיָּמִ֜ין וְחָמֵ֧שׁ מִשְּׂמֹ֛אול לִפְנֵ֥י הַדְּבִ֖יר זָהָ֣ב סָג֑וּר וְהַפֶּ֧רַח וְהַנֵּרֹ֛ת וְהַמֶּלְקַחַ֖יִם זָהָֽב׃
Translated: the lampstands—five on the right side and five on the left—in front of the Shrine, of solid gold; and the petals, lamps, and tongs, of gold;
Transliteration: veet-hamenorvot chamesh miyamiyn vechamesh mishemovl lifeney hadeviyr zahav sagur vehaferach vehanerot vehamelekachayiim zahav

Hebrew: וְ֠הַסִּפּ֠וֹת וְהַֽמְזַמְּר֧וֹת וְהַמִּזְרָק֛וֹת וְהַכַּפּ֥וֹת וְהַמַּחְתּ֖וֹת זָהָ֣ב סָג֑וּר וְהַפֹּת֡וֹת לְדַלְתוֹת֩ הַבַּ֨יִת הַפְּנִימִ֜י לְקֹ֣דֶשׁ הַקֳּדָשִׁ֗ים לְדַלְתֵ֥י הַבַּ֛יִת לַהֵיכָ֖ל זָהָֽב׃ {פ}
Translated: the basins, snuffers, sprinkling bowls, ladles, and fire pans, of solid gold; and the hinge sockets for the doors of the innermost part of the House, the Holy of Holies, and for the doors of the Great Hall of the House, of gold.
Transliteration: vehasifvot vehamezamervot vehamizerakvot vehakhafvot vehamachetvot zahav sagur vehafotvot ledaletvot havayiit hafeniymiy lekodesh hakodashiym ledaletey havayiit laheykhal zahav {f}

Hebrew: וַתִּשְׁלַם֙ כׇּל־הַמְּלָאכָ֔ה אֲשֶׁ֥ר עָשָׂ֛ה הַמֶּ֥לֶךְ שְׁלֹמֹ֖ה בֵּ֣ית יְהֹוָ֑ה וַיָּבֵ֨א שְׁלֹמֹ֜ה אֶת־קׇדְשֵׁ֣י ׀ דָּוִ֣ד אָבִ֗יו אֶת־הַכֶּ֤סֶף וְאֶת־הַזָּהָב֙ וְאֶת־הַכֵּלִ֔ים נָתַ֕ן בְּאֹצְר֖וֹת בֵּ֥ית יְהֹוָֽה׃ {פ}
Translated: When all the work that King Solomon had done in the House of G<small>OD</small> was completed, Solomon brought in the sacred donations of his father David—the silver, the gold, and the vessels—and deposited them in the treasury of the House of G<small>OD</small>.
Transliteration: vatishelam khׇl-hamelakhah asher ashah hamelekhe shelomoh veyt yehovah vayave shelomoh et-kׇdeshey david aviyv et-hakhesef veet-hazahav veet-hakheliym natan veotservot veyt yehovah {f}

Hebrew: אָ֣ז יַקְהֵ֣ל שְׁלֹמֹ֣ה אֶת־זִקְנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֡ל אֶת־כׇּל־רָאשֵׁ֣י הַמַּטּוֹת֩ נְשִׂיאֵ֨י הָאָב֜וֹת לִבְנֵ֧י יִשְׂרָאֵ֛ל אֶל־הַמֶּ֥לֶךְ שְׁלֹמֹ֖ה יְרוּשָׁלָ֑͏ִם לְֽהַעֲל֞וֹת אֶת־אֲר֧וֹן בְּרִית־יְהֹוָ֛ה מֵעִ֥יר דָּוִ֖ד הִ֥יא צִיּֽוֹן׃
Translated: Then Solomon convoked the elders of Israel—all the heads of the tribes and the ancestral chieftains of the Israelites—before King Solomon in Jerusalem, to bring up the Ark of the Covenant of G<small>OD</small> from the City of David, that is, Zion.
Transliteration: az yakehel shelomoh et-zikeney yisherael et-khׇl-rashey hamatvot neshiyey haavvot liveney yisherael el-hamelekhe shelomoh yerushala͏im lehaalvot et-arvon veriyt-yehovah meiyr david hiy tsiyyvon

Hebrew: וַיִּקָּ֨הֲל֜וּ אֶל־הַמֶּ֤לֶךְ שְׁלֹמֹה֙ כׇּל־אִ֣ישׁ יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל בְּיֶ֥רַח הָאֵתָנִ֖ים בֶּחָ֑ג ה֖וּא הַחֹ֥דֶשׁ הַשְּׁבִיעִֽי׃
Translated: The entire body of Israel gathered before King Solomon at the Feast [of Booths], in the month of Ethanim—that is, the seventh month.
Transliteration: vayikahalu el-hamelekhe shelomoh khׇl-iysh yisherael veyerach haetaniym vechag hu hachodesh hasheviyiy

Hebrew: וַיָּבֹ֕אוּ כֹּ֖ל זִקְנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל וַיִּשְׂא֥וּ הַכֹּהֲנִ֖ים אֶת־הָאָרֽוֹן׃
Translated: When all the elders of Israel had come, the priests lifted the Ark
Transliteration: vayavou khol zikeney yisherael vayisheu hakhohaniym et-haarvon

Hebrew: וַֽיַּעֲל֞וּ אֶת־אֲר֤וֹן יְהֹוָה֙ וְאֶת־אֹ֣הֶל מוֹעֵ֔ד וְאֶת־כׇּל־כְּלֵ֥י הַקֹּ֖דֶשׁ אֲשֶׁ֣ר בָּאֹ֑הֶל וַיַּעֲל֣וּ אֹתָ֔ם הַכֹּהֲנִ֖ים וְהַלְוִיִּֽם׃
Translated: and carried up the Ark of G<small>OD</small>. Then the priests and the Levites brought the Tent of Meeting and all the holy vessels that were in the Tent.
Transliteration: vayaalu et-arvon yehovah veet-ohel mvoed veet-khׇl-kheley hakodesh asher vaohel vayaalu otam hakhohaniym vehaleviyim

Hebrew: וְהַמֶּ֣לֶךְ שְׁלֹמֹ֗ה וְכׇל־עֲדַ֤ת יִשְׂרָאֵל֙ הַנּוֹעָדִ֣ים עָלָ֔יו אִתּ֖וֹ לִפְנֵ֣י הָאָר֑וֹן מְזַבְּחִים֙ צֹ֣אן וּבָקָ֔ר אֲשֶׁ֧ר לֹֽא־יִסָּפְר֛וּ וְלֹ֥א יִמָּנ֖וּ מֵרֹֽב׃
Translated: Meanwhile, King Solomon and the whole community of Israel, who were assembled with him before the Ark, were sacrificing sheep and oxen in such abundance that they could not be numbered or counted.
Transliteration: vehamelekhe shelomoh vekhׇl-adat yisherael hanvoadiym alayv itvo lifeney haarvon mezavechiym tson uvakar asher lo-yisaferu velo yimanu merov

Hebrew: וַיָּבִ֣אוּ הַ֠כֹּהֲנִ֠ים אֶת־אֲר֨וֹן בְּרִית־יְהֹוָ֧ה אֶל־מְקוֹמ֛וֹ אֶל־דְּבִ֥יר הַבַּ֖יִת אֶל־קֹ֣דֶשׁ הַקֳּדָשִׁ֑ים אֶל־תַּ֖חַת כַּנְפֵ֥י הַכְּרוּבִֽים׃
Translated: The priests brought the Ark of G<small>OD</small>’s Covenant to its place underneath the wings of the cherubim, in the Shrine of the House, in the Holy of Holies;
Transliteration: vayaviu hakhohaniym et-arvon veriyt-yehovah el-mekvomvo el-deviyr havayiit el-kodesh hakodashiym el-tachat khanefey hakheruviym

Hebrew: כִּ֤י הַכְּרוּבִים֙ פֹּרְשִׂ֣ים כְּנָפַ֔יִם אֶל־מְק֖וֹם הָאָר֑וֹן וַיָּסֹ֧כּוּ הַכְּרֻבִ֛ים עַל־הָאָר֥וֹן וְעַל־בַּדָּ֖יו מִלְמָֽעְלָה׃
Translated: for the cherubim had their wings spread out over the place of the Ark, so that the cherubim shielded the Ark and its poles from above.
Transliteration: khiy hakheruviym foreshiym khenafayiim el-mekvom haarvon vayasokhu hakheruviym al-haarvon veal-vadayv milemaelah

Hebrew: וַֽיַּאֲרִ֘כוּ֮ הַבַּדִּים֒ וַיֵּרָאוּ֩ רָאשֵׁ֨י הַבַּדִּ֤ים מִן־הַקֹּ֙דֶשׁ֙ עַל־פְּנֵ֣י הַדְּבִ֔יר וְלֹ֥א יֵרָא֖וּ הַח֑וּצָה וַיִּ֣הְיוּ שָׁ֔ם עַ֖ד הַיּ֥וֹם הַזֶּֽה׃
Translated: The poles projected so that the ends of the poles were visible in the sanctuary in front of the Shrine, but they could not be seen outside; and there they remain to this day.
Transliteration: vayaarikhu havadiym vayerau rashey havadiym min-hakodesh al-feney hadeviyr velo eirau hachutsah vayiheyu sham ad hayyvom hazeh

Hebrew: אֵ֚ין בָּֽאָר֔וֹן רַ֗ק שְׁנֵי֙ לֻח֣וֹת הָאֲבָנִ֔ים אֲשֶׁ֨ר הִנִּ֥חַ שָׁ֛ם מֹשֶׁ֖ה בְּחֹרֵ֑ב אֲשֶׁ֨ר כָּרַ֤ת יְהֹוָה֙ עִם־בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל בְּצֵאתָ֖ם מֵאֶ֥רֶץ מִצְרָֽיִם׃
Translated: There was nothing inside the Ark but the two tablets of stone that Moses placed there at Horeb, when G<small>OD</small> made [a covenant] with the Israelites after their departure from the land of Egypt.
Transliteration: eyn vaarvon rak sheney luchvot haavaniym asher hinicha sham mosheh vechorev asher kharat yehovah im-veney yisherael vetsetam meerets mitserayiim

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֕י בְּצֵ֥את הַכֹּהֲנִ֖ים מִן־הַקֹּ֑דֶשׁ וְהֶעָנָ֥ן מָלֵ֖א אֶת־בֵּ֥ית יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: When the priests came out of the sanctuary—for the cloud had filled the House of G<small>OD</small>
Transliteration: vayehiy vetset hakhohaniym min-hakodesh veheanan male et-veyt yehovah

Hebrew: וְלֹא־יָכְל֧וּ הַכֹּהֲנִ֛ים לַעֲמֹ֥ד לְשָׁרֵ֖ת מִפְּנֵ֣י הֶעָנָ֑ן כִּי־מָלֵ֥א כְבוֹד־יְהֹוָ֖ה אֶת־בֵּ֥ית יְהֹוָֽה׃ {פ}
Translated: and the priests were not able to remain and perform the service because of the cloud, for the Presence of the E<small>TERNAL</small> filled the House of G<small>OD</small>—
Transliteration: velo-yakhelu hakhohaniym laamod lesharet mifeney heanan khiy-male khevvod-yehovah et-veyt yehovah {f}

Hebrew: אָ֖ז אָמַ֣ר שְׁלֹמֹ֑ה יְהֹוָ֣ה אָמַ֔ר לִשְׁכֹּ֖ן בָּעֲרָפֶֽל׃
Translated:
then Solomon declared:
“ GOD has chosen
To abide in a thick cloud:
Transliteration: az amar shelomoh yehovah amar lishekhon vaarafel

Hebrew: בָּנֹ֥ה בָנִ֛יתִי בֵּ֥ית זְבֻ֖ל לָ֑ךְ מָכ֥וֹן לְשִׁבְתְּךָ֖ עוֹלָמִֽים׃
Translated:
I have now built for You
A stately House,
A place where You
May dwell forever.”
Transliteration: vanoh vaniytiy veyt zevul lakhe makhvon leshivetekha volamiym

Hebrew: וַיַּסֵּ֤ב הַמֶּ֙לֶךְ֙ אֶת־פָּנָ֔יו וַיְבָ֕רֶךְ אֵ֖ת כׇּל־קְהַ֣ל יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל וְכׇל־קְהַ֥ל יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל עֹמֵֽד׃
Translated: Then, with the whole congregation of Israel standing, the king faced about and blessed the whole congregation of Israel.
Transliteration: vayasev hamelekhe et-fanayv vayevarekhe et khׇl-kehal yisherael vekhׇl-kehal yisherael omed

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֗אמֶר בָּר֤וּךְ יְהֹוָה֙ אֱלֹהֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל אֲשֶׁר֙ דִּבֶּ֣ר בְּפִ֔יו אֵ֖ת דָּוִ֣ד אָבִ֑י וּבְיָד֥וֹ מִלֵּ֖א לֵאמֹֽר׃
Translated:
He said:
“Praised be the ETERNAL, the God of Israel, who has fulfilled with deeds the promise made to my father David. For [God] said,
Transliteration: vayomer varukhe yehovah elohey yisherael asher diver vefiyv et david aviy uveyadvo mile lemor

Hebrew: מִן־הַיּ֗וֹם אֲשֶׁ֨ר הוֹצֵ֜אתִי אֶת־עַמִּ֣י אֶת־יִשְׂרָאֵל֮ מִמִּצְרַ֒יִם֒ לֹֽא־בָחַ֣רְתִּֽי בְעִ֗יר מִכֹּל֙ שִׁבְטֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל לִבְנ֣וֹת בַּ֔יִת לִהְי֥וֹת שְׁמִ֖י שָׁ֑ם וָאֶבְחַ֣ר בְּדָוִ֔ד לִהְי֖וֹת עַל־עַמִּ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated: ‘Ever since I brought My people Israel out of Egypt, I have not chosen a city among all the tribes of Israel for building a House where My name might abide; but I have chosen David to rule My people Israel.’
Transliteration: min-hayyvom asher hvotsetiy et-amiy et-yisherael mimitserayiim lo-vacharetiy veiyr mikhol shivetey yisherael livenvot vayiit liheyvot shemiy sham vaevechar vedavid liheyvot al-amiy yisherael

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֕י עִם־לְבַ֖ב דָּוִ֣ד אָבִ֑י לִבְנ֣וֹת בַּ֔יִת לְשֵׁ֥ם יְהֹוָ֖ה אֱלֹהֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated: “Now my father David had intended to build a House for the name of the E<small>TERNAL</small> One, the God of Israel.
Transliteration: vayehiy im-levav david aviy livenvot vayiit leshem yehovah elohey yisherael

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר יְהֹוָה֙ אֶל־דָּוִ֣ד אָבִ֔י יַ֗עַן אֲשֶׁ֤ר הָיָה֙ עִם־לְבָ֣בְךָ֔ לִבְנ֥וֹת בַּ֖יִת לִשְׁמִ֑י הֱֽטִיבֹ֔תָ כִּ֥י הָיָ֖ה עִם־לְבָבֶֽךָ׃
Translated: But G<small>OD</small> said to my father David, ‘As regards your intention to build a House for My name, you did right to have that intention.
Transliteration: vayomer yehovah el-david aviy yaan asher hayah im-levavekha livenvot vayiit lishemiy hetiyvota khiy hayah im-levavekha

Hebrew: רַ֣ק אַתָּ֔ה לֹ֥א תִבְנֶ֖ה הַבָּ֑יִת כִּ֤י אִם־בִּנְךָ֙ הַיֹּצֵ֣א מֵחֲלָצֶ֔יךָ הֽוּא־יִבְנֶ֥ה הַבַּ֖יִת לִשְׁמִֽי׃
Translated: However, you shall not build the House yourself; instead, your son, the issue of your loins, shall build the House for My name.’
Transliteration: rak atah lo tiveneh havayiit khiy im-vinekha hayotse mechalatseykha hu-yiveneh havayiit lishemiy

Hebrew: וַיָּ֣קֶם יְהֹוָ֔ה אֶת־דְּבָר֖וֹ אֲשֶׁ֣ר דִּבֵּ֑ר וָאָקֻ֡ם תַּ֩חַת֩ דָּוִ֨ד אָבִ֜י וָאֵשֵׁ֣ב ׀ עַל־כִּסֵּ֣א יִשְׂרָאֵ֗ל כַּֽאֲשֶׁר֙ דִּבֶּ֣ר יְהֹוָ֔ה וָאֶבְנֶ֣ה הַבַּ֔יִת לְשֵׁ֥ם יְהֹוָ֖ה אֱלֹהֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated: “And G<small>OD</small> has fulfilled the promise that was made: I have succeeded my father David and have ascended the throne of Israel, as G<small>OD</small> promised. I have built the House for the name of the E<small>TERNAL</small> One, the God of Israel;
Transliteration: vayakem yehovah et-devarvo asher diver vaakum tachat david aviy vaeshev al-khise yisherael khaasher diver yehovah vaeveneh havayiit leshem yehovah elohey yisherael

Hebrew: וָאָשִׂ֨ם שָׁ֤ם מָקוֹם֙ לָאָר֔וֹן אֲשֶׁר־שָׁ֖ם בְּרִ֣ית יְהֹוָ֑ה אֲשֶׁ֤ר כָּרַת֙ עִם־אֲבֹתֵ֔ינוּ בְּהוֹצִיא֥וֹ אֹתָ֖ם מֵאֶ֥רֶץ מִצְרָֽיִם׃ {ס}
Translated: and I have set a place there for the Ark, containing the covenant that G<small>OD</small> made with our ancestors upon bringing them out from the land of Egypt.”
Transliteration: vaashim sham makvom laarvon asher-sham veriyt yehovah asher kharat im-avoteynu vehvotsiyvo otam meerets mitserayiim {s}

Hebrew: וַיַּעֲמֹ֣ד שְׁלֹמֹ֗ה לִפְנֵי֙ מִזְבַּ֣ח יְהֹוָ֔ה נֶ֖גֶד כׇּל־קְהַ֣ל יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל וַיִּפְרֹ֥שׂ כַּפָּ֖יו הַשָּׁמָֽיִם׃
Translated: Then Solomon stood before the altar of G<small>OD</small> in the presence of the whole community of Israel; he spread the palms of his hands toward heaven
Transliteration: vayaamod shelomoh lifeney mizevach yehovah neged khׇl-kehal yisherael vayiferosh khafayv hashamayiim

Hebrew: וַיֹּאמַ֗ר יְהֹוָ֞ה אֱלֹהֵ֤י יִשְׂרָאֵל֙ אֵין־כָּמ֣וֹךָ אֱלֹהִ֔ים בַּשָּׁמַ֣יִם מִמַּ֔עַל וְעַל־הָאָ֖רֶץ מִתָּ֑חַת שֹׁמֵ֤ר הַבְּרִית֙ וְֽהַחֶ֔סֶד לַעֲבָדֶ֕יךָ הַהֹלְכִ֥ים לְפָנֶ֖יךָ בְּכׇל־לִבָּֽם׃
Translated: and said, “O E<small>TERNAL</small> God of Israel, in the heavens above and on the earth below there is no god like You, who keep Your gracious covenant with Your servants when they walk before You in wholehearted devotion;
Transliteration: vayomar yehovah elohey yisherael eyn-khamvokha Elohim vashamayiim mimaal veal-haarets mitachat shomer haveriyt vehachesed laavadeykha haholekhiym lefaneykha vekhׇl-livam

Hebrew: אֲשֶׁ֣ר שָׁמַ֗רְתָּ לְעַבְדְּךָ֙ דָּוִ֣ד אָבִ֔י אֵ֥ת אֲשֶׁר־דִּבַּ֖רְתָּ ל֑וֹ וַתְּדַבֵּ֥ר בְּפִ֛יךָ וּבְיָדְךָ֥ מִלֵּ֖אתָ כַּיּ֥וֹם הַזֶּֽה׃
Translated: You who have kept the promises You made to Your servant, my father David, fulfilling with deeds the promise You made—as is now the case.
Transliteration: asher shamareta leavedekha david aviy et asher-divareta lvo vatedaver vefiykha uveyadekha mileta khayyvom hazeh

Hebrew: וְעַתָּ֞ה יְהֹוָ֣ה ׀ אֱלֹהֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֗ל שְׁ֠מֹ֠ר לְעַבְדְּךָ֨ דָוִ֤ד אָבִי֙ אֵת֩ אֲשֶׁ֨ר דִּבַּ֤רְתָּ לּוֹ֙ לֵאמֹ֔ר לֹא־יִכָּרֵ֨ת לְךָ֥ אִישׁ֙ מִלְּפָנַ֔י יֹשֵׁ֖ב עַל־כִּסֵּ֣א יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל רַ֠ק אִם־יִשְׁמְר֨וּ בָנֶ֤יךָ אֶת־דַּרְכָּם֙ לָלֶ֣כֶת לְפָנַ֔י כַּאֲשֶׁ֥ר הָלַ֖כְתָּ לְפָנָֽי׃
Translated: And now, O E<small>TERNAL</small> God of Israel, keep the further promise that You made to Your servant, my father David: ‘Your line on the throne of Israel shall never end, if only your descendants will look to their way and walk before Me as you have walked before Me.’
Transliteration: veatah yehovah elohey yisherael shemor leavedekha david aviy et asher divareta lvo lemor lo-yikharet lekha iysh milefanay yoshev al-khise yisherael rak im-yishemeru vaneykha et-darekham lalekhet lefanay khaasher halakheta lefanay

Hebrew: וְעַתָּ֖ה אֱלֹהֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל יֵאָ֤מֶן נָא֙ (דבריך) [דְּבָ֣רְךָ֔] אֲשֶׁ֣ר דִּבַּ֔רְתָּ לְעַבְדְּךָ֖ דָּוִ֥ד אָבִֽי׃
Translated: Now, therefore, O God of Israel, let the promise that You made to Your servant my father David be fulfilled.
Transliteration: veatah elohey yisherael eiamen na (dvrykh) [devarekha] asher divareta leavedekha david aviy

Hebrew: כִּ֚י הַֽאֻמְנָ֔ם יֵשֵׁ֥ב אֱלֹהִ֖ים עַל־הָאָ֑רֶץ הִ֠נֵּ֠ה הַשָּׁמַ֜יִם וּשְׁמֵ֤י הַשָּׁמַ֙יִם֙ לֹ֣א יְכַלְכְּל֔וּךָ אַ֕ף כִּֽי־הַבַּ֥יִת הַזֶּ֖ה אֲשֶׁ֥ר בָּנִֽיתִי׃
Translated: “But will God really dwell on earth? Even the heavens to their uttermost reaches cannot contain You, how much less this House that I have built!
Transliteration: khiy haumenam eishev Elohim al-haarets hineh hashamayiim ushemey hashamayiim lo yekhalekhelukha af khiy-havayiit hazeh asher vaniytiy

Hebrew: וּפָנִ֜יתָ אֶל־תְּפִלַּ֧ת עַבְדְּךָ֛ וְאֶל־תְּחִנָּת֖וֹ יְהֹוָ֣ה אֱלֹהָ֑י לִשְׁמֹ֤עַ אֶל־הָֽרִנָּה֙ וְאֶל־הַתְּפִלָּ֔ה אֲשֶׁ֧ר עַבְדְּךָ֛ מִתְפַּלֵּ֥ל לְפָנֶ֖יךָ הַיּֽוֹם׃
Translated: Yet turn, my E<small>TERNAL</small> God, to the prayer and supplication of Your servant, and hear the cry and prayer that Your servant offers before You this day.
Transliteration: ufaniyta el-tefilat avedekha veel-techinatvo yehovah elohay lishemoa el-harinah veel-hatefilah asher avedekha mitefalel lefaneykha hayyvom

Hebrew: לִהְיוֹת֩ עֵינֶ֨ךָ פְתֻחֹ֜ת אֶל־הַבַּ֤יִת הַזֶּה֙ לַ֣יְלָה וָי֔וֹם אֶ֨ל־הַמָּק֔וֹם אֲשֶׁ֣ר אָמַ֔רְתָּ יִהְיֶ֥ה שְׁמִ֖י שָׁ֑ם לִשְׁמֹ֙עַ֙ אֶל־הַתְּפִלָּ֔ה אֲשֶׁ֣ר יִתְפַּלֵּ֣ל עַבְדְּךָ֔ אֶל־הַמָּק֖וֹם הַזֶּֽה׃
Translated: May Your eyes be open day and night toward this House, toward the place of which You have said, ‘My name shall abide there’; may You heed the prayers that Your servant will offer toward this place.
Transliteration: liheyvot eynekha fetuchot el-havayiit hazeh layelah vayvom el-hamakvom asher amareta yiheyeh shemiy sham lishemoa el-hatefilah asher yitefalel avedekha el-hamakvom hazeh

Hebrew: וְשָׁ֨מַעְתָּ֜ אֶל־תְּחִנַּ֤ת עַבְדְּךָ֙ וְעַמְּךָ֣ יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל אֲשֶׁ֥ר יִֽתְפַּלְל֖וּ אֶל־הַמָּק֣וֹם הַזֶּ֑ה וְ֠אַתָּ֠ה תִּשְׁמַ֞ע אֶל־מְק֤וֹם שִׁבְתְּךָ֙ אֶל־הַשָּׁמַ֔יִם וְשָׁמַעְתָּ֖ וְסָלָֽחְתָּ׃
Translated: And when You hear the supplications that Your servant and Your people Israel offer toward this place, give heed in Your heavenly abode—give heed and pardon.
Transliteration: veshamaeta el-techinat avedekha veamekha yisherael asher yitefalelu el-hamakvom hazeh veatah tishema el-mekvom shivetekha el-hashamayiim veshamaeta vesalacheta

Hebrew: אֵת֩ אֲשֶׁ֨ר יֶחֱטָ֥א אִישׁ֙ לְרֵעֵ֔הוּ וְנָשָׁא־ב֥וֹ אָלָ֖ה לְהַאֲלֹת֑וֹ וּבָ֗א אָלָ֛ה לִפְנֵ֥י מִֽזְבַּחֲךָ֖ בַּבַּ֥יִת הַזֶּֽה׃
Translated: “Whenever one person commits an offense against another, and the latter utters an imprecation to bring a curse upon the former, and comes with that imprecation before Your altar in this House,
Transliteration: et asher yecheta iysh lereehu venasha-vvo alah lehaalotvo uva alah lifeney mizevachakha vavayiit hazeh

Hebrew: וְאַתָּ֣ה ׀ תִּשְׁמַ֣ע הַשָּׁמַ֗יִם וְעָשִׂ֙יתָ֙ וְשָׁפַטְתָּ֣ אֶת־עֲבָדֶ֔יךָ לְהַרְשִׁ֣יעַ רָשָׁ֔ע לָתֵ֥ת דַּרְכּ֖וֹ בְּרֹאשׁ֑וֹ וּלְהַצְדִּ֣יק צַדִּ֔יק לָ֥תֶת ל֖וֹ כְּצִדְקָתֽוֹ׃
Translated: oh, hear in heaven and take action to judge Your servants, condemning the one who is in the wrong and bringing down the punishment of their conduct on their head—while vindicating the other, who is in the right, by rewarding them according to their righteousness.
Transliteration: veatah tishema hashamayiim veashiyta veshafateta et-avadeykha lehareshiya rasha latet darekhvo veroshvo ulehatsediyk tsadiyk latet lvo khetsidekatvo

Hebrew: בְּֽהִנָּגֵ֞ף עַמְּךָ֧ יִשְׂרָאֵ֛ל לִפְנֵ֥י אוֹיֵ֖ב אֲשֶׁ֣ר יֶחֶטְאוּ־לָ֑ךְ וְשָׁ֤בוּ אֵלֶ֙יךָ֙ וְהוֹד֣וּ אֶת־שְׁמֶ֔ךָ וְהִתְפַּלְל֧וּ וְהִֽתְחַנְּנ֛וּ אֵלֶ֖יךָ בַּבַּ֥יִת הַזֶּֽה׃
Translated: “Should Your people Israel be routed by an enemy because they have sinned against You, and then turn back to You and acknowledge Your name, and they offer prayer and supplication to You in this House,
Transliteration: vehinagef amekha yisherael lifeney voeiv asher yecheteu-lakhe veshavu eleykha vehvodu et-shemekha vehitefalelu vehitechanenu eleykha vavayiit hazeh

Hebrew: וְאַתָּה֙ תִּשְׁמַ֣ע הַשָּׁמַ֔יִם וְסָ֣לַחְתָּ֔ לְחַטַּ֖את עַמְּךָ֣ יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל וַהֲשֵֽׁבֹתָם֙ אֶל־הָ֣אֲדָמָ֔ה אֲשֶׁ֥ר נָתַ֖תָּ לַאֲבוֹתָֽם׃ {ס}
Translated: oh, hear in heaven and pardon the sin of Your people Israel, and restore them to the land that You gave to their ancestors.
Transliteration: veatah tishema hashamayiim vesalacheta lechatat amekha yisherael vahashevotam el-haadamah asher natata laavvotam {s}

Hebrew: בְּהֵעָצֵ֥ר שָׁמַ֛יִם וְלֹֽא־יִֽהְיֶ֥ה מָטָ֖ר כִּ֣י יֶחֶטְאוּ־לָ֑ךְ וְהִֽתְפַּלְל֞וּ אֶל־הַמָּק֤וֹם הַזֶּה֙ וְהוֹד֣וּ אֶת־שְׁמֶ֔ךָ וּמֵחַטָּאתָ֥ם יְשׁוּב֖וּן כִּ֥י תַעֲנֵֽם׃
Translated: “Should the heavens be shut up and there be no rain, because they have sinned against You, and then they pray toward this place and acknowledge Your name and repent of their sins, when You answer them,
Transliteration: veheatser shamayiim velo-yiheyeh matar khiy yecheteu-lakhe vehitefalelu el-hamakvom hazeh vehvodu et-shemekha umechatatam yeshuvun khiy taanem

Hebrew: וְאַתָּ֣ה ׀ תִּשְׁמַ֣ע הַשָּׁמַ֗יִם וְסָ֨לַחְתָּ֜ לְחַטַּ֤את עֲבָדֶ֙יךָ֙ וְעַמְּךָ֣ יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל כִּ֥י תוֹרֵ֛ם אֶת־הַדֶּ֥רֶךְ הַטּוֹבָ֖ה אֲשֶׁ֣ר יֵֽלְכוּ־בָ֑הּ וְנָתַתָּ֤ה מָטָר֙ עַֽל־אַרְצְךָ֔ אֲשֶׁר־נָתַ֥תָּה לְעַמְּךָ֖ לְנַחֲלָֽה׃ {ס}
Translated: oh, hear in heaven and pardon the sin of Your servants, Your people Israel, after You have shown them the proper way in which they are to walk; and send down rain upon the land that You gave to Your people as their heritage.
Transliteration: veatah tishema hashamayiim vesalacheta lechatat avadeykha veamekha yisherael khiy tvorem et-haderekhe hatvovah asher eilekhu-vah venatatah matar al-aretsekha asher-natatah leamekha lenachalah {s}

Hebrew: רָעָ֞ב כִּֽי־יִֽהְיֶ֣ה בָאָ֗רֶץ דֶּ֣בֶר כִּֽי־יִֽ֠הְיֶ֠ה שִׁדָּפ֨וֹן יֵרָק֜וֹן אַרְבֶּ֤ה חָסִיל֙ כִּ֣י יִֽהְיֶ֔ה כִּ֧י יָֽצַר־ל֛וֹ אֹיְב֖וֹ בְּאֶ֣רֶץ שְׁעָרָ֑יו כׇּל־נֶ֖גַע כׇּֽל־מַחֲלָֽה׃
Translated:
So, too, if there is a famine in the land, if there is pestilence, blight, mildew, locusts or caterpillars, or if an enemy oppresses them in any of the settlements of the land.
“In any plague and in any disease,
Transliteration: raav khiy-yiheyeh vaarets dever khiy-yiheyeh shidafvon eirakvon areveh chasiyl khiy yiheyeh khiy yatsar-lvo oyevvo veerets shearayv khׇl-nega khׇl-machalah

Hebrew: כׇּל־תְּפִלָּ֣ה כׇל־תְּחִנָּ֗ה אֲשֶׁ֤ר תִּֽהְיֶה֙ לְכׇל־הָ֣אָדָ֔ם לְכֹ֖ל עַמְּךָ֣ יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל אֲשֶׁ֣ר יֵדְע֗וּן אִ֚ישׁ נֶ֣גַע לְבָב֔וֹ וּפָרַ֥שׂ כַּפָּ֖יו אֶל־הַבַּ֥יִת הַזֶּֽה׃
Translated: in any prayer or supplication offered by any person among all Your people Israel—each of whom knows their own affliction—when they spread their palms toward this House,
Transliteration: khׇl-tefilah khׇl-techinah asher tiheyeh lekhׇl-haadam lekhol amekha yisherael asher eideun iysh nega levavvo ufarash khafayv el-havayiit hazeh

Hebrew: וְ֠אַתָּ֠ה תִּשְׁמַ֨ע הַשָּׁמַ֜יִם מְכ֤וֹן שִׁבְתֶּ֙ךָ֙ וְסָלַחְתָּ֣ וְעָשִׂ֔יתָ וְנָתַתָּ֤ לָאִישׁ֙ כְּכׇל־דְּרָכָ֔יו אֲשֶׁ֥ר תֵּדַ֖ע אֶת־לְבָב֑וֹ כִּֽי־אַתָּ֤ה יָדַ֙עְתָּ֙ לְבַדְּךָ֔ אֶת־לְבַ֖ב כׇּל־בְּנֵ֥י הָאָדָֽם׃
Translated: oh, hear in Your heavenly abode, and pardon and take action! Render to that individual according to their ways as You know their heart to be—for You alone know every human heart.
Transliteration: veatah tishema hashamayiim mekhvon shivetekha vesalacheta veashiyta venatata laiysh khekhׇl-derakhayv asher teda et-levavvo khiy-atah yadaeta levadekha et-levav khׇl-veney haadam

Hebrew: לְמַ֙עַן֙ יִרָא֔וּךָ כׇּ֨ל־הַיָּמִ֔ים אֲשֶׁר־הֵ֥ם חַיִּ֖ים עַל־פְּנֵ֣י הָאֲדָמָ֑ה אֲשֶׁ֥ר נָתַ֖תָּה לַאֲבֹתֵֽינוּ׃
Translated: Thus may Your people revere You all the days that they live on the land that You gave to our ancestors.
Transliteration: lemaan yiraukha khׇl-hayamiym asher-hem chayiym al-feney haadamah asher natatah laavoteynu

Hebrew: וְגַם֙ אֶל־הַנׇּכְרִ֔י אֲשֶׁ֛ר לֹא־מֵעַמְּךָ֥ יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל ה֑וּא וּבָ֛א מֵאֶ֥רֶץ רְחוֹקָ֖ה לְמַ֥עַן שְׁמֶֽךָ׃
Translated: “Or if a foreigner who is not of Your people Israel comes from a distant land for the sake of Your name—
Transliteration: vegam el-hanׇkheriy asher lo-meamekha yisherael hu uva meerets rechvokah lemaan shemekha

Hebrew: כִּ֤י יִשְׁמְעוּן֙ אֶת־שִׁמְךָ֣ הַגָּד֔וֹל וְאֶת־יָֽדְךָ֙ הַחֲזָקָ֔ה וּֽזְרֹעֲךָ֖ הַנְּטוּיָ֑ה וּבָ֥א וְהִתְפַּלֵּ֖ל אֶל־הַבַּ֥יִת הַזֶּֽה׃
Translated: for they shall hear about Your great name and Your mighty hand and Your outstretched arm—and thus comes to pray toward this House,
Transliteration: khiy yishemeun et-shimekha hagadvol veet-yadekha hachazakah uzeroakha hanetuyah uva vehitefalel el-havayiit hazeh

Hebrew: אַתָּ֞ה תִּשְׁמַ֤ע הַשָּׁמַ֙יִם֙ מְכ֣וֹן שִׁבְתֶּ֔ךָ וְעָשִׂ֕יתָ כְּכֹ֛ל אֲשֶׁר־יִקְרָ֥א אֵלֶ֖יךָ הַנׇּכְרִ֑י לְמַ֣עַן יֵדְעוּן֩ כׇּל־עַמֵּ֨י הָאָ֜רֶץ אֶת־שְׁמֶ֗ךָ לְיִרְאָ֤ה אֹֽתְךָ֙ כְּעַמְּךָ֣ יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל וְלָדַ֕עַת כִּֽי־שִׁמְךָ֣ נִקְרָ֔א עַל־הַבַּ֥יִת הַזֶּ֖ה אֲשֶׁ֥ר בָּנִֽיתִי׃
Translated: oh, hear in Your heavenly abode and grant all that the foreigner asks You for. Thus all the peoples of the earth will know Your name and revere You, as does Your people Israel; and they will recognize that Your name is attached to this House that I have built.
Transliteration: atah tishema hashamayiim mekhvon shivetekha veashiyta khekhol asher-yikera eleykha hanׇkheriy lemaan eideun khׇl-amey haarets et-shemekha leyireah otekha kheamekha yisherael veladaat khiy-shimekha nikera al-havayiit hazeh asher vaniytiy

Hebrew: כִּֽי־יֵצֵ֨א עַמְּךָ֤ לַמִּלְחָמָה֙ עַל־אֹ֣יְב֔וֹ בַּדֶּ֖רֶךְ אֲשֶׁ֣ר תִּשְׁלָחֵ֑ם וְהִתְפַּלְל֣וּ אֶל־יְהֹוָ֗ה דֶּ֤רֶךְ הָעִיר֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר בָּחַ֣רְתָּ בָּ֔הּ וְהַבַּ֖יִת אֲשֶׁר־בָּנִ֥תִי לִשְׁמֶֽךָ׃
Translated: “When Your people take the field against their enemy by whatever way You send them, and they pray to G<small>OD</small> in the direction of the city that You have chosen, and of the House that I have built to Your name,
Transliteration: khiy-eitse amekha lamilechamah al-oyevvo vaderekhe asher tishelachem vehitefalelu el-yehovah derekhe haiyr asher vachareta vah vehavayiit asher-vanitiy lishemekha

Hebrew: וְשָֽׁמַעְתָּ֙ הַשָּׁמַ֔יִם אֶת־תְּפִלָּתָ֖ם וְאֶת־תְּחִנָּתָ֑ם וְעָשִׂ֖יתָ מִשְׁפָּטָֽם׃
Translated: oh, hear in heaven their prayer and supplication and uphold their cause.
Transliteration: veshamaeta hashamayiim et-tefilatam veet-techinatam veashiyta mishefatam

Hebrew: כִּ֣י יֶחֶטְאוּ־לָ֗ךְ כִּ֣י אֵ֤ין אָדָם֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר לֹֽא־יֶחֱטָ֔א וְאָנַפְתָּ֣ בָ֔ם וּנְתַתָּ֖ם לִפְנֵ֣י אוֹיֵ֑ב וְשָׁב֤וּם שֹֽׁבֵיהֶם֙ אֶל־אֶ֣רֶץ הָאוֹיֵ֔ב רְחוֹקָ֖ה א֥וֹ קְרוֹבָֽה׃
Translated: “When they sin against You—for there is no mortal who does not sin—and You are angry with them and deliver them to the enemy, and their captors carry them off to an enemy land, near or far;
Transliteration: khiy yecheteu-lakhe khiy eyn adam asher lo-yecheta veanafeta vam unetatam lifeney voeiv veshavum shoveyhem el-erets havoeiv rechvokah vo kervovah

Hebrew: וְהֵשִׁ֙יבוּ֙ אֶל־לִבָּ֔ם בָּאָ֖רֶץ אֲשֶׁ֣ר נִשְׁבּוּ־שָׁ֑ם וְשָׁ֣בוּ ׀ וְהִֽתְחַנְּנ֣וּ אֵלֶ֗יךָ בְּאֶ֤רֶץ שֹֽׁבֵיהֶם֙ לֵאמֹ֔ר חָטָ֥אנוּ וְהֶעֱוִ֖ינוּ רָשָֽׁעְנוּ׃
Translated: and then they take it to heart in the land to which they have been carried off, and they repent and make supplication to You in the land of their captors, saying: ‘We have sinned, we have acted perversely, we have acted wickedly,’
Transliteration: veheshiyvu el-livam vaarets asher nishevu-sham veshavu vehitechanenu eleykha veerets shoveyhem lemor chatanu veheeviynu rashaenu

Hebrew: וְשָׁ֣בוּ אֵלֶ֗יךָ בְּכׇל־לְבָבָם֙ וּבְכׇל־נַפְשָׁ֔ם בְּאֶ֥רֶץ אֹיְבֵיהֶ֖ם אֲשֶׁר־שָׁב֣וּ אֹתָ֑ם וְהִתְפַּלְל֣וּ אֵלֶ֗יךָ דֶּ֤רֶךְ אַרְצָם֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר נָתַ֣תָּה לַאֲבוֹתָ֔ם הָעִיר֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר בָּחַ֔רְתָּ וְהַבַּ֖יִת אֲשֶׁר־[בָּנִ֥יתִי] (בנית) לִשְׁמֶֽךָ׃
Translated: and they turn back to You with all their heart and soul, in the land of the enemies who have carried them off, and they pray to You in the direction of their land that You gave to their ancestors, of the city that You have chosen, and of the House that I have built to Your name—
Transliteration: veshavu eleykha vekhׇl-levavam uvekhׇl-nafesham veerets oyeveyhem asher-shavu otam vehitefalelu eleykha derekhe aretsam asher natatah laavvotam haiyr asher vachareta vehavayiit asher-[vaniytiy] (vnyt) lishemekha

Hebrew: וְשָׁמַעְתָּ֤ הַשָּׁמַ֙יִם֙ מְכ֣וֹן שִׁבְתְּךָ֔ אֶת־תְּפִלָּתָ֖ם וְאֶת־תְּחִנָּתָ֑ם וְעָשִׂ֖יתָ מִשְׁפָּטָֽם׃
Translated: oh, give heed in Your heavenly abode to their prayer and supplication, uphold their cause,
Transliteration: veshamaeta hashamayiim mekhvon shivetekha et-tefilatam veet-techinatam veashiyta mishefatam

Hebrew: וְסָלַחְתָּ֤ לְעַמְּךָ֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר חָטְאוּ־לָ֔ךְ וּלְכׇל־פִּשְׁעֵיהֶ֖ם אֲשֶׁ֣ר פָּשְׁעוּ־בָ֑ךְ וּנְתַתָּ֧ם לְרַחֲמִ֛ים לִפְנֵ֥י שֹׁבֵיהֶ֖ם וְרִחֲמֽוּם׃
Translated: and pardon Your people who have sinned against You for all the transgressions that they have committed against You. Grant them mercy in the sight of their captors that they may be merciful to them.
Transliteration: vesalacheta leamekha asher chateu-lakhe ulekhׇl-fisheeyhem asher fasheu-vakhe unetatam lerachamiym lifeney shoveyhem verichamum

Hebrew: כִּֽי־עַמְּךָ֥ וְנַחֲלָתְךָ֖ הֵ֑ם אֲשֶׁ֤ר הוֹצֵ֙אתָ֙ מִמִּצְרַ֔יִם מִתּ֖וֹךְ כּ֥וּר הַבַּרְזֶֽל׃
Translated: For they are Your very own people that You freed from Egypt, from the midst of the iron furnace.
Transliteration: khiy-amekha venachalatekha hem asher hvotseta mimitserayiim mitvokhe khur havarezel

Hebrew: לִהְי֨וֹת עֵינֶ֤יךָ פְתֻחֹת֙ אֶל־תְּחִנַּ֣ת עַבְדְּךָ֔ וְאֶל־תְּחִנַּ֖ת עַמְּךָ֣ יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל לִשְׁמֹ֣עַ אֲלֵיהֶ֔ם בְּכֹ֖ל קׇרְאָ֥ם אֵלֶֽיךָ׃
Translated: May Your eyes be open to the supplication of Your servant and the supplication of Your people Israel, and may You heed them whenever they call upon You.
Transliteration: liheyvot eyneykha fetuchot el-techinat avedekha veel-techinat amekha yisherael lishemoa aleyhem vekhol kׇream eleykha

Hebrew: כִּֽי־אַתָּ֞ה הִבְדַּלְתָּ֤ם לְךָ֙ לְֽנַחֲלָ֔ה מִכֹּ֖ל עַמֵּ֣י הָאָ֑רֶץ כַּאֲשֶׁ֨ר דִּבַּ֜רְתָּ בְּיַ֣ד ׀ מֹשֶׁ֣ה עַבְדֶּ֗ךָ בְּהוֹצִיאֲךָ֧ אֶת־אֲבֹתֵ֛ינוּ מִמִּצְרַ֖יִם אֲדֹנָ֥י יֱהֹוִֽה׃ {פ}
Translated: For You, O Sovereign G<small>OD</small>, have set them apart for Yourself from all the peoples of the earth as Your very own, as You promised through Moses Your servant when You freed our ancestors from Egypt.”
Transliteration: khiy-atah hivedaletam lekha lenachalah mikhol amey haarets khaasher divareta veyad mosheh avedekha vehvotsiyakha et-avoteynu mimitserayiim adonay yehovih {f}

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֣י ׀ כְּכַלּ֣וֹת שְׁלֹמֹ֗ה לְהִתְפַּלֵּל֙ אֶל־יְהֹוָ֔ה אֵ֛ת כׇּל־הַתְּפִלָּ֥ה וְהַתְּחִנָּ֖ה הַזֹּ֑את קָ֞ם מִלִּפְנֵ֨י מִזְבַּ֤ח יְהֹוָה֙ מִכְּרֹ֣עַ עַל־בִּרְכָּ֔יו וְכַפָּ֖יו פְּרֻשׂ֥וֹת הַשָּׁמָֽיִם׃
Translated: When Solomon finished offering to G<small>OD</small> all this prayer and supplication, he rose from where he had been kneeling, in front of the altar of G<small>OD</small>, his hands spread out toward heaven.
Transliteration: vayehiy khekhalvot shelomoh lehitefalel el-yehovah et khׇl-hatefilah vehatechinah hazot kam milifeney mizevach yehovah mikheroa al-virekhayv vekhafayv ferushvot hashamayiim

Hebrew: וַיַּעֲמֹ֕ד וַיְבָ֕רֶךְ אֵ֖ת כׇּל־קְהַ֣ל יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל ק֥וֹל גָּד֖וֹל לֵאמֹֽר׃
Translated: He stood, and in a loud voice blessed the whole congregation of Israel:
Transliteration: vayaamod vayevarekhe et khׇl-kehal yisherael kvol gadvol lemor

Hebrew: בָּר֣וּךְ יְהֹוָ֗ה אֲשֶׁ֨ר נָתַ֤ן מְנוּחָה֙ לְעַמּ֣וֹ יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל כְּכֹ֖ל אֲשֶׁ֣ר דִּבֵּ֑ר לֹֽא־נָפַ֞ל דָּבָ֣ר אֶחָ֗ד מִכֹּל֙ דְּבָר֣וֹ הַטּ֔וֹב אֲשֶׁ֣ר דִּבֶּ֔ר בְּיַ֖ד מֹשֶׁ֥ה עַבְדּֽוֹ׃
Translated: “Praised be G<small>OD</small> who has granted a haven to Israel—God’s people—just as promised; not a single word has failed of all the gracious promises that were made through God’s servant Moses.
Transliteration: varukhe yehovah asher natan menuchah leamvo yisherael khekhol asher diver lo-nafal davar echad mikhol devarvo hatvov asher diver veyad mosheh avedvo

Hebrew: יְהִ֨י יְהֹוָ֤ה אֱלֹהֵ֙ינוּ֙ עִמָּ֔נוּ כַּאֲשֶׁ֥ר הָיָ֖ה עִם־אֲבֹתֵ֑ינוּ אַל־יַעַזְבֵ֖נוּ וְאַֽל־יִטְּשֵֽׁנוּ׃
Translated: May the E<small>TERNAL</small> our God be with us, as was the case with our ancestors. May we never be abandoned or forsaken.
Transliteration: yehiy yehovah eloheynu imanu khaasher hayah im-avoteynu al-yaazevenu veal-yiteshenu

Hebrew: לְהַטּ֥וֹת לְבָבֵ֖נוּ אֵלָ֑יו לָלֶ֣כֶת בְּכׇל־דְּרָכָ֗יו וְלִשְׁמֹ֨ר מִצְוֺתָ֤יו וְחֻקָּיו֙ וּמִשְׁפָּטָ֔יו אֲשֶׁ֥ר צִוָּ֖ה אֶת־אֲבֹתֵֽינוּ׃
Translated: May our hearts be inclined to [God], that we may walk in all God’s ways and keep the commandments, the laws, and the rules that were enjoined upon our ancestors.
Transliteration: lehatvot levavenu elayv lalekhet vekhׇl-derakhayv velishemor mitsevotayv vechukayv umishefatayv asher tsivah et-avoteynu

Hebrew: וְיִֽהְי֨וּ דְבָרַ֜י אֵ֗לֶּה אֲשֶׁ֤ר הִתְחַנַּ֙נְתִּי֙ לִפְנֵ֣י יְהֹוָ֔ה קְרֹבִ֛ים אֶל־יְהֹוָ֥ה אֱלֹהֵ֖ינוּ יוֹמָ֣ם וָלָ֑יְלָה לַעֲשׂ֣וֹת ׀ מִשְׁפַּ֣ט עַבְדּ֗וֹ וּמִשְׁפַּ֛ט עַמּ֥וֹ יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל דְּבַר־י֥וֹם בְּיוֹמֽוֹ׃
Translated: And may these words of mine, which I have offered in supplication before G<small>OD</small>, be close to the E<small>TERNAL</small> our God day and night, that God’s servant and this covenanted people Israel may be provided for, according to each day’s needs—
Transliteration: veyiheyu devaray eleh asher hitechananetiy lifeney yehovah keroviym el-yehovah eloheynu yvomam valayelah laashvot mishefat avedvo umishefat amvo yisherael devar-yvom veyvomvo

Hebrew: לְמַ֗עַן דַּ֚עַת כׇּל־עַמֵּ֣י הָאָ֔רֶץ כִּ֥י יְהֹוָ֖ה ה֣וּא הָאֱלֹהִ֑ים אֵ֖ין עֽוֹד׃
Translated: to the end that all the peoples of the earth may know that the E<small>TERNAL</small> alone is God, there is no other.
Transliteration: lemaan daat khׇl-amey haarets khiy yehovah hu haElohim eyn vod

Hebrew: וְהָיָ֤ה לְבַבְכֶם֙ שָׁלֵ֔ם עִ֖ם יְהֹוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֵ֑ינוּ לָלֶ֧כֶת בְּחֻקָּ֛יו וְלִשְׁמֹ֥ר מִצְוֺתָ֖יו כַּיּ֥וֹם הַזֶּֽה׃
Translated: And may you be wholehearted with the E<small>TERNAL</small> our God, to walk in God’s ways and keep God’s commandments, even as now.”
Transliteration: vehayah levavekhem shalem im yehovah eloheynu lalekhet vechukayv velishemor mitsevotayv khayyvom hazeh

Hebrew: וְֽהַמֶּ֔לֶךְ וְכׇל־יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל עִמּ֑וֹ זֹבְחִ֥ים זֶ֖בַח לִפְנֵ֥י יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: The king and all Israel with him offered sacrifices before G<small>OD</small>.
Transliteration: vehamelekhe vekhׇl-yisherael imvo zovechiym zevach lifeney yehovah

Hebrew: וַיִּזְבַּ֣ח שְׁלֹמֹ֗ה אֵ֣ת זֶ֣בַח הַשְּׁלָמִים֮ אֲשֶׁ֣ר זָבַ֣ח לַיהֹוָה֒ בָּקָ֗ר עֶשְׂרִ֤ים וּשְׁנַ֙יִם֙ אֶ֔לֶף וְצֹ֕אן מֵאָ֥ה וְעֶשְׂרִ֖ים אָ֑לֶף וַֽיַּחְנְכוּ֙ אֶת־בֵּ֣ית יְהֹוָ֔ה הַמֶּ֖לֶךְ וְכׇל־בְּנֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated: Solomon offered 22,000 oxen and 120,000 sheep as sacrifices of well-being to G<small>OD</small>. Thus the king and all the Israelites dedicated the House of G<small>OD</small>.
Transliteration: vayizevach shelomoh et zevach hashelamiym asher zavach layhovah vakar esheriym ushenayiim elef vetson meah veesheriym alef vayachenekhu et-veyt yehovah hamelekhe vekhׇl-veney yisherael

Hebrew: בַּיּ֣וֹם הַה֗וּא קִדַּ֨שׁ הַמֶּ֜לֶךְ אֶת־תּ֣וֹךְ הֶחָצֵ֗ר אֲשֶׁר֙ לִפְנֵ֣י בֵית־יְהֹוָ֔ה כִּי־עָ֣שָׂה שָׁ֗ם אֶת־הָֽעֹלָה֙ וְאֶת־הַמִּנְחָ֔ה וְאֵ֖ת חֶלְבֵ֣י הַשְּׁלָמִ֑ים כִּֽי־מִזְבַּ֤ח הַנְּחֹ֙שֶׁת֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר לִפְנֵ֣י יְהֹוָ֔ה קָטֹ֗ן מֵֽהָכִיל֙ אֶת־הָעֹלָ֣ה וְאֶת־הַמִּנְחָ֔ה וְאֵ֖ת חֶלְבֵ֥י הַשְּׁלָמִֽים׃
Translated: That day the king consecrated the center of the court that was in front of the House of G<small>OD</small>. For it was there that he presented the burnt offerings, the grain offerings, and the fat parts of the offerings of well-being, because the bronze altar that was before G<small>OD</small> was too small to hold the burnt offerings, the grain offerings, and the fat parts of the offerings of well-being.
Transliteration: vayyvom hahu kidash hamelekhe et-tvokhe hechatser asher lifeney veyt-yehovah khiy-ashah sham et-haolah veet-haminechah veet chelevey hashelamiym khiy-mizevach hanechoshet asher lifeney yehovah katon mehakhiyl et-haolah veet-haminechah veet chelevey hashelamiym

Hebrew: וַיַּ֣עַשׂ שְׁלֹמֹ֣ה בָעֵת־הַהִ֣יא ׀ אֶת־הֶחָ֡ג וְכׇל־יִשְׂרָאֵ֣ל עִמּוֹ֩ קָהָ֨ל גָּד֜וֹל מִלְּב֥וֹא חֲמָ֣ת ׀ עַד־נַ֣חַל מִצְרַ֗יִם לִפְנֵי֙ יְהֹוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֵ֔ינוּ שִׁבְעַ֥ת יָמִ֖ים וְשִׁבְעַ֣ת יָמִ֑ים אַרְבָּעָ֥ה עָשָׂ֖ר יֽוֹם׃
Translated: So Solomon and all Israel with him—a great assemblage, [coming] from Lebo-hamath to the Wadi of Egypt—observed the Feast at that time before the E<small>TERNAL</small> our God, seven days and again seven days, fourteen days in all.
Transliteration: vayaash shelomoh vaet-hahiy et-hechag vekhׇl-yisherael imvo kahal gadvol milevvo chamat ad-nachal mitserayiim lifeney yehovah eloheynu shiveat yamiym veshiveat yamiym arevaah ashar yvom

Hebrew: בַּיּ֤וֹם הַשְּׁמִינִי֙ שִׁלַּ֣ח אֶת־הָעָ֔ם וַֽיְבָרְכ֖וּ אֶת־הַמֶּ֑לֶךְ וַיֵּלְכ֣וּ לְאׇהֳלֵיהֶ֗ם שְׂמֵחִים֙ וְט֣וֹבֵי לֵ֔ב עַ֣ל כׇּל־הַטּוֹבָ֗ה אֲשֶׁ֨ר עָשָׂ֤ה יְהֹוָה֙ לְדָוִ֣ד עַבְדּ֔וֹ וּלְיִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל עַמּֽוֹ׃
Translated: On the eighth day he let the people go. They bade the king good-bye and went to their homes, joyful and glad of heart over all the goodness that G<small>OD</small> had shown to God’s servant David and to Israel—God’s people.
Transliteration: vayyvom hashemiyniy shilach et-haam vayevarekhu et-hamelekhe vayelekhu leׇholeyhem shemechiym vetvovey lev al khׇl-hatvovah asher ashah yehovah ledavid avedvo uleyisherael amvo

Hebrew: וַֽיְהִי֙ כְּכַלּ֣וֹת שְׁלֹמֹ֔ה לִבְנ֥וֹת אֶת־בֵּית־יְהֹוָ֖ה וְאֶת־בֵּ֣ית הַמֶּ֑לֶךְ וְאֵת֙ כׇּל־חֵ֣שֶׁק שְׁלֹמֹ֔ה אֲשֶׁ֥ר חָפֵ֖ץ לַעֲשֽׂוֹת׃ {פ}
Translated: When Solomon had finished building the House of G<small>OD</small> and the royal palace and everything that Solomon had set his heart on constructing,
Transliteration: vayehiy khekhalvot shelomoh livenvot et-veyt-yehovah veet-veyt hamelekhe veet khׇl-cheshek shelomoh asher chafets laashvot {f}

Hebrew: וַיֵּרָ֧א יְהֹוָ֛ה אֶל־שְׁלֹמֹ֖ה שֵׁנִ֑ית כַּאֲשֶׁ֛ר נִרְאָ֥ה אֵלָ֖יו בְּגִבְעֽוֹן׃
Translated: G<small>OD</small> appeared to Solomon a second time, as before, at Gibeon.
Transliteration: vayera yehovah el-shelomoh sheniyt khaasher nireah elayv vegivevon

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר יְהֹוָ֜ה אֵלָ֗יו שָׁ֠מַ֠עְתִּי אֶת־תְּפִלָּתְךָ֣ וְאֶת־תְּחִנָּתְךָ֮ אֲשֶׁ֣ר הִתְחַנַּ֣נְתָּה לְפָנַי֒ הִקְדַּ֗שְׁתִּי אֶת־הַבַּ֤יִת הַזֶּה֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר בָּנִ֔תָה לָשׂוּם־שְׁמִ֥י שָׁ֖ם עַד־עוֹלָ֑ם וְהָי֨וּ עֵינַ֧י וְלִבִּ֛י שָׁ֖ם כׇּל־הַיָּמִֽים׃
Translated: G<small>OD</small> said to him, “I have heard the prayer and the supplication that you have offered to Me. I consecrate this House that you have built and I set My name there forever. My eyes and My heart shall ever be there.
Transliteration: vayomer yehovah elayv shamaetiy et-tefilatekha veet-techinatekha asher hitechananetah lefanay hikedashetiy et-havayiit hazeh asher vanitah lashum-shemiy sham ad-volam vehayu eynay veliviy sham khׇl-hayamiym

Hebrew: וְאַתָּ֞ה אִם־תֵּלֵ֣ךְ לְפָנַ֗י כַּאֲשֶׁ֨ר הָלַ֜ךְ דָּוִ֤ד אָבִ֙יךָ֙ בְּתׇם־לֵבָ֣ב וּבְיֹ֔שֶׁר לַעֲשׂ֕וֹת כְּכֹ֖ל אֲשֶׁ֣ר צִוִּיתִ֑יךָ חֻקַּ֥י וּמִשְׁפָּטַ֖י תִּשְׁמֹֽר׃
Translated: As for you, if you walk before Me as your father David walked before Me, wholeheartedly and with uprightness, doing all that I have commanded you [and] keeping My laws and My rules,
Transliteration: veatah im-telekhe lefanay khaasher halakhe david aviykha vetׇm-levav uveyosher laashvot khekhol asher tsiviytiykha chukay umishefatay tishemor

Hebrew: וַהֲקִ֨מֹתִ֜י אֶת־כִּסֵּ֧א מַֽמְלַכְתְּךָ֛ עַל־יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל לְעֹלָ֑ם כַּאֲשֶׁ֣ר דִּבַּ֗רְתִּי עַל־דָּוִ֤ד אָבִ֙יךָ֙ לֵאמֹ֔ר לֹֽא־יִכָּרֵ֤ת לְךָ֙ אִ֔ישׁ מֵעַ֖ל כִּסֵּ֥א יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated: then I will establish your throne of kingship over Israel forever, as I promised your father David, saying, ‘Your line on the throne of Israel shall never end.’
Transliteration: vahakimotiy et-khise mamelakhetekha al-yisherael leolam khaasher divaretiy al-david aviykha lemor lo-yikharet lekha iysh meal khise yisherael

Hebrew: אִם־שׁ֨וֹב תְּשֻׁב֜וּן אַתֶּ֤ם וּבְנֵיכֶם֙ מֵֽאַחֲרַ֔י וְלֹ֤א תִשְׁמְרוּ֙ מִצְוֺתַ֣י חֻקֹּתַ֔י אֲשֶׁ֥ר נָתַ֖תִּי לִפְנֵיכֶ֑ם וַהֲלַכְתֶּ֗ם וַֽעֲבַדְתֶּם֙ אֱלֹהִ֣ים אֲחֵרִ֔ים וְהִשְׁתַּחֲוִיתֶ֖ם לָהֶֽם׃
Translated: [But] if you and your descendants turn away from Me and do not keep the commandments [and] the laws that I have set before you, and go and serve other gods and worship them,
Transliteration: im-shvov teshuvun atem uveneykhem meacharay velo tishemeru mitsevotay chukotay asher natatiy lifeneykhem vahalakhetem vaavadetem Elohim acheriym vehishetachaviytem lahem

Hebrew: וְהִכְרַתִּ֣י אֶת־יִשְׂרָאֵ֗ל מֵעַ֨ל פְּנֵ֤י הָאֲדָמָה֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר נָתַ֣תִּי לָהֶ֔ם וְאֶת־הַבַּ֙יִת֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר הִקְדַּ֣שְׁתִּי לִשְׁמִ֔י אֲשַׁלַּ֖ח מֵעַ֣ל פָּנָ֑י וְהָיָ֧ה יִשְׂרָאֵ֛ל לְמָשָׁ֥ל וְלִשְׁנִינָ֖ה בְּכׇל־הָעַמִּֽים׃
Translated: then I will sweep Israel off the land that I gave them; I will reject the House that I have consecrated to My name; and Israel shall become a proverb and a byword among all peoples.
Transliteration: vehikheratiy et-yisherael meal feney haadamah asher natatiy lahem veet-havayiit asher hikedashetiy lishemiy ashalach meal fanay vehayah yisherael lemashal velisheniynah vekhׇl-haamiym

Hebrew: וְהַבַּ֤יִת הַזֶּה֙ יִהְיֶ֣ה עֶלְי֔וֹן כׇּל־עֹבֵ֥ר עָלָ֖יו יִשֹּׁ֣ם וְשָׁרָ֑ק וְאָמְר֗וּ עַל־מֶ֨ה עָשָׂ֤ה יְהֹוָה֙ כָּ֔כָה לָאָ֥רֶץ הַזֹּ֖את וְלַבַּ֥יִת הַזֶּֽה׃
Translated: And as for this House, once so exalted, everyone passing by it shall be appalled and shall hiss. And when they ask, ‘Why did G<small>OD</small> do thus to the land and to this House?’
Transliteration: vehavayiit hazeh yiheyeh eleyvon khׇl-over alayv yishom vesharak veameru al-meh ashah yehovah khakhah laarets hazot velavayiit hazeh

Hebrew: וְאָמְר֗וּ עַל֩ אֲשֶׁ֨ר עָזְב֜וּ אֶת־יְהֹוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֵיהֶ֗ם אֲשֶׁ֨ר הוֹצִ֣יא אֶת־אֲבֹתָם֮ מֵאֶ֣רֶץ מִצְרַ֒יִם֒ וַֽיַּחֲזִ֙קוּ֙ בֵּאלֹהִ֣ים אֲחֵרִ֔ים (וישתחו) [וַיִּשְׁתַּחֲו֥וּ] לָהֶ֖ם וַיַּעַבְדֻ֑ם עַל־כֵּ֗ן הֵבִ֤יא יְהֹוָה֙ עֲלֵיהֶ֔ם אֵ֥ת כׇּל־הָרָעָ֖ה הַזֹּֽאת׃ {פ}
Translated: they shall be told, ‘It is because they forsook the E<small>TERNAL</small> their God who freed them from the land of Egypt, and they embraced other gods and worshiped them and served them; therefore G<small>OD</small> has brought all this calamity upon them.’”
Transliteration: veameru al asher azevu et-yehovah eloheyhem asher hvotsiy et-avotam meerets mitserayiim vayachaziku velohiym acheriym (vyshtchv) [vayishetachavu] lahem vayaavedum al-khen heviy yehovah aleyhem et khׇl-haraah hazot {f}

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֗י מִקְצֵה֙ עֶשְׂרִ֣ים שָׁנָ֔ה אֲשֶׁר־בָּנָ֥ה שְׁלֹמֹ֖ה אֶת־שְׁנֵ֣י הַבָּתִּ֑ים אֶת־בֵּ֥ית יְהֹוָ֖ה וְאֶת־בֵּ֥ית הַמֶּֽלֶךְ׃
Translated: At the end of the twenty years during which Solomon constructed the two buildings, G<small>OD</small>’s House and the royal palace—
Transliteration: vayehiy miketseh esheriym shanah asher-vanah shelomoh et-sheney havatiym et-veyt yehovah veet-veyt hamelekhe

Hebrew: חִירָ֣ם מֶֽלֶךְ־צֹ֠ר נִשָּׂ֨א אֶת־שְׁלֹמֹ֜ה בַּעֲצֵי֩ אֲרָזִ֨ים וּבַעֲצֵ֧י בְרוֹשִׁ֛ים וּבַזָּהָ֖ב לְכׇל־חֶפְצ֑וֹ אָ֡ז יִתֵּן֩ הַמֶּ֨לֶךְ שְׁלֹמֹ֤ה לְחִירָם֙ עֶשְׂרִ֣ים עִ֔יר בְּאֶ֖רֶץ הַגָּלִֽיל׃
Translated: since King Hiram of Tyre had supplied Solomon with all the cedar and cypress timber and gold that he required—King Solomon in turn gave Hiram twenty towns in the region of Galilee.
Transliteration: chiyram melekhe-tsor nisha et-shelomoh vaatsey araziym uvaatsey vervoshiym uvazahav lekhׇl-chefetsvo az yiten hamelekhe shelomoh lechiyram esheriym iyr veerets hagaliyl

Hebrew: וַיֵּצֵ֤א חִירָם֙ מִצֹּ֔ר לִרְאוֹת֙ אֶת־הֶ֣עָרִ֔ים אֲשֶׁ֥ר נָתַן־ל֖וֹ שְׁלֹמֹ֑ה וְלֹ֥א יָשְׁר֖וּ בְּעֵינָֽיו׃
Translated: But when Hiram came from Tyre to inspect the towns that Solomon had given him, he was not pleased with them.
Transliteration: vayetse chiyram mitsor lirevot et-heariym asher natan-lvo shelomoh velo yasheru veeynayv

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֕אמֶר מָ֚ה הֶעָרִ֣ים הָאֵ֔לֶּה אֲשֶׁר־נָתַ֥תָּה לִּ֖י אָחִ֑י וַיִּקְרָ֤א לָהֶם֙ אֶ֣רֶץ כָּב֔וּל עַ֖ד הַיּ֥וֹם הַזֶּֽה׃ {פ}
Translated: “My brother,” he said, “what sort of towns are these you have given me?” So they were named the land of Cabul, as is still the case.
Transliteration: vayomer mah heariym haeleh asher-natatah liy achiy vayikera lahem erets khavul ad hayyvom hazeh {f}

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׁלַ֥ח חִירָ֖ם לַמֶּ֑לֶךְ מֵאָ֥ה וְעֶשְׂרִ֖ים כִּכַּ֥ר זָהָֽב׃
Translated: However, Hiram sent the king one hundred and twenty talents of gold.
Transliteration: vayishelach chiyram lamelekhe meah veesheriym khikhar zahav

Hebrew: וְזֶ֨ה דְבַר־הַמַּ֜ס אֲשֶֽׁר־הֶעֱלָ֣ה ׀ הַמֶּ֣לֶךְ שְׁלֹמֹ֗ה לִבְנוֹת֩ אֶת־בֵּ֨ית יְהֹוָ֤ה וְאֶת־בֵּיתוֹ֙ וְאֶת־הַמִּלּ֔וֹא וְאֵ֖ת חוֹמַ֣ת יְרוּשָׁלָ֑͏ִם וְאֶת־חָצֹ֥ר וְאֶת־מְגִדּ֖וֹ וְאֶת־גָּֽזֶר׃
Translated: This was the purpose of the forced labor that Solomon imposed: It was to build the House of G<small>OD</small>, his own palace, the Millo, and the wall of Jerusalem, and [to fortify] Hazor, Megiddo, and Gezer.
Transliteration: vezeh devar-hamas asher-heelah hamelekhe shelomoh livenvot et-veyt yehovah veet-veytvo veet-hamilvo veet chvomat yerushala͏im veet-chatsor veet-megidvo veet-gazer

Hebrew: פַּרְעֹ֨ה מֶלֶךְ־מִצְרַ֜יִם עָלָ֗ה וַיִּלְכֹּ֤ד אֶת־גֶּ֙זֶר֙ וַיִּשְׂרְפָ֣הּ בָּאֵ֔שׁ וְאֶת־הַֽכְּנַעֲנִ֛י הַיֹּשֵׁ֥ב בָּעִ֖יר הָרָ֑ג וַֽיִּתְּנָהּ֙ שִׁלֻּחִ֔ים לְבִתּ֖וֹ אֵ֥שֶׁת שְׁלֹמֹֽה׃
Translated: (Pharaoh king of Egypt had come up and captured Gezer; he destroyed it by fire, killed the Canaanites who dwelt in the town, and gave it as dowry to his daughter, Solomon’s wife.)
Transliteration: fareoh melekhe-mitserayiim alah vayilekhod et-gezer vayisherefah vaesh veet-hakhenaaniy hayoshev vaiyr harag vayitenah shiluchiym levitvo eshet shelomoh

Hebrew: וַיִּ֤בֶן שְׁלֹמֹה֙ אֶת־גָּ֔זֶר וְאֶת־בֵּ֥ית חֹרֹ֖ן תַּחְתּֽוֹן׃
Translated: So Solomon fortified Gezer, lower Beth-horon,
Transliteration: vayiven shelomoh et-gazer veet-veyt choron tachetvon

Hebrew: וְאֶֽת־בַּעֲלָ֛ת וְאֶת־[תַּדְמֹ֥ר] (תמר) בַּמִּדְבָּ֖ר בָּאָֽרֶץ׃
Translated: Baalith, and Tamar in the wilderness, in the land [of Judah],
Transliteration: veet-vaalat veet-[tademor] (tmr) vamidevar vaarets

Hebrew: וְאֵ֨ת כׇּל־עָרֵ֤י הַֽמִּסְכְּנוֹת֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר הָי֣וּ לִשְׁלֹמֹ֔ה וְאֵת֙ עָרֵ֣י הָרֶ֔כֶב וְאֵ֖ת עָרֵ֣י הַפָּרָשִׁ֑ים וְאֵ֣ת ׀ חֵ֣שֶׁק שְׁלֹמֹ֗ה אֲשֶׁ֤ר חָשַׁק֙ לִבְנ֤וֹת בִּירוּשָׁלַ֙͏ִם֙ וּבַלְּבָנ֔וֹן וּבְכֹ֖ל אֶ֥רֶץ מֶמְשַׁלְתּֽוֹ׃
Translated: and all of Solomon’s garrison towns, chariot towns, and towns for his riders—everything that Solomon set his heart on building in Jerusalem and in the Lebanon, and throughout the territory that he ruled.
Transliteration: veet khׇl-arey hamisekhenvot asher hayu lishelomoh veet arey harekhev veet arey hafarashiym veet cheshek shelomoh asher chashak livenvot viyrushala͏im uvalevanvon uvekhol erets memeshaletvo

Hebrew: כׇּל־הָ֠עָ֠ם הַנּוֹתָ֨ר מִן־הָאֱמֹרִ֜י הַחִתִּ֤י הַפְּרִזִּי֙ הַחִוִּ֣י וְהַיְבוּסִ֔י אֲשֶׁ֛ר לֹא־מִבְּנֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל הֵֽמָּה׃
Translated: All the people that were left of the Amorites, Hittites, Perizzites, Hivites, and Jebusites who were not of the Israelite stock—
