Transliteration: khׇl-haam hanvotar min-haemoriy hachitiy haferiziy hachiviy vehayevusiy asher lo-miveney yisherael hemah

Hebrew: בְּנֵיהֶ֗ם אֲשֶׁ֨ר נֹתְר֤וּ אַֽחֲרֵיהֶם֙ בָּאָ֔רֶץ אֲשֶׁ֧ר לֹא־יָכְל֛וּ בְּנֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל לְהַחֲרִימָ֑ם וַיַּעֲלֵ֤ם שְׁלֹמֹה֙ לְמַס־עֹבֵ֔ד עַ֖ד הַיּ֥וֹם הַזֶּֽה׃
Translated: those of their descendants who remained in the land and whom the Israelites were not able to annihilate—of these Solomon made a slave force, as is still the case.
Transliteration: veneyhem asher noteru achareyhem vaarets asher lo-yakhelu veney yisherael lehachariymam vayaalem shelomoh lemas-oved ad hayyvom hazeh

Hebrew: וּמִבְּנֵי֙ יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל לֹא־נָתַ֥ן שְׁלֹמֹ֖ה עָ֑בֶד כִּי־הֵ֞ם אַנְשֵׁ֣י הַמִּלְחָמָ֗ה וַֽעֲבָדָיו֙ וְשָׂרָ֣יו וְשָׁלִישָׁ֔יו וְשָׂרֵ֥י רִכְבּ֖וֹ וּפָרָשָֽׁיו׃ {ס}
Translated: But he did not reduce any Israelites to slavery; they served, rather, as warriors and as his attendants, officials, and officers, and as commanders of his chariots and riders.
Transliteration: umiveney yisherael lo-natan shelomoh aved khiy-hem aneshey hamilechamah vaavadayv vesharayv veshaliyshayv vesharey rikhevvo ufarashayv {s}

Hebrew: אֵ֣לֶּה ׀ שָׂרֵ֣י הַנִּצָּבִ֗ים אֲשֶׁ֤ר עַל־הַמְּלָאכָה֙ לִשְׁלֹמֹ֔ה חֲמִשִּׁ֖ים וַחֲמֵ֣שׁ מֵא֑וֹת הָרֹדִ֣ים בָּעָ֔ם הָעֹשִׂ֖ים בַּמְּלָאכָֽה׃
Translated: These were the prefects that were in charge of Solomon’s works and were supervising the people engaged in the work, who numbered 550.
Transliteration: eleh sharey hanitsaviym asher al-hamelakhah lishelomoh chamishiym vachamesh mevot harodiym vaam haoshiym vamelakhah

Hebrew: אַ֣ךְ בַּת־פַּרְעֹ֗ה עָֽלְתָה֙ מֵעִ֣יר דָּוִ֔ד אֶל־בֵּיתָ֖הּ אֲשֶׁ֣ר בָּֽנָה־לָ֑הּ אָ֖ז בָּנָ֥ה אֶת־הַמִּלּֽוֹא׃
Translated: As soon as Pharaoh’s daughter went up from the City of David to the palace that he had built for her, he built the Millo.
Transliteration: akhe vat-fareoh aletah meiyr david el-veytah asher vanah-lah az vanah et-hamilvo

Hebrew: וְהֶעֱלָ֣ה שְׁלֹמֹ֡ה שָׁלֹשׁ֩ פְּעָמִ֨ים בַּשָּׁנָ֜ה עֹל֣וֹת וּשְׁלָמִ֗ים עַל־הַמִּזְבֵּ֙חַ֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר בָּנָ֣ה לַֽיהֹוָ֔ה וְהַקְטֵ֣יר אִתּ֔וֹ אֲשֶׁ֖ר לִפְנֵ֣י יְהֹוָ֑ה וְשִׁלַּ֖ם אֶת־הַבָּֽיִת׃
Translated: Solomon used to offer burnt offerings and sacrifices of well-being three times a year on the altar that he had built for G<small>OD</small>, and he used to offer incense on the one that was before G<small>OD</small>. And he kept the House in repair.
Transliteration: veheelah shelomoh shalosh feamiym vashanah olvot ushelamiym al-hamizevecha asher vanah layhovah vehaketeyr itvo asher lifeney yehovah veshilam et-havayiit

Hebrew: וׇאֳנִ֡י עָשָׂה֩ הַמֶּ֨לֶךְ שְׁלֹמֹ֜ה בְּעֶצְיֽוֹן־גֶּ֨בֶר אֲשֶׁ֧ר אֶת־אֵל֛וֹת עַל־שְׂפַ֥ת יַם־ס֖וּף בְּאֶ֥רֶץ אֱדֽוֹם׃
Translated: King Solomon also built a fleet of ships at Ezion-geber, which is near Eloth on the shore of the Sea of Reeds in the land of Edom.
Transliteration: vׇoniy ashah hamelekhe shelomoh veetseyvon-gever asher et-elvot al-shefat yam-suf veerets edvom

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׁלַ֨ח חִירָ֤ם בׇּֽאֳנִי֙ אֶת־עֲבָדָ֔יו אַנְשֵׁ֣י אֳנִיּ֔וֹת יֹדְעֵ֖י הַיָּ֑ם עִ֖ם עַבְדֵ֥י שְׁלֹמֹֽה׃
Translated: Hiram sent servants of his with the fleet, mariners who were experienced on the sea, to serve with Solomon’s men.
Transliteration: vayishelach chiyram vׇoniy et-avadayv aneshey oniyyvot yodeey hayam im avedey shelomoh

Hebrew: וַיָּבֹ֣אוּ אוֹפִ֔ירָה וַיִּקְח֤וּ מִשָּׁם֙ זָהָ֔ב אַרְבַּע־מֵא֥וֹת וְעֶשְׂרִ֖ים כִּכָּ֑ר וַיָּבִ֖אוּ אֶל־הַמֶּ֥לֶךְ שְׁלֹמֹֽה׃ {פ}
Translated: They came to Ophir; there they obtained gold in the amount of four hundred and twenty talents, which they delivered to King Solomon.
Transliteration: vayavou vofiyrah vayikechu misham zahav areva-mevot veesheriym khikhar vayaviu el-hamelekhe shelomoh {f}

Hebrew: וּמַֽלְכַּת־שְׁבָ֗א שֹׁמַ֛עַת אֶת־שֵׁ֥מַע שְׁלֹמֹ֖ה לְשֵׁ֣ם יְהֹוָ֑ה וַתָּבֹ֥א לְנַסֹּת֖וֹ בְּחִידֽוֹת׃
Translated: The queen of Sheba heard of Solomon’s fame, through the name of G<small>OD</small>, and she came to test him with hard questions.
Transliteration: umalekhat-sheva shomaat et-shema shelomoh leshem yehovah vatavo lenasotvo vechiydvot

Hebrew: וַתָּבֹ֣א יְרוּשָׁלַ֗͏ְמָה בְּחַ֘יִל֮ כָּבֵ֣ד מְאֹד֒ גְּ֠מַלִּ֠ים נֹשְׂאִ֨ים בְּשָׂמִ֧ים וְזָהָ֛ב רַב־מְאֹ֖ד וְאֶ֣בֶן יְקָרָ֑ה וַתָּבֹא֙ אֶל־שְׁלֹמֹ֔ה וַתְּדַבֵּ֣ר אֵלָ֔יו אֵ֛ת כׇּל־אֲשֶׁ֥ר הָיָ֖ה עִם־לְבָבָֽהּ׃
Translated: She arrived in Jerusalem with a very large retinue, with camels bearing spices, a great quantity of gold, and precious stones. When she came to Solomon, she asked him all that she had in mind.
Transliteration: vatavo yerushala͏emah vechayiil khaved meod gemaliym nosheiym veshamiym vezahav rav-meod veeven yekarah vatavo el-shelomoh vatedaver elayv et khׇl-asher hayah im-levavah

Hebrew: וַיַּגֶּד־לָ֥הּ שְׁלֹמֹ֖ה אֶת־כׇּל־דְּבָרֶ֑יהָ לֹֽא־הָיָ֤ה דָבָר֙ נֶעְלָ֣ם מִן־הַמֶּ֔לֶךְ אֲשֶׁ֧ר לֹ֦א הִגִּ֖יד לָֽהּ׃
Translated: Solomon had answers for all her questions; there was nothing that the king did not know, [nothing] to which he could not give her an answer.
Transliteration: vayaged-lah shelomoh et-khׇl-devareyha lo-hayah davar neelam min-hamelekhe asher lo higiyd lah

Hebrew: וַתֵּ֙רֶא֙ מַֽלְכַּת־שְׁבָ֔א אֵ֖ת כׇּל־חׇכְמַ֣ת שְׁלֹמֹ֑ה וְהַבַּ֖יִת אֲשֶׁ֥ר בָּנָֽה׃
Translated: When the queen of Sheba observed all of Solomon’s wisdom, and the palace he had built,
Transliteration: vatere malekhat-sheva et khׇl-chׇkhemat shelomoh vehavayiit asher vanah

Hebrew: וּמַאֲכַ֣ל שֻׁלְחָנ֡וֹ וּמוֹשַׁ֣ב עֲבָדָיו֩ וּמַעֲמַ֨ד מְשָׁרְתָ֜ו וּמַלְבֻּֽשֵׁיהֶם֙ וּמַשְׁקָ֔יו וְעֹ֣לָת֔וֹ אֲשֶׁ֥ר יַעֲלֶ֖ה בֵּ֣ית יְהֹוָ֑ה וְלֹא־הָ֥יָה בָ֛הּ ע֖וֹד רֽוּחַ׃
Translated: the fare of his table, the seating of his courtiers, the service and attire of his attendants, and his wine service, and the burnt offerings that he offered at the House of G<small>OD</small>, she was left breathless.
Transliteration: umaakhal shulechanvo umvoshav avadayv umaamad mesharetav umalevusheyhem umashekayv veolatvo asher yaaleh veyt yehovah velo-hayah vah vod rucha

Hebrew: וַתֹּ֙אמֶר֙ אֶל־הַמֶּ֔לֶךְ אֱמֶת֙ הָיָ֣ה הַדָּבָ֔ר אֲשֶׁ֥ר שָׁמַ֖עְתִּי בְּאַרְצִ֑י עַל־דְּבָרֶ֖יךָ וְעַל־חׇכְמָתֶֽךָ׃
Translated: She said to the king, “The report I heard in my own land about you and your wisdom was true.
Transliteration: vatomer el-hamelekhe emet hayah hadavar asher shamaetiy vearetsiy al-devareykha veal-chׇkhematekha

Hebrew: וְלֹא־הֶאֱמַ֣נְתִּי לַדְּבָרִ֗ים עַ֤ד אֲשֶׁר־בָּ֙אתִי֙ וַתִּרְאֶ֣ינָה עֵינַ֔י וְהִנֵּ֥ה לֹֽא־הֻגַּד־לִ֖י הַחֵ֑צִי הוֹסַ֤פְתָּ חׇכְמָה֙ וָט֔וֹב אֶל־הַשְּׁמוּעָ֖ה אֲשֶׁ֥ר שָׁמָֽעְתִּי׃
Translated: But I did not believe the reports until I came and saw with my own eyes that not even the half had been told me; your wisdom and wealth surpass the reports that I heard.
Transliteration: velo-heemanetiy ladevariym ad asher-vatiy vatireeynah eynay vehineh lo-hugad-liy hachetsiy hvosafeta chׇkhemah vatvov el-hashemuah asher shamaetiy

Hebrew: אַשְׁרֵ֣י אֲנָשֶׁ֔יךָ אַשְׁרֵ֖י עֲבָדֶ֣יךָ אֵ֑לֶּה הָעֹמְדִ֤ים לְפָנֶ֙יךָ֙ תָּמִ֔יד הַשֹּׁמְעִ֖ים אֶת־חׇכְמָתֶֽךָ׃
Translated: How fortunate are your people and how fortunate are these your courtiers, who are always in attendance on you and can hear your wisdom!
Transliteration: asherey anasheykha asherey avadeykha eleh haomediym lefaneykha tamiyd hashomeiym et-chׇkhematekha

Hebrew: יְהִ֨י יְהֹוָ֤ה אֱלֹהֶ֙יךָ֙ בָּר֔וּךְ אֲשֶׁר֙ חָפֵ֣ץ בְּךָ֔ לְתִתְּךָ֖ עַל־כִּסֵּ֣א יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל בְּאַהֲבַ֨ת יְהֹוָ֤ה אֶת־יִשְׂרָאֵל֙ לְעֹלָ֔ם וַיְשִֽׂימְךָ֣ לְמֶ֔לֶךְ לַעֲשׂ֥וֹת מִשְׁפָּ֖ט וּצְדָקָֽה׃
Translated: Praised be the E<small>TERNAL</small> your God, who delighted in you and set you on the throne of Israel. It is because of G<small>OD</small>’s everlasting love for Israel that you were made king—to administer justice and righteousness.”
Transliteration: yehiy yehovah eloheykha varukhe asher chafets vekha letitekha al-khise yisherael veahavat yehovah et-yisherael leolam vayeshiymekha lemelekhe laashvot mishefat utsedakah

Hebrew: וַתִּתֵּ֨ן לַמֶּ֜לֶךְ מֵאָ֥ה וְעֶשְׂרִ֣ים ׀ כִּכַּ֣ר זָהָ֗ב וּבְשָׂמִ֛ים הַרְבֵּ֥ה מְאֹ֖ד וְאֶ֣בֶן יְקָרָ֑ה לֹ֣א בָא֩ כַבֹּ֨שֶׂם הַה֥וּא עוֹד֙ לָרֹ֔ב אֲשֶׁר־נָתְנָ֥ה מַֽלְכַּת־שְׁבָ֖א לַמֶּ֥לֶךְ שְׁלֹמֹֽה׃
Translated: She presented the king with one hundred and twenty talents of gold, and a large quantity of spices, and precious stones. Never again did such a vast quantity of spices arrive as that which the queen of Sheba gave to King Solomon.—
Transliteration: vatiten lamelekhe meah veesheriym khikhar zahav uveshamiym hareveh meod veeven yekarah lo va khavoshem hahu vod larov asher-natenah malekhat-sheva lamelekhe shelomoh

Hebrew: וְגַם֙ אֳנִ֣י חִירָ֔ם אֲשֶׁר־נָשָׂ֥א זָהָ֖ב מֵאוֹפִ֑יר הֵבִ֨יא מֵאֹפִ֜יר עֲצֵ֧י אַלְמֻגִּ֛ים הַרְבֵּ֥ה מְאֹ֖ד וְאֶ֥בֶן יְקָרָֽה׃
Translated: Moreover, Hiram’s fleet, which carried gold from Ophir, brought in from Ophir a huge quantity of almug wood and precious stones.
Transliteration: vegam oniy chiyram asher-nasha zahav mevofiyr heviy meofiyr atsey alemugiym hareveh meod veeven yekarah

Hebrew: וַיַּ֣עַשׂ הַ֠מֶּ֠לֶךְ אֶת־עֲצֵ֨י הָאַלְמֻגִּ֜ים מִסְעָ֤ד לְבֵית־יְהֹוָה֙ וּלְבֵ֣ית הַמֶּ֔לֶךְ וְכִנֹּר֥וֹת וּנְבָלִ֖ים לַשָּׁרִ֑ים לֹ֣א בָא־כֵ֞ן עֲצֵ֤י אַלְמֻגִּים֙ וְלֹ֣א נִרְאָ֔ה עַ֖ד הַיּ֥וֹם הַזֶּֽה׃
Translated: The king used the almug wood for decorations in the House of GOD and in the royal palace, and for harps and lyres for the musicians. Such a quantity of almug wood has never arrived or been seen to this day.—
Transliteration: vayaash hamelekhe et-atsey haalemugiym misead leveyt-yehovah uleveyt hamelekhe vekhinorvot unevaliym lashariym lo va-khen atsey alemugiym velo nireah ad hayyvom hazeh

Hebrew: וְהַמֶּ֨לֶךְ שְׁלֹמֹ֜ה נָתַ֣ן לְמַֽלְכַּת־שְׁבָ֗א אֶת־כׇּל־חֶפְצָהּ֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר שָׁאָ֔לָה מִלְּבַד֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר נָֽתַן־לָ֔הּ כְּיַ֖ד הַמֶּ֣לֶךְ שְׁלֹמֹ֑ה וַתֵּ֛פֶן וַתֵּ֥לֶךְ לְאַרְצָ֖הּ הִ֥יא וַעֲבָדֶֽיהָ׃ {פ}
Translated: King Solomon, in turn, gave the queen of Sheba everything she wanted and asked for, in addition to what King Solomon gave her out of his royal bounty. Then she and her attendants left and returned to her own land.
Transliteration: vehamelekhe shelomoh natan lemalekhat-sheva et-khׇl-chefetsah asher shaalah milevad asher natan-lah kheyad hamelekhe shelomoh vatefen vatelekhe learetsah hiy vaavadeyha {f}

Hebrew: וַֽיְהִי֙ מִשְׁקַ֣ל הַזָּהָ֔ב אֲשֶׁר־בָּ֥א לִשְׁלֹמֹ֖ה בְּשָׁנָ֣ה אֶחָ֑ת שֵׁ֥שׁ מֵא֛וֹת שִׁשִּׁ֥ים וָשֵׁ֖שׁ כִּכַּ֥ר זָהָֽב׃
Translated: The weight of the gold that Solomon received every year was 666 talents of gold,
Transliteration: vayehiy mishekal hazahav asher-va lishelomoh veshanah echat shesh mevot shishiym vashesh khikhar zahav

Hebrew: לְבַד֙ מֵאַנְשֵׁ֣י הַתָּרִ֔ים וּמִסְחַ֖ר הָרֹֽכְלִ֑ים וְכׇל־מַלְכֵ֥י הָעֶ֖רֶב וּפַח֥וֹת הָאָֽרֶץ׃
Translated: besides what came from the traders, from the traffic of the merchants, and from all the kings of Arabia and the governors of the regions.
Transliteration: levad meaneshey hatariym umisechar harokheliym vekhׇl-malekhey haerev ufachvot haarets

Hebrew: וַיַּ֨עַשׂ הַמֶּ֧לֶךְ שְׁלֹמֹ֛ה מָאתַ֥יִם צִנָּ֖ה זָהָ֣ב שָׁח֑וּט שֵֽׁשׁ־מֵא֣וֹת זָהָ֔ב יַעֲלֶ֖ה עַל־הַצִּנָּ֥ה הָאֶחָֽת׃
Translated: King Solomon made 200 shields of beaten gold—600 shekels of gold to each shield—
Transliteration: vayaash hamelekhe shelomoh matayiim tsinah zahav shachut shesh-mevot zahav yaaleh al-hatsinah haechat

Hebrew: וּשְׁלֹשׁ־מֵא֤וֹת מָֽגִנִּים֙ זָהָ֣ב שָׁח֔וּט שְׁלֹ֤שֶׁת מָנִים֙ זָהָ֔ב יַעֲלֶ֖ה עַל־הַמָּגֵ֣ן הָאֶחָ֑ת וַיִּתְּנֵ֣ם הַמֶּ֔לֶךְ בֵּ֖ית יַ֥עַר הַלְּבָנֽוֹן׃ {פ}
Translated: and 300 bucklers of beaten gold—three minas of gold to each buckler. The king placed them in the Lebanon Forest House.
Transliteration: ushelosh-mevot maginiym zahav shachut sheloshet maniym zahav yaaleh al-hamagen haechat vayitenem hamelekhe veyt yaar halevanvon {f}

Hebrew: וַיַּ֧עַשׂ הַמֶּ֛לֶךְ כִּסֵּא־שֵׁ֖ן גָּד֑וֹל וַיְצַפֵּ֖הוּ זָהָ֥ב מוּפָֽז׃
Translated: The king also made a large throne of ivory, and he overlaid it with refined gold.
Transliteration: vayaash hamelekhe khise-shen gadvol vayetsafehu zahav mufaz

Hebrew: שֵׁ֧שׁ מַעֲל֣וֹת לַכִּסֵּ֗ה וְרֹאשׁ־עָגֹ֤ל לַכִּסֵּה֙ מֵֽאַחֲרָ֔יו וְיָדֹ֛ת מִזֶּ֥ה וּמִזֶּ֖ה אֶל־מְק֣וֹם הַשָּׁ֑בֶת וּשְׁנַ֣יִם אֲרָי֔וֹת עֹמְדִ֖ים אֵ֥צֶל הַיָּדֽוֹת׃
Translated: Six steps led up to the throne, and the throne had a back with a rounded top, and arms on either side of the seat. Two lions stood beside the arms,
Transliteration: shesh maalvot lakhiseh verosh-agol lakhiseh meacharayv veyadot mizeh umizeh el-mekvom hashavet ushenayiim arayvot omediym etsel hayadvot

Hebrew: וּשְׁנֵ֧ים עָשָׂ֣ר אֲרָיִ֗ים עֹמְדִ֥ים שָׁ֛ם עַל־שֵׁ֥שׁ הַֽמַּעֲל֖וֹת מִזֶּ֣ה וּמִזֶּ֑ה לֹא־נַעֲשָׂ֥ה כֵ֖ן לְכׇל־מַמְלָכֽוֹת׃
Translated: and twelve lions stood on the six steps, six on either side. No such throne was ever made for any other kingdom.
Transliteration: usheneym ashar arayiym omediym sham al-shesh hamaalvot mizeh umizeh lo-naashah khen lekhׇl-mamelakhvot

Hebrew: וְ֠כֹ֠ל כְּלֵ֞י מַשְׁקֵ֨ה הַמֶּ֤לֶךְ שְׁלֹמֹה֙ זָהָ֔ב וְכֹ֗ל כְּלֵ֛י בֵּֽית־יַ֥עַר הַלְּבָנ֖וֹן זָהָ֣ב סָג֑וּר אֵ֣ין כֶּ֗סֶף לֹ֥א נֶחְשָׁ֛ב בִּימֵ֥י שְׁלֹמֹ֖ה לִמְאֽוּמָה׃
Translated: All King Solomon’s drinking cups were of gold, and all the utensils of the Lebanon Forest House were of pure gold: silver did not count for anything in Solomon’s days.
Transliteration: vekhol kheley mashekeh hamelekhe shelomoh zahav vekhol kheley veyt-yaar halevanvon zahav sagur eyn khesef lo necheshav viymey shelomoh limeumah

Hebrew: כִּי֩ אֳנִ֨י תַרְשִׁ֤ישׁ לַמֶּ֙לֶךְ֙ בַּיָּ֔ם עִ֖ם אֳנִ֣י חִירָ֑ם אַחַת֩ לְשָׁלֹ֨שׁ שָׁנִ֜ים תָּב֣וֹא ׀ אֳנִ֣י תַרְשִׁ֗ישׁ נֹֽשְׂאֵת֙ זָהָ֣ב וָכֶ֔סֶף שֶׁנְהַבִּ֥ים וְקֹפִ֖ים וְתֻכִּיִּֽים׃
Translated: For the king had a Tarshish fleet on the sea, along with Hiram’s fleet. Once every three years, the Tarshish fleet came in, bearing gold and silver, ivory, apes, and peacocks.
Transliteration: khiy oniy tareshiysh lamelekhe vayam im oniy chiyram achat leshalosh shaniym tavvo oniy tareshiysh nosheet zahav vakhesef shenehaviym vekofiym vetukhiyiym

Hebrew: וַיִּגְדַּל֙ הַמֶּ֣לֶךְ שְׁלֹמֹ֔ה מִכֹּ֖ל מַלְכֵ֣י הָאָ֑רֶץ לְעֹ֖שֶׁר וּלְחׇכְמָֽה׃
Translated: King Solomon surpassed all the monarchs on earth in wealth and in wisdom.
Transliteration: vayigedal hamelekhe shelomoh mikhol malekhey haarets leosher ulechׇkhemah

Hebrew: וְכׇ֨ל־הָאָ֔רֶץ מְבַקְשִׁ֖ים אֶת־פְּנֵ֣י שְׁלֹמֹ֑ה לִשְׁמֹ֙עַ֙ אֶת־חׇכְמָת֔וֹ אֲשֶׁר־נָתַ֥ן אֱלֹהִ֖ים בְּלִבּֽוֹ׃
Translated: All the world came to pay homage to Solomon and to listen to the wisdom with which God had endowed him;
Transliteration: vekhׇl-haarets mevakeshiym et-feney shelomoh lishemoa et-chׇkhematvo asher-natan Elohim velivvo

Hebrew: וְהֵ֣מָּה מְבִאִ֣ים אִ֣ישׁ מִנְחָת֡וֹ כְּלֵ֣י כֶ֩סֶף֩ וּכְלֵ֨י זָהָ֤ב וּשְׂלָמוֹת֙ וְנֵ֣שֶׁק וּבְשָׂמִ֔ים סוּסִ֖ים וּפְרָדִ֑ים דְּבַר־שָׁנָ֖ה בְּשָׁנָֽה׃ {ס}
Translated: and each one would bring tribute—silver and gold objects, robes, weapons and spices, horses and mules—in the amount due each year.
Transliteration: vehemah meviiym iysh minechatvo kheley khesef ukheley zahav ushelamvot veneshek uveshamiym susiym uferadiym devar-shanah veshanah {s}

Hebrew: וַיֶּאֱסֹ֣ף שְׁלֹמֹה֮ רֶ֣כֶב וּפָרָשִׁים֒ וַֽיְהִי־ל֗וֹ אֶ֤לֶף וְאַרְבַּע־מֵאוֹת֙ רֶ֔כֶב וּשְׁנֵים־עָשָׂ֥ר אֶ֖לֶף פָּרָשִׁ֑ים וַיַּנְחֵם֙ בְּעָרֵ֣י הָרֶ֔כֶב וְעִם־הַמֶּ֖לֶךְ בִּירוּשָׁלָֽ͏ִם׃
Translated: Solomon assembled chariots and horses. He had 1,400 chariots and 12,000 horses, which he stationed in the chariot towns and with the king in Jerusalem.
Transliteration: vayeesof shelomoh rekhev ufarashiym vayehiy-lvo elef veareva-mevot rekhev usheneym-ashar elef farashiym vayanechem vearey harekhev veim-hamelekhe viyrushala͏im

Hebrew: וַיִּתֵּ֨ן הַמֶּ֧לֶךְ אֶת־הַכֶּ֛סֶף בִּירוּשָׁלַ֖͏ִם כָּאֲבָנִ֑ים וְאֵ֣ת הָאֲרָזִ֗ים נָתַ֛ן כַּשִּׁקְמִ֥ים אֲשֶׁר־בַּשְּׁפֵלָ֖ה לָרֹֽב׃
Translated: The king made silver as plentiful in Jerusalem as stones, and cedars as plentiful as sycamores in the Shephelah.
Transliteration: vayiten hamelekhe et-hakhesef viyrushala͏im khaavaniym veet haaraziym natan khashikemiym asher-vashefelah larov

Hebrew: וּמוֹצָ֧א הַסּוּסִ֛ים אֲשֶׁ֥ר לִשְׁלֹמֹ֖ה מִמִּצְרָ֑יִם וּמִקְוֵ֕ה סֹחֲרֵ֣י הַמֶּ֔לֶךְ יִקְח֥וּ מִקְוֵ֖ה בִּמְחִֽיר׃
Translated: Solomon’s horses were procured from Mizraim and Kue. The king’s dealers would buy them from Kue at a fixed price.
Transliteration: umvotsa hasusiym asher lishelomoh mimitserayiim umikeveh socharey hamelekhe yikechu mikeveh vimechiyr

Hebrew: וַֽ֠תַּעֲלֶ֠ה וַתֵּצֵ֨א מֶרְכָּבָ֤ה מִמִּצְרַ֙יִם֙ בְּשֵׁ֣שׁ מֵא֣וֹת כֶּ֔סֶף וְס֖וּס בַּחֲמִשִּׁ֣ים וּמֵאָ֑ה וְ֠כֵ֠ן לְכׇל־מַלְכֵ֧י הַחִתִּ֛ים וּלְמַלְכֵ֥י אֲרָ֖ם בְּיָדָ֥ם יֹצִֽאוּ׃ {פ}
Translated: A chariot imported from Mizraim cost 600 shekels of silver, and a horse 150; these in turn were exported by them to all the kings of the Hittites and the kings of the Arameans.
Transliteration: vataaleh vatetse merekhavah mimitserayiim veshesh mevot khesef vesus vachamishiym umeah vekhen lekhׇl-malekhey hachitiym ulemalekhey aram veyadam yotsiu {f}

Hebrew: וְהַמֶּ֣לֶךְ שְׁלֹמֹ֗ה אָהַ֞ב נָשִׁ֧ים נׇכְרִיּ֛וֹת רַבּ֖וֹת וְאֶת־בַּת־פַּרְעֹ֑ה מוֹאֲבִיּ֤וֹת עַמֳּנִיּוֹת֙ אֲדֹ֣מִיֹּ֔ת צֵֽדְנִיֹּ֖ת חִתִּיֹּֽת׃
Translated: King Solomon loved many foreign women in addition to Pharaoh’s daughter—Moabite, Ammonite, Edomite, Phoenician, and Hittite women,
Transliteration: vehamelekhe shelomoh ahav nashiym nׇkheriyyvot ravvot veet-vat-fareoh mvoaviyyvot amoniyyvot adomiyot tsedeniyot chitiyot

Hebrew: מִן־הַגּוֹיִ֗ם אֲשֶׁ֣ר אָֽמַר־יְהֹוָה֩ אֶל־בְּנֵ֨י יִשְׂרָאֵ֜ל לֹא־תָבֹ֣אוּ בָהֶ֗ם וְהֵם֙ לֹא־יָבֹ֣אוּ בָכֶ֔ם אָכֵן֙ יַטּ֣וּ אֶת־לְבַבְכֶ֔ם אַחֲרֵ֖י אֱלֹהֵיהֶ֑ם בָּהֶ֛ם דָּבַ֥ק שְׁלֹמֹ֖ה לְאַהֲבָֽה׃
Translated: from the nations of which G<small>OD</small> had said to the Israelites, “None of you shall join them and none of them shall join you, lest they turn your heart away to follow their gods.” Such Solomon clung to and loved.
Transliteration: min-hagvoyim asher amar-yehovah el-veney yisherael lo-tavou vahem vehem lo-yavou vakhem akhen yatu et-levavekhem acharey eloheyhem vahem davak shelomoh leahavah

Hebrew: וַיְהִי־ל֣וֹ נָשִׁ֗ים שָׂרוֹת֙ שְׁבַ֣ע מֵא֔וֹת וּפִלַגְשִׁ֖ים שְׁלֹ֣שׁ מֵא֑וֹת וַיַּטּ֥וּ נָשָׁ֖יו אֶת־לִבּֽוֹ׃
Translated: He had seven hundred royal wives and three hundred concubines; and his wives turned his heart away.
Transliteration: vayehiy-lvo nashiym sharvot sheva mevot ufilageshiym shelosh mevot vayatu nashayv et-livvo

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֗י לְעֵת֙ זִקְנַ֣ת שְׁלֹמֹ֔ה נָשָׁיו֙ הִטּ֣וּ אֶת־לְבָב֔וֹ אַחֲרֵ֖י אֱלֹהִ֣ים אֲחֵרִ֑ים וְלֹא־הָיָ֨ה לְבָב֤וֹ שָׁלֵם֙ עִם־יְהֹוָ֣ה אֱלֹהָ֔יו כִּלְבַ֖ב דָּוִ֥יד אָבִֽיו׃
Translated: In his old age, his wives turned away Solomon’s heart after other gods, and he was not as wholeheartedly devoted to the E<small>TERNAL</small> his God as his father David had been.
Transliteration: vayehiy leet zikenat shelomoh nashayv hitu et-levavvo acharey Elohim acheriym velo-hayah levavvo shalem im-yehovah elohayv khilevav daviyd aviyv

Hebrew: וַיֵּ֣לֶךְ שְׁלֹמֹ֔ה אַחֲרֵ֣י עַשְׁתֹּ֔רֶת אֱלֹהֵ֖י צִדֹנִ֑ים וְאַחֲרֵ֣י מִלְכֹּ֔ם שִׁקֻּ֖ץ עַמֹּנִֽים׃
Translated: Solomon followed Ashtoreth the goddess of the Phoenicians, and Milcom the abomination of the Ammonites.
Transliteration: vayelekhe shelomoh acharey ashetoret elohey tsidoniym veacharey milekhom shikuts amoniym

Hebrew: וַיַּ֧עַשׂ שְׁלֹמֹ֛ה הָרַ֖ע בְּעֵינֵ֣י יְהֹוָ֑ה וְלֹ֥א מִלֵּ֛א אַחֲרֵ֥י יְהֹוָ֖ה כְּדָוִ֥ד אָבִֽיו׃ {ס}
Translated: Solomon did what was displeasing to G<small>OD</small> and did not remain loyal to G<small>OD</small> like his father David.
Transliteration: vayaash shelomoh hara veeyney yehovah velo mile acharey yehovah khedavid aviyv {s}

Hebrew: אָז֩ יִבְנֶ֨ה שְׁלֹמֹ֜ה בָּמָ֗ה לִכְמוֹשׁ֙ שִׁקֻּ֣ץ מוֹאָ֔ב בָּהָ֕ר אֲשֶׁ֖ר עַל־פְּנֵ֣י יְרוּשָׁלָ֑͏ִם וּלְמֹ֕לֶךְ שִׁקֻּ֖ץ בְּנֵ֥י עַמּֽוֹן׃
Translated: At that time, Solomon built a shrine for Chemosh the abomination of Moab on the hill near Jerusalem, and one for Molech the abomination of the Ammonites.
Transliteration: az yiveneh shelomoh vamah likhemvosh shikuts mvoav vahar asher al-feney yerushala͏im ulemolekhe shikuts veney amvon

Hebrew: וְכֵ֣ן עָשָׂ֔ה לְכׇל־נָשָׁ֖יו הַנׇּכְרִיּ֑וֹת מַקְטִיר֥וֹת וּֽמְזַבְּח֖וֹת לֵאלֹהֵיהֶֽן׃
Translated: And he did the same for all his foreign wives who offered and sacrificed to their gods.
Transliteration: vekhen ashah lekhׇl-nashayv hanׇkheriyyvot maketiyrvot umezavechvot leloheyhen

Hebrew: וַיִּתְאַנַּ֥ף יְהֹוָ֖ה בִּשְׁלֹמֹ֑ה כִּֽי־נָטָ֣ה לְבָב֗וֹ מֵעִ֤ם יְהֹוָה֙ אֱלֹהֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל הַנִּרְאָ֥ה אֵלָ֖יו פַּעֲמָֽיִם׃
Translated: G<small>OD</small> was angry with Solomon, because his heart turned away from the E<small>TERNAL</small>, the God of Israel, who had appeared to him twice
Transliteration: vayiteanaf yehovah vishelomoh khiy-natah levavvo meim yehovah elohey yisherael hanireah elayv faamayiim

Hebrew: וְצִוָּ֤ה אֵלָיו֙ עַל־הַדָּבָ֣ר הַזֶּ֔ה לְבִ֨לְתִּי־לֶ֔כֶת אַחֲרֵ֖י אֱלֹהִ֣ים אֲחֵרִ֑ים וְלֹ֣א שָׁמַ֔ר אֵ֥ת אֲשֶׁר־צִוָּ֖ה יְהֹוָֽה׃ {פ}
Translated: and had commanded him about this matter, not to follow other gods; he did not obey what G<small>OD</small> had commanded.
Transliteration: vetsivah elayv al-hadavar hazeh leviletiy-lekhet acharey Elohim acheriym velo shamar et asher-tsivah yehovah {f}

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר יְהֹוָ֜ה לִשְׁלֹמֹ֗ה יַ֚עַן אֲשֶׁ֣ר הָֽיְתָה־זֹּ֣את עִמָּ֔ךְ וְלֹ֤א שָׁמַ֙רְתָּ֙ בְּרִיתִ֣י וְחֻקֹּתַ֔י אֲשֶׁ֥ר צִוִּ֖יתִי עָלֶ֑יךָ קָרֹ֨עַ אֶקְרַ֤ע אֶת־הַמַּמְלָכָה֙ מֵעָלֶ֔יךָ וּנְתַתִּ֖יהָ לְעַבְדֶּֽךָ׃
Translated: And G<small>OD</small> said to Solomon, “Because you are guilty of this—you have not kept My covenant and the laws that I enjoined upon you—I will tear the kingdom away from you and give it to one of your servants.
Transliteration: vayomer yehovah lishelomoh yaan asher hayetah-zot imakhe velo shamareta veriytiy vechukotay asher tsiviytiy aleykha karoa ekera et-hamamelakhah mealeykha unetatiyha leavedekha

Hebrew: אַךְ־בְּיָמֶ֙יךָ֙ לֹ֣א אֶעֱשֶׂ֔נָּה לְמַ֖עַן דָּוִ֣ד אָבִ֑יךָ מִיַּ֥ד בִּנְךָ֖ אֶקְרָעֶֽנָּה׃
Translated: But, for the sake of your father David, I will not do it in your lifetime; I will tear it away from your son.
Transliteration: akhe-veyameykha lo eeshenah lemaan david aviykha miyad vinekha ekeraenah

Hebrew: רַ֤ק אֶת־כׇּל־הַמַּמְלָכָה֙ לֹ֣א אֶקְרָ֔ע שֵׁ֥בֶט אֶחָ֖ד אֶתֵּ֣ן לִבְנֶ֑ךָ לְמַ֙עַן֙ דָּוִ֣ד עַבְדִּ֔י וּלְמַ֥עַן יְרוּשָׁלַ֖͏ִם אֲשֶׁ֥ר בָּחָֽרְתִּי׃ {ס}
Translated: However, I will not tear away the whole kingdom; I will give your son one tribe, for the sake of My servant David and for the sake of Jerusalem that I have chosen.”
Transliteration: rak et-khׇl-hamamelakhah lo ekera shevet echad eten livenekha lemaan david avediy ulemaan yerushala͏im asher vacharetiy {s}

Hebrew: וַיָּ֨קֶם יְהֹוָ֤ה שָׂטָן֙ לִשְׁלֹמֹ֔ה אֵ֖ת הֲדַ֣ד הָאֲדֹמִ֑י מִזֶּ֧רַע הַמֶּ֛לֶךְ ה֖וּא בֶּאֱדֽוֹם׃
Translated: So G<small>OD</small> raised up an adversary against Solomon, the Edomite Hadad, who was of the royal family of Edom.
Transliteration: vayakem yehovah shatan lishelomoh et hadad haadomiy mizera hamelekhe hu veedvom

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֗י בִּֽהְי֤וֹת דָּוִד֙ אֶת־אֱד֔וֹם בַּעֲל֗וֹת יוֹאָב֙ שַׂ֣ר הַצָּבָ֔א לְקַבֵּ֖ר אֶת־הַחֲלָלִ֑ים וַיַּ֥ךְ כׇּל־זָכָ֖ר בֶּאֱדֽוֹם׃
Translated: When David was in Edom, Joab the army commander went up to bury the slain, and he killed every male in Edom;
Transliteration: vayehiy viheyvot david et-edvom vaalvot yvoav shar hatsava lekaver et-hachalaliym vayakhe khׇl-zakhar veedvom

Hebrew: כִּ֣י שֵׁ֧שֶׁת חֳדָשִׁ֛ים יָשַׁב־שָׁ֥ם יוֹאָ֖ב וְכׇל־יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל עַד־הִכְרִ֥ית כׇּל־זָכָ֖ר בֶּאֱדֽוֹם׃
Translated: for Joab and all Israel stayed there for six months until he had killed off every male in Edom.
Transliteration: khiy sheshet chodashiym yashav-sham yvoav vekhׇl-yisherael ad-hikheriyt khׇl-zakhar veedvom

Hebrew: וַיִּבְרַ֣ח אֲדַ֡ד הוּא֩ וַאֲנָשִׁ֨ים אֲדֹמִיִּ֜ים מֵעַבְדֵ֥י אָבִ֛יו אִתּ֖וֹ לָב֣וֹא מִצְרָ֑יִם וַהֲדַ֖ד נַ֥עַר קָטָֽן׃
Translated: But Hadad, together with some Edomites, servants of his father, escaped and headed for Egypt; Hadad was then a young boy.
Transliteration: vayiverach adad hu vaanashiym adomiyiym meavedey aviyv itvo lavvo mitserayiim vahadad naar katan

Hebrew: וַיָּקֻ֙מוּ֙ מִמִּדְיָ֔ן וַיָּבֹ֖אוּ פָּארָ֑ן וַיִּקְחוּ֩ אֲנָשִׁ֨ים עִמָּ֜ם מִפָּארָ֗ן וַיָּבֹ֤אוּ מִצְרַ֙יִם֙ אֶל־פַּרְעֹ֣ה מֶלֶךְ־מִצְרַ֔יִם וַיִּתֶּן־ל֣וֹ בַ֗יִת וְלֶ֙חֶם֙ אָ֣מַר ל֔וֹ וְאֶ֖רֶץ נָ֥תַן לֽוֹ׃
Translated: Setting out from Midian, they came to Paran and took others from Paran along with them. Thus they came to Egypt, to Pharaoh king of Egypt, who gave him a house, assigned a food allowance to him, and granted him an estate.
Transliteration: vayakumu mimideyan vayavou faran vayikechu anashiym imam mifaran vayavou mitserayiim el-fareoh melekhe-mitserayiim vayiten-lvo vayiit velechem amar lvo veerets natan lvo

Hebrew: וַיִּמְצָ֨א הֲדַ֥ד חֵ֛ן בְּעֵינֵ֥י פַרְעֹ֖ה מְאֹ֑ד וַיִּתֶּן־ל֤וֹ אִשָּׁה֙ אֶת־אֲח֣וֹת אִשְׁתּ֔וֹ אֲח֖וֹת תַּחְפְּנֵ֥יס הַגְּבִירָֽה׃
Translated: Pharaoh took a great liking to Hadad and gave him his sister-in-law, the sister of Queen Tahpenes, as wife.
Transliteration: vayimetsa hadad chen veeyney fareoh meod vayiten-lvo ishah et-achvot ishetvo achvot tachefeneys hageviyrah

Hebrew: וַתֵּ֨לֶד ל֜וֹ אֲח֣וֹת תַּחְפְּנֵ֗יס אֵ֚ת גְּנֻבַ֣ת בְּנ֔וֹ וַתִּגְמְלֵ֣הוּ תַחְפְּנֵ֔ס בְּת֖וֹךְ בֵּ֣ית פַּרְעֹ֑ה וַיְהִ֤י גְנֻבַת֙ בֵּ֣ית פַּרְעֹ֔ה בְּת֖וֹךְ בְּנֵ֥י פַרְעֹֽה׃
Translated: The sister of Tahpenes bore him a son, Genubath. Tahpenes weaned him in Pharaoh’s palace, and Genubath remained in Pharaoh’s palace among the sons of Pharaoh.
Transliteration: vateled lvo achvot tachefeneys et genuvat venvo vatigemelehu tachefenes vetvokhe veyt fareoh vayehiy genuvat veyt fareoh vetvokhe veney fareoh

Hebrew: וַהֲדַ֞ד שָׁמַ֣ע בְּמִצְרַ֗יִם כִּֽי־שָׁכַ֤ב דָּוִד֙ עִם־אֲבֹתָ֔יו וְכִי־מֵ֖ת יוֹאָ֣ב שַׂר־הַצָּבָ֑א וַיֹּ֤אמֶר הֲדַד֙ אֶל־פַּרְעֹ֔ה שַׁלְּחֵ֖נִי וְאֵלֵ֥ךְ אֶל־אַרְצִֽי׃
Translated: When Hadad heard in Egypt that David had been laid to rest with his ancestors and that Joab the army commander was dead, Hadad said to Pharaoh, “Give me leave to go to my own country.”
Transliteration: vahadad shama vemitserayiim khiy-shakhav david im-avotayv vekhiy-met yvoav shar-hatsava vayomer hadad el-fareoh shalecheniy veelekhe el-aretsiy

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֧אמֶר ל֣וֹ פַרְעֹ֗ה כִּ֠י מָֽה־אַתָּ֤ה חָסֵר֙ עִמִּ֔י וְהִנְּךָ֥ מְבַקֵּ֖שׁ לָלֶ֣כֶת אֶל־אַרְצֶ֑ךָ וַיֹּ֣אמֶֽר <small>׀</small> לֹ֔א כִּ֥י שַׁלֵּ֖חַ תְּשַׁלְּחֵֽנִי׃
Translated: Pharaoh replied, “What do you lack with me, that you want to go to your own country?” But he said, “Nevertheless, give me leave to go.”
Transliteration: vayomer lvo fareoh khiy mah-atah chaser imiy vehinekha mevakesh lalekhet el-aretsekha vayomer <small></small> lo khiy shalecha teshalecheniy

Hebrew: וַיָּ֨קֶם אֱלֹהִ֥ים לוֹ֙ שָׂטָ֔ן אֶת־רְז֖וֹן בֶּן־אֶלְיָדָ֑ע אֲשֶׁ֣ר בָּרַ֗ח מֵאֵ֛ת הֲדַדְעֶ֥זֶר מֶלֶךְ־צוֹבָ֖ה אֲדֹנָֽיו׃
Translated: Another adversary that God raised up against Solomon was Rezon son of Eliada, who had fled from his lord, King Hadadezer of Zobah,
Transliteration: vayakem Elohim lvo shatan et-rezvon ven-eleyada asher varach meet hadadeezer melekhe-tsvovah adonayv

Hebrew: וַיִּקְבֹּ֤ץ עָלָיו֙ אֲנָשִׁ֔ים וַיְהִ֣י שַׂר־גְּד֔וּד בַּהֲרֹ֥ג דָּוִ֖ד אֹתָ֑ם וַיֵּלְכ֤וּ דַמֶּ֙שֶׂק֙ וַיֵּ֣שְׁבוּ בָ֔הּ וַֽיִּמְלְכ֖וּ בְּדַמָּֽשֶׂק׃
Translated: when David was slaughtering them. He gathered some men and became captain over a troop; they went to Damascus and settled there, and they established a kingdom in Damascus.
Transliteration: vayikevots alayv anashiym vayehiy shar-gedud vaharog david otam vayelekhu dameshek vayeshevu vah vayimelekhu vedamashek

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֨י שָׂטָ֤ן לְיִשְׂרָאֵל֙ כׇּל־יְמֵ֣י שְׁלֹמֹ֔ה וְאֶת־הָרָעָ֖ה אֲשֶׁ֣ר הֲדָ֑ד וַיָּ֙קָץ֙ בְּיִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל וַיִּמְלֹ֖ךְ עַל־אֲרָֽם׃ {פ}
Translated: He was an adversary of Israel all the days of Solomon, adding to the trouble [caused by] Hadad; he repudiated [the authority of] Israel and reigned over Aram.
Transliteration: vayehiy shatan leyisherael khׇl-yemey shelomoh veet-haraah asher hadad vayakats veyisherael vayimelokhe al-aram {f}

Hebrew: וְיָרׇבְעָם֩ בֶּן־נְבָ֨ט אֶפְרָתִ֜י מִן־הַצְּרֵדָ֗ה וְשֵׁ֤ם אִמּוֹ֙ צְרוּעָה֙ אִשָּׁ֣ה אַלְמָנָ֔ה עֶ֖בֶד לִשְׁלֹמֹ֑ה וַיָּ֥רֶם יָ֖ד בַּמֶּֽלֶךְ׃
Translated: Jeroboam son of Nebat, an Ephraimite of Zeredah, the son of a widow whose name was Zeruah, was in Solomon’s service; he raised his hand against the king.
Transliteration: veyarׇveam ven-nevat eferatiy min-hatseredah veshem imvo tseruah ishah alemanah eved lishelomoh vayarem yad vamelekhe

Hebrew: וְזֶ֣ה הַדָּבָ֔ר אֲשֶׁר־הֵרִ֥ים יָ֖ד בַּמֶּ֑לֶךְ שְׁלֹמֹה֙ בָּנָ֣ה אֶת־הַמִּלּ֔וֹא סָגַ֕ר אֶת־פֶּ֕רֶץ עִ֖יר דָּוִ֥ד אָבִֽיו׃
Translated: The circumstances under which he raised his hand against the king were as follows: Solomon built the Millo and repaired the breach of the city of his father, David.
Transliteration: vezeh hadavar asher-heriym yad vamelekhe shelomoh vanah et-hamilvo sagar et-ferets iyr david aviyv

Hebrew: וְהָאִ֥ישׁ יָרׇבְעָ֖ם גִּבּ֣וֹר חָ֑יִל וַיַּ֨רְא שְׁלֹמֹ֜ה אֶת־הַנַּ֗עַר כִּֽי־עֹשֵׂ֤ה מְלָאכָה֙ ה֔וּא וַיַּפְקֵ֣ד אֹת֔וֹ לְכׇל־סֵ֖בֶל בֵּ֥ית יוֹסֵֽף׃ {ס}
Translated: This man Jeroboam was very capable, and when Solomon saw that the young man was a productive worker, he appointed him over all the forced labor of the House of Joseph.
Transliteration: vehaiysh yarׇveam givvor chayiil vayare shelomoh et-hanaar khiy-osheh melakhah hu vayafeked otvo lekhׇl-sevel veyt yvosef {s}

Hebrew: וַֽיְהִי֙ בָּעֵ֣ת הַהִ֔יא וְיָרׇבְעָ֖ם יָצָ֣א מִירוּשָׁלָ֑͏ִם וַיִּמְצָ֣א אֹת֡וֹ אֲחִיָּה֩ הַשִּׁילֹנִ֨י הַנָּבִ֜יא בַּדֶּ֗רֶךְ וְה֤וּא מִתְכַּסֶּה֙ בְּשַׂלְמָ֣ה חֲדָשָׁ֔ה וּשְׁנֵיהֶ֥ם לְבַדָּ֖ם בַּשָּׂדֶֽה׃
Translated: During that time Jeroboam went out of Jerusalem and the prophet Ahijah of Shiloh met him on the way. He had put on a new robe; and when the two were alone in the open country,
Transliteration: vayehiy vaet hahiy veyarׇveam yatsa miyrushala͏im vayimetsa otvo achiyah hashiyloniy hanaviy vaderekhe vehu mitekhaseh veshalemah chadashah usheneyhem levadam vashadeh

Hebrew: וַיִּתְפֹּ֣שׂ אֲחִיָּ֔ה בַּשַּׂלְמָ֥ה הַחֲדָשָׁ֖ה אֲשֶׁ֣ר עָלָ֑יו וַיִּ֨קְרָעֶ֔הָ שְׁנֵ֥ים עָשָׂ֖ר קְרָעִֽים׃
Translated: Ahijah took hold of the new robe he was wearing and tore it into twelve pieces.
Transliteration: vayitefosh achiyah vashalemah hachadashah asher alayv vayikeraeha sheneym ashar keraiym

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֙אמֶר֙ לְיָֽרׇבְעָ֔ם קַח־לְךָ֖ עֲשָׂרָ֣ה קְרָעִ֑ים כִּ֣י כֹה֩ אָמַ֨ר יְהֹוָ֜ה אֱלֹהֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֗ל הִנְנִ֨י קֹרֵ֤עַ אֶת־הַמַּמְלָכָה֙ מִיַּ֣ד שְׁלֹמֹ֔ה וְנָתַתִּ֣י לְךָ֔ אֵ֖ת עֲשָׂרָ֥ה הַשְּׁבָטִֽים׃
Translated: “Take ten pieces,” he said to Jeroboam. “For thus said the E<small>TERNAL</small>, the God of Israel: I am about to tear the kingdom out of Solomon’s hands, and I will give you ten tribes.
Transliteration: vayomer leyarׇveam kach-lekha asharah keraiym khiy khoh amar yehovah elohey yisherael hineniy korea et-hamamelakhah miyad shelomoh venatatiy lekha et asharah hashevatiym

Hebrew: וְהַשֵּׁ֥בֶט הָאֶחָ֖ד יִֽהְיֶה־לּ֑וֹ לְמַ֣עַן ׀ עַבְדִּ֣י דָוִ֗ד וּלְמַ֙עַן֙ יְר֣וּשָׁלַ֔͏ִם הָעִיר֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר בָּחַ֣רְתִּי בָ֔הּ מִכֹּ֖ל שִׁבְטֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated: But one tribe shall remain his—for the sake of My servant David and for the sake of Jerusalem, the city that I have chosen out of all the tribes of Israel.
Transliteration: vehashevet haechad yiheyeh-lvo lemaan avediy david ulemaan yerushala͏im haiyr asher vacharetiy vah mikhol shivetey yisherael

Hebrew: יַ֣עַן ׀ אֲשֶׁ֣ר עֲזָב֗וּנִי וַיִּֽשְׁתַּחֲווּ֮ לְעַשְׁתֹּ֘רֶת֮ אֱלֹהֵ֣י צִדֹנִין֒ לִכְמוֹשׁ֙ אֱלֹהֵ֣י מוֹאָ֔ב וּלְמִלְכֹּ֖ם אֱלֹהֵ֣י בְנֵֽי־עַמּ֑וֹן וְלֹא־הָלְכ֣וּ בִדְרָכַ֗י לַעֲשׂ֨וֹת הַיָּשָׁ֧ר בְּעֵינַ֛י וְחֻקֹּתַ֥י וּמִשְׁפָּטַ֖י כְּדָוִ֥ד אָבִֽיו׃
Translated: For they have forsaken Me; they have worshiped Ashtoreth the goddess of the Phoenicians, Chemosh the god of Moab, and Milcom the god of the Ammonites; they have not walked in My ways, or done what is pleasing to Me, or [kept] My laws and rules, as his father David did.
Transliteration: yaan asher azavuniy vayishetachavu leashetoret elohey tsidoniyn likhemvosh elohey mvoav ulemilekhom elohey veney-amvon velo-halekhu viderakhay laashvot hayashar veeynay vechukotay umishefatay khedavid aviyv

Hebrew: וְלֹא־אֶקַּ֥ח אֶת־כׇּל־הַמַּמְלָכָ֖ה מִיָּד֑וֹ כִּ֣י ׀ נָשִׂ֣יא אֲשִׁתֶ֗נּוּ כֹּ֚ל יְמֵ֣י חַיָּ֔יו לְמַ֨עַן דָּוִ֤ד עַבְדִּי֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר בָּחַ֣רְתִּי אֹת֔וֹ אֲשֶׁ֥ר שָׁמַ֖ר מִצְוֺתַ֥י וְחֻקֹּתָֽי׃
Translated: However, I will not take the entire kingdom away from him, but will keep him as ruler as long as he lives for the sake of My servant David whom I chose, and who kept My commandments and My laws.
Transliteration: velo-ekach et-khׇl-hamamelakhah miyadvo khiy nashiy ashitenu khol yemey chayayv lemaan david avediy asher vacharetiy otvo asher shamar mitsevotay vechukotay

Hebrew: וְלָקַחְתִּ֥י הַמְּלוּכָ֖ה מִיַּ֣ד בְּנ֑וֹ וּנְתַתִּ֣יהָ לְּךָ֔ אֵ֖ת עֲשֶׂ֥רֶת הַשְּׁבָטִֽים׃
Translated: But I will take the kingship out of the hands of his son and give it to you—the ten tribes.
Transliteration: velakachetiy hamelukhah miyad venvo unetatiyha lekha et asheret hashevatiym

Hebrew: וְלִבְנ֖וֹ אֶתֵּ֣ן שֵֽׁבֶט־אֶחָ֑ד לְמַ֣עַן הֱיֽוֹת־נִ֣יר לְדָֽוִיד־עַ֠בְדִּ֠י כׇּֽל־הַיָּמִ֤ים <small>׀</small> לְפָנַי֙ בִּיר֣וּשָׁלַ֔͏ִם הָעִיר֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר בָּחַ֣רְתִּי לִ֔י לָשׂ֥וּם שְׁמִ֖י שָֽׁם׃
Translated: To his son I will give one tribe, so that there may be a lamp for My servant David forever before Me in Jerusalem—the city where I have chosen to establish My name.
Transliteration: velivenvo eten shevet-echad lemaan heyvot-niyr ledaviyd-avediy khׇl-hayamiym <small></small> lefanay viyrushala͏im haiyr asher vacharetiy liy lashum shemiy sham

Hebrew: וְאֹתְךָ֣ אֶקַּ֔ח וּמָ֣לַכְתָּ֔ בְּכֹ֥ל אֲשֶׁר־תְּאַוֶּ֖ה נַפְשֶׁ֑ךָ וְהָיִ֥יתָ מֶּ֖לֶךְ עַל־יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated: But you have been chosen by Me; reign wherever you wish, and you shall be king over Israel.
Transliteration: veotekha ekach umalakheta vekhol asher-teaveh nafeshekha vehayiyta melekhe al-yisherael

Hebrew: וְהָיָ֗ה אִם־תִּשְׁמַע֮ אֶת־כׇּל־אֲשֶׁ֣ר אֲצַוֶּ֒ךָ֒ וְהָלַכְתָּ֣ בִדְרָכַ֗י וְעָשִׂ֨יתָ הַיָּשָׁ֤ר בְּעֵינַי֙ לִשְׁמ֤וֹר חֻקּוֹתַי֙ וּמִצְוֺתַ֔י כַּאֲשֶׁ֥ר עָשָׂ֖ה דָּוִ֣ד עַבְדִּ֑י וְהָיִ֣יתִי עִמָּ֗ךְ וּבָנִ֨יתִֽי לְךָ֤ בַיִת־נֶֽאֱמָן֙ כַּאֲשֶׁ֣ר בָּנִ֣יתִי לְדָוִ֔ד וְנָתַתִּ֥י לְךָ֖ אֶת־יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated: If you heed all that I command you, and walk in My ways, and do what is right in My sight, keeping My laws and commandments as My servant David did, then I will be with you and I will build for you a lasting dynasty as I did for David. I hereby give Israel to you;
Transliteration: vehayah im-tishema et-khׇl-asher atsavekha vehalakheta viderakhay veashiyta hayashar veeynay lishemvor chukvotay umitsevotay khaasher ashah david avediy vehayiytiy imakhe uvaniytiy lekha vayit-neeman khaasher vaniytiy ledavid venatatiy lekha et-yisherael

Hebrew: וַאעַנֶּ֛ה אֶת־זֶ֥רַע דָּוִ֖ד לְמַ֣עַן זֹ֑את אַ֖ךְ לֹ֥א כׇל־הַיָּמִֽים׃ {ס}
Translated: and I will chastise David’s descendants for that [sin], though not forever.”
Transliteration: vaaneh et-zera david lemaan zot akhe lo khׇl-hayamiym {s}

Hebrew: וַיְבַקֵּ֥שׁ שְׁלֹמֹ֖ה לְהָמִ֣ית אֶת־יָרׇבְעָ֑ם וַיָּ֣קׇם יָרׇבְעָ֗ם וַיִּבְרַ֤ח מִצְרַ֙יִם֙ אֶל־שִׁישַׁ֣ק מֶֽלֶךְ־מִצְרַ֔יִם וַיְהִ֥י בְמִצְרַ֖יִם עַד־מ֥וֹת שְׁלֹמֹֽה׃ {ס}
Translated: Solomon sought to put Jeroboam to death, but Jeroboam promptly fled to King Shishak of Egypt; and he remained in Egypt till the death of Solomon.
Transliteration: vayevakesh shelomoh lehamiyt et-yarׇveam vayakׇm yarׇveam vayiverach mitserayiim el-shiyshak melekhe-mitserayiim vayehiy vemitserayiim ad-mvot shelomoh {s}

Hebrew: וְיֶ֨תֶר דִּבְרֵ֧י שְׁלֹמֹ֛ה וְכׇל־אֲשֶׁ֥ר עָשָׂ֖ה וְחׇכְמָת֑וֹ הֲלוֹא־הֵ֣ם כְּתֻבִ֔ים עַל־סֵ֖פֶר דִּבְרֵ֥י שְׁלֹמֹֽה׃
Translated: The other events of Solomon’s reign, and all his actions and his wisdom, are recorded in the book of the Annals of Solomon.
Transliteration: veyeter diverey shelomoh vekhׇl-asher ashah vechׇkhematvo halvo-hem khetuviym al-sefer diverey shelomoh

Hebrew: וְהַיָּמִ֗ים אֲשֶׁר֩ מָלַ֨ךְ שְׁלֹמֹ֤ה בִירוּשָׁלַ֙͏ִם֙ עַל־כׇּל־יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל אַרְבָּעִ֖ים שָׁנָֽה׃
Translated: The length of Solomon’s reign in Jerusalem, over all Israel, was forty years.
Transliteration: vehayamiym asher malakhe shelomoh viyrushala͏im al-khׇl-yisherael arevaiym shanah

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׁכַּ֤ב שְׁלֹמֹה֙ עִם־אֲבֹתָ֔יו וַיִּ֨קָּבֵ֔ר בְּעִ֖יר דָּוִ֣ד אָבִ֑יו וַיִּמְלֹ֛ךְ רְחַבְעָ֥ם בְּנ֖וֹ תַּחְתָּֽיו׃ {ס}
Translated: Solomon rested with his ancestors and was buried in the city of his father David; and his son Rehoboam succeeded him as king.
Transliteration: vayishekhav shelomoh im-avotayv vayikaver veiyr david aviyv vayimelokhe rechaveam venvo tachetayv {s}

Hebrew: וַיֵּ֥לֶךְ רְחַבְעָ֖ם שְׁכֶ֑ם כִּ֥י שְׁכֶ֛ם בָּ֥א כׇל־יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל לְהַמְלִ֥יךְ אֹתֽוֹ׃
Translated: Rehoboam went to Shechem, for all Israel had come to Shechem to acclaim him as king.
Transliteration: vayelekhe rechaveam shekhem khiy shekhem va khׇl-yisherael lehameliykhe otvo

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֞י כִּשְׁמֹ֣עַ ׀ יָרׇבְעָ֣ם בֶּן־נְבָ֗ט וְהוּא֙ עוֹדֶ֣נּוּ בְמִצְרַ֔יִם אֲשֶׁ֣ר בָּרַ֔ח מִפְּנֵ֖י הַמֶּ֣לֶךְ שְׁלֹמֹ֑ה וַיֵּ֥שֶׁב יָרׇבְעָ֖ם בְּמִצְרָֽיִם׃
Translated: Jeroboam son of Nebat learned of it while he was still in Egypt; for Jeroboam had fled from King Solomon, and had settled in Egypt.
Transliteration: vayehiy khishemoa yarׇveam ven-nevat vehu vodenu vemitserayiim asher varach mifeney hamelekhe shelomoh vayeshev yarׇveam vemitserayiim

Hebrew: וַֽיִּשְׁלְחוּ֙ וַיִּקְרְאוּ־ל֔וֹ (ויבאו) [וַיָּבֹ֥א] יָרׇבְעָ֖ם וְכׇל־קְהַ֣ל יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל וַֽיְדַבְּר֔וּ אֶל־רְחַבְעָ֖ם לֵאמֹֽר׃
Translated: They sent for him; and Jeroboam and all the assembly of Israel came and spoke to Rehoboam as follows:
Transliteration: vayishelechu vayikereu-lvo (vyvv) [vayavo] yarׇveam vekhׇl-kehal yisherael vayedaveru el-rechaveam lemor

Hebrew: אָבִ֖יךָ הִקְשָׁ֣ה אֶת־עֻלֵּ֑נוּ וְאַתָּ֡ה עַתָּ֣ה הָקֵל֩ מֵעֲבֹדַ֨ת אָבִ֜יךָ הַקָּשָׁ֗ה וּמֵעֻלּ֧וֹ הַכָּבֵ֛ד אֲשֶׁר־נָתַ֥ן עָלֵ֖ינוּ וְנַעַבְדֶֽךָּ׃
Translated: “Your father made our yoke heavy. Now lighten the harsh labor and the heavy yoke that your father laid on us, and we will serve you.”
Transliteration: aviykha hikeshah et-ulenu veatah atah hakel meavodat aviykha hakashah umeulvo hakhaved asher-natan aleynu venaavedekha

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר אֲלֵיהֶ֗ם לְכוּ־עֹ֛ד שְׁלֹשָׁ֥ה יָמִ֖ים וְשׁ֣וּבוּ אֵלָ֑י וַיֵּלְכ֖וּ הָעָֽם׃
Translated: He answered them, “Go away for three days and then come back to me.” So the people went away.
Transliteration: vayomer aleyhem lekhu-od sheloshah yamiym veshuvu elay vayelekhu haam

Hebrew: וַיִּוָּעַ֞ץ הַמֶּ֣לֶךְ רְחַבְעָ֗ם אֶת־הַזְּקֵנִים֙ אֲשֶׁר־הָי֣וּ עֹמְדִ֗ים אֶת־פְּנֵי֙ שְׁלֹמֹ֣ה אָבִ֔יו בִּֽהְיֹת֥וֹ חַ֖י לֵאמֹ֑ר אֵ֚יךְ אַתֶּ֣ם נוֹעָצִ֔ים לְהָשִׁ֥יב אֶת־הָעָם־הַזֶּ֖ה דָּבָֽר׃
Translated: King Rehoboam took counsel with the elders who had served his father Solomon during his lifetime. He said, “What answer do you advise [me] to give to this people?”
Transliteration: vayivaats hamelekhe rechaveam et-hazekeniym asher-hayu omediym et-feney shelomoh aviyv viheyotvo chay lemor eykhe atem nvoatsiym lehashiyv et-haam-hazeh davar

Hebrew: (וידבר) [וַיְדַבְּר֨וּ] אֵלָ֜יו לֵאמֹ֗ר אִם־הַ֠יּ֠וֹם תִּֽהְיֶה־עֶ֜בֶד לָעָ֤ם הַזֶּה֙ וַעֲבַדְתָּ֔ם וַעֲנִיתָ֕ם וְדִבַּרְתָּ֥ אֲלֵיהֶ֖ם דְּבָרִ֣ים טוֹבִ֑ים וְהָי֥וּ לְךָ֛ עֲבָדִ֖ים כׇּל־הַיָּמִֽים׃
Translated: They answered him, “If you will be a servant to those people today and serve them, and if you respond to them with kind words, they will be your servants always.”
Transliteration: (vydvr) [vayedaveru] elayv lemor im-hayyvom tiheyeh-eved laam hazeh vaavadetam vaaniytam vedivareta aleyhem devariym tvoviym vehayu lekha avadiym khׇl-hayamiym

Hebrew: וַֽיַּעֲזֹ֛ב אֶת־עֲצַ֥ת הַזְּקֵנִ֖ים אֲשֶׁ֣ר יְעָצֻ֑הוּ וַיִּוָּעַ֗ץ אֶת־הַיְלָדִים֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר גָּדְל֣וּ אִתּ֔וֹ אֲשֶׁ֥ר הָעֹמְדִ֖ים לְפָנָֽיו׃
Translated: But he ignored the advice that the elders gave him, and took counsel with the young men who had grown up with him and were serving him.
Transliteration: vayaazov et-atsat hazekeniym asher yeatsuhu vayivaats et-hayeladiym asher gadelu itvo asher haomediym lefanayv

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר אֲלֵיהֶ֗ם מָ֚ה אַתֶּ֣ם נֽוֹעָצִ֔ים וְנָשִׁ֥יב דָּבָ֖ר אֶת־הָעָ֣ם הַזֶּ֑ה אֲשֶׁ֨ר דִּבְּר֤וּ אֵלַי֙ לֵאמֹ֔ר הָקֵל֙ מִן־הָעֹ֔ל אֲשֶׁר־נָתַ֥ן אָבִ֖יךָ עָלֵֽינוּ׃
Translated: “What,” he asked, “do you advise that we reply to the people who said to me, ‘Lighten the yoke that your father placed upon us’?”
Transliteration: vayomer aleyhem mah atem nvoatsiym venashiyv davar et-haam hazeh asher diveru elay lemor hakel min-haol asher-natan aviykha aleynu

Hebrew: וַיְדַבְּר֣וּ אֵלָ֗יו הַיְלָדִים֙ אֲשֶׁ֨ר גָּדְל֣וּ אִתּוֹ֮ לֵאמֹר֒ כֹּה־תֹאמַ֣ר לָעָ֣ם הַזֶּ֡ה אֲשֶׁר֩ דִּבְּר֨וּ אֵלֶ֜יךָ לֵאמֹ֗ר אָבִ֙יךָ֙ הִכְבִּ֣יד אֶת־עֻלֵּ֔נוּ וְאַתָּ֖ה הָקֵ֣ל מֵעָלֵ֑ינוּ כֹּ֚ה תְּדַבֵּ֣ר אֲלֵיהֶ֔ם קׇטׇנִּ֥י עָבָ֖ה מִמׇּתְנֵ֥י אָבִֽי׃
Translated: And the young men who had grown up with him answered, “Speak thus to the people who said to you, ‘Your father made our yoke heavy, now you make it lighter for us.’ Say to them, ‘My little finger is thicker than my father’s loins.
Transliteration: vayedaveru elayv hayeladiym asher gadelu itvo lemor khoh-tomar laam hazeh asher diveru eleykha lemor aviykha hikheviyd et-ulenu veatah hakel mealeynu khoh tedaver aleyhem kׇtׇniy avah mimׇteney aviy

Hebrew: וְעַתָּ֗ה אָבִי֙ הֶעְמִ֤יס עֲלֵיכֶם֙ עֹ֣ל כָּבֵ֔ד וַאֲנִ֖י אוֹסִ֣יף עַֽל־עֻלְּכֶ֑ם אָבִ֗י יִסַּ֤ר אֶתְכֶם֙ בַּשּׁוֹטִ֔ים וַאֲנִ֕י אֲיַסֵּ֥ר אֶתְכֶ֖ם בָּעַקְרַבִּֽים׃
Translated: My father imposed a heavy yoke on you, and I will add to your yoke; my father flogged you with whips, but I will flog you with scorpions.’”
Transliteration: veatah aviy heemiys aleykhem ol khaved vaaniy vosiyf al-ulekhem aviy yisar etekhem vashvotiym vaaniy ayaser etekhem vaakeraviym

Hebrew: וַיָּב֨וֹ יָרׇבְעָ֧ם וְכׇל־הָעָ֛ם אֶל־רְחַבְעָ֖ם בַּיּ֣וֹם הַשְּׁלִישִׁ֑י כַּאֲשֶׁ֨ר דִּבֶּ֤ר הַמֶּ֙לֶךְ֙ לֵאמֹ֔ר שׁ֥וּבוּ אֵלַ֖י בַּיּ֥וֹם הַשְּׁלִישִֽׁי׃
Translated: Jeroboam and all the people came to Rehoboam on the third day, since the king had told them: “Come back on the third day.”
Transliteration: vayavvo yarׇveam vekhׇl-haam el-rechaveam vayyvom hasheliyshiy khaasher diver hamelekhe lemor shuvu elay vayyvom hasheliyshiy

Hebrew: וַיַּ֧עַן הַמֶּ֛לֶךְ אֶת־הָעָ֖ם קָשָׁ֑ה וַֽיַּעֲזֹ֛ב אֶת־עֲצַ֥ת הַזְּקֵנִ֖ים אֲשֶׁ֥ר יְעָצֻֽהוּ׃
Translated: The king answered the people harshly, ignoring the advice that the elders had given him.
Transliteration: vayaan hamelekhe et-haam kashah vayaazov et-atsat hazekeniym asher yeatsuhu

Hebrew: וַיְדַבֵּ֣ר אֲלֵיהֶ֗ם כַּעֲצַ֤ת הַיְלָדִים֙ לֵאמֹ֔ר אָבִי֙ הִכְבִּ֣יד אֶֽת־עֻלְּכֶ֔ם וַאֲנִ֖י אֹסִ֣יף עַֽל־עֻלְּכֶ֑ם אָבִ֗י יִסַּ֤ר אֶתְכֶם֙ בַּשּׁוֹטִ֔ים וַאֲנִ֕י אֲיַסֵּ֥ר אֶתְכֶ֖ם בָּעַקְרַבִּֽים׃
Translated: He spoke to them in accordance with the advice of the young men, and said, “My father made your yoke heavy, but I will add to your yoke; my father flogged you with whips, but I will flog you with scorpions.”
Transliteration: vayedaver aleyhem khaatsat hayeladiym lemor aviy hikheviyd et-ulekhem vaaniy osiyf al-ulekhem aviy yisar etekhem vashvotiym vaaniy ayaser etekhem vaakeraviym

Hebrew: וְלֹא־שָׁמַ֥ע הַמֶּ֖לֶךְ אֶל־הָעָ֑ם כִּֽי־הָיְתָ֤ה סִבָּה֙ מֵעִ֣ם יְהֹוָ֔ה לְמַ֜עַן הָקִ֣ים אֶת־דְּבָר֗וֹ אֲשֶׁ֨ר דִּבֶּ֤ר יְהֹוָה֙ בְּיַד֙ אֲחִיָּ֣ה הַשִּֽׁילֹנִ֔י אֶל־יָרׇבְעָ֖ם בֶּן־נְבָֽט׃
Translated: (The king did not listen to the people; for G<small>OD</small> had brought it about in order to fulfill the promise that G<small>OD</small> had made through Ahijah the Shilonite to Jeroboam son of Nebat.)
Transliteration: velo-shama hamelekhe el-haam khiy-hayetah sivah meim yehovah lemaan hakiym et-devarvo asher diver yehovah veyad achiyah hashiyloniy el-yarׇveam ven-nevat

Hebrew: וַיַּ֣רְא כׇּל־יִשְׂרָאֵ֗ל כִּ֠י לֹא־שָׁמַ֣ע הַמֶּ֘לֶךְ֮ אֲלֵהֶם֒ וַיָּשִׁ֣בוּ הָעָ֣ם אֶת־הַמֶּ֣לֶךְ <small>׀</small> דָּבָ֣ר <small>׀</small> לֵאמֹ֡ר מַה־לָּ֩נוּ֩ חֵ֨לֶק בְּדָוִ֜ד וְלֹא־נַחֲלָ֣ה בְּבֶן־יִשַׁ֗י לְאֹהָלֶ֙יךָ֙ יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל עַתָּ֕ה רְאֵ֥ה בֵיתְךָ֖ דָּוִ֑ד וַיֵּ֥לֶךְ יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל לְאֹהָלָֽיו׃
Translated:
When all Israel saw that the king had not listened to them, the people answered the king:
“We have no portion in David,
No share in Jesse’s son!
To your tents, O Israel!
Now look to your own House, O David.”
So the Israelites returned to their homes.
Transliteration: vayare khׇl-yisherael khiy lo-shama hamelekhe alehem vayashivu haam et-hamelekhe <small></small> davar <small></small> lemor mah-lanu chelek vedavid velo-nachalah veven-yishay leohaleykha yisherael atah reeh veytekha david vayelekhe yisherael leohalayv

Hebrew: וּבְנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל הַיֹּשְׁבִ֖ים בְּעָרֵ֣י יְהוּדָ֑ה וַיִּמְלֹ֥ךְ עֲלֵיהֶ֖ם רְחַבְעָֽם׃ {פ}
Translated: But Rehoboam continued to reign over the Israelites who lived in the towns of Judah.
Transliteration: uveney yisherael hayosheviym vearey yehudah vayimelokhe aleyhem rechaveam {f}

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׁלַ֞ח הַמֶּ֣לֶךְ רְחַבְעָ֗ם אֶת־אֲדֹרָם֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר עַל־הַמַּ֔ס וַיִּרְגְּמ֨וּ כׇל־יִשְׂרָאֵ֥ל בּ֛וֹ אֶ֖בֶן וַיָּמֹ֑ת וְהַמֶּ֣לֶךְ רְחַבְעָ֗ם הִתְאַמֵּץ֙ לַעֲל֣וֹת בַּמֶּרְכָּבָ֔ה לָנ֖וּס יְרֽוּשָׁלָֽ͏ִם׃
Translated: King Rehoboam sent Adoram, who was in charge of the forced labor, but all Israel pelted him to death with stones. Thereupon King Rehoboam hurriedly mounted his chariot and fled to Jerusalem.
Transliteration: vayishelach hamelekhe rechaveam et-adoram asher al-hamas vayiregemu khׇl-yisherael vvo even vayamot vehamelekhe rechaveam hiteamets laalvot vamerekhavah lanus yerushala͏im

Hebrew: וַיִּפְשְׁע֤וּ יִשְׂרָאֵל֙ בְּבֵ֣ית דָּוִ֔ד עַ֖ד הַיּ֥וֹם הַזֶּֽה׃ {ס}
Translated: Thus Israel revolted against the House of David, as is still the case.
Transliteration: vayifesheu yisherael veveyt david ad hayyvom hazeh {s}

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֞י כִּשְׁמֹ֤עַ כׇּל־יִשְׂרָאֵל֙ כִּֽי־שָׁ֣ב יָרׇבְעָ֔ם וַֽיִּשְׁלְח֗וּ וַיִּקְרְא֤וּ אֹתוֹ֙ אֶל־הָ֣עֵדָ֔ה וַיַּמְלִ֥יכוּ אֹת֖וֹ עַל־כׇּל־יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל לֹ֤א הָיָה֙ אַחֲרֵ֣י בֵית־דָּוִ֔ד זוּלָתִ֥י שֵׁבֶט־יְהוּדָ֖ה לְבַדּֽוֹ׃
Translated: When all Israel heard that Jeroboam had returned, they sent messengers and summoned him to the assembly and made him king over all Israel. Only the tribe of Judah remained loyal to the House of David.
Transliteration: vayehiy khishemoa khׇl-yisherael khiy-shav yarׇveam vayishelechu vayikereu otvo el-haedah vayameliykhu otvo al-khׇl-yisherael lo hayah acharey veyt-david zulatiy shevet-yehudah levadvo

Hebrew: (ויבאו) [וַיָּבֹ֣א] רְחַבְעָם֮ יְרוּשָׁלַ֒͏ִם֒ וַיַּקְהֵל֩ אֶת־כׇּל־בֵּ֨ית יְהוּדָ֜ה וְאֶת־שֵׁ֣בֶט בִּנְיָמִ֗ן מֵאָ֨ה וּשְׁמֹנִ֥ים אֶ֛לֶף בָּח֖וּר עֹשֵׂ֣ה מִלְחָמָ֑ה לְהִלָּחֵם֙ עִם־בֵּ֣ית יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל לְהָשִׁיב֙ אֶת־הַמְּלוּכָ֔ה לִרְחַבְעָ֖ם בֶּן־שְׁלֹמֹֽה׃ {פ}
Translated: On his return to Jerusalem, Rehoboam mustered all the House of Judah and the tribe of Benjamin, 180,000 of the best warriors, to fight against the House of Israel, in order to restore the kingship to Rehoboam son of Solomon.
Transliteration: (vyvv) [vayavo] rechaveam yerushala͏im vayakehel et-khׇl-veyt yehudah veet-shevet vineyamin meah ushemoniym elef vachur osheh milechamah lehilachem im-veyt yisherael lehashiyv et-hamelukhah lirechaveam ven-shelomoh {f}

Hebrew: וַֽיְהִי֙ דְּבַ֣ר הָאֱלֹהִ֔ים אֶל־שְׁמַֽעְיָ֥ה אִישׁ־הָאֱלֹהִ֖ים לֵאמֹֽר׃
Translated: But the word of God came to Shemaiah, the agent of God:
Transliteration: vayehiy devar haElohim el-shemaeyah iysh-haElohim lemor

Hebrew: אֱמֹ֗ר אֶל־רְחַבְעָ֤ם בֶּן־שְׁלֹמֹה֙ מֶ֣לֶךְ יְהוּדָ֔ה וְאֶל־כׇּל־בֵּ֥ית יְהוּדָ֖ה וּבִנְיָמִ֑ין וְיֶ֥תֶר הָעָ֖ם לֵאמֹֽר׃
Translated: “Say to King Rehoboam son of Solomon of Judah, and to all the House of Judah and Benjamin and the rest of the people:
Transliteration: emor el-rechaveam ven-shelomoh melekhe yehudah veel-khׇl-veyt yehudah uvineyamiyn veyeter haam lemor

Hebrew: כֹּ֣ה אָמַ֣ר יְהֹוָ֡ה לֹא־תַעֲלוּ֩ וְלֹא־תִלָּ֨חֲמ֜וּן עִם־אֲחֵיכֶ֣ם בְּנֵֽי־יִשְׂרָאֵ֗ל שׁ֚וּבוּ אִ֣ישׁ לְבֵית֔וֹ כִּ֧י מֵאִתִּ֛י נִֽהְיָ֖ה הַדָּבָ֣ר הַזֶּ֑ה וַֽיִּשְׁמְעוּ֙ אֶת־דְּבַ֣ר יְהֹוָ֔ה וַיָּשֻׁ֥בוּ לָלֶ֖כֶת כִּדְבַ֥ר יְהֹוָֽה׃ {ס}
Translated: Thus said G<small>OD</small>: You shall not set out to make war on your kindred the Israelites. Return to your homes, for this thing has been brought about by Me.” They heeded the word of G<small>OD</small> and turned back, in accordance with the word of G<small>OD</small>.
Transliteration: khoh amar yehovah lo-taalu velo-tilachamun im-acheykhem veney-yisherael shuvu iysh leveytvo khiy meitiy niheyah hadavar hazeh vayishemeu et-devar yehovah vayashuvu lalekhet khidevar yehovah {s}

Hebrew: וַיִּ֨בֶן יָרׇבְעָ֧ם אֶת־שְׁכֶ֛ם בְּהַ֥ר אֶפְרַ֖יִם וַיֵּ֣שֶׁב בָּ֑הּ וַיֵּצֵ֣א מִשָּׁ֔ם וַיִּ֖בֶן אֶת־פְּנוּאֵֽל׃
Translated: Jeroboam fortified Shechem in the hill country of Ephraim and resided there; he moved out from there and fortified Penuel.
Transliteration: vayiven yarׇveam et-shekhem vehar eferayiim vayeshev vah vayetse misham vayiven et-fenuel

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֥אמֶר יָרׇבְעָ֖ם בְּלִבּ֑וֹ עַתָּ֛ה תָּשׁ֥וּב הַמַּמְלָכָ֖ה לְבֵ֥ית דָּוִֽד׃
Translated: Jeroboam said to himself, “Now the kingdom may well return to the House of David.
Transliteration: vayomer yarׇveam velivvo atah tashuv hamamelakhah leveyt david

Hebrew: אִֽם־יַעֲלֶ֣ה ׀ הָעָ֣ם הַזֶּ֗ה לַעֲשׂ֨וֹת זְבָחִ֤ים בְּבֵית־יְהֹוָה֙ בִּיר֣וּשָׁלַ֔͏ִם וְ֠שָׁ֠ב לֵ֣ב הָעָ֤ם הַזֶּה֙ אֶל־אֲדֹ֣נֵיהֶ֔ם אֶל־רְחַבְעָ֖ם מֶ֣לֶךְ יְהוּדָ֑ה וַהֲרָגֻ֕נִי וְשָׁ֖בוּ אֶל־רְחַבְעָ֥ם מֶלֶךְ־יְהוּדָֽה׃
Translated: If these people still go up to offer sacrifices at the House of G<small>OD</small> in Jerusalem, the heart of these people will turn back to their master, King Rehoboam of Judah; they will kill me and go back to King Rehoboam of Judah.”
Transliteration: im-yaaleh haam hazeh laashvot zevachiym veveyt-yehovah viyrushala͏im veshav lev haam hazeh el-adoneyhem el-rechaveam melekhe yehudah vaharaguniy veshavu el-rechaveam melekhe-yehudah

Hebrew: וַיִּוָּעַ֣ץ הַמֶּ֔לֶךְ וַיַּ֕עַשׂ שְׁנֵ֖י עֶגְלֵ֣י זָהָ֑ב וַיֹּ֣אמֶר אֲלֵהֶ֗ם רַב־לָכֶם֙ מֵעֲל֣וֹת יְרוּשָׁלַ֔͏ִם הִנֵּ֤ה אֱלֹהֶ֙יךָ֙ יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל אֲשֶׁ֥ר הֶעֱל֖וּךָ מֵאֶ֥רֶץ מִצְרָֽיִם׃
Translated: So the king took counsel and made two golden calves. He said to the people, “You have been going up to Jerusalem long enough. This is your god, O Israel, who brought you up from the land of Egypt!”
Transliteration: vayivaats hamelekhe vayaash sheney egeley zahav vayomer alehem rav-lakhem mealvot yerushala͏im hineh eloheykha yisherael asher heelukha meerets mitserayiim

Hebrew: וַיָּ֥שֶׂם אֶת־הָאֶחָ֖ד בְּבֵֽית־אֵ֑ל וְאֶת־הָאֶחָ֖ד נָתַ֥ן בְּדָֽן׃
Translated: He set up one in Bethel and placed the other in Dan.
Transliteration: vayashem et-haechad veveyt-el veet-haechad natan vedan

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֛י הַדָּבָ֥ר הַזֶּ֖ה לְחַטָּ֑את וַיֵּלְכ֥וּ הָעָ֛ם לִפְנֵ֥י הָאֶחָ֖ד עַד־דָּֽן׃
Translated: That proved to be a cause of guilt, for the people went to worship [the calf at Bethel and] the one at Dan.
Transliteration: vayehiy hadavar hazeh lechatat vayelekhu haam lifeney haechad ad-dan

Hebrew: וַיַּ֖עַשׂ אֶת־בֵּ֣ית בָּמ֑וֹת וַיַּ֤עַשׂ כֹּֽהֲנִים֙ מִקְצ֣וֹת הָעָ֔ם אֲשֶׁ֥ר לֹא־הָי֖וּ מִבְּנֵ֥י לֵוִֽי׃
Translated: He also made cult places and appointed priests from the ranks of the people who were not of Levite descent.
Transliteration: vayaash et-veyt vamvot vayaash khohaniym miketsvot haam asher lo-hayu miveney leviy

Hebrew: וַיַּ֣עַשׂ יָרׇבְעָ֣ם ׀ חָ֡ג בַּחֹ֣דֶשׁ הַשְּׁמִינִ֣י בַחֲמִשָּֽׁה־עָשָׂר֩ י֨וֹם ׀ לַחֹ֜דֶשׁ כֶּחָ֣ג ׀ אֲשֶׁ֣ר בִּיהוּדָ֗ה וַיַּ֙עַל֙ עַל־הַמִּזְבֵּ֔חַ כֵּ֤ן עָשָׂה֙ בְּבֵֽית־אֵ֔ל לְזַבֵּ֖חַ לָעֲגָלִ֣ים אֲשֶׁר־עָשָׂ֑ה וְהֶֽעֱמִיד֙ בְּבֵ֣ית אֵ֔ל אֶת־כֹּהֲנֵ֥י הַבָּמ֖וֹת אֲשֶׁ֥ר עָשָֽׂה׃
Translated: He stationed at Bethel the priests of the shrines that he had appointed to sacrifice to the calves that he had made. And Jeroboam established a festival on the fifteenth day of the eighth month; in imitation of the festival in Judah, he established one at Bethel, and he ascended the altar [there].
Transliteration: vayaash yarׇveam chag vachodesh hashemiyniy vachamishah-ashar yvom lachodesh khechag asher viyhudah vayaal al-hamizevecha khen ashah veveyt-el lezavecha laagaliym asher-ashah veheemiyd veveyt el et-khohaney havamvot asher ashah

Hebrew: וַיַּ֜עַל עַֽל־הַמִּזְבֵּ֣חַ ׀ אֲשֶׁר־עָשָׂ֣ה בְּבֵֽית־אֵ֗ל בַּחֲמִשָּׁ֨ה עָשָׂ֥ר יוֹם֙ בַּחֹ֣דֶשׁ הַשְּׁמִינִ֔י בַּחֹ֖דֶשׁ אֲשֶׁר־בָּדָ֣א (מלבד) [מִלִּבּ֑וֹ] וַיַּ֤עַשׂ חָג֙ לִבְנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל וַיַּ֥עַל עַל־הַמִּזְבֵּ֖חַ לְהַקְטִֽיר׃ {פ}
Translated:
On the fifteenth day of the eighth month—the month in which he had contrived of his own mind to establish a festival for the Israelites—Jeroboam ascended the altar that he had made in Bethel.
As he ascended the altar to present an offering,
Transliteration: vayaal al-hamizevecha asher-ashah veveyt-el vachamishah ashar yvom vachodesh hashemiyniy vachodesh asher-vada (mlvd) [milivvo] vayaash chag liveney yisherael vayaal al-hamizevecha lehaketiyr {f}

Hebrew: וְהִנֵּ֣ה ׀ אִ֣ישׁ אֱלֹהִ֗ים בָּ֧א מִיהוּדָ֛ה בִּדְבַ֥ר יְהֹוָ֖ה אֶל־בֵּֽית־אֵ֑ל וְיָרׇבְעָ֛ם עֹמֵ֥ד עַל־הַמִּזְבֵּ֖חַ לְהַקְטִֽיר׃
Translated: an agent of God arrived at Bethel from Judah at the command of G<small>OD</small>. While Jeroboam was standing on the altar to present the offering,
Transliteration: vehineh iysh Elohim va miyhudah videvar yehovah el-veyt-el veyarׇveam omed al-hamizevecha lehaketiyr

Hebrew: וַיִּקְרָ֤א עַל־הַמִּזְבֵּ֙חַ֙ בִּדְבַ֣ר יְהֹוָ֔ה וַיֹּ֙אמֶר֙ מִזְבֵּ֣חַ מִזְבֵּ֔חַ כֹּ֖ה אָמַ֣ר יְהֹוָ֑ה הִנֵּה־בֵ֞ן נוֹלָ֤ד לְבֵית־דָּוִד֙ יֹאשִׁיָּ֣הֽוּ שְׁמ֔וֹ וְזָבַ֣ח עָלֶ֗יךָ אֶת־כֹּהֲנֵ֤י הַבָּמוֹת֙ הַמַּקְטִרִ֣ים עָלֶ֔יךָ וְעַצְמ֥וֹת אָדָ֖ם יִשְׂרְפ֥וּ עָלֶֽיךָ׃
Translated: he—the agent of God—at the command of G<small>OD</small>, cried out against the altar: “O altar, altar! Thus said G<small>OD</small>: A son shall be born to the House of David, Josiah by name; and he shall slaughter upon you the priests of the shrines who bring offerings upon you. And human bones shall be burned upon you.”
Transliteration: vayikera al-hamizevecha videvar yehovah vayomer mizevecha mizevecha khoh amar yehovah hineh-ven nvolad leveyt-david yoshiyahu shemvo vezavach aleykha et-khohaney havamvot hamaketiriym aleykha veatsemvot adam yisherefu aleykha

Hebrew: וְנָתַן֩ בַּיּ֨וֹם הַה֤וּא מוֹפֵת֙ לֵאמֹ֔ר זֶ֣ה הַמּוֹפֵ֔ת אֲשֶׁ֖ר דִּבֶּ֣ר יְהֹוָ֑ה הִנֵּ֤ה הַמִּזְבֵּ֙חַ֙ נִקְרָ֔ע וְנִשְׁפַּ֖ךְ הַדֶּ֥שֶׁן אֲשֶׁר־עָלָֽיו׃
Translated: He gave a portent on that day, saying, “Here is the portent that G<small>OD</small> has decreed: This altar shall break apart, and the ashes on it shall be spilled.”
Transliteration: venatan vayyvom hahu mvofet lemor zeh hamvofet asher diver yehovah hineh hamizevecha nikera venishefakhe hadeshen asher-alayv

Hebrew: וַיְהִי֩ כִשְׁמֹ֨עַ הַמֶּ֜לֶךְ אֶת־דְּבַ֣ר אִישׁ־הָאֱלֹהִ֗ים אֲשֶׁ֨ר קָרָ֤א עַל־הַמִּזְבֵּ֙חַ֙ בְּבֵֽית־אֵ֔ל וַיִּשְׁלַ֨ח יָרׇבְעָ֧ם אֶת־יָד֛וֹ מֵעַ֥ל הַמִּזְבֵּ֖חַ לֵאמֹ֣ר <small>׀</small> תִּפְשֻׂ֑הוּ וַתִּיבַ֤שׁ יָדוֹ֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר שָׁלַ֣ח עָלָ֔יו וְלֹ֥א יָכֹ֖ל לַהֲשִׁיבָ֥הּ אֵלָֽיו׃
Translated: When the king heard what the agent of God had proclaimed against the altar in Bethel, Jeroboam stretched out his arm above the altar and cried, “Seize him!” But the arm that he stretched out against him became rigid, and he could not draw it back.
Transliteration: vayehiy khishemoa hamelekhe et-devar iysh-haElohim asher kara al-hamizevecha veveyt-el vayishelach yarׇveam et-yadvo meal hamizevecha lemor <small></small> tifeshuhu vatiyvash yadvo asher shalach alayv velo yakhol lahashiyvah elayv

Hebrew: וְהַמִּזְבֵּ֣חַ נִקְרָ֔ע וַיִּשָּׁפֵ֥ךְ הַדֶּ֖שֶׁן מִן־הַמִּזְבֵּ֑חַ כַּמּוֹפֵ֗ת אֲשֶׁ֥ר נָתַ֛ן אִ֥ישׁ הָאֱלֹהִ֖ים בִּדְבַ֥ר יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: The altar broke apart and its ashes were spilled—the very portent that the agent of God had announced at G<small>OD</small>’s command.
Transliteration: vehamizevecha nikera vayishafekhe hadeshen min-hamizevecha khamvofet asher natan iysh haElohim videvar yehovah

Hebrew: וַיַּ֨עַן הַמֶּ֜לֶךְ וַיֹּ֣אמֶר ׀ אֶל־אִ֣ישׁ הָאֱלֹהִ֗ים חַל־נָ֞א אֶת־פְּנֵ֨י יְהֹוָ֤ה אֱלֹהֶ֙יךָ֙ וְהִתְפַּלֵּ֣ל בַּעֲדִ֔י וְתָשֹׁ֥ב יָדִ֖י אֵלָ֑י וַיְחַ֤ל אִישׁ־הָֽאֱלֹהִים֙ אֶת־פְּנֵ֣י יְהֹוָ֔ה וַתָּ֤שׇׁב יַד־הַמֶּ֙לֶךְ֙ אֵלָ֔יו וַתְּהִ֖י כְּבָרִאשֹׁנָֽה׃
Translated: Then the king spoke up and said to the agent of God, “Please entreat the E<small>TERNAL</small> your God and pray for me that I may be able to draw back my arm.” The agent of God entreated G<small>OD</small> and the king was able to draw his arm back; it became as it was before.
Transliteration: vayaan hamelekhe vayomer el-iysh haElohim chal-na et-feney yehovah eloheykha vehitefalel vaadiy vetashov yadiy elay vayechal iysh-haElohim et-feney yehovah vatashׇv yad-hamelekhe elayv vatehiy khevarishonah

Hebrew: וַיְדַבֵּ֤ר הַמֶּ֙לֶךְ֙ אֶל־אִ֣ישׁ הָאֱלֹהִ֔ים בֹּֽאָה־אִתִּ֥י הַבַּ֖יְתָה וּֽסְעָ֑דָה וְאֶתְּנָ֥ה לְךָ֖ מַתָּֽת׃
Translated: The king said to the agent of God, “Come with me to my house and have some refreshment; and I shall give you a gift.”
Transliteration: vayedaver hamelekhe el-iysh haElohim voah-itiy havayetah useadah veetenah lekha matat

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר אִישׁ־הָֽאֱלֹהִים֙ אֶל־הַמֶּ֔לֶךְ אִם־תִּתֶּן־לִי֙ אֶת־חֲצִ֣י בֵיתֶ֔ךָ לֹ֥א אָבֹ֖א עִמָּ֑ךְ וְלֹא־אֹ֤כַל לֶ֙חֶם֙ וְלֹ֣א אֶשְׁתֶּה־מַּ֔יִם בַּמָּק֖וֹם הַזֶּֽה׃
Translated: But the agent of God replied to the king, “Even if you give me half your wealth, I will not go in with you, nor will I eat bread or drink water in this place;
Transliteration: vayomer iysh-haElohim el-hamelekhe im-titen-liy et-chatsiy veytekha lo avo imakhe velo-okhal lechem velo esheteh-mayiim vamakvom hazeh

Hebrew: כִּי־כֵ֣ן ׀ צִוָּ֣ה אֹתִ֗י בִּדְבַ֤ר יְהֹוָה֙ לֵאמֹ֔ר לֹא־תֹ֥אכַל לֶ֖חֶם וְלֹ֣א תִשְׁתֶּה־מָּ֑יִם וְלֹ֣א תָשׁ֔וּב בַּדֶּ֖רֶךְ אֲשֶׁ֥ר הָלָֽכְתָּ׃
Translated: for so I was commanded by the word of G<small>OD</small>: You shall eat no bread and drink no water, nor shall you go back by the road by which you came.”
Transliteration: khiy-khen tsivah otiy videvar yehovah lemor lo-tokhal lechem velo tisheteh-mayiim velo tashuv vaderekhe asher halakheta

Hebrew: וַיֵּ֖לֶךְ בְּדֶ֣רֶךְ אַחֵ֑ר וְלֹא־שָׁ֣ב בַּדֶּ֔רֶךְ אֲשֶׁ֛ר בָּ֥א בָ֖הּ אֶל־בֵּֽית־אֵֽל׃ {פ}
Translated: So he left by another road and did not go back by the road on which he had come to Bethel.
Transliteration: vayelekhe vederekhe acher velo-shav vaderekhe asher va vah el-veyt-el {f}

Hebrew: וְנָבִ֤יא אֶחָד֙ זָקֵ֔ן יֹשֵׁ֖ב בְּבֵֽית־אֵ֑ל וַיָּב֣וֹא בְנ֡וֹ וַיְסַפֶּר־ל֣וֹ אֶת־כׇּל־הַמַּעֲשֶׂ֣ה אֲשֶׁר־עָשָׂה֩ אִישׁ־הָאֱלֹהִ֨ים <small>׀</small> הַיּ֜וֹם בְּבֵֽית־אֵ֗ל אֶת־הַדְּבָרִים֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר דִּבֶּ֣ר אֶל־הַמֶּ֔לֶךְ וַֽיְסַפְּר֖וּם לַאֲבִיהֶֽם׃
Translated: There was an old prophet living in Bethel; and his sons came and told him all the things that the agent of God had done that day in Bethel [and] the words that he had spoken to the king. When they told it to their father,
Transliteration: venaviy echad zaken yoshev veveyt-el vayavvo venvo vayesafer-lvo et-khׇl-hamaasheh asher-ashah iysh-haElohim <small></small> hayyvom veveyt-el et-hadevariym asher diver el-hamelekhe vayesaferum laaviyhem

Hebrew: וַיְדַבֵּ֤ר אֲלֵהֶם֙ אֲבִיהֶ֔ם אֵי־זֶ֥ה הַדֶּ֖רֶךְ הָלָ֑ךְ וַיִּרְא֣וּ בָנָ֗יו אֶת־הַדֶּ֙רֶךְ֙ אֲשֶׁ֤ר הָלַךְ֙ אִ֣ישׁ הָאֱלֹהִ֔ים אֲשֶׁר־בָּ֖א מִיהוּדָֽה׃
Translated: their father said to them, “Which road did he leave by?” His sons had seen the road taken by the agent of God who had come from Judah.
Transliteration: vayedaver alehem aviyhem ey-zeh haderekhe halakhe vayireu vanayv et-haderekhe asher halakhe iysh haElohim asher-va miyhudah

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֙אמֶר֙ אֶל־בָּנָ֔יו חִבְשׁוּ־לִ֖י הַחֲמ֑וֹר וַיַּחְבְּשׁוּ־ל֣וֹ הַחֲמ֔וֹר וַיִּרְכַּ֖ב עָלָֽיו׃
Translated: “Saddle the donkey for me,” he said to his sons. They saddled the donkey for him, and he mounted it
Transliteration: vayomer el-vanayv chiveshu-liy hachamvor vayacheveshu-lvo hachamvor vayirekhav alayv

Hebrew: וַיֵּ֗לֶךְ אַֽחֲרֵי֙ אִ֣ישׁ הָאֱלֹהִ֔ים וַיִּ֨מְצָאֵ֔הוּ יֹשֵׁ֖ב תַּ֣חַת הָאֵלָ֑ה וַיֹּ֣אמֶר אֵלָ֗יו הַאַתָּ֧ה אִישׁ־הָאֱלֹהִ֛ים אֲשֶׁר־בָּ֥אתָ מִיהוּדָ֖ה וַיֹּ֥אמֶר אָֽנִי׃
Translated: and rode after the agent of God. He came upon him sitting under a terebinth and said to him, “Are you the agent of God who came from Judah?” “Yes, I am,” he answered.
Transliteration: vayelekhe acharey iysh haElohim vayimetsaehu yoshev tachat haelah vayomer elayv haatah iysh-haElohim asher-vata miyhudah vayomer aniy

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר אֵלָ֔יו לֵ֥ךְ אִתִּ֖י הַבָּ֑יְתָה וֶאֱכֹ֖ל לָֽחֶם׃
Translated: “Come home with me,” he said, “and have something to eat.”
Transliteration: vayomer elayv lekhe itiy havayetah veekhol lachem

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֗אמֶר לֹ֥א אוּכַ֛ל לָשׁ֥וּב אִתָּ֖ךְ וְלָב֣וֹא אִתָּ֑ךְ וְלֹא־אֹ֣כַל לֶ֗חֶם וְלֹֽא־אֶשְׁתֶּ֤ה אִתְּךָ֙ מַ֔יִם בַּמָּק֖וֹם הַזֶּֽה׃
Translated: He replied, “I may not go back with you and enter your home; and I may not eat bread or drink water in this place;
Transliteration: vayomer lo ukhal lashuv itakhe velavvo itakhe velo-okhal lechem velo-esheteh itekha mayiim vamakvom hazeh

Hebrew: כִּֽי־דָבָ֤ר אֵלַי֙ בִּדְבַ֣ר יְהֹוָ֔ה לֹא־תֹאכַ֣ל לֶ֔חֶם וְלֹא־תִשְׁתֶּ֥ה שָׁ֖ם מָ֑יִם לֹא־תָשׁ֣וּב לָלֶ֔כֶת בַּדֶּ֖רֶךְ אֲשֶׁר־הָלַ֥כְתָּ בָּֽהּ׃
Translated: the order I received by the word of G<small>OD</small> was: You shall not eat bread or drink water there; nor shall you return by the road on which you came.”
Transliteration: khiy-davar elay videvar yehovah lo-tokhal lechem velo-tisheteh sham mayiim lo-tashuv lalekhet vaderekhe asher-halakheta vah

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר ל֗וֹ גַּם־אֲנִ֣י נָבִיא֮ כָּמ֒וֹךָ֒ וּמַלְאָ֡ךְ דִּבֶּ֣ר אֵלַי֩ בִּדְבַ֨ר יְהֹוָ֜ה לֵאמֹ֗ר הֲשִׁבֵ֤הוּ אִתְּךָ֙ אֶל־בֵּיתֶ֔ךָ וְיֹ֥אכַל לֶ֖חֶם וְיֵ֣שְׁתְּ מָ֑יִם כִּחֵ֖שׁ לֽוֹ׃
Translated: “I am a prophet, too,” said the other, “and an angel said to me by command of G<small>OD</small>: Bring him back with you to your house, that he may eat bread and drink water.” He was lying to him.
Transliteration: vayomer lvo gam-aniy naviy khamvokha umaleakhe diver elay videvar yehovah lemor hashivehu itekha el-veytekha veyokhal lechem veeishete mayiim khichesh lvo

Hebrew: וַיָּ֣שׇׁב אִתּ֗וֹ וַיֹּ֥אכַל לֶ֛חֶם בְּבֵית֖וֹ וַיֵּ֥שְׁתְּ מָֽיִם׃
Translated: So he went back with him, and he ate bread and drank water in his house.
Transliteration: vayashׇv itvo vayokhal lechem veveytvo vayeshete mayiim

Hebrew:
וַיְהִ֕י הֵ֥ם יֹשְׁבִ֖ים אֶל־הַשֻּׁלְחָ֑ן {פ}
וַֽיְהִי֙ דְּבַר־יְהֹוָ֔ה אֶל־הַנָּבִ֖יא אֲשֶׁ֥ר הֱשִׁיבֽוֹ׃
Translated: While they were sitting at the table, the word of G<small>OD</small> came to the prophet who had brought him back.
Transliteration:
vayehiy hem yosheviym el-hashulechan {f}
vayehiy devar-yehovah el-hanaviy asher heshiyvvo

Hebrew: וַיִּקְרָ֞א אֶל־אִ֣ישׁ הָאֱלֹהִ֗ים אֲשֶׁר־בָּ֤א מִֽיהוּדָה֙ לֵאמֹ֔ר כֹּ֖ה אָמַ֣ר יְהֹוָ֑ה יַ֗עַן כִּ֤י מָרִ֙יתָ֙ פִּ֣י יְהֹוָ֔ה וְלֹ֤א שָׁמַ֙רְתָּ֙ אֶת־הַמִּצְוָ֔ה אֲשֶׁ֥ר צִוְּךָ֖ יְהֹוָ֥ה אֱלֹהֶֽיךָ׃
Translated: He cried out to the agent of God who had come from Judah: “Thus said G<small>OD</small>: Because you have flouted the word of G<small>OD</small> and have not observed what the E<small>TERNAL</small> your God commanded you,
Transliteration: vayikera el-iysh haElohim asher-va miyhudah lemor khoh amar yehovah yaan khiy mariyta fiy yehovah velo shamareta et-hamitsevah asher tsivekha yehovah eloheykha

Hebrew: וַתָּ֗שׇׁב וַתֹּ֤אכַל לֶ֙חֶם֙ וַתֵּ֣שְׁתְּ מַ֔יִם בַּמָּקוֹם֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר דִּבֶּ֣ר אֵלֶ֔יךָ אַל־תֹּ֥אכַל לֶ֖חֶם וְאַל־תֵּ֣שְׁתְּ מָ֑יִם לֹא־תָב֥וֹא נִבְלָתְךָ֖ אֶל־קֶ֥בֶר אֲבֹתֶֽיךָ׃
Translated: but have gone back and eaten bread and drunk water in the place of which [God] said to you, ‘Do not eat bread or drink water [there],’ your corpse shall not come to the grave of your ancestors.”
Transliteration: vatashׇv vatokhal lechem vateshete mayiim vamakvom asher diver eleykha al-tokhal lechem veal-teshete mayiim lo-tavvo nivelatekha el-kever avoteykha

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֗י אַחֲרֵ֛י אׇכְל֥וֹ לֶ֖חֶם וְאַחֲרֵ֣י שְׁתוֹת֑וֹ וַיַּחֲבׇשׁ־ל֣וֹ הַחֲמ֔וֹר לַנָּבִ֖יא אֲשֶׁ֥ר הֱשִׁיבֽוֹ׃
Translated: After he had eaten bread and had drunk, he saddled the donkey for him—for the prophet whom he had brought back.
Transliteration: vayehiy acharey ׇkhelvo lechem veacharey shetvotvo vayachavׇsh-lvo hachamvor lanaviy asher heshiyvvo

Hebrew: וַיֵּ֕לֶךְ וַיִּמְצָאֵ֧הוּ אַרְיֵ֛ה בַּדֶּ֖רֶךְ וַיְמִיתֵ֑הוּ וַתְּהִ֤י נִבְלָתוֹ֙ מֻשְׁלֶ֣כֶת בַּדֶּ֔רֶךְ וְהַֽחֲמוֹר֙ עֹמֵ֣ד אֶצְלָ֔הּ וְהָ֣אַרְיֵ֔ה עֹמֵ֖ד אֵ֥צֶל הַנְּבֵלָֽה׃
Translated: He set out, and a lion came upon him on the road and killed him. His corpse lay on the road, with the donkey standing beside it, and the lion also standing beside the corpse.
Transliteration: vayelekhe vayimetsaehu areeih vaderekhe vayemiytehu vatehiy nivelatvo mushelekhet vaderekhe vehachamvor omed etselah vehaareeih omed etsel hanevelah

Hebrew: וְהִנֵּ֧ה אֲנָשִׁ֣ים עֹבְרִ֗ים וַיִּרְא֤וּ אֶת־הַנְּבֵלָה֙ מֻשְׁלֶ֣כֶת בַּדֶּ֔רֶךְ וְאֶת־הָ֣אַרְיֵ֔ה עֹמֵ֖ד אֵ֣צֶל הַנְּבֵלָ֑ה וַיָּבֹ֙אוּ֙ וַיְדַבְּר֣וּ בָעִ֔יר אֲשֶׁ֛ר הַנָּבִ֥יא הַזָּקֵ֖ן יֹשֵׁ֥ב בָּֽהּ׃
Translated: Some people who passed by saw the corpse lying on the road and the lion standing beside the corpse; they went and told it in the town where the old prophet lived.
Transliteration: vehineh anashiym overiym vayireu et-hanevelah mushelekhet vaderekhe veet-haareeih omed etsel hanevelah vayavou vayedaveru vaiyr asher hanaviy hazaken yoshev vah

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׁמַ֣ע הַנָּבִיא֮ אֲשֶׁ֣ר הֱשִׁיב֣וֹ מִן־הַדֶּ֒רֶךְ֒ וַיֹּ֙אמֶר֙ אִ֣ישׁ הָאֱלֹהִ֣ים ה֔וּא אֲשֶׁ֥ר מָרָ֖ה אֶת־פִּ֣י יְהֹוָ֑ה וַיִּתְּנֵ֨הוּ יְהֹוָ֜ה לָאַרְיֵ֗ה וַֽיִּשְׁבְּרֵ֙הוּ֙ וַיְמִתֵ֔הוּ כִּדְבַ֥ר יְהֹוָ֖ה אֲשֶׁ֥ר דִּבֶּר־לֽוֹ׃
Translated: And when the prophet who had brought him back from the road heard it, he said, “That is the agent of God who flouted G<small>OD</small>’s command; G<small>OD</small> gave him over to the lion, which mauled him and killed him in accordance with the word that G<small>OD</small> had spoken to him.”
Transliteration: vayishema hanaviy asher heshiyvvo min-haderekhe vayomer iysh haElohim hu asher marah et-fiy yehovah vayitenehu yehovah laareeih vayisheverehu vayemitehu khidevar yehovah asher diver-lvo

Hebrew: וַיְדַבֵּ֤ר אֶל־בָּנָיו֙ לֵאמֹ֔ר חִבְשׁוּ־לִ֖י אֶֽת־הַחֲמ֑וֹר וַֽיַּחֲבֹֽשׁוּ׃
Translated: He said to his sons, “Saddle the donkey for me,” and they did so.
Transliteration: vayedaver el-vanayv lemor chiveshu-liy et-hachamvor vayachavoshu

Hebrew: וַיֵּ֗לֶךְ וַיִּמְצָ֤א אֶת־נִבְלָתוֹ֙ מֻשְׁלֶ֣כֶת בַּדֶּ֔רֶךְ וַֽחֲמוֹר֙ וְהָ֣אַרְיֵ֔ה עֹמְדִ֖ים אֵ֣צֶל הַנְּבֵלָ֑ה לֹֽא־אָכַ֤ל הָֽאַרְיֵה֙ אֶת־הַנְּבֵלָ֔ה וְלֹ֥א שָׁבַ֖ר אֶֽת־הַחֲמֽוֹר׃
Translated: He set out and found the corpse lying on the road, with the donkey and the lion standing beside the corpse; the lion had not eaten the corpse nor had it mauled the donkey.
Transliteration: vayelekhe vayimetsa et-nivelatvo mushelekhet vaderekhe vachamvor vehaareeih omediym etsel hanevelah lo-akhal haareeih et-hanevelah velo shavar et-hachamvor

Hebrew: וַיִּשָּׂ֨א הַנָּבִ֜יא אֶת־נִבְלַ֧ת אִישׁ־הָאֱלֹהִ֛ים וַיַּנִּחֵ֥הוּ אֶֽל־הַחֲמ֖וֹר וַיְשִׁיבֵ֑הוּ וַיָּבֹ֗א אֶל־עִיר֙ הַנָּבִ֣יא הַזָּקֵ֔ן לִסְפֹּ֖ד וּלְקׇבְרֽוֹ׃
Translated: The prophet lifted up the corpse of the agent of God, laid it on the donkey, and brought it back; it was brought to the town of the old prophet for lamentation and burial.
Transliteration: vayisha hanaviy et-nivelat iysh-haElohim vayanichehu el-hachamvor vayeshiyvehu vayavo el-iyr hanaviy hazaken lisefod ulekׇvervo

Hebrew: וַיַּנַּ֥ח אֶת־נִבְלָת֖וֹ בְּקִבְר֑וֹ וַיִּסְפְּד֥וּ עָלָ֖יו ה֥וֹי אָחִֽי׃
Translated: He laid the corpse in his own burial place; and they lamented over it, “Alas, my brother!”
Transliteration: vayanach et-nivelatvo vekivervo vayisefedu alayv hvoy achiy

Hebrew: וַיְהִי֮ אַחֲרֵ֣י קׇבְר֣וֹ אֹתוֹ֒ וַיֹּ֤אמֶר אֶל־בָּנָיו֙ לֵאמֹ֔ר בְּמוֹתִי֙ וּקְבַרְתֶּ֣ם אֹתִ֔י בַּקֶּ֕בֶר אֲשֶׁ֛ר אִ֥ישׁ הָאֱלֹהִ֖ים קָב֣וּר בּ֑וֹ אֵ֚צֶל עַצְמֹתָ֔יו הַנִּ֖יחוּ אֶת־עַצְמֹתָֽי׃
Translated: After burying him, he said to his sons, “When I die, bury me in the grave where the agent of God lies buried; lay my bones beside his.
Transliteration: vayehiy acharey kׇvervo otvo vayomer el-vanayv lemor vemvotiy ukevaretem otiy vakever asher iysh haElohim kavur vvo etsel atsemotayv haniychu et-atsemotay

Hebrew: כִּי֩ הָיֹ֨ה יִֽהְיֶ֜ה הַדָּבָ֗ר אֲשֶׁ֤ר קָרָא֙ בִּדְבַ֣ר יְהֹוָ֔ה עַל־הַמִּזְבֵּ֖חַ אֲשֶׁ֣ר בְּבֵֽית־אֵ֑ל וְעַל֙ כׇּל־בָּתֵּ֣י הַבָּמ֔וֹת אֲשֶׁ֖ר בְּעָרֵ֥י שֹׁמְרֽוֹן׃ {פ}
Translated: For what he announced by the word of G<small>OD</small> against the altar in Bethel, and against all the cult places in the towns of Samaria, shall surely come true.”
Transliteration: khiy hayoh yiheyeh hadavar asher kara videvar yehovah al-hamizevecha asher veveyt-el veal khׇl-vatey havamvot asher vearey shomervon {f}

Hebrew: אַחַר֙ הַדָּבָ֣ר הַזֶּ֔ה לֹא־שָׁ֥ב יָרׇבְעָ֖ם מִדַּרְכּ֣וֹ הָרָעָ֑ה וַ֠יָּ֠שׇׁב וַיַּ֜עַשׂ מִקְצ֤וֹת הָעָם֙ כֹּהֲנֵ֣י בָמ֔וֹת הֶֽחָפֵץ֙ יְמַלֵּ֣א אֶת־יָד֔וֹ וִיהִ֖י כֹּהֲנֵ֥י בָמֽוֹת׃
Translated: Even after this incident, Jeroboam did not turn back from his evil way, but kept on appointing priests for the shrines from the ranks of the people. He ordained as priests of the shrines any who so desired.
Transliteration: achar hadavar hazeh lo-shav yarׇveam midarekhvo haraah vayashׇv vayaash miketsvot haam khohaney vamvot hechafets yemale et-yadvo viyhiy khohaney vamvot

Hebrew: וַֽיְהִי֙ בַּדָּבָ֣ר הַזֶּ֔ה לְחַטַּ֖את בֵּ֣ית יָרׇבְעָ֑ם וּלְהַכְחִיד֙ וּלְהַשְׁמִ֔יד מֵעַ֖ל פְּנֵ֥י הָאֲדָמָֽה׃ {פ}
Translated: Thereby the House of Jeroboam incurred guilt—to their utter annihilation from the face of the earth.
Transliteration: vayehiy vadavar hazeh lechatat veyt yarׇveam ulehakhechiyd ulehashemiyd meal feney haadamah {f}

Hebrew: בָּעֵ֣ת הַהִ֔יא חָלָ֖ה אֲבִיָּ֥ה בֶן־יָרׇבְעָֽם׃
Translated: At that time, Abijah, a son of Jeroboam, fell sick.
Transliteration: vaet hahiy chalah aviyah ven-yarׇveam

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר יָרׇבְעָ֜ם לְאִשְׁתּ֗וֹ ק֤וּמִי נָא֙ וְהִשְׁתַּנִּ֔ית וְלֹ֣א יֵֽדְע֔וּ כִּי־[אַ֖תְּ] (אתי) אֵ֣שֶׁת יָרׇבְעָ֑ם וְהָלַ֣כְתְּ שִׁלֹ֗ה הִנֵּה־שָׁם֙ אֲחִיָּ֣ה הַנָּבִ֔יא הוּא־דִבֶּ֥ר עָלַ֛י לְמֶ֖לֶךְ עַל־הָעָ֥ם הַזֶּֽה׃
Translated: Jeroboam said to his wife, “Go and disguise yourself, so that you will not be recognized as Jeroboam’s wife, and go to Shiloh. The prophet Ahijah lives there, the one who predicted that I would be king over this people.
Transliteration: vayomer yarׇveam leishetvo kumiy na vehishetaniyt velo eideu khiy-[ate] (ty) eshet yarׇveam vehalakhete shiloh hineh-sham achiyah hanaviy hu-diver alay lemelekhe al-haam hazeh

Hebrew: וְלָקַ֣חַתְּ בְּ֠יָדֵ֠ךְ עֲשָׂרָ֨ה לֶ֧חֶם וְנִקֻּדִ֛ים וּבַקְבֻּ֥ק דְּבַ֖שׁ וּבָ֣את אֵלָ֑יו ה֚וּא יַגִּ֣יד לָ֔ךְ מַה־יִּֽהְיֶ֖ה לַנָּֽעַר׃
Translated: Take with you ten loaves, some wafers, and a jug of honey, and go to him; he will tell you what will happen to the boy.”
Transliteration: velakachate veyadekhe asharah lechem venikudiym uvakevuk devash uvat elayv hu yagiyd lakhe mah-yiheyeh lanaar

Hebrew: וַתַּ֤עַשׂ כֵּן֙ אֵ֣שֶׁת יָרׇבְעָ֔ם וַתָּ֙קׇם֙ וַתֵּ֣לֶךְ שִׁלֹ֔ה וַתָּבֹ֖א בֵּ֣ית אֲחִיָּ֑ה וַאֲחִיָּ֙הוּ֙ לֹא־יָכֹ֣ל לִרְא֔וֹת כִּ֛י קָ֥מוּ עֵינָ֖יו מִשֵּׂיבֽוֹ׃ {פ}
Translated: Jeroboam’s wife did so; she left and went to Shiloh and came to the house of Ahijah. Now Ahijah could not see, for his eyes had become sightless with age;
Transliteration: vataash khen eshet yarׇveam vatakׇm vatelekhe shiloh vatavo veyt achiyah vaachiyahu lo-yakhol lirevot khiy kamu eynayv misheyvvo {f}

Hebrew: וַיהֹוָ֞ה אָמַ֣ר אֶל־אֲחִיָּ֗הוּ הִנֵּ֣ה אֵ֣שֶׁת יָרׇבְעָ֡ם בָּאָ֣ה לִדְרֹשׁ֩ דָּבָ֨ר מֵעִמְּךָ֤ אֶל־בְּנָהּ֙ כִּֽי־חֹלֶ֣ה ה֔וּא כָּזֹ֥ה וְכָזֶ֖ה תְּדַבֵּ֣ר אֵלֶ֑יהָ וִיהִ֣י כְבֹאָ֔הּ וְהִ֖יא מִתְנַכֵּרָֽה׃
Translated: but G<small>OD</small> had said to Ahijah, “Jeroboam’s wife is coming to inquire of you concerning her son, who is sick. Speak to her thus and thus. When she arrives, she will be in disguise.”
Transliteration: vayhovah amar el-achiyahu hineh eshet yarׇveam vaah liderosh davar meimekha el-venah khiy-choleh hu khazoh vekhazeh tedaver eleyha viyhiy khevoah vehiy mitenakherah

Hebrew: וַיְהִי֩ כִשְׁמֹ֨עַ אֲחִיָּ֜הוּ אֶת־ק֤וֹל רַגְלֶ֙יהָ֙ בָּאָ֣ה בַפֶּ֔תַח וַיֹּ֕אמֶר בֹּ֖אִי אֵ֣שֶׁת יָרׇבְעָ֑ם לָ֣מָּה זֶּ֗ה אַ֚תְּ מִתְנַכֵּרָ֔ה וְאָ֣נֹכִ֔י שָׁל֥וּחַ אֵלַ֖יִךְ קָשָֽׁה׃
Translated: Ahijah heard the sound of her feet as she came through the door, and he said, “Come in, wife of Jeroboam. Why are you disguised? I have a harsh message for you.
Transliteration: vayehiy khishemoa achiyahu et-kvol rageleyha vaah vafetach vayomer voiy eshet yarׇveam lamah zeh ate mitenakherah veanokhiy shalucha elayiikhe kashah

Hebrew: לְכִ֞י אִמְרִ֣י לְיָרׇבְעָ֗ם כֹּֽה־אָמַ֤ר יְהֹוָה֙ אֱלֹהֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל יַ֛עַן אֲשֶׁ֥ר הֲרִמֹתִ֖יךָ מִתּ֣וֹךְ הָעָ֑ם וָאֶתֶּנְךָ֣ נָגִ֔יד עַ֖ל עַמִּ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated: Go tell Jeroboam: Thus said the E<small>TERNAL</small>, the God of Israel: I raised you up from among the people and made you a ruler over My people Israel;
Transliteration: lekhiy imeriy leyarׇveam khoh-amar yehovah elohey yisherael yaan asher harimotiykha mitvokhe haam vaetenekha nagiyd al amiy yisherael

Hebrew: וָאֶקְרַ֤ע אֶת־הַמַּמְלָכָה֙ מִבֵּ֣ית דָּוִ֔ד וָאֶתְּנֶ֖הָ לָ֑ךְ וְלֹֽא־הָיִ֜יתָ כְּעַבְדִּ֣י דָוִ֗ד אֲשֶׁר֩ שָׁמַ֨ר מִצְוֺתַ֜י וַֽאֲשֶׁר־הָלַ֤ךְ אַֽחֲרַי֙ בְּכׇל־לְבָב֔וֹ לַעֲשׂ֕וֹת רַ֖ק הַיָּשָׁ֥ר בְּעֵינָֽי׃
Translated: I tore away the kingdom from the House of David and gave it to you. But you have not been like My servant David, who kept My commandments and followed Me with all his heart, doing only what was right in My sight.
Transliteration: vaekera et-hamamelakhah miveyt david vaeteneha lakhe velo-hayiyta kheavediy david asher shamar mitsevotay vaasher-halakhe acharay vekhׇl-levavvo laashvot rak hayashar veeynay

Hebrew: וַתָּ֣רַע לַעֲשׂ֔וֹת מִכֹּ֖ל אֲשֶׁר־הָי֣וּ לְפָנֶ֑יךָ וַתֵּ֡לֶךְ וַתַּֽעֲשֶׂה־לְּךָ֩ אֱלֹהִ֨ים אֲחֵרִ֤ים וּמַסֵּכוֹת֙ לְהַכְעִיסֵ֔נִי וְאֹתִ֥י הִשְׁלַ֖כְתָּ אַחֲרֵ֥י גַוֶּֽךָ׃
Translated: You have acted worse than all those who preceded you; you have gone and made for yourself other gods and molten images to provoke My anger; and Me you have cast behind your back.
Transliteration: vatara laashvot mikhol asher-hayu lefaneykha vatelekhe vataasheh-lekha Elohim acheriym umasekhvot lehakheiyseniy veotiy hishelakheta acharey gavekha

Hebrew: לָכֵ֗ן הִנְנִ֨י מֵבִ֤יא רָעָה֙ אֶל־בֵּ֣ית יָרׇבְעָ֔ם וְהִכְרַתִּ֤י לְיָֽרׇבְעָם֙ מַשְׁתִּ֣ין בְּקִ֔יר עָצ֥וּר וְעָז֖וּב בְּיִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל וּבִֽעַרְתִּי֙ אַחֲרֵ֣י בֵית־יָרׇבְעָ֔ם כַּאֲשֶׁ֛ר יְבַעֵ֥ר הַגָּלָ֖ל עַד־תֻּמּֽוֹ׃
Translated: Therefore I will bring disaster upon the House of Jeroboam and will cut off from Jeroboam every male, bond and free, in Israel. I will sweep away the House of Jeroboam utterly, as dung is swept away.
Transliteration: lakhen hineniy meviy raah el-veyt yarׇveam vehikheratiy leyarׇveam mashetiyn vekiyr atsur veazuv veyisherael uviaretiy acharey veyt-yarׇveam khaasher yevaer hagalal ad-tumvo

Hebrew: הַמֵּ֨ת לְיָרׇבְעָ֤ם בָּעִיר֙ יֹאכְל֣וּ הַכְּלָבִ֔ים וְהַמֵּת֙ בַּשָּׂדֶ֔ה יֹאכְל֖וּ ע֣וֹף הַשָּׁמָ֑יִם כִּ֥י יְהֹוָ֖ה דִּבֵּֽר׃
Translated: Anyone belonging to Jeroboam who dies in the town shall be devoured by dogs; and anyone who dies in the open country shall be eaten by the birds of the air; for G<small>OD</small> has spoken.
Transliteration: hamet leyarׇveam vaiyr yokhelu hakhelaviym vehamet vashadeh yokhelu vof hashamayiim khiy yehovah diver

Hebrew: וְאַ֥תְּ ק֖וּמִי לְכִ֣י לְבֵיתֵ֑ךְ בְּבֹאָ֥הֿ רַגְלַ֛יִךְ הָעִ֖ירָה וּמֵ֥ת הַיָּֽלֶד׃
Translated: As for you, go back home; as soon as you set foot in the town, the child will die.
Transliteration: veate kumiy lekhiy leveytekhe vevoahֿ ragelayiikhe haiyrah umet hayaled

Hebrew: וְסָֽפְדוּ־ל֤וֹ כׇל־יִשְׂרָאֵל֙ וְקָבְר֣וּ אֹת֔וֹ כִּי־זֶ֣ה לְבַדּ֔וֹ יָבֹ֥א לְיָרׇבְעָ֖ם אֶל־קָ֑בֶר יַ֣עַן נִמְצָא־ב֞וֹ דָּבָ֣ר ט֗וֹב אֶל־יְהֹוָ֛ה אֱלֹהֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל בְּבֵ֥ית יָרׇבְעָֽם׃
Translated: And all Israel shall lament over him and bury him; he alone of Jeroboam’s family shall be brought to burial, for in him alone of the House of Jeroboam has some devotion been found to the E<small>TERNAL</small>, the God of Israel.
Transliteration: vesafedu-lvo khׇl-yisherael vekaveru otvo khiy-zeh levadvo yavo leyarׇveam el-kaver yaan nimetsa-vvo davar tvov el-yehovah elohey yisherael veveyt yarׇveam

Hebrew: וְהֵקִים֩ יְהֹוָ֨ה ל֥וֹ מֶ֙לֶךְ֙ עַל־יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל אֲשֶׁ֥ר יַכְרִ֛ית אֶת־בֵּ֥ית יָרׇבְעָ֖ם זֶ֣ה הַיּ֑וֹם וּמֶ֖ה גַּם־עָֽתָּה׃
Translated: Moreover, G<small>OD</small> will raise up a king over Israel who will destroy the House of Jeroboam, this day and even now.
Transliteration: vehekiym yehovah lvo melekhe al-yisherael asher yakheriyt et-veyt yarׇveam zeh hayyvom umeh gam-atah

Hebrew: וְהִכָּ֨ה יְהֹוָ֜ה אֶת־יִשְׂרָאֵ֗ל כַּאֲשֶׁ֨ר יָנ֣וּד הַקָּנֶה֮ בַּמַּ֒יִם֒ וְנָתַ֣שׁ אֶת־יִשְׂרָאֵ֗ל מֵ֠עַ֠ל הָאֲדָמָ֨ה הַטּוֹבָ֤ה הַזֹּאת֙ אֲשֶׁ֤ר נָתַן֙ לַאֲב֣וֹתֵיהֶ֔ם וְזֵרָ֖ם מֵעֵ֣בֶר לַנָּהָ֑ר יַ֗עַן אֲשֶׁ֤ר עָשׂוּ֙ אֶת־אֲשֵׁ֣רֵיהֶ֔ם מַכְעִיסִ֖ים אֶת־יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: “G<small>OD</small> will strike Israel until it sways like a reed in water—and uproot Israel from this good land that was given to their ancestors, and will scatter them beyond the Euphrates, because they have provoked G<small>OD</small> by the sacred posts that they have made for themselves.
Transliteration: vehikhah yehovah et-yisherael khaasher yanud hakaneh vamayiim venatash et-yisherael meal haadamah hatvovah hazot asher natan laavvoteyhem vezeram meever lanahar yaan asher ashu et-ashereyhem makheiysiym et-yehovah

Hebrew: וְיִתֵּ֖ן אֶת־יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל בִּגְלַ֞ל חַטֹּ֤אות יָֽרׇבְעָם֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר חָטָ֔א וַאֲשֶׁ֥ר הֶחֱטִ֖יא אֶת־יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated: Israel will be forsaken because of the sins that Jeroboam committed and led Israel to commit.”
Transliteration: veyiten et-yisherael vigelal chatovt yarׇveam asher chata vaasher hechetiy et-yisherael

Hebrew: וַתָּ֙קׇם֙ אֵ֣שֶׁת יָרׇבְעָ֔ם וַתֵּ֖לֶךְ וַתָּבֹ֣א תִרְצָ֑תָה הִ֛יא בָּאָ֥ה בְסַף־הַבַּ֖יִת וְהַנַּ֥עַר מֵֽת׃
Translated: Jeroboam’s wife got up and left, and she went to Tirzah. As soon as she stepped over the threshold of her house, the child died.
Transliteration: vatakׇm eshet yarׇveam vatelekhe vatavo tiretsatah hiy vaah vesaf-havayiit vehanaar met

Hebrew: וַיִּקְבְּר֥וּ אֹת֛וֹ וַיִּסְפְּדוּ־ל֖וֹ כׇּל־יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל כִּדְבַ֤ר יְהֹוָה֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר דִּבֶּ֔ר בְּיַד־עַבְדּ֖וֹ אֲחִיָּ֥הוּ הַנָּבִֽיא׃
Translated: They buried him and all Israel lamented over him, in accordance with the word that G<small>OD</small> had spoken through the prophet Ahijah—God’s servant.
Transliteration: vayikeveru otvo vayisefedu-lvo khׇl-yisherael khidevar yehovah asher diver veyad-avedvo achiyahu hanaviy

Hebrew: וְיֶ֙תֶר֙ דִּבְרֵ֣י יָרׇבְעָ֔ם אֲשֶׁ֥ר נִלְחַ֖ם וַאֲשֶׁ֣ר מָלָ֑ךְ הִנָּ֣ם כְּתוּבִ֗ים עַל־סֵ֛פֶר דִּבְרֵ֥י הַיָּמִ֖ים לְמַלְכֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated: The other events of Jeroboam’s reign, how he fought and how he ruled, are recorded in the Annals of the Kings of Israel.
Transliteration: veyeter diverey yarׇveam asher nilecham vaasher malakhe hinam khetuviym al-sefer diverey hayamiym lemalekhey yisherael

Hebrew: וְהַיָּמִים֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר מָלַ֣ךְ יָרׇבְעָ֔ם עֶשְׂרִ֥ים וּשְׁתַּ֖יִם שָׁנָ֑ה וַיִּשְׁכַּב֙ עִם־אֲבֹתָ֔יו וַיִּמְלֹ֛ךְ נָדָ֥ב בְּנ֖וֹ תַּחְתָּֽיו׃ {פ}
Translated: Jeroboam reigned twenty-two years; then he rested with his ancestors, and his son Nadab succeeded him as king.
Transliteration: vehayamiym asher malakhe yarׇveam esheriym ushetayiim shanah vayishekhav im-avotayv vayimelokhe nadav venvo tachetayv {f}

Hebrew: וּרְחַבְעָם֙ בֶּן־שְׁלֹמֹ֔ה מָלַ֖ךְ בִּיהוּדָ֑ה בֶּן־אַרְבָּעִ֣ים וְאַחַ֣ת שָׁנָה֩ רְחַבְעָ֨ם בְּמׇלְכ֜וֹ וּֽשְׁבַ֨ע עֶשְׂרֵ֥ה שָׁנָ֣ה ׀ מָלַ֣ךְ בִּירוּשָׁלַ֗͏ִם הָ֠עִ֠יר אֲשֶׁר־בָּחַ֨ר יְהֹוָ֜ה לָשׂ֨וּם אֶת־שְׁמ֥וֹ שָׁם֙ מִכֹּל֙ שִׁבְטֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל וְשֵׁ֣ם אִמּ֔וֹ נַעֲמָ֖ה הָעַמֹּנִֽית׃
Translated: Meanwhile, Rehoboam son of Solomon had become king in Judah. Rehoboam was forty-one years old when he became king, and he reigned seventeen years in Jerusalem—the city G<small>OD</small> had chosen out of all the tribes of Israel to establish God’s name there. His mother’s name was Naamah the Ammonitess.
Transliteration: urechaveam ven-shelomoh malakhe viyhudah ven-arevaiym veachat shanah rechaveam vemׇlekhvo usheva eshereh shanah malakhe viyrushala͏im haiyr asher-vachar yehovah lashum et-shemvo sham mikhol shivetey yisherael veshem imvo naamah haamoniyt

Hebrew: וַיַּ֧עַשׂ יְהוּדָ֛ה הָרַ֖ע בְּעֵינֵ֣י יְהֹוָ֑ה וַיְקַנְא֣וּ אֹת֗וֹ מִכֹּל֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר עָשׂ֣וּ אֲבֹתָ֔ם בְּחַטֹּאתָ֖ם אֲשֶׁ֥ר חָטָֽאוּ׃
Translated: Judah did what was displeasing to G<small>OD</small>, provoking more outrage than their ancestors had by the sins that they committed.
Transliteration: vayaash yehudah hara veeyney yehovah vayekaneu otvo mikhol asher ashu avotam vechatotam asher chatau
