Hebrew: וַיִּבְנ֨וּ גַם־הֵ֧מָּה לָהֶ֛ם בָּמ֥וֹת וּמַצֵּב֖וֹת וַאֲשֵׁרִ֑ים עַ֚ל כׇּל־גִּבְעָ֣ה גְבֹהָ֔ה וְתַ֖חַת כׇּל־עֵ֥ץ רַעֲנָֽן׃
Translated: They too built for themselves shrines, pillars, and sacred posts on every high hill and under every leafy tree;
Transliteration: vayivenu gam-hemah lahem vamvot umatsevvot vaasheriym al khׇl-giveah gevohah vetachat khׇl-ets raanan

Hebrew: וְגַם־קָדֵ֖שׁ הָיָ֣ה בָאָ֑רֶץ עָשׂ֗וּ כְּכֹל֙ הַתּוֹעֲבֹ֣ת הַגּוֹיִ֔ם אֲשֶׁר֙ הוֹרִ֣ישׁ יְהֹוָ֔ה מִפְּנֵ֖י בְּנֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃ {פ}
Translated: there were also consecrated workers in the land. [Judah] imitated all the abhorrent practices of the nations that G<small>OD</small> had dispossessed before the Israelites.
Transliteration: vegam-kadesh hayah vaarets ashu khekhol hatvoavot hagvoyim asher hvoriysh yehovah mifeney veney yisherael {f}

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֛י בַּשָּׁנָ֥ה הַחֲמִישִׁ֖ית לַמֶּ֣לֶךְ רְחַבְעָ֑ם עָלָ֛ה (שושק) [שִׁישַׁ֥ק] מֶלֶךְ־מִצְרַ֖יִם עַל־יְרוּשָׁלָֽ͏ִם׃
Translated: In the fifth year of King Rehoboam, King Shishak of Egypt marched against Jerusalem
Transliteration: vayehiy vashanah hachamiyshiyt lamelekhe rechaveam alah (shvshk) [shiyshak] melekhe-mitserayiim al-yerushala͏im

Hebrew: וַיִּקַּ֞ח אֶת־אֹצְר֣וֹת בֵּית־יְהֹוָ֗ה וְאֶת־אֽוֹצְרוֹת֙ בֵּ֣ית הַמֶּ֔לֶךְ וְאֶת־הַכֹּ֖ל לָקָ֑ח וַיִּקַּח֙ אֶת־כׇּל־מָגִנֵּ֣י הַזָּהָ֔ב אֲשֶׁ֥ר עָשָׂ֖ה שְׁלֹמֹֽה׃
Translated: and carried off the treasures of the House of G<small>OD</small> and the treasures of the royal palace. He carried off everything; he even carried off all the golden shields that Solomon had made.
Transliteration: vayikach et-otservot veyt-yehovah veet-votservot veyt hamelekhe veet-hakhol lakach vayikach et-khׇl-maginey hazahav asher ashah shelomoh

Hebrew: וַיַּ֨עַשׂ הַמֶּ֤לֶךְ רְחַבְעָם֙ תַּחְתָּ֔ם מָגִנֵּ֖י נְחֹ֑שֶׁת וְהִפְקִ֗יד עַל־יַד֙ שָׂרֵ֣י הָרָצִ֔ים הַשֹּׁ֣מְרִ֔ים פֶּ֖תַח בֵּ֥ית הַמֶּֽלֶךְ׃
Translated: King Rehoboam had bronze shields made instead, and he entrusted them to the officers of the guard who guarded the entrance to the royal palace.
Transliteration: vayaash hamelekhe rechaveam tachetam maginey nechoshet vehifekiyd al-yad sharey haratsiym hashomeriym fetach veyt hamelekhe

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֛י מִדֵּי־בֹ֥א הַמֶּ֖לֶךְ בֵּ֣ית יְהֹוָ֑ה יִשָּׂאוּם֙ הָרָצִ֔ים וֶהֱשִׁיב֖וּם אֶל־תָּ֥א הָרָצִֽים׃
Translated: Whenever the king went into the House of G<small>OD</small>, the guards would carry them and then bring them back to the armory of the guards.
Transliteration: vayehiy midey-vo hamelekhe veyt yehovah yishaum haratsiym veheshiyvum el-ta haratsiym

Hebrew: וְיֶ֛תֶר דִּבְרֵ֥י רְחַבְעָ֖ם וְכׇל־אֲשֶׁ֣ר עָשָׂ֑ה הֲלֹא־הֵ֣מָּה כְתוּבִ֗ים עַל־סֵ֛פֶר דִּבְרֵ֥י הַיָּמִ֖ים לְמַלְכֵ֥י יְהוּדָֽה׃
Translated: The other events of Rehoboam’s reign, and all his actions, are recorded in the Annals of the Kings of Judah.
Transliteration: veyeter diverey rechaveam vekhׇl-asher ashah halo-hemah khetuviym al-sefer diverey hayamiym lemalekhey yehudah

Hebrew: וּמִלְחָמָ֨ה הָיְתָ֧ה בֵין־רְחַבְעָ֛ם וּבֵ֥ין יָרׇבְעָ֖ם כׇּל־הַיָּמִֽים׃
Translated: There was continual war between Rehoboam and Jeroboam.
Transliteration: umilechamah hayetah veyn-rechaveam uveyn yarׇveam khׇl-hayamiym

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׁכַּ֨ב רְחַבְעָ֜ם עִם־אֲבֹתָ֗יו וַיִּקָּבֵ֤ר עִם־אֲבֹתָיו֙ בְּעִ֣יר דָּוִ֔ד וְשֵׁ֣ם אִמּ֔וֹ נַעֲמָ֖ה הָעַמֹּנִ֑ית וַיִּמְלֹ֛ךְ אֲבִיָּ֥ם בְּנ֖וֹ תַּחְתָּֽיו׃ {פ}
Translated: Rehoboam rested with his ancestors and was buried with his ancestors in the City of David; his mother’s name was Naamah the Ammonitess. His son Abijam succeeded him as king.
Transliteration: vayishekhav rechaveam im-avotayv vayikaver im-avotayv veiyr david veshem imvo naamah haamoniyt vayimelokhe aviyam venvo tachetayv {f}

Hebrew: וּבִשְׁנַת֙ שְׁמֹנֶ֣ה עֶשְׂרֵ֔ה לַמֶּ֖לֶךְ יָרׇבְעָ֣ם בֶּן־נְבָ֑ט מָלַ֥ךְ אֲבִיָּ֖ם עַל־יְהוּדָֽה׃
Translated: In the eighteenth year of King Jeroboam son of Nebat, Abijam became king over Judah.
Transliteration: uvishenat shemoneh eshereh lamelekhe yarׇveam ven-nevat malakhe aviyam al-yehudah

Hebrew: שָׁלֹ֣שׁ שָׁנִ֔ים מָלַ֖ךְ בִּירוּשָׁלָ֑͏ִם וְשֵׁ֣ם אִמּ֔וֹ מַעֲכָ֖ה בַּת־אֲבִישָׁלֽוֹם׃
Translated: He reigned three years in Jerusalem; his mother’s name was Maacah daughter of Abishalom.
Transliteration: shalosh shaniym malakhe viyrushala͏im veshem imvo maakhah vat-aviyshalvom

Hebrew: וַיֵּ֕לֶךְ בְּכׇל־חַטֹּ֥אות אָבִ֖יו אֲשֶׁר־עָשָׂ֣ה לְפָנָ֑יו וְלֹא־הָיָ֨ה לְבָב֤וֹ שָׁלֵם֙ עִם־יְהֹוָ֣ה אֱלֹהָ֔יו כִּלְבַ֖ב דָּוִ֥ד אָבִֽיו׃
Translated: He continued in all the sins that his father before him had committed; he was not wholehearted with the E<small>TERNAL</small> his God, like his forefather David.
Transliteration: vayelekhe vekhׇl-chatovt aviyv asher-ashah lefanayv velo-hayah levavvo shalem im-yehovah elohayv khilevav david aviyv

Hebrew: כִּ֚י לְמַ֣עַן דָּוִ֔ד נָתַן֩ יְהֹוָ֨ה אֱלֹהָ֥יו ל֛וֹ נִ֖יר בִּירוּשָׁלָ֑͏ִם לְהָקִ֤ים אֶת־בְּנוֹ֙ אַחֲרָ֔יו וּֽלְהַעֲמִ֖יד אֶת־יְרוּשָׁלָֽ͏ִם׃
Translated: Yet, for the sake of David, the E<small>TERNAL</small> his God gave him a lamp in Jerusalem, by raising up his descendant after him and by preserving Jerusalem.
Transliteration: khiy lemaan david natan yehovah elohayv lvo niyr viyrushala͏im lehakiym et-venvo acharayv ulehaamiyd et-yerushala͏im

Hebrew: אֲשֶׁ֨ר עָשָׂ֥ה דָוִ֛ד אֶת־הַיָּשָׁ֖ר בְּעֵינֵ֣י יְהֹוָ֑ה וְלֹא־סָ֞ר מִכֹּ֣ל אֲשֶׁר־צִוָּ֗הוּ כֹּ֚ל יְמֵ֣י חַיָּ֔יו רַ֕ק בִּדְבַ֖ר אוּרִיָּ֥ה הַֽחִתִּֽי׃
Translated: For David had done what was pleasing to G<small>OD</small> and never turned throughout his life from all that had been commanded him, except in the matter of Uriah the Hittite.
Transliteration: asher ashah david et-hayashar veeyney yehovah velo-sar mikhol asher-tsivahu khol yemey chayayv rak videvar uriyah hachitiy

Hebrew: וּמִלְחָמָ֨ה הָיְתָ֧ה בֵין־רְחַבְעָ֛ם וּבֵ֥ין יָרׇבְעָ֖ם כׇּל־יְמֵ֥י חַיָּֽיו׃
Translated: There was war between Abijam and Jeroboam all the days of his life.
Transliteration: umilechamah hayetah veyn-rechaveam uveyn yarׇveam khׇl-yemey chayayv

Hebrew: וְיֶ֨תֶר דִּבְרֵ֤י אֲבִיָּם֙ וְכׇל־אֲשֶׁ֣ר עָשָׂ֔ה הֲלוֹא־הֵ֣ם כְּתוּבִ֗ים עַל־סֵ֛פֶר דִּבְרֵ֥י הַיָּמִ֖ים לְמַלְכֵ֣י יְהוּדָ֑ה וּמִלְחָמָ֥ה הָיְתָ֛ה בֵּ֥ין אֲבִיָּ֖ם וּבֵ֥ין יָרׇבְעָֽם׃
Translated: The other events of Abijam’s reign and all his actions are recorded in the Annals of the Kings of Judah; there was war between Abijam and Jeroboam.
Transliteration: veyeter diverey aviyam vekhׇl-asher ashah halvo-hem khetuviym al-sefer diverey hayamiym lemalekhey yehudah umilechamah hayetah veyn aviyam uveyn yarׇveam

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׁכַּ֤ב אֲבִיָּם֙ עִם־אֲבֹתָ֔יו וַיִּקְבְּר֥וּ אֹת֖וֹ בְּעִ֣יר דָּוִ֑ד וַיִּמְלֹ֛ךְ אָסָ֥א בְנ֖וֹ תַּחְתָּֽיו׃ {פ}
Translated: Abijam rested with his ancestors; he was buried in the City of David, and his son Asa succeeded him as king.
Transliteration: vayishekhav aviyam im-avotayv vayikeveru otvo veiyr david vayimelokhe asa venvo tachetayv {f}

Hebrew: וּבִשְׁנַ֣ת עֶשְׂרִ֔ים לְיָרׇבְעָ֖ם מֶ֣לֶךְ יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל מָלַ֥ךְ אָסָ֖א מֶ֥לֶךְ יְהוּדָֽה׃
Translated: In the twentieth year of King Jeroboam of Israel, Asa became king over Judah.
Transliteration: uvishenat esheriym leyarׇveam melekhe yisherael malakhe asa melekhe yehudah

Hebrew: וְאַרְבָּעִ֤ים וְאַחַת֙ שָׁנָ֔ה מָלַ֖ךְ בִּירוּשָׁלָ֑͏ִם וְשֵׁ֣ם אִמּ֔וֹ מַעֲכָ֖ה בַּת־אֲבִישָׁלֽוֹם׃
Translated: He reigned forty-one years in Jerusalem; his mother’s name was Maacah daughter of Abishalom.
Transliteration: vearevaiym veachat shanah malakhe viyrushala͏im veshem imvo maakhah vat-aviyshalvom

Hebrew: וַיַּ֧עַשׂ אָסָ֛א הַיָּשָׁ֖ר בְּעֵינֵ֣י יְהֹוָ֑ה כְּדָוִ֖ד אָבִֽיו׃
Translated: Asa did what was pleasing to G<small>OD</small>, as his forefather David had done.
Transliteration: vayaash asa hayashar veeyney yehovah khedavid aviyv

Hebrew: וַיַּעֲבֵ֥ר הַקְּדֵשִׁ֖ים מִן־הָאָ֑רֶץ וַיָּ֙סַר֙ אֶת־כׇּל־הַגִּלֻּלִ֔ים אֲשֶׁ֥ר עָשׂ֖וּ אֲבֹתָֽיו׃
Translated: He expelled the consecrated workers from the land, and he removed all the idols that his ancestors had made.
Transliteration: vayaaver hakedeshiym min-haarets vayasar et-khׇl-hagiluliym asher ashu avotayv

Hebrew: וְגַ֣ם ׀ אֶת־מַעֲכָ֣ה אִמּ֗וֹ וַיְסִרֶ֙הָ֙ מִגְּבִירָ֔ה אֲשֶׁר־עָשְׂתָ֥ה מִפְלֶ֖צֶת לָאֲשֵׁרָ֑ה וַיִּכְרֹ֤ת אָסָא֙ אֶת־מִפְלַצְתָּ֔הּ וַיִּשְׂרֹ֖ף בְּנַ֥חַל קִדְרֽוֹן׃
Translated: He also deposed his mother Maacah from the rank of queen mother, because she had made an abominable thing for [the goddess] Asherah. Asa cut down her abominable thing and burnt it in the Wadi Kidron.
Transliteration: vegam et-maakhah imvo vayesireha migeviyrah asher-ashetah mifeletset laasherah vayikherot asa et-mifelatsetah vayisherof venachal kidervon

Hebrew: וְהַבָּמ֖וֹת לֹא־סָ֑רוּ רַ֣ק לְבַב־אָסָ֗א הָיָ֥ה שָׁלֵ֛ם עִם־יְהֹוָ֖ה כׇּל־יָמָֽיו׃ {ס}
Translated: The shrines, indeed, were not abolished; however, Asa was wholehearted with the Eternal his God all his life.
Transliteration: vehavamvot lo-saru rak levav-asa hayah shalem im-yehovah khׇl-yamayv {s}

Hebrew: וַיָּבֵא֙ אֶת־קׇדְשֵׁ֣י אָבִ֔יו (וקדשו) [וְקׇדְשֵׁ֖י] בֵּ֣ית יְהֹוָ֑ה כֶּ֥סֶף וְזָהָ֖ב וְכֵלִֽים׃
Translated: He brought into the House of G<small>OD</small> all the consecrated things of his father and his own consecrated things—silver, gold, and utensils.
Transliteration: vayave et-kׇdeshey aviyv (vkdshv) [vekׇdeshey] veyt yehovah khesef vezahav vekheliym

Hebrew: וּמִלְחָמָ֨ה הָיְתָ֜ה בֵּ֣ין אָסָ֗א וּבֵ֛ין בַּעְשָׁ֥א מֶלֶךְ־יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל כׇּל־יְמֵיהֶֽם׃
Translated: There was war between Asa and King Baasha of Israel all their days.
Transliteration: umilechamah hayetah veyn asa uveyn vaesha melekhe-yisherael khׇl-yemeyhem

Hebrew: וַיַּ֨עַל בַּעְשָׁ֤א מֶֽלֶךְ־יִשְׂרָאֵל֙ עַל־יְהוּדָ֔ה וַיִּ֖בֶן אֶת־הָרָמָ֑ה לְבִלְתִּ֗י תֵּ֚ת יֹצֵ֣א וָבָ֔א לְאָסָ֖א מֶ֥לֶךְ יְהוּדָֽה׃
Translated: King Baasha of Israel advanced against Judah, and he fortified Ramah to prevent anyone belonging to King Asa of Judah from going out or coming in.
Transliteration: vayaal vaesha melekhe-yisherael al-yehudah vayiven et-haramah leviletiy tet yotse vava leasa melekhe yehudah

Hebrew: וַיִּקַּ֣ח אָ֠סָ֠א אֶת־כׇּל־הַכֶּ֨סֶף וְהַזָּהָ֜ב הַנּוֹתָרִ֣ים ׀ בְּאוֹצְר֣וֹת בֵּית־יְהֹוָ֗ה וְאֶת־אֽוֹצְרוֹת֙ בֵּ֣ית (מלך) [הַמֶּ֔לֶךְ] וַֽיִּתְּנֵ֖ם בְּיַד־עֲבָדָ֑יו וַיִּשְׁלָחֵ֞ם הַמֶּ֣לֶךְ אָסָ֗א אֶל־בֶּן־הֲ֠דַ֠ד בֶּן־טַבְרִמֹּ֤ן בֶּן־חֶזְיוֹן֙ מֶ֣לֶךְ אֲרָ֔ם הַיֹּשֵׁ֥ב בְּדַמֶּ֖שֶׂק לֵאמֹֽר׃
Translated: So Asa took all the silver and gold that remained in the treasuries of the House of G<small>OD</small> as well as the treasuries of the royal palace, and he entrusted them to his officials. King Asa sent them to King Ben-hadad son of Tabrimmon son of Hezion of Aram, who resided in Damascus, with this message:
Transliteration: vayikach asa et-khׇl-hakhesef vehazahav hanvotariym vevotservot veyt-yehovah veet-votservot veyt (mlkh) [hamelekhe] vayitenem veyad-avadayv vayishelachem hamelekhe asa el-ven-hadad ven-taverimon ven-chezeyvon melekhe aram hayoshev vedameshek lemor

Hebrew: בְּרִית֙ בֵּינִ֣י וּבֵינֶ֔ךָ בֵּ֥ין אָבִ֖י וּבֵ֣ין אָבִ֑יךָ הִנֵּה֩ שָׁלַ֨חְתִּי לְךָ֥ שֹׁ֙חַד֙ כֶּ֣סֶף וְזָהָ֔ב לֵ֣ךְ הָפֵ֗רָה אֶת־בְּרִֽיתְךָ֙ אֶת־בַּעְשָׁ֣א מֶלֶךְ־יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל וְיַעֲלֶ֖ה מֵֽעָלָֽי׃
Translated: “There is a pact between you and me, and between your father and my father. I herewith send you a gift of silver and gold: Go and break your pact with King Baasha of Israel, so that he may withdraw from me.”
Transliteration: veriyt veyniy uveynekha veyn aviy uveyn aviykha hineh shalachetiy lekha shochad khesef vezahav lekhe haferah et-veriytekha et-vaesha melekhe-yisherael veyaaleh mealay

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׁמַ֨ע בֶּן־הֲדַ֜ד אֶל־הַמֶּ֣לֶךְ אָסָ֗א וַ֠יִּשְׁלַ֠ח אֶת־שָׂרֵ֨י הַחֲיָלִ֤ים אֲשֶׁר־לוֹ֙ עַל־עָרֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל וַיַּךְ֙ אֶת־עִיּ֣וֹן וְאֶת־דָּ֔ן וְאֵ֖ת אָבֵ֣ל בֵּֽית־מַעֲכָ֑ה וְאֵת֙ כׇּל־כִּנְר֔וֹת עַ֖ל כׇּל־אֶ֥רֶץ נַפְתָּלִֽי׃
Translated: Ben-hadad responded to King Asa’s request; he sent his army officers against the towns of Israel and captured Ijon, Dan, Abel-beth-maacah, and all Chinneroth, as well as all the land of Naphtali.
Transliteration: vayishema ven-hadad el-hamelekhe asa vayishelach et-sharey hachayaliym asher-lvo al-arey yisherael vayakhe et-iyyvon veet-dan veet avel veyt-maakhah veet khׇl-khinervot al khׇl-erets nafetaliy

Hebrew: וַֽיְהִי֙ כִּשְׁמֹ֣עַ בַּעְשָׁ֔א וַיֶּחְדַּ֕ל מִבְּנ֖וֹת אֶת־הָרָמָ֑ה וַיֵּ֖שֶׁב בְּתִרְצָֽה׃
Translated: When Baasha heard about it, he stopped fortifying Ramah and remained in Tirzah.
Transliteration: vayehiy khishemoa vaesha vayechedal mivenvot et-haramah vayeshev vetiretsah

Hebrew: וְהַמֶּ֨לֶךְ אָסָ֜א הִשְׁמִ֤יעַ אֶת־כׇּל־יְהוּדָה֙ אֵ֣ין נָקִ֔י וַיִּשְׂא֞וּ אֶת־אַבְנֵ֤י הָֽרָמָה֙ וְאֶת־עֵצֶ֔יהָ אֲשֶׁ֥ר בָּנָ֖ה בַּעְשָׁ֑א וַיִּ֤בֶן בָּם֙ הַמֶּ֣לֶךְ אָסָ֔א אֶת־גֶּ֥בַע בִּנְיָמִ֖ן וְאֶת־הַמִּצְפָּֽה׃
Translated: Then King Asa mustered all Judah, with no exemptions; and they carried away the stones and timber with which Baasha had fortified Ramah. With these King Asa fortified Geba of Benjamin, and Mizpah.
Transliteration: vehamelekhe asa hishemiya et-khׇl-yehudah eyn nakiy vayisheu et-aveney haramah veet-etseyha asher vanah vaesha vayiven vam hamelekhe asa et-geva vineyamin veet-hamitsefah

Hebrew: וְיֶ֣תֶר כׇּל־דִּבְרֵֽי־אָ֠סָ֠א וְכׇל־גְּב֨וּרָת֜וֹ וְכׇל־אֲשֶׁ֣ר עָשָׂ֗ה וְהֶֽעָרִים֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר בָּנָ֔ה הֲלֹא־הֵ֣מָּה כְתוּבִ֗ים עַל־סֵ֛פֶר דִּבְרֵ֥י הַיָּמִ֖ים לְמַלְכֵ֣י יְהוּדָ֑ה רַ֚ק לְעֵ֣ת זִקְנָת֔וֹ חָלָ֖ה אֶת־רַגְלָֽיו׃
Translated: All the other events of Asa’s reign, and all his exploits, and all his actions, and the towns that he fortified, are recorded in the Annals of the Kings of Judah. However, in his old age he suffered from a foot ailment.
Transliteration: veyeter khׇl-diverey-asa vekhׇl-gevuratvo vekhׇl-asher ashah veheariym asher vanah halo-hemah khetuviym al-sefer diverey hayamiym lemalekhey yehudah rak leet zikenatvo chalah et-ragelayv

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׁכַּ֤ב אָסָא֙ עִם־אֲבֹתָ֔יו וַיִּקָּבֵר֙ עִם־אֲבֹתָ֔יו בְּעִ֖יר דָּוִ֣ד אָבִ֑יו וַיִּמְלֹ֛ךְ יְהוֹשָׁפָ֥ט בְּנ֖וֹ תַּחְתָּֽיו׃ {פ}
Translated: Asa rested with his ancestors and was buried with his ancestors in the city of his forefather David. His son Jehoshaphat succeeded him as king.
Transliteration: vayishekhav asa im-avotayv vayikaver im-avotayv veiyr david aviyv vayimelokhe yehvoshafat venvo tachetayv {f}

Hebrew: וְנָדָ֣ב בֶּן־יָרׇבְעָ֗ם מָלַךְ֙ עַל־יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל בִּשְׁנַ֣ת שְׁתַּ֔יִם לְאָסָ֖א מֶ֣לֶךְ יְהוּדָ֑ה וַיִּמְלֹ֥ךְ עַל־יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל שְׁנָתָֽיִם׃
Translated: Nadab son of Jeroboam had become king over Israel in the second year of King Asa of Judah, and he reigned over Israel for two years.
Transliteration: venadav ven-yarׇveam malakhe al-yisherael vishenat shetayiim leasa melekhe yehudah vayimelokhe al-yisherael shenatayiim

Hebrew: וַיַּ֥עַשׂ הָרַ֖ע בְּעֵינֵ֣י יְהֹוָ֑ה וַיֵּ֙לֶךְ֙ בְּדֶ֣רֶךְ אָבִ֔יו וּ֨בְחַטָּאת֔וֹ אֲשֶׁ֥ר הֶחֱטִ֖יא אֶת־יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated: He did what was displeasing to G<small>OD</small>; he continued in the ways of his father, in the sins that he caused Israel to commit.
Transliteration: vayaash hara veeyney yehovah vayelekhe vederekhe aviyv uvechatatvo asher hechetiy et-yisherael

Hebrew: וַיִּקְשֹׁ֨ר עָלָ֜יו בַּעְשָׁ֤א בֶן־אֲחִיָּה֙ לְבֵ֣ית יִשָּׂשכָ֔ר וַיַּכֵּ֣הוּ בַעְשָׁ֔א בְּגִבְּת֖וֹן אֲשֶׁ֣ר לַפְּלִשְׁתִּ֑ים וְנָדָב֙ וְכׇל־יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל צָרִ֖ים עַֽל־גִּבְּתֽוֹן׃
Translated: Then Baasha son of Ahijah, of the House of Issachar, conspired against him; and Baasha struck him down at Gibbethon of the Philistines, while Nadab and all Israel were laying siege to Gibbethon.
Transliteration: vayikeshor alayv vaesha ven-achiyah leveyt yishashkhar vayakhehu vaesha vegivetvon asher lafelishetiym venadav vekhׇl-yisherael tsariym al-givetvon

Hebrew: וַיְמִתֵ֣הוּ בַעְשָׁ֔א בִּשְׁנַ֣ת שָׁלֹ֔שׁ לְאָסָ֖א מֶ֣לֶךְ יְהוּדָ֑ה וַיִּמְלֹ֖ךְ תַּחְתָּֽיו׃
Translated: Baasha killed him in the third year of King Asa of Judah and became king in his stead.
Transliteration: vayemitehu vaesha vishenat shalosh leasa melekhe yehudah vayimelokhe tachetayv

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֣י כְמׇלְכ֗וֹ הִכָּה֙ אֶת־כׇּל־בֵּ֣ית יָרׇבְעָ֔ם לֹא־הִשְׁאִ֧יר כׇּל־נְשָׁמָ֛ה לְיָרׇבְעָ֖ם עַד־הִשְׁמִד֑וֹ כִּדְבַ֣ר יְהֹוָ֔ה אֲשֶׁ֣ר דִּבֶּ֔ר בְּיַד־עַבְדּ֖וֹ אֲחִיָּ֥ה הַשִּׁילֹנִֽי׃
Translated: As soon as he became king, he struck down all the House of Jeroboam; he did not spare a single soul belonging to Jeroboam until he destroyed it—in accordance with the word spoken through G<small>OD</small>’s servant Ahijah the Shilonite—
Transliteration: vayehiy khemׇlekhvo hikhah et-khׇl-veyt yarׇveam lo-hisheiyr khׇl-neshamah leyarׇveam ad-hishemidvo khidevar yehovah asher diver veyad-avedvo achiyah hashiyloniy

Hebrew: עַל־חַטֹּ֤אות יָֽרׇבְעָם֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר חָטָ֔א וַאֲשֶׁ֥ר הֶחֱטִ֖יא אֶת־יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל בְּכַעְס֕וֹ אֲשֶׁ֣ר הִכְעִ֔יס אֶת־יְהֹוָ֖ה אֱלֹהֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated: because of the sins that Jeroboam committed and that he caused Israel to commit, thereby provoking the anger of the E<small>TERNAL</small>, the God of Israel.
Transliteration: al-chatovt yarׇveam asher chata vaasher hechetiy et-yisherael vekhaesvo asher hikheiys et-yehovah elohey yisherael

Hebrew: וְיֶ֛תֶר דִּבְרֵ֥י נָדָ֖ב וְכׇל־אֲשֶׁ֣ר עָשָׂ֑ה הֲלֹא־הֵ֣ם כְּתוּבִ֗ים עַל־סֵ֛פֶר דִּבְרֵ֥י הַיָּמִ֖ים לְמַלְכֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated: The other events of Nadab’s reign and all his actions are recorded in the Annals of the Kings of Israel.
Transliteration: veyeter diverey nadav vekhׇl-asher ashah halo-hem khetuviym al-sefer diverey hayamiym lemalekhey yisherael

Hebrew: וּמִלְחָמָ֨ה הָיְתָ֜ה בֵּ֣ין אָסָ֗א וּבֵ֛ין בַּעְשָׁ֥א מֶֽלֶךְ־יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל כׇּל־יְמֵיהֶֽם׃ {פ}
Translated: There was war between Asa and King Baasha of Israel all their days.
Transliteration: umilechamah hayetah veyn asa uveyn vaesha melekhe-yisherael khׇl-yemeyhem {f}

Hebrew: בִּשְׁנַ֣ת שָׁלֹ֔שׁ לְאָסָ֖א מֶ֣לֶךְ יְהוּדָ֑ה מָ֠לַ֠ךְ בַּעְשָׁ֨א בֶן־אֲחִיָּ֤ה עַל־כׇּל־יִשְׂרָאֵל֙ בְּתִרְצָ֔ה עֶשְׂרִ֥ים וְאַרְבַּ֖ע שָׁנָֽה׃
Translated: In the third year of King Asa of Judah, Baasha son of Ahijah became king in Tirzah over all Israel—for twenty-four years.
Transliteration: vishenat shalosh leasa melekhe yehudah malakhe vaesha ven-achiyah al-khׇl-yisherael vetiretsah esheriym veareva shanah

Hebrew: וַיַּ֥עַשׂ הָרַ֖ע בְּעֵינֵ֣י יְהֹוָ֑ה וַיֵּ֙לֶךְ֙ בְּדֶ֣רֶךְ יָרׇבְעָ֔ם וּ֨בְחַטָּאת֔וֹ אֲשֶׁ֥ר הֶחֱטִ֖יא אֶת־יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃ {ס}
Translated: He did what was displeasing to G<small>OD</small>; he followed the ways of Jeroboam and the sins that he caused Israel to commit.
Transliteration: vayaash hara veeyney yehovah vayelekhe vederekhe yarׇveam uvechatatvo asher hechetiy et-yisherael {s}

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֤י דְבַר־יְהֹוָה֙ אֶל־יֵה֣וּא בֶן־חֲנָ֔נִי עַל־בַּעְשָׁ֖א לֵאמֹֽר׃
Translated: The word of G<small>OD</small> came to Jehu son of Hanani against Baasha:
Transliteration: vayehiy devar-yehovah el-eihu ven-chananiy al-vaesha lemor

Hebrew: יַ֗עַן אֲשֶׁ֤ר הֲרִימֹתִ֙יךָ֙ מִן־הֶ֣עָפָ֔ר וָאֶתֶּנְךָ֣ נָגִ֔יד עַ֖ל עַמִּ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל וַתֵּ֣לֶךְ ׀ בְּדֶ֣רֶךְ יָרׇבְעָ֗ם וַֽתַּחֲטִא֙ אֶת־עַמִּ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל לְהַכְעִיסֵ֖נִי בְּחַטֹּאתָֽם׃
Translated: “Because I lifted you up from the dust and made you a ruler over My people Israel, but you followed the way of Jeroboam and caused My people Israel to sin, provoking My anger with their sins—
Transliteration: yaan asher hariymotiykha min-heafar vaetenekha nagiyd al amiy yisherael vatelekhe vederekhe yarׇveam vatachati et-amiy yisherael lehakheiyseniy vechatotam

Hebrew: הִנְנִ֥י מַבְעִ֛יר אַחֲרֵ֥י בַעְשָׁ֖א וְאַחֲרֵ֣י בֵית֑וֹ וְנָֽתַתִּי֙ אֶת־בֵּ֣יתְךָ֔ כְּבֵ֖ית יָרׇבְעָ֥ם בֶּן־נְבָֽט׃
Translated: I am going to sweep away Baasha and his house. I will make your house like the House of Jeroboam son of Nebat.
Transliteration: hineniy maveiyr acharey vaesha veacharey veytvo venatatiy et-veytekha kheveyt yarׇveam ven-nevat

Hebrew: הַמֵּ֤ת לְבַעְשָׁא֙ בָּעִ֔יר יֹאכְל֖וּ הַכְּלָבִ֑ים וְהַמֵּ֥ת לוֹ֙ בַּשָּׂדֶ֔ה יֹאכְל֖וּ ע֥וֹף הַשָּׁמָֽיִם׃
Translated: Anyone belonging to Baasha who dies in the town shall be devoured by dogs, and anyone belonging to him who dies in the open country shall be devoured by the birds of the sky.”
Transliteration: hamet levaesha vaiyr yokhelu hakhelaviym vehamet lvo vashadeh yokhelu vof hashamayiim

Hebrew: וְיֶ֨תֶר דִּבְרֵ֥י בַעְשָׁ֛א וַאֲשֶׁ֥ר עָשָׂ֖ה וּגְבוּרָת֑וֹ הֲלֹא־הֵ֣ם כְּתוּבִ֗ים עַל־סֵ֛פֶר דִּבְרֵ֥י הַיָּמִ֖ים לְמַלְכֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated: The other events of Baasha’s reign and his actions and his exploits are recorded in the Annals of the Kings of Israel.
Transliteration: veyeter diverey vaesha vaasher ashah ugevuratvo halo-hem khetuviym al-sefer diverey hayamiym lemalekhey yisherael

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׁכַּ֤ב בַּעְשָׁא֙ עִם־אֲבֹתָ֔יו וַיִּקָּבֵ֖ר בְּתִרְצָ֑ה וַיִּמְלֹ֛ךְ אֵלָ֥ה בְנ֖וֹ תַּחְתָּֽיו׃
Translated: Baasha rested with his ancestors and was buried in Tirzah. His son Elah succeeded him as king.
Transliteration: vayishekhav vaesha im-avotayv vayikaver vetiretsah vayimelokhe elah venvo tachetayv

Hebrew: וְגַ֡ם בְּיַד־יֵה֨וּא בֶן־חֲנָ֜נִי הַנָּבִ֗יא דְּבַר־יְהֹוָ֡ה הָיָה֩ אֶל־בַּעְשָׁ֨א וְאֶל־בֵּית֜וֹ וְעַ֥ל כׇּל־הָרָעָ֣ה ׀ אֲשֶׁר־עָשָׂ֣ה ׀ בְּעֵינֵ֣י יְהֹוָ֗ה לְהַכְעִיסוֹ֙ בְּמַעֲשֵׂ֣ה יָדָ֔יו לִֽהְי֖וֹת כְּבֵ֣ית יָרׇבְעָ֑ם וְעַ֥ל אֲשֶׁר־הִכָּ֖ה אֹתֽוֹ׃ {פ}
Translated: But the word of G<small>OD</small> had come through the prophet Jehu son of Hanani against Baasha and against his house, that it would fare like the House of Jeroboam, which he himself had struck down, because of all the evil he did that was displeasing to G<small>OD</small>, provoking anger with his deeds.
Transliteration: vegam veyad-eihu ven-chananiy hanaviy devar-yehovah hayah el-vaesha veel-veytvo veal khׇl-haraah asher-ashah veeyney yehovah lehakheiysvo vemaasheh yadayv liheyvot kheveyt yarׇveam veal asher-hikhah otvo {f}

Hebrew: בִּשְׁנַ֨ת עֶשְׂרִ֤ים וָשֵׁשׁ֙ שָׁנָ֔ה לְאָסָ֖א מֶ֣לֶךְ יְהוּדָ֑ה מָ֠לַ֠ךְ אֵלָ֨ה בֶן־בַּעְשָׁ֧א עַל־יִשְׂרָאֵ֛ל בְּתִרְצָ֖ה שְׁנָתָֽיִם׃
Translated: In the twenty-sixth year of King Asa of Judah, Elah son of Baasha became king over Israel, at Tirzah—for two years.
Transliteration: vishenat esheriym vashesh shanah leasa melekhe yehudah malakhe elah ven-vaesha al-yisherael vetiretsah shenatayiim

Hebrew: וַיִּקְשֹׁ֤ר עָלָיו֙ עַבְדּ֣וֹ זִמְרִ֔י שַׂ֖ר מַחֲצִ֣ית הָרָ֑כֶב וְה֤וּא בְתִרְצָה֙ שֹׁתֶ֣ה שִׁכּ֔וֹר בֵּ֣ית אַרְצָ֔א אֲשֶׁ֥ר עַל־הַבַּ֖יִת בְּתִרְצָֽה׃
Translated: His officer Zimri, commander of half the chariotry, committed treason against him while he was at Tirzah drinking himself drunk in the house of Arza, who was in charge of the palace at Tirzah.
Transliteration: vayikeshor alayv avedvo zimeriy shar machatsiyt harakhev vehu vetiretsah shoteh shikhvor veyt aretsa asher al-havayiit vetiretsah

Hebrew: וַיָּבֹ֤א זִמְרִי֙ וַיַּכֵּ֣הוּ וַיְמִיתֵ֔הוּ בִּשְׁנַת֙ עֶשְׂרִ֣ים וָשֶׁ֔בַע לְאָסָ֖א מֶ֣לֶךְ יְהוּדָ֑ה וַיִּמְלֹ֖ךְ תַּחְתָּֽיו׃
Translated: Zimri entered, struck him down, and killed him; he succeeded him as king in the twenty-seventh year of King Asa of Judah.
Transliteration: vayavo zimeriy vayakhehu vayemiytehu vishenat esheriym vasheva leasa melekhe yehudah vayimelokhe tachetayv

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֨י בְמׇלְכ֜וֹ כְּשִׁבְתּ֣וֹ עַל־כִּסְא֗וֹ הִכָּה֙ אֶת־כׇּל־בֵּ֣ית בַּעְשָׁ֔א לֹא־הִשְׁאִ֥יר ל֖וֹ מַשְׁתִּ֣ין בְּקִ֑יר וְגֹאֲלָ֖יו וְרֵעֵֽהוּ׃
Translated: No sooner had he become king and ascended the throne than he struck down all the House of Baasha; he did not leave a single male of his, nor any kin or friend.
Transliteration: vayehiy vemׇlekhvo kheshivetvo al-khisevo hikhah et-khׇl-veyt vaesha lo-hisheiyr lvo mashetiyn vekiyr vegoalayv vereehu

Hebrew: וַיַּשְׁמֵ֣ד זִמְרִ֔י אֵ֖ת כׇּל־בֵּ֣ית בַּעְשָׁ֑א כִּדְבַ֤ר יְהֹוָה֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר דִּבֶּ֣ר אֶל־בַּעְשָׁ֔א בְּיַ֖ד יֵה֥וּא הַנָּבִֽיא׃
Translated: Thus Zimri destroyed all the House of Baasha, in accordance with the word that G<small>OD</small> had spoken through the prophet Jehu—
Transliteration: vayashemed zimeriy et khׇl-veyt vaesha khidevar yehovah asher diver el-vaesha veyad eihu hanaviy

Hebrew: אֶ֚ל כׇּל־חַטֹּ֣אות בַּעְשָׁ֔א וְחַטֹּ֖אות אֵלָ֣ה בְנ֑וֹ אֲשֶׁ֣ר חָטְא֗וּ וַאֲשֶׁ֤ר הֶחֱטִ֙יאוּ֙ אֶת־יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל לְהַכְעִ֗יס אֶת־יְהֹוָ֛ה אֱלֹהֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל בְּהַבְלֵיהֶֽם׃
Translated: because of the sinful acts that Baasha and his son Elah committed, and that they caused Israel to commit, provoking the anger of the E<small>TERNAL</small>, the God of Israel, with their false gods.
Transliteration: el khׇl-chatovt vaesha vechatovt elah venvo asher chateu vaasher hechetiyu et-yisherael lehakheiys et-yehovah elohey yisherael vehaveleyhem

Hebrew: וְיֶ֛תֶר דִּבְרֵ֥י אֵלָ֖ה וְכׇל־אֲשֶׁ֣ר עָשָׂ֑ה הֲלוֹא־הֵ֣ם כְּתוּבִ֗ים עַל־סֵ֛פֶר דִּבְרֵ֥י הַיָּמִ֖ים לְמַלְכֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃ {פ}
Translated: The other events of Elah’s reign and all his actions are recorded in the Annals of the Kings of Israel.
Transliteration: veyeter diverey elah vekhׇl-asher ashah halvo-hem khetuviym al-sefer diverey hayamiym lemalekhey yisherael {f}

Hebrew: בִּשְׁנַת֩ עֶשְׂרִ֨ים וָשֶׁ֜בַע שָׁנָ֗ה לְאָסָא֙ מֶ֣לֶךְ יְהוּדָ֔ה מָלַ֥ךְ זִמְרִ֛י שִׁבְעַ֥ת יָמִ֖ים בְּתִרְצָ֑ה וְהָעָ֣ם חֹנִ֔ים עַֽל־גִּבְּת֖וֹן אֲשֶׁ֥ר לַפְּלִשְׁתִּֽים׃
Translated: During the twenty-seventh year of King Asa of Judah, Zimri reigned in Tirzah for seven days. At the time, the troops were encamped at Gibbethon of the Philistines.
Transliteration: vishenat esheriym vasheva shanah leasa melekhe yehudah malakhe zimeriy shiveat yamiym vetiretsah vehaam choniym al-givetvon asher lafelishetiym

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׁמַ֤ע הָעָם֙ הַחֹנִ֣ים לֵאמֹ֔ר קָשַׁ֣ר זִמְרִ֔י וְגַ֖ם הִכָּ֣ה אֶת־הַמֶּ֑לֶךְ וַיַּמְלִ֣כוּ כׇֽל־יִ֠שְׂרָאֵ֠ל אֶת־עׇמְרִ֨י שַׂר־צָבָ֧א עַל־יִשְׂרָאֵ֛ל בַּיּ֥וֹם הַה֖וּא בַּֽמַּחֲנֶֽה׃
Translated: When the troops who were encamped there learned that Zimri had committed treason and had struck down the king, that very day, in the camp, all Israel acclaimed the army commander Omri king over Israel.
Transliteration: vayishema haam hachoniym lemor kashar zimeriy vegam hikhah et-hamelekhe vayamelikhu khׇl-yisherael et-ׇmeriy shar-tsava al-yisherael vayyvom hahu vamachaneh

Hebrew: וַיַּעֲלֶ֥ה עׇמְרִ֛י וְכׇל־יִשְׂרָאֵ֥ל עִמּ֖וֹ מִֽגִּבְּת֑וֹן וַיָּצֻ֖רוּ עַל־תִּרְצָֽה׃
Translated: Omri and all Israel then withdrew from Gibbethon and laid siege to Tirzah.
Transliteration: vayaaleh ׇmeriy vekhׇl-yisherael imvo migivetvon vayatsuru al-tiretsah

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֞י כִּרְא֤וֹת זִמְרִי֙ כִּֽי־נִלְכְּדָ֣ה הָעִ֔יר וַיָּבֹ֖א אֶל־אַרְמ֣וֹן בֵּית־הַמֶּ֑לֶךְ וַיִּשְׂרֹ֨ף עָלָ֧יו אֶת־בֵּֽית־מֶ֛לֶךְ בָּאֵ֖שׁ וַיָּמֹֽת׃
Translated: When Zimri saw that the town was taken, he went into the citadel of the royal palace and burned down the royal palace over himself. And so he died—
Transliteration: vayehiy khirevot zimeriy khiy-nilekhedah haiyr vayavo el-aremvon veyt-hamelekhe vayisherof alayv et-veyt-melekhe vaesh vayamot

Hebrew: עַל־חַטֹּאתָיו֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר חָטָ֔א לַעֲשׂ֥וֹת הָרַ֖ע בְּעֵינֵ֣י יְהֹוָ֑ה לָלֶ֙כֶת֙ בְּדֶ֣רֶךְ יָרׇבְעָ֔ם וּבְחַטָּאתוֹ֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר עָשָׂ֔ה לְהַחֲטִ֖יא אֶת־יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated: because of the sins that he committed and caused Israel to commit, doing what was displeasing to G<small>OD</small> and following the ways of Jeroboam.
Transliteration: al-chatotayv asher chata laashvot hara veeyney yehovah lalekhet vederekhe yarׇveam uvechatatvo asher ashah lehachatiy et-yisherael

Hebrew: וְיֶ֙תֶר֙ דִּבְרֵ֣י זִמְרִ֔י וְקִשְׁר֖וֹ אֲשֶׁ֣ר קָשָׁ֑ר הֲלֹא־הֵ֣ם כְּתוּבִ֗ים עַל־סֵ֛פֶר דִּבְרֵ֥י הַיָּמִ֖ים לְמַלְכֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃ {פ}
Translated: The other events of Zimri’s reign, and the treason that he committed, are recorded in the Annals of the Kings of Israel.
Transliteration: veyeter diverey zimeriy vekishervo asher kashar halo-hem khetuviym al-sefer diverey hayamiym lemalekhey yisherael {f}

Hebrew: אָ֧ז יֵחָלֵ֛ק הָעָ֥ם יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל לַחֵ֑צִי חֲצִ֨י הָעָ֜ם הָ֠יָ֠ה אַחֲרֵ֨י תִבְנִ֤י בֶן־גִּינַת֙ לְהַמְלִיכ֔וֹ וְהַחֲצִ֖י אַחֲרֵ֥י עׇמְרִֽי׃
Translated: Then the people of Israel split into two factions: a part of the people followed Tibni son of Ginath to make him king, and the other part followed Omri.
Transliteration: az eichalek haam yisherael lachetsiy chatsiy haam hayah acharey tiveniy ven-giynat lehameliykhvo vehachatsiy acharey ׇmeriy

Hebrew: וַיֶּחֱזַ֤ק הָעָם֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר אַחֲרֵ֣י עׇמְרִ֔י אֶת־הָעָ֕ם אֲשֶׁ֥ר אַחֲרֵ֖י תִּבְנִ֣י בֶן־גִּינַ֑ת וַיָּ֣מׇת תִּבְנִ֔י וַיִּמְלֹ֖ךְ עׇמְרִֽי׃ {פ}
Translated: Those who followed Omri proved stronger than those who followed Tibni son of Ginath; Tibni died and Omri became king.
Transliteration: vayechezak haam asher acharey ׇmeriy et-haam asher acharey tiveniy ven-giynat vayamׇt tiveniy vayimelokhe ׇmeriy {f}

Hebrew: בִּשְׁנַת֩ שְׁלֹשִׁ֨ים וְאַחַ֜ת שָׁנָ֗ה לְאָסָא֙ מֶ֣לֶךְ יְהוּדָ֔ה מָלַ֤ךְ עׇמְרִי֙ עַל־יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל שְׁתֵּ֥ים עֶשְׂרֵ֖ה שָׁנָ֑ה בְּתִרְצָ֖ה מָלַ֥ךְ שֵׁשׁ־שָׁנִֽים׃
Translated: In the thirty-first year of King Asa of Judah, Omri became king over Israel—for twelve years. He reigned in Tirzah six years.
Transliteration: vishenat sheloshiym veachat shanah leasa melekhe yehudah malakhe ׇmeriy al-yisherael sheteym eshereh shanah vetiretsah malakhe shesh-shaniym

Hebrew: וַיִּ֜קֶן אֶת־הָהָ֥ר שֹׁמְר֛וֹן מֵ֥אֶת שֶׁ֖מֶר בְּכִכְּרַ֣יִם כָּ֑סֶף וַיִּ֙בֶן֙ אֶת־הָהָ֔ר וַיִּקְרָ֗א אֶת־שֵׁ֤ם הָעִיר֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר בָּנָ֔ה עַ֣ל שֶׁם־שֶׁ֔מֶר אֲדֹנֵ֖י הָהָ֥ר שֹׁמְרֽוֹן׃
Translated: Then he bought the hill of Samaria from Shemer for two talents of silver; he built [a town] on the hill and named the town that he built Samaria, after Shemer, the owner of the hill.
Transliteration: vayiken et-hahar shomervon meet shemer vekhikherayiim khasef vayiven et-hahar vayikera et-shem haiyr asher vanah al shem-shemer adoney hahar shomervon

Hebrew: וַיַּעֲשֶׂ֥ה עׇמְרִ֛י הָרַ֖ע בְּעֵינֵ֣י יְהֹוָ֑ה וַיָּ֕רַע מִכֹּ֖ל אֲשֶׁ֥ר לְפָנָֽיו׃
Translated: Omri did what was displeasing to G<small>OD</small>; he was worse than all who preceded him.
Transliteration: vayaasheh ׇmeriy hara veeyney yehovah vayara mikhol asher lefanayv

Hebrew: וַיֵּ֗לֶךְ בְּכׇל־דֶּ֙רֶךְ֙ יָרׇבְעָ֣ם בֶּן־נְבָ֔ט (ובחטאתיו) [וּ֨בְחַטָּאת֔וֹ] אֲשֶׁ֥ר הֶחֱטִ֖יא אֶת־יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל לְהַכְעִ֗יס אֶת־יְהֹוָ֛ה אֱלֹהֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל בְּהַבְלֵיהֶֽם׃
Translated: He followed all the ways of Jeroboam son of Nebat and the sins that he committed and caused Israel to commit, provoking the anger of the E<small>TERNAL</small>, the God of Israel, with their futilities.
Transliteration: vayelekhe vekhׇl-derekhe yarׇveam ven-nevat (vvchttyv) [uvechatatvo] asher hechetiy et-yisherael lehakheiys et-yehovah elohey yisherael vehaveleyhem

Hebrew: וְיֶ֨תֶר דִּבְרֵ֤י עׇמְרִי֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר עָשָׂ֔ה וּגְבוּרָת֖וֹ אֲשֶׁ֣ר עָשָׂ֑ה הֲלֹא־הֵ֣ם כְּתוּבִ֗ים עַל־סֵ֛פֶר דִּבְרֵ֥י הַיָּמִ֖ים לְמַלְכֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated: The other events of Omri’s reign, [and] his actions, and the exploits he performed, are recorded in the Annals of the Kings of Israel.
Transliteration: veyeter diverey ׇmeriy asher ashah ugevuratvo asher ashah halo-hem khetuviym al-sefer diverey hayamiym lemalekhey yisherael

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׁכַּ֤ב עׇמְרִי֙ עִם־אֲבֹתָ֔יו וַיִּקָּבֵ֖ר בְּשֹׁמְר֑וֹן וַיִּמְלֹ֛ךְ אַחְאָ֥ב בְּנ֖וֹ תַּחְתָּֽיו׃ {פ}
Translated: Omri rested with his ancestors and was buried in Samaria; and his son Ahab succeeded him as king.
Transliteration: vayishekhav ׇmeriy im-avotayv vayikaver veshomervon vayimelokhe acheav venvo tachetayv {f}

Hebrew: וְאַחְאָ֣ב בֶּן־עׇמְרִ֗י מָלַךְ֙ עַל־יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל בִּשְׁנַ֨ת שְׁלֹשִׁ֤ים וּשְׁמֹנֶה֙ שָׁנָ֔ה לְאָסָ֖א מֶ֣לֶךְ יְהוּדָ֑ה וַ֠יִּמְלֹ֠ךְ אַחְאָ֨ב בֶּן־עׇמְרִ֤י עַל־יִשְׂרָאֵל֙ בְּשֹׁ֣מְר֔וֹן עֶשְׂרִ֥ים וּשְׁתַּ֖יִם שָׁנָֽה׃
Translated: Ahab son of Omri became king over Israel in the thirty-eighth year of King Asa of Judah, and Ahab son of Omri reigned over Israel in Samaria for twenty-two years.
Transliteration: veacheav ven-ׇmeriy malakhe al-yisherael vishenat sheloshiym ushemoneh shanah leasa melekhe yehudah vayimelokhe acheav ven-ׇmeriy al-yisherael veshomervon esheriym ushetayiim shanah

Hebrew: וַיַּ֨עַשׂ אַחְאָ֧ב בֶּן־עׇמְרִ֛י הָרַ֖ע בְּעֵינֵ֣י יְהֹוָ֑ה מִכֹּ֖ל אֲשֶׁ֥ר לְפָנָֽיו׃
Translated: Ahab son of Omri did what was displeasing to G<small>OD</small>, more than all who preceded him.
Transliteration: vayaash acheav ven-ׇmeriy hara veeyney yehovah mikhol asher lefanayv

Hebrew: וַֽיְהִי֙ הֲנָקֵ֣ל לֶכְתּ֔וֹ בְּחַטֹּ֖אות יָרׇבְעָ֣ם בֶּן־נְבָ֑ט וַיִּקַּ֨ח אִשָּׁ֜ה אֶת־אִיזֶ֗בֶל בַּת־אֶתְבַּ֙עַל֙ מֶ֣לֶךְ צִידֹנִ֔ים וַיֵּ֙לֶךְ֙ וַיַּעֲבֹ֣ד אֶת־הַבַּ֔עַל וַיִּשְׁתַּ֖חוּ לֽוֹ׃
Translated: Not content to follow the sins of Jeroboam son of Nebat, he took as wife Jezebel daughter of King Ethbaal of the Phoenicians, and he went and served Baal and worshiped him.
Transliteration: vayehiy hanakel lekhetvo vechatovt yarׇveam ven-nevat vayikach ishah et-iyzevel vat-etevaal melekhe tsiydoniym vayelekhe vayaavod et-havaal vayishetachu lvo

Hebrew: וַיָּ֥קֶם מִזְבֵּ֖חַ לַבָּ֑עַל בֵּ֣ית הַבַּ֔עַל אֲשֶׁ֥ר בָּנָ֖ה בְּשֹׁמְרֽוֹן׃
Translated: He erected an altar to Baal in the temple of Baal that he built in Samaria.
Transliteration: vayakem mizevecha lavaal veyt havaal asher vanah veshomervon

Hebrew: וַיַּ֥עַשׂ אַחְאָ֖ב אֶת־הָאֲשֵׁרָ֑ה וַיּ֨וֹסֶף אַחְאָ֜ב לַעֲשׂ֗וֹת לְהַכְעִיס֙ אֶת־יְהֹוָה֙ אֱלֹהֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל מִכֹּל֙ מַלְכֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל אֲשֶׁ֥ר הָי֖וּ לְפָנָֽיו׃
Translated: Ahab also made a sacred post. Ahab did more to provoke the anger of the E<small>TERNAL</small>, the God of Israel, than all the kings of Israel who preceded him.
Transliteration: vayaash acheav et-haasherah vayyvosef acheav laashvot lehakheiys et-yehovah elohey yisherael mikhol malekhey yisherael asher hayu lefanayv

Hebrew: בְּיָמָ֞יו בָּנָ֥ה חִיאֵ֛ל בֵּ֥ית הָאֱלִ֖י אֶת־יְרִיחֹ֑ה בַּאֲבִירָ֨ם בְּכֹר֜וֹ יִסְּדָ֗הּ (ובשגיב) [וּבִשְׂג֤וּב] צְעִירוֹ֙ הִצִּ֣יב דְּלָתֶ֔יהָ כִּדְבַ֣ר יְהֹוָ֔ה אֲשֶׁ֣ר דִּבֶּ֔ר בְּיַ֖ד יְהוֹשֻׁ֥עַ בִּן־נֽוּן׃ {ס}
Translated: During his reign, Hiel the Bethelite fortified Jericho. He laid its foundations at the cost of Abiram his first-born, and set its gates in place at the cost of Segub his youngest, in accordance with the words that G<small>OD</small> had spoken through Joshua son of Nun.
Transliteration: veyamayv vanah chiyel veyt haeliy et-yeriychoh vaaviyram vekhorvo yisedah (vvshgyv) [uvisheguv] tseiyrvo hitsiyv delateyha khidevar yehovah asher diver veyad yehvoshua vin-nun {s}

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֩אמֶר֩ אֵלִיָּ֨הוּ הַתִּשְׁבִּ֜י מִתֹּשָׁבֵ֣י גִלְעָד֮ אֶל־אַחְאָב֒ חַי־יְהֹוָ֞ה אֱלֹהֵ֤י יִשְׂרָאֵל֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר עָמַ֣דְתִּי לְפָנָ֔יו אִם־יִֽהְיֶ֛ה הַשָּׁנִ֥ים הָאֵ֖לֶּה טַ֣ל וּמָטָ֑ר כִּ֖י אִם־לְפִ֥י דְבָרִֽי׃ {ס}
Translated: Elijah the Tishbite, an inhabitant of Gilead, said to Ahab, “As the E<small>TERNAL</small> lives, the God of Israel whom I serve, there will be no dew or rain except at my bidding.”
Transliteration: vayomer eliyahu hatisheviy mitoshavey gilead el-acheav chay-yehovah elohey yisherael asher amadetiy lefanayv im-yiheyeh hashaniym haeleh tal umatar khiy im-lefiy devariy {s}

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֥י דְבַר־יְהֹוָ֖ה אֵלָ֥יו לֵאמֹֽר׃
Translated: The word of G<small>OD</small> came to him:
Transliteration: vayehiy devar-yehovah elayv lemor

Hebrew: לֵ֣ךְ מִזֶּ֔ה וּפָנִ֥יתָ לְּךָ֖ קֵ֑דְמָה וְנִסְתַּרְתָּ֙ בְּנַ֣חַל כְּרִ֔ית אֲשֶׁ֖ר עַל־פְּנֵ֥י הַיַּרְדֵּֽן׃
Translated: “Leave this place; turn eastward and go into hiding by the Wadi Cherith, which is east of the Jordan.
Transliteration: lekhe mizeh ufaniyta lekha kedemah venisetareta venachal kheriyt asher al-feney hayareden

Hebrew: וְהָיָ֖ה מֵהַנַּ֣חַל תִּשְׁתֶּ֑ה וְאֶת־הָעֹרְבִ֣ים צִוִּ֔יתִי לְכַלְכֶּלְךָ֖ שָֽׁם׃
Translated: You will drink from the wadi, and I have commanded the ravens to feed you there.”
Transliteration: vehayah mehanachal tisheteh veet-haoreviym tsiviytiy lekhalekhelekha sham

Hebrew: וַיֵּ֥לֶךְ וַיַּ֖עַשׂ כִּדְבַ֣ר יְהֹוָ֑ה וַיֵּ֗לֶךְ וַיֵּ֙שֶׁב֙ בְּנַ֣חַל כְּרִ֔ית אֲשֶׁ֖ר עַל־פְּנֵ֥י הַיַּרְדֵּֽן׃
Translated: He proceeded to do as G<small>OD</small> had bidden: he went, and he stayed by the Wadi Cherith, which is east of the Jordan.
Transliteration: vayelekhe vayaash khidevar yehovah vayelekhe vayeshev venachal kheriyt asher al-feney hayareden

Hebrew: וְהָעֹרְבִ֗ים מְבִאִ֨ים ל֜וֹ לֶ֤חֶם וּבָשָׂר֙ בַּבֹּ֔קֶר וְלֶ֥חֶם וּבָשָׂ֖ר בָּעָ֑רֶב וּמִן־הַנַּ֖חַל יִשְׁתֶּֽה׃
Translated: The ravens brought him bread and meat every morning and every evening, and he drank from the wadi.
Transliteration: vehaoreviym meviiym lvo lechem uvashar vavoker velechem uvashar vaarev umin-hanachal yisheteh

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֛י מִקֵּ֥ץ יָמִ֖ים וַיִּיבַ֣שׁ הַנָּ֑חַל כִּ֛י לֹא־הָיָ֥ה גֶ֖שֶׁם בָּאָֽרֶץ׃ {ס}
Translated: After some time the wadi dried up, because there was no rain in the land.
Transliteration: vayehiy mikets yamiym vayiyvash hanachal khiy lo-hayah geshem vaarets {s}

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֥י דְבַר־יְהֹוָ֖ה אֵלָ֥יו לֵאמֹֽר׃
Translated: And the word of G<small>OD</small> came to him:
Transliteration: vayehiy devar-yehovah elayv lemor

Hebrew: ק֣וּם לֵ֤ךְ צָֽרְפַ֙תָה֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר לְצִיד֔וֹן וְיָשַׁבְתָּ֖ שָׁ֑ם הִנֵּ֨ה צִוִּ֥יתִי שָׁ֛ם אִשָּׁ֥ה אַלְמָנָ֖ה לְכַלְכְּלֶֽךָ׃
Translated: “Go at once to Zarephath of Sidon, and stay there; I have designated a widow there to feed you.”
Transliteration: kum lekhe tsarefatah asher letsiydvon veyashaveta sham hineh tsiviytiy sham ishah alemanah lekhalekhelekha

Hebrew: וַיָּ֣קׇם ׀ וַיֵּ֣לֶךְ צָֽרְפַ֗תָה וַיָּבֹא֙ אֶל־פֶּ֣תַח הָעִ֔יר וְהִנֵּה־שָׁ֛ם אִשָּׁ֥ה אַלְמָנָ֖ה מְקֹשֶׁ֣שֶׁת עֵצִ֑ים וַיִּקְרָ֤א אֵלֶ֙יהָ֙ וַיֹּאמַ֔ר קְחִי־נָ֨א לִ֧י מְעַט־מַ֛יִם בַּכְּלִ֖י וְאֶשְׁתֶּֽה׃
Translated: So he went at once to Zarephath. When he came to the entrance of the town, a widow was there gathering wood. He called out to her, “Please bring me a little water in your pitcher, and let me drink.”
Transliteration: vayakׇm vayelekhe tsarefatah vayavo el-fetach haiyr vehineh-sham ishah alemanah mekosheshet etsiym vayikera eleyha vayomar kechiy-na liy meat-mayiim vakheliy veesheteh

Hebrew: וַתֵּ֖לֶךְ לָקַ֑חַת וַיִּקְרָ֤א אֵלֶ֙יהָ֙ וַיֹּאמַ֔ר לִֽקְחִי־נָ֥א לִ֛י פַּת־לֶ֖חֶם בְּיָדֵֽךְ׃
Translated: As she went to fetch it, he called out to her, “Please bring along a piece of bread for me.”
Transliteration: vatelekhe lakachat vayikera eleyha vayomar likechiy-na liy fat-lechem veyadekhe

Hebrew: וַתֹּ֗אמֶר חַי־יְהֹוָ֤ה אֱלֹהֶ֙יךָ֙ אִם־יֶשׁ־לִ֣י מָע֔וֹג כִּ֣י אִם־מְלֹ֤א כַף־קֶ֙מַח֙ בַּכַּ֔ד וּמְעַט־שֶׁ֖מֶן בַּצַּפָּ֑חַת וְהִנְנִ֨י מְקֹשֶׁ֜שֶׁת שְׁנַ֣יִם עֵצִ֗ים וּבָ֙אתִי֙ וַעֲשִׂיתִ֙יהוּ֙ לִ֣י וְלִבְנִ֔י וַאֲכַלְנֻ֖הוּ וָמָֽתְנוּ׃
Translated: “As the E<small>TERNAL</small> your God lives,” she replied, “I have nothing baked, nothing but a handful of flour in a jar and a little oil in a jug. I am just gathering a couple of sticks, so that I can go home and prepare it for me and my son; we shall eat it and then we shall die.”
Transliteration: vatomer chay-yehovah eloheykha im-yesh-liy mavog khiy im-melo khaf-kemach vakhad umeat-shemen vatsafachat vehineniy mekosheshet shenayiim etsiym uvatiy vaashiytiyhu liy veliveniy vaakhalenuhu vamatenu

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר אֵלֶ֤יהָ אֵלִיָּ֙הוּ֙ אַל־תִּ֣ירְאִ֔י בֹּ֖אִי עֲשִׂ֣י כִדְבָרֵ֑ךְ אַ֣ךְ עֲשִׂי־לִֽי־מִ֠שָּׁ֠ם עֻגָ֨ה קְטַנָּ֤ה בָרִֽאשֹׁנָה֙ וְהוֹצֵ֣את לִ֔י וְלָ֣ךְ וְלִבְנֵ֔ךְ תַּעֲשִׂ֖י בָּאַחֲרֹנָֽה׃
Translated: “Don’t be afraid,” said Elijah to her. “Go and do as you have said; but first make me a small cake from what you have there, and bring it out to me; then make some for yourself and your son.
Transliteration: vayomer eleyha eliyahu al-tiyreiy voiy ashiy khidevarekhe akhe ashiy-liy-misham ugah ketanah varishonah vehvotset liy velakhe velivenekhe taashiy vaacharonah

Hebrew: כִּ֣י כֹה֩ אָמַ֨ר יְהֹוָ֜ה אֱלֹהֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֗ל כַּ֤ד הַקֶּ֙מַח֙ לֹ֣א תִכְלָ֔ה וְצַפַּ֥חַת הַשֶּׁ֖מֶן לֹ֣א תֶחְסָ֑ר עַ֠ד י֧וֹם (תתן) [תֵּת־]יְהֹוָ֛ה גֶּ֖שֶׁם עַל־פְּנֵ֥י הָאֲדָמָֽה׃
Translated: For thus said the E<small>TERNAL</small>, the God of Israel: The jar of flour shall not give out and the jug of oil shall not fail until the day that G<small>OD</small> sends rain upon the ground.”
Transliteration: khiy khoh amar yehovah elohey yisherael khad hakemach lo tikhelah vetsafachat hashemen lo techesar ad yvom (ttn) [tet-]yehovah geshem al-feney haadamah

Hebrew: וַתֵּ֥לֶךְ וַֽתַּעֲשֶׂ֖ה כִּדְבַ֣ר אֵלִיָּ֑הוּ וַתֹּ֧אכַל (הוא והיא) [הִֽיא־וָה֛וּא] וּבֵיתָ֖הּ יָמִֽים׃
Translated: She went and did as Elijah had spoken, and she and he and her household had food for a long time.
Transliteration: vatelekhe vataasheh khidevar eliyahu vatokhal (hv vhy) [hiy-vahu] uveytah yamiym

Hebrew: כַּ֤ד הַקֶּ֙מַח֙ לֹ֣א כָלָ֔תָה וְצַפַּ֥חַת הַשֶּׁ֖מֶן לֹ֣א חָסֵ֑ר כִּדְבַ֣ר יְהֹוָ֔ה אֲשֶׁ֥ר דִּבֶּ֖ר בְּיַ֥ד אֵֽלִיָּֽהוּ׃ {פ}
Translated: The jar of flour did not give out, nor did the jug of oil fail, just as G<small>OD</small> had spoken through Elijah.
Transliteration: khad hakemach lo khalatah vetsafachat hashemen lo chaser khidevar yehovah asher diver veyad eliyahu {f}

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֗י אַחַר֙ הַדְּבָרִ֣ים הָאֵ֔לֶּה חָלָ֕ה בֶּן־הָאִשָּׁ֖ה בַּעֲלַ֣ת הַבָּ֑יִת וַיְהִ֤י חׇלְיוֹ֙ חָזָ֣ק מְאֹ֔ד עַ֛ד אֲשֶׁ֥ר לֹא־נֽוֹתְרָה־בּ֖וֹ נְשָׁמָֽה׃
Translated: After a while, the son of that woman—the owner of the house—fell sick, and his illness grew worse, until he had no breath left in him.
Transliteration: vayehiy achar hadevariym haeleh chalah ven-haishah vaalat havayiit vayehiy chׇleyvo chazak meod ad asher lo-nvoterah-vvo neshamah

Hebrew: וַתֹּ֙אמֶר֙ אֶל־אֵ֣לִיָּ֔הוּ מַה־לִּ֥י וָלָ֖ךְ אִ֣ישׁ הָאֱלֹהִ֑ים בָּ֧אתָ אֵלַ֛י לְהַזְכִּ֥יר אֶת־עֲוֺנִ֖י וּלְהָמִ֥ית אֶת־בְּנִֽי׃
Translated: She said to Elijah, “What harm have I done you, O agent of God, that you should come here to recall my sin and cause the death of my son?”
Transliteration: vatomer el-eliyahu mah-liy valakhe iysh haElohim vata elay lehazekhiyr et-avoniy ulehamiyt et-veniy

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֥אמֶר אֵלֶ֖יהָ תְּנִי־לִ֣י אֶת־בְּנֵ֑ךְ וַיִּקָּחֵ֣הוּ מֵחֵיקָ֗הּ וַֽיַּעֲלֵ֙הוּ֙ אֶל־הָעֲלִיָּ֗ה אֲשֶׁר־הוּא֙ יֹשֵׁ֣ב שָׁ֔ם וַיַּשְׁכִּבֵ֖הוּ עַל־מִטָּתֽוֹ׃
Translated: “Give me the boy,” he said to her; and taking him from her arms, he carried him to the upper chamber where he was staying, and laid him down on his own bed.
Transliteration: vayomer eleyha teniy-liy et-venekhe vayikachehu mecheykah vayaalehu el-haaliyah asher-hu yoshev sham vayashekhivehu al-mitatvo

Hebrew: וַיִּקְרָ֥א אֶל־יְהֹוָ֖ה וַיֹּאמַ֑ר יְהֹוָ֣ה אֱלֹהָ֔י הֲ֠גַ֠ם עַֽל־הָאַלְמָנָ֞ה אֲשֶׁר־אֲנִ֨י מִתְגּוֹרֵ֥ר עִמָּ֛הּ הֲרֵע֖וֹתָ לְהָמִ֥ית אֶת־בְּנָֽהּ׃
Translated: He cried out to G<small>OD</small> and said, “My E<small>TERNAL</small> God, will You bring calamity upon this widow whose guest I am, and let her son die?”
Transliteration: vayikera el-yehovah vayomar yehovah elohay hagam al-haalemanah asher-aniy mitegvorer imah harevota lehamiyt et-venah

Hebrew: וַיִּתְמֹדֵ֤ד עַל־הַיֶּ֙לֶד֙ שָׁלֹ֣שׁ פְּעָמִ֔ים וַיִּקְרָ֥א אֶל־יְהֹוָ֖ה וַיֹּאמַ֑ר יְהֹוָ֣ה אֱלֹהָ֔י תָּ֥שׇׁב נָ֛א נֶפֶשׁ־הַיֶּ֥לֶד הַזֶּ֖ה עַל־קִרְבּֽוֹ׃
Translated: Then he stretched out over the child three times, and cried out to G<small>OD</small>, saying, “My E<small>TERNAL</small> God, let this child’s life return to his body!”
Transliteration: vayitemoded al-hayeled shalosh feamiym vayikera el-yehovah vayomar yehovah elohay tashׇv na nefesh-hayeled hazeh al-kirevvo

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׁמַ֥ע יְהֹוָ֖ה בְּק֣וֹל אֵלִיָּ֑הוּ וַתָּ֧שׇׁב נֶפֶשׁ־הַיֶּ֛לֶד עַל־קִרְבּ֖וֹ וַיֶּֽחִי׃
Translated: G<small>OD</small> heard Elijah’s plea; the child’s life returned to his body, and he revived.
Transliteration: vayishema yehovah vekvol eliyahu vatashׇv nefesh-hayeled al-kirevvo vayechiy

Hebrew: וַיִּקַּ֨ח אֵלִיָּ֜הוּ אֶת־הַיֶּ֗לֶד וַיֹּרִדֵ֤הוּ מִן־הָֽעֲלִיָּה֙ הַבַּ֔יְתָה וַֽיִּתְּנֵ֖הוּ לְאִמּ֑וֹ וַיֹּ֙אמֶר֙ אֵ֣לִיָּ֔הוּ רְאִ֖י חַ֥י בְּנֵֽךְ׃
Translated: Elijah picked up the child and brought him down from the upper room into the main room, and gave him to his mother. “See,” said Elijah, “your son is alive.”
Transliteration: vayikach eliyahu et-hayeled vayoridehu min-haaliyah havayetah vayitenehu leimvo vayomer eliyahu reiy chay venekhe

Hebrew: וַתֹּ֤אמֶר הָֽאִשָּׁה֙ אֶל־אֵ֣לִיָּ֔הוּ עַתָּה֙ זֶ֣ה יָדַ֔עְתִּי כִּ֛י אִ֥ישׁ אֱלֹהִ֖ים אָ֑תָּה וּדְבַר־יְהֹוָ֥ה בְּפִ֖יךָ אֱמֶֽת׃ {פ}
Translated: And the woman answered Elijah, “Now I know that you are an agent of God and that the word of G<small>OD</small> is truly in your mouth.”
Transliteration: vatomer haishah el-eliyahu atah zeh yadaetiy khiy iysh Elohim atah udevar-yehovah vefiykha emet {f}

Hebrew: וַֽיְהִי֙ יָמִ֣ים רַבִּ֔ים וּדְבַר־יְהֹוָ֗ה הָיָה֙ אֶל־אֵ֣לִיָּ֔הוּ בַּשָּׁנָ֥ה הַשְּׁלִישִׁ֖ית לֵאמֹ֑ר לֵ֚ךְ הֵרָאֵ֣ה אֶל־אַחְאָ֔ב וְאֶתְּנָ֥ה מָטָ֖ר עַל־פְּנֵ֥י הָֽאֲדָמָֽה׃
Translated: Much later, in the third year, the word of G<small>OD</small> came to Elijah: “Go, appear before Ahab; then I will send rain upon the earth.”
Transliteration: vayehiy yamiym raviym udevar-yehovah hayah el-eliyahu vashanah hasheliyshiyt lemor lekhe heraeh el-acheav veetenah matar al-feney haadamah

Hebrew: וַיֵּ֙לֶךְ֙ אֵֽלִיָּ֔הוּ לְהֵרָא֖וֹת אֶל־אַחְאָ֑ב וְהָרָעָ֥ב חָזָ֖ק בְּשֹׁמְרֽוֹן׃
Translated:
Thereupon Elijah set out to appear before Ahab.
The famine was severe in Samaria.
Transliteration: vayelekhe eliyahu leheravot el-acheav veharaav chazak veshomervon

Hebrew: וַיִּקְרָ֣א אַחְאָ֔ב אֶל־עֹבַדְיָ֖הוּ אֲשֶׁ֣ר עַל־הַבָּ֑יִת וְעֹבַדְיָ֗הוּ הָיָ֥ה יָרֵ֛א אֶת־יְהֹוָ֖ה מְאֹֽד׃
Translated: Ahab had summoned Obadiah, the steward of the palace. (Obadiah revered G<small>OD</small> greatly.
Transliteration: vayikera acheav el-ovadeyahu asher al-havayiit veovadeyahu hayah yare et-yehovah meod

Hebrew: וַֽיְהִי֙ בְּהַכְרִ֣ית אִיזֶ֔בֶל אֵ֖ת נְבִיאֵ֣י יְהֹוָ֑ה וַיִּקַּ֨ח עֹבַדְיָ֜הוּ מֵאָ֣ה נְבִיאִ֗ים וַֽיַּחְבִּיאֵ֞ם חֲמִשִּׁ֥ים אִישׁ֙ בַּמְּעָרָ֔ה וְכִלְכְּלָ֖ם לֶ֥חֶם וָמָֽיִם׃
Translated: When Jezebel was killing off the prophets of G<small>OD</small>, Obadiah had taken a hundred prophets and hidden them, fifty to a cave, and provided them with food and drink.)
Transliteration: vayehiy vehakheriyt iyzevel et neviyey yehovah vayikach ovadeyahu meah neviyiym vayacheviyem chamishiym iysh vamearah vekhilekhelam lechem vamayiim

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר אַחְאָב֙ אֶל־עֹ֣בַדְיָ֔הוּ לֵ֤ךְ בָּאָ֙רֶץ֙ אֶל־כׇּל־מַעְיְנֵ֣י הַמַּ֔יִם וְאֶ֖ל כׇּל־הַנְּחָלִ֑ים אוּלַ֣י ׀ נִמְצָ֣א חָצִ֗יר וּנְחַיֶּה֙ ס֣וּס וָפֶ֔רֶד וְל֥וֹא נַכְרִ֖ית מֵהַבְּהֵמָֽה׃
Translated: And Ahab had said to Obadiah, “Go through the land, to all the springs of water and to all the wadis. Perhaps we shall find some grass to keep horses and mules alive, so that we are not left without beasts.”
Transliteration: vayomer acheav el-ovadeyahu lekhe vaarets el-khׇl-maeyeney hamayiim veel khׇl-hanechaliym ulay nimetsa chatsiyr unechayeh sus vafered velvo nakheriyt mehavehemah

Hebrew: וַֽיְחַלְּק֥וּ לָהֶ֛ם אֶת־הָאָ֖רֶץ לַעֲבׇר־בָּ֑הּ אַחְאָ֞ב הָלַ֨ךְ בְּדֶ֤רֶךְ אֶחָד֙ לְבַדּ֔וֹ וְעֹבַדְיָ֛הוּ הָלַ֥ךְ בְּדֶרֶךְ־אֶחָ֖ד לְבַדּֽוֹ׃
Translated: They divided the country between them to explore it, Ahab going alone in one direction and Obadiah going alone in another direction.
Transliteration: vayechaleku lahem et-haarets laavׇr-vah acheav halakhe vederekhe echad levadvo veovadeyahu halakhe vederekhe-echad levadvo

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֤י עֹבַדְיָ֙הוּ֙ בַּדֶּ֔רֶךְ וְהִנֵּ֥ה אֵלִיָּ֖הוּ לִקְרָאת֑וֹ וַיַּכִּרֵ֙הוּ֙ וַיִּפֹּ֣ל עַל־פָּנָ֔יו וַיֹּ֕אמֶר הַאַתָּ֥ה זֶ֖ה אֲדֹנִ֥י אֵלִיָּֽהוּ׃
Translated: Obadiah was on the road, when Elijah suddenly confronted him. [Obadiah] recognized him and flung himself on his face, saying, “Is that you, my lord Elijah?”
Transliteration: vayehiy ovadeyahu vaderekhe vehineh eliyahu likeratvo vayakhirehu vayifol al-fanayv vayomer haatah zeh adoniy eliyahu

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֥אמֶר ל֖וֹ אָ֑נִי לֵ֛ךְ אֱמֹ֥ר לַאדֹנֶ֖יךָ הִנֵּ֥ה אֵלִיָּֽהוּ׃
Translated: “Yes, it is I,” he answered. “Go tell your lord: Elijah is here!”
Transliteration: vayomer lvo aniy lekhe emor ladoneykha hineh eliyahu

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֖אמֶר מֶ֣ה חָטָ֑אתִי כִּֽי־אַתָּ֞ה נֹתֵ֧ן אֶֽת־עַבְדְּךָ֛ בְּיַד־אַחְאָ֖ב לַהֲמִיתֵֽנִי׃
Translated: But he said, “What wrong have I done, that you should hand your servant over to Ahab to be killed?
Transliteration: vayomer meh chatatiy khiy-atah noten et-avedekha veyad-acheav lahamiyteniy

Hebrew: חַ֣י ׀ יְהֹוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֶ֗יךָ אִם־יֶשׁ־גּ֤וֹי וּמַמְלָכָה֙ אֲ֠שֶׁ֠ר לֹא־שָׁלַ֨ח אֲדֹנִ֥י שָׁם֙ לְבַקֶּשְׁךָ֔ וְאָמְר֖וּ אָ֑יִן וְהִשְׁבִּ֤יעַ אֶת־הַמַּמְלָכָה֙ וְאֶת־הַגּ֔וֹי כִּ֖י לֹ֥א יִמְצָאֶֽכָּה׃
Translated: As the E<small>TERNAL</small> your God lives, there is no nation or kingdom to which my lord has not sent to look for you; and when they said, ‘He is not here,’ he made that kingdom or nation swear that you could not be found.
Transliteration: chay yehovah eloheykha im-yesh-gvoy umamelakhah asher lo-shalach adoniy sham levakeshekha veameru ayiin vehisheviya et-hamamelakhah veet-hagvoy khiy lo yimetsaekhah

Hebrew: וְעַתָּ֖ה אַתָּ֣ה אֹמֵ֑ר לֵ֛ךְ אֱמֹ֥ר לַאדֹנֶ֖יךָ הִנֵּ֥ה אֵלִיָּֽהוּ׃
Translated: And now you say, ‘Go tell your lord: Elijah is here!’
Transliteration: veatah atah omer lekhe emor ladoneykha hineh eliyahu

Hebrew: וְהָיָ֞ה אֲנִ֣י ׀ אֵלֵ֣ךְ מֵאִתָּ֗ךְ וְר֨וּחַ יְהֹוָ֤ה ׀ יִֽשָּׂאֲךָ֙ עַ֚ל אֲשֶׁ֣ר לֹֽא־אֵדָ֔ע וּבָ֨אתִי לְהַגִּ֧יד לְאַחְאָ֛ב וְלֹ֥א יִֽמְצָאֲךָ֖ וַהֲרָגָ֑נִי וְעַבְדְּךָ֛ יָרֵ֥א אֶת־יְהֹוָ֖ה מִנְּעֻרָֽי׃
Translated: When I leave you, the spirit of G<small>OD</small> will carry you off I don’t know where; and when I come and tell Ahab and he does not find you, he will kill me. Yet your servant has revered G<small>OD</small> from my youth.
Transliteration: vehayah aniy elekhe meitakhe verucha yehovah yishaakha al asher lo-eda uvatiy lehagiyd leacheav velo yimetsaakha vaharaganiy veavedekha yare et-yehovah mineuray

Hebrew: הֲלֹֽא־הֻגַּ֤ד לַֽאדֹנִי֙ אֵ֣ת אֲשֶׁר־עָשִׂ֔יתִי בַּהֲרֹ֣ג אִיזֶ֔בֶל אֵ֖ת נְבִיאֵ֣י יְהֹוָ֑ה וָאַחְבִּא֩ מִנְּבִיאֵ֨י יְהֹוָ֜ה מֵ֣אָה אִ֗ישׁ חֲמִשִּׁ֨ים חֲמִשִּׁ֥ים אִישׁ֙ בַּמְּעָרָ֔ה וָאֲכַלְכְּלֵ֖ם לֶ֥חֶם וָמָֽיִם׃
Translated: My lord has surely been told what I did when Jezebel was killing the prophets of G<small>OD</small>, how I hid a hundred of the prophets of G<small>OD</small>, fifty to a cave, and provided them with food and drink.
Transliteration: halo-hugad ladoniy et asher-ashiytiy vaharog iyzevel et neviyey yehovah vaachevi mineviyey yehovah meah iysh chamishiym chamishiym iysh vamearah vaakhalekhelem lechem vamayiim

Hebrew: וְעַתָּה֙ אַתָּ֣ה אֹמֵ֔ר לֵ֛ךְ אֱמֹ֥ר לַאדֹנֶ֖יךָ הִנֵּ֣ה אֵלִיָּ֑הוּ וַהֲרָגָֽנִי׃ {ס}
Translated: And now you say, ‘Go tell your lord: Elijah is here.’ Why, he will kill me!”
Transliteration: veatah atah omer lekhe emor ladoneykha hineh eliyahu vaharaganiy {s}

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֙אמֶר֙ אֵֽלִיָּ֔הוּ חַ֚י יְהֹוָ֣ה צְבָא֔וֹת אֲשֶׁ֥ר עָמַ֖דְתִּי לְפָנָ֑יו כִּ֥י הַיּ֖וֹם אֵרָאֶ֥ה אֵלָֽיו׃
Translated: Elijah replied, “As G<small>OD</small> of Hosts lives, whom I serve, I will appear before him this very day.”
Transliteration: vayomer eliyahu chay yehovah tsevavot asher amadetiy lefanayv khiy hayyvom eraeh elayv

Hebrew: וַיֵּ֧לֶךְ עֹבַדְיָ֛הוּ לִקְרַ֥את אַחְאָ֖ב וַיַּגֶּד־ל֑וֹ וַיֵּ֥לֶךְ אַחְאָ֖ב לִקְרַ֥את אֵלִיָּֽהוּ׃
Translated: Obadiah went to find Ahab, and informed him; and Ahab went to meet Elijah.
Transliteration: vayelekhe ovadeyahu likerat acheav vayaged-lvo vayelekhe acheav likerat eliyahu

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֛י כִּרְא֥וֹת אַחְאָ֖ב אֶת־אֵלִיָּ֑הוּ וַיֹּ֤אמֶר אַחְאָב֙ אֵלָ֔יו הַאַתָּ֥ה זֶ֖ה עֹכֵ֥ר יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated: When Ahab caught sight of Elijah, Ahab said to him, “Is that you, you troubler of Israel?”
Transliteration: vayehiy khirevot acheav et-eliyahu vayomer acheav elayv haatah zeh okher yisherael

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֗אמֶר לֹ֤א עָכַ֙רְתִּי֙ אֶת־יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל כִּ֥י אִם־אַתָּ֖ה וּבֵ֣ית אָבִ֑יךָ בַּעֲזׇבְכֶם֙ אֶת־מִצְוֺ֣ת יְהֹוָ֔ה וַתֵּ֖לֶךְ אַחֲרֵ֥י הַבְּעָלִֽים׃
Translated: He retorted, “It is not I who have brought trouble on Israel, but you and your father’s House, by forsaking the commandments of G<small>OD</small> and going after the Baalim.
Transliteration: vayomer lo akharetiy et-yisherael khiy im-atah uveyt aviykha vaazׇvekhem et-mitsevot yehovah vatelekhe acharey havealiym

Hebrew: וְעַתָּ֗ה שְׁלַ֨ח קְבֹ֥ץ אֵלַ֛י אֶת־כׇּל־יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל אֶל־הַ֣ר הַכַּרְמֶ֑ל וְאֶת־נְבִיאֵ֨י הַבַּ֜עַל אַרְבַּ֧ע מֵא֣וֹת וַחֲמִשִּׁ֗ים וּנְבִיאֵ֤י הָאֲשֵׁרָה֙ אַרְבַּ֣ע מֵא֔וֹת אֹכְלֵ֖י שֻׁלְחַ֥ן אִיזָֽבֶל׃
Translated: Now summon all Israel to join me at Mount Carmel, together with the four hundred and fifty prophets of Baal and the four hundred prophets of Asherah, who eat at Jezebel’s table.”
Transliteration: veatah shelach kevots elay et-khׇl-yisherael el-har hakharemel veet-neviyey havaal areva mevot vachamishiym uneviyey haasherah areva mevot okheley shulechan iyzavel

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׁלַ֥ח אַחְאָ֖ב בְּכׇל־בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל וַיִּקְבֹּ֥ץ אֶת־הַנְּבִיאִ֖ים אֶל־הַ֥ר הַכַּרְמֶֽל׃
Translated: Ahab sent orders to all the Israelites and gathered the prophets at Mount Carmel.
Transliteration: vayishelach acheav vekhׇl-veney yisherael vayikevots et-haneviyiym el-har hakharemel

Hebrew: וַיִּגַּ֨שׁ אֵלִיָּ֜הוּ אֶל־כׇּל־הָעָ֗ם וַיֹּ֙אמֶר֙ עַד־מָתַ֞י אַתֶּ֣ם פֹּסְחִים֮ עַל־שְׁתֵּ֣י הַסְּעִפִּים֒ אִם־יְהֹוָ֤ה הָאֱלֹהִים֙ לְכ֣וּ אַחֲרָ֔יו וְאִם־הַבַּ֖עַל לְכ֣וּ אַחֲרָ֑יו וְלֹא־עָנ֥וּ הָעָ֛ם אֹת֖וֹ דָּבָֽר׃
Translated: Elijah approached all the people and said, “How long will you keep hopping between two opinions? If the E<small>TERNAL</small> is God, then follow [the E<small>TERNAL</small>]; and if Baal, follow [Baal]!” But the people answered him not a word.
Transliteration: vayigash eliyahu el-khׇl-haam vayomer ad-matay atem fosechiym al-shetey haseifiym im-yehovah haElohim lekhu acharayv veim-havaal lekhu acharayv velo-anu haam otvo davar

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר אֵלִיָּ֙הוּ֙ אֶל־הָעָ֔ם אֲנִ֞י נוֹתַ֧רְתִּי נָבִ֛יא לַיהֹוָ֖ה לְבַדִּ֑י וּנְבִיאֵ֣י הַבַּ֔עַל אַרְבַּע־מֵא֥וֹת וַחֲמִשִּׁ֖ים אִֽישׁ׃
Translated: Then Elijah said to the people, “I am the only prophet of G<small>OD</small> left, while the prophets of Baal number four hundred and fifty.
Transliteration: vayomer eliyahu el-haam aniy nvotaretiy naviy layhovah levadiy uneviyey havaal areva-mevot vachamishiym iysh

Hebrew: וְיִתְּנוּ־לָ֜נוּ שְׁנַ֣יִם פָּרִ֗ים וְיִבְחֲר֣וּ לָהֶם֩ הַפָּ֨ר הָאֶחָ֜ד וִינַתְּחֻ֗הוּ וְיָשִׂ֙ימוּ֙ עַל־הָ֣עֵצִ֔ים וְאֵ֖שׁ לֹ֣א יָשִׂ֑ימוּ וַאֲנִ֞י אֶעֱשֶׂ֣ה ׀ אֶת־הַפָּ֣ר הָאֶחָ֗ד וְנָֽתַתִּי֙ עַל־הָ֣עֵצִ֔ים וְאֵ֖שׁ לֹ֥א אָשִֽׂים׃
Translated: Let two young bulls be given to us. Let them choose one bull, cut it up, and lay it on the wood, but let them not apply fire; I will prepare the other bull, and lay it on the wood, and will not apply fire.
Transliteration: veyitenu-lanu shenayiim fariym veyivecharu lahem hafar haechad viynatechuhu veyashiymu al-haetsiym veesh lo yashiymu vaaniy eesheh et-hafar haechad venatatiy al-haetsiym veesh lo ashiym

Hebrew: וּקְרָאתֶ֞ם בְּשֵׁ֣ם אֱלֹהֵיכֶ֗ם וַֽאֲנִי֙ אֶקְרָ֣א בְשֵׁם־יְהֹוָ֔ה וְהָיָ֧ה הָאֱלֹהִ֛ים אֲשֶׁר־יַעֲנֶ֥ה בָאֵ֖שׁ ה֣וּא הָאֱלֹהִ֑ים וַיַּ֧עַן כׇּל־הָעָ֛ם וַיֹּאמְר֖וּ ט֥וֹב הַדָּבָֽר׃
Translated: You will then invoke your god by name, and I will invoke G<small>OD</small> by name; and let us agree: the god who responds with fire, that one is God.” And all the people answered, “Very good!”
Transliteration: ukeratem veshem eloheykhem vaaniy ekera veshem-yehovah vehayah haElohim asher-yaaneh vaesh hu haElohim vayaan khׇl-haam vayomeru tvov hadavar

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר אֵלִיָּ֜הוּ לִנְבִיאֵ֣י הַבַּ֗עַל בַּחֲר֨וּ לָכֶ֜ם הַפָּ֤ר הָאֶחָד֙ וַעֲשׂ֣וּ רִאשֹׁנָ֔ה כִּ֥י אַתֶּ֖ם הָרַבִּ֑ים וְקִרְאוּ֙ בְּשֵׁ֣ם אֱלֹהֵיכֶ֔ם וְאֵ֖שׁ לֹ֥א תָשִֽׂימוּ׃
Translated: Elijah said to the prophets of Baal, “Choose one bull and prepare it first, for you are the majority; invoke your god by name, but apply no fire.”
Transliteration: vayomer eliyahu lineviyey havaal vacharu lakhem hafar haechad vaashu rishonah khiy atem haraviym vekireu veshem eloheykhem veesh lo tashiymu

Hebrew: וַ֠יִּקְח֠וּ אֶת־הַפָּ֨ר אֲשֶׁר־נָתַ֣ן לָהֶם֮ וַֽיַּעֲשׂוּ֒ וַיִּקְרְא֣וּ בְשֵׁם־הַ֠בַּ֠עַל מֵהַבֹּ֨קֶר וְעַד־הַצׇּהֳרַ֤יִם לֵאמֹר֙ הַבַּ֣עַל עֲנֵ֔נוּ וְאֵ֥ין ק֖וֹל וְאֵ֣ין עֹנֶ֑ה וַֽיְפַסְּח֔וּ עַל־הַמִּזְבֵּ֖חַ אֲשֶׁ֥ר עָשָֽׂה׃
Translated: They took the bull that was given them; they prepared it, and invoked Baal by name from morning until noon, shouting, “O Baal, answer us!” But there was no sound, and no one who responded; so they performed a hopping dance about the altar that had been set up.
Transliteration: vayikechu et-hafar asher-natan lahem vayaashu vayikereu veshem-havaal mehavoker vead-hatsׇhorayiim lemor havaal anenu veeyn kvol veeyn oneh vayefasechu al-hamizevecha asher ashah

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֨י בַֽצׇּהֳרַ֜יִם וַיְהַתֵּ֧ל בָּהֶ֣ם אֵלִיָּ֗הוּ וַיֹּ֙אמֶר֙ קִרְא֤וּ בְקוֹל־גָּדוֹל֙ כִּֽי־אֱלֹהִ֣ים ה֔וּא כִּ֣י שִׂ֧יחַ וְכִי־שִׂ֛יג ל֖וֹ וְכִי־דֶ֣רֶךְ ל֑וֹ אוּלַ֛י יָשֵׁ֥ן ה֖וּא וְיִקָֽץ׃
Translated: When noon came, Elijah mocked them, saying, “Shout louder! After all, he is a god. But he may be in conversation, he may be detained, or he may be on a journey, or perhaps he is asleep and will wake up.”
Transliteration: vayehiy vatsׇhorayiim vayehatel vahem eliyahu vayomer kireu vekvol-gadvol khiy-Elohim hu khiy shiycha vekhiy-shiyg lvo vekhiy-derekhe lvo ulay yashen hu veyikats

Hebrew: וַֽיִּקְרְאוּ֙ בְּק֣וֹל גָּד֔וֹל וַיִּתְגֹּֽדְדוּ֙ כְּמִשְׁפָּטָ֔ם בַּחֲרָב֖וֹת וּבָרְמָחִ֑ים עַד־שְׁפׇךְ־דָּ֖ם עֲלֵיהֶֽם׃
Translated: So they shouted louder, and gashed themselves with knives and spears, according to their practice, until the blood streamed over them.
Transliteration: vayikereu vekvol gadvol vayitegodedu khemishefatam vacharavvot uvaremachiym ad-shefׇkhe-dam aleyhem

Hebrew: וַֽיְהִי֙ כַּעֲבֹ֣ר הַֽצׇּהֳרַ֔יִם וַיִּֽתְנַבְּא֔וּ עַ֖ד לַעֲל֣וֹת הַמִּנְחָ֑ה וְאֵֽין־ק֥וֹל וְאֵין־עֹנֶ֖ה וְאֵ֥ין קָֽשֶׁב׃
Translated: When noon passed, they kept raving until the hour of presenting the grain offering. Still there was no sound, and no one who responded or heeded.
Transliteration: vayehiy khaavor hatsׇhorayiim vayitenaveu ad laalvot haminechah veeyn-kvol veeyn-oneh veeyn kashev

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר אֵלִיָּ֤הוּ לְכׇל־הָעָם֙ גְּשׁ֣וּ אֵלַ֔י וַיִּגְּשׁ֥וּ כׇל־הָעָ֖ם אֵלָ֑יו וַיְרַפֵּ֛א אֶת־מִזְבַּ֥ח יְהֹוָ֖ה הֶהָרֽוּס׃
Translated: Then Elijah said to all the people, “Come closer to me”; and all the people came closer to him. He repaired the damaged altar of G<small>OD</small>.
Transliteration: vayomer eliyahu lekhׇl-haam geshu elay vayigeshu khׇl-haam elayv vayerafe et-mizevach yehovah heharus

Hebrew: וַיִּקַּ֣ח אֵלִיָּ֗הוּ שְׁתֵּ֤ים עֶשְׂרֵה֙ אֲבָנִ֔ים כְּמִסְפַּ֖ר שִׁבְטֵ֣י בְנֵֽי־יַעֲקֹ֑ב אֲשֶׁר֩ הָיָ֨ה דְבַר־יְהֹוָ֤ה אֵלָיו֙ לֵאמֹ֔ר יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל יִהְיֶ֥ה שְׁמֶֽךָ׃
Translated: Then Elijah took twelve stones, corresponding to the number of the tribes of the sons of Jacob—to whom the word of G<small>OD</small> had come: “Israel shall be your name”—
Transliteration: vayikach eliyahu sheteym eshereh avaniym khemisefar shivetey veney-yaakov asher hayah devar-yehovah elayv lemor yisherael yiheyeh shemekha

Hebrew: וַיִּבְנֶ֧ה אֶת־הָאֲבָנִ֛ים מִזְבֵּ֖חַ בְּשֵׁ֣ם יְהֹוָ֑ה וַיַּ֣עַשׂ תְּעָלָ֗ה כְּבֵית֙ סָאתַ֣יִם זֶ֔רַע סָבִ֖יב לַמִּזְבֵּֽחַ׃
Translated: and with the stones he built an altar in the name of GOD. Around the altar he made a trench large enough for two seahs of seed.
Transliteration: vayiveneh et-haavaniym mizevecha veshem yehovah vayaash tealah kheveyt satayiim zera saviyv lamizevecha

Hebrew: וַֽיַּעֲרֹ֖ךְ אֶת־הָעֵצִ֑ים וַיְנַתַּח֙ אֶת־הַפָּ֔ר וַיָּ֖שֶׂם עַל־הָעֵצִֽים׃
Translated: He laid out the wood, and he cut up the bull and laid it on the wood.
Transliteration: vayaarokhe et-haetsiym vayenatach et-hafar vayashem al-haetsiym

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֗אמֶר מִלְא֨וּ אַרְבָּעָ֤ה כַדִּים֙ מַ֔יִם וְיִֽצְק֥וּ עַל־הָעֹלָ֖ה וְעַל־הָעֵצִ֑ים וַיֹּ֤אמֶר שְׁנוּ֙ וַיִּשְׁנ֔וּ וַיֹּ֥אמֶר שַׁלֵּ֖שׁוּ וַיְשַׁלֵּֽשׁוּ׃
Translated: And he said, “Fill four jars with water and pour it over the burnt offering and the wood.” Then he said, “Do it a second time”; and they did it a second time. “Do it a third time,” he said; and they did it a third time.
Transliteration: vayomer mileu arevaah khadiym mayiim veyitseku al-haolah veal-haetsiym vayomer shenu vayishenu vayomer shaleshu vayeshaleshu

Hebrew: וַיֵּלְכ֣וּ הַמַּ֔יִם סָבִ֖יב לַמִּזְבֵּ֑חַ וְגַ֥ם אֶת־הַתְּעָלָ֖ה מִלֵּא־מָֽיִם׃
Translated: The water ran down around the altar, and even the trench was filled with water.
Transliteration: vayelekhu hamayiim saviyv lamizevecha vegam et-hatealah mile-mayiim

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֣י ׀ בַּעֲל֣וֹת הַמִּנְחָ֗ה וַיִּגַּ֞שׁ אֵלִיָּ֣הוּ הַנָּבִיא֮ וַיֹּאמַר֒ יְהֹוָ֗ה אֱלֹהֵי֙ אַבְרָהָם֙ יִצְחָ֣ק וְיִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל הַיּ֣וֹם יִוָּדַ֗ע כִּֽי־אַתָּ֧ה אֱלֹהִ֛ים בְּיִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל וַאֲנִ֣י עַבְדֶּ֑ךָ (ובדבריך) [וּבִדְבָרְךָ֣] עָשִׂ֔יתִי אֵ֥ת כׇּל־הַדְּבָרִ֖ים הָאֵֽלֶּה׃
Translated: When it was time to present the grain offering, the prophet Elijah came forward and said, “O E<small>TERNAL</small> One, God of Abraham, Isaac, and Israel! Let it be known today that You are God in Israel and that I am Your servant, and that I have done all these things at Your bidding.
Transliteration: vayehiy vaalvot haminechah vayigash eliyahu hanaviy vayomar yehovah elohey averaham yitsechak veyisherael hayyvom yivada khiy-atah Elohim veyisherael vaaniy avedekha (vvdvrykh) [uvidevarekha] ashiytiy et khׇl-hadevariym haeleh

Hebrew: עֲנֵ֤נִי יְהֹוָה֙ עֲנֵ֔נִי וְיֵֽדְעוּ֙ הָעָ֣ם הַזֶּ֔ה כִּֽי־אַתָּ֥ה יְהֹוָ֖ה הָאֱלֹהִ֑ים וְאַתָּ֛ה הֲסִבֹּ֥תָ אֶת־לִבָּ֖ם אֲחֹרַנִּֽית׃
Translated: Answer me, O E<small>TERNAL</small> One, answer me, that this people may know that You, O E<small>TERNAL</small> One, are God; for You have turned their hearts backward.”
Transliteration: aneniy yehovah aneniy veeideu haam hazeh khiy-atah yehovah haElohim veatah hasivota et-livam achoraniyt

Hebrew: וַתִּפֹּ֣ל אֵשׁ־יְהֹוָ֗ה וַתֹּ֤אכַל אֶת־הָעֹלָה֙ וְאֶת־הָֽעֵצִ֔ים וְאֶת־הָאֲבָנִ֖ים וְאֶת־הֶֽעָפָ֑ר וְאֶת־הַמַּ֥יִם אֲשֶׁר־בַּתְּעָלָ֖ה לִחֵֽכָה׃
Translated: Then fire from G<small>OD</small> descended and consumed the burnt offering, the wood, the stones, and the earth; and it licked up the water that was in the trench.
Transliteration: vatifol esh-yehovah vatokhal et-haolah veet-haetsiym veet-haavaniym veet-heafar veet-hamayiim asher-vatealah lichekhah

Hebrew: וַיַּרְא֙ כׇּל־הָעָ֔ם וַֽיִּפְּל֖וּ עַל־פְּנֵיהֶ֑ם וַיֹּ֣אמְר֔וּ יְהֹוָה֙ ה֣וּא הָאֱלֹהִ֔ים יְהֹוָ֖ה ה֥וּא הָאֱלֹהִֽים׃
Translated: When they saw this, all the people flung themselves on their faces and cried out: “the E<small>TERNAL</small> One alone is God, the E<small>TERNAL</small> One alone is God!”
Transliteration: vayare khׇl-haam vayifelu al-feneyhem vayomeru yehovah hu haElohim yehovah hu haElohim

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֩אמֶר֩ אֵלִיָּ֨הוּ לָהֶ֜ם תִּפְשׂ֣וּ ׀ אֶת־נְבִיאֵ֣י הַבַּ֗עַל אִ֛ישׁ אַל־יִמָּלֵ֥ט מֵהֶ֖ם וַֽיִּתְפְּשׂ֑וּם וַיּוֹרִדֵ֤ם אֵלִיָּ֙הוּ֙ אֶל־נַ֣חַל קִישׁ֔וֹן וַיִּשְׁחָטֵ֖ם שָֽׁם׃
Translated: Then Elijah said to them, “Seize the prophets of Baal, let not a single one of them get away.” They seized them, and Elijah took them down to the Wadi Kishon and slaughtered them there.
Transliteration: vayomer eliyahu lahem tifeshu et-neviyey havaal iysh al-yimalet mehem vayitefeshum vayyvoridem eliyahu el-nachal kiyshvon vayishechatem sham

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר אֵלִיָּ֙הוּ֙ לְאַחְאָ֔ב עֲלֵ֖ה אֱכֹ֣ל וּשְׁתֵ֑ה כִּי־ק֖וֹל הֲמ֥וֹן הַגָּֽשֶׁם׃
Translated: Elijah said to Ahab, “Go up, eat and drink, for there is a rumbling of [approaching] rain,”
Transliteration: vayomer eliyahu leacheav aleh ekhol usheteh khiy-kvol hamvon hagashem

Hebrew: וַיַּעֲלֶ֥ה אַחְאָ֖ב לֶאֱכֹ֣ל וְלִשְׁתּ֑וֹת וְאֵ֨לִיָּ֜הוּ עָלָ֨ה אֶל־רֹ֤אשׁ הַכַּרְמֶל֙ וַיִּגְהַ֣ר אַ֔רְצָה וַיָּ֥שֶׂם פָּנָ֖יו בֵּ֥ין בִּרְכָּֽו׃
Translated: and Ahab went up to eat and drink. Elijah meanwhile climbed to the top of Mount Carmel, crouched on the ground, and put his face between his knees.
Transliteration: vayaaleh acheav leekhol velishetvot veeliyahu alah el-rosh hakharemel vayigehar aretsah vayashem fanayv veyn virekhav

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר אֶֽל־נַעֲר֗וֹ עֲלֵה־נָא֙ הַבֵּ֣ט דֶּֽרֶךְ־יָ֔ם וַיַּ֙עַל֙ וַיַּבֵּ֔ט וַיֹּ֖אמֶר אֵ֣ין מְא֑וּמָה וַיֹּ֕אמֶר שֻׁ֖ב שֶׁ֥בַע פְּעָמִֽים׃
Translated: And he said to his servant, “Go up and look toward the Sea.” He went up and looked and reported, “There is nothing.” Seven times [Elijah] said, “Go back,”
Transliteration: vayomer el-naarvo aleh-na havet derekhe-yam vayaal vayavet vayomer eyn meumah vayomer shuv sheva feamiym

Hebrew: וַֽיְהִי֙ בַּשְּׁבִעִ֔ית וַיֹּ֗אמֶר הִנֵּה־עָ֛ב קְטַנָּ֥ה כְּכַף־אִ֖ישׁ עֹלָ֣ה מִיָּ֑ם וַיֹּ֗אמֶר עֲלֵ֨ה אֱמֹ֤ר אֶל־אַחְאָב֙ אֱסֹ֣ר וָרֵ֔ד וְלֹ֥א יַעֲצׇרְכָ֖ה הַגָּֽשֶׁם׃
Translated: and the seventh time, [the servant] reported, “A cloud as small as a person’s hand is rising in the west.” Then [Elijah] said, “Go say to Ahab, ‘Hitch up [your chariot] and go down before the rain stops you.’”
Transliteration: vayehiy vasheviiyt vayomer hineh-av ketanah khekhaf-iysh olah miyam vayomer aleh emor el-acheav esor vared velo yaatsׇrekhah hagashem

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֣י ׀ עַד־כֹּ֣ה וְעַד־כֹּ֗ה וְהַשָּׁמַ֙יִם֙ הִֽתְקַדְּרוּ֙ עָבִ֣ים וְר֔וּחַ וַיְהִ֖י גֶּ֣שֶׁם גָּד֑וֹל וַיִּרְכַּ֥ב אַחְאָ֖ב וַיֵּ֥לֶךְ יִזְרְעֶֽאלָה׃
Translated: Meanwhile the sky grew black with clouds; there was wind, and a heavy downpour fell; Ahab mounted his chariot and drove off to Jezreel.
Transliteration: vayehiy ad-khoh vead-khoh vehashamayiim hitekaderu aviym verucha vayehiy geshem gadvol vayirekhav acheav vayelekhe yizereelah

Hebrew: וְיַד־יְהֹוָ֗ה הָֽיְתָה֙ אֶל־אֵ֣לִיָּ֔הוּ וַיְשַׁנֵּ֖ס מׇתְנָ֑יו וַיָּ֙רׇץ֙ לִפְנֵ֣י אַחְאָ֔ב עַד־בֹּאֲכָ֖ה יִזְרְעֶֽאלָה׃
Translated: G<small>OD</small>’s hand had come upon Elijah. He tied up his skirts and ran in front of Ahab all the way to Jezreel.
Transliteration: veyad-yehovah hayetah el-eliyahu vayeshanes mׇtenayv vayarׇts lifeney acheav ad-voakhah yizereelah

Hebrew: וַיַּגֵּ֤ד אַחְאָב֙ לְאִיזֶ֔בֶל אֵ֛ת כׇּל־אֲשֶׁ֥ר עָשָׂ֖ה אֵלִיָּ֑הוּ וְאֵ֨ת כׇּל־אֲשֶׁ֥ר הָרַ֛ג אֶת־כׇּל־הַנְּבִיאִ֖ים בֶּחָֽרֶב׃
Translated: When Ahab told Jezebel all that Elijah had done and how he had put all the prophets to the sword,
Transliteration: vayaged acheav leiyzevel et khׇl-asher ashah eliyahu veet khׇl-asher harag et-khׇl-haneviyiym vecharev

Hebrew: וַתִּשְׁלַ֤ח אִיזֶ֙בֶל֙ מַלְאָ֔ךְ אֶל־אֵלִיָּ֖הוּ לֵאמֹ֑ר כֹּֽה־יַעֲשׂ֤וּן אֱלֹהִים֙ וְכֹ֣ה יֽוֹסִפ֔וּן כִּֽי־כָעֵ֤ת מָחָר֙ אָשִׂ֣ים אֶֽת־נַפְשְׁךָ֔ כְּנֶ֖פֶשׁ אַחַ֥ד מֵהֶֽם׃
Translated: Jezebel sent a messenger to Elijah, saying, “Thus and more may the gods do if by this time tomorrow I have not made you like one of them.”
Transliteration: vatishelach iyzevel maleakhe el-eliyahu lemor khoh-yaashun Elohim vekhoh yvosifun khiy-khaet machar ashiym et-nafeshekha khenefesh achad mehem

Hebrew: וַיַּ֗רְא וַיָּ֙קׇם֙ וַיֵּ֣לֶךְ אֶל־נַפְשׁ֔וֹ וַיָּבֹ֕א בְּאֵ֥ר שֶׁ֖בַע אֲשֶׁ֣ר לִיהוּדָ֑ה וַיַּנַּ֥ח אֶֽת־נַעֲר֖וֹ שָֽׁם׃
Translated: Frightened, he fled at once for his life. He came to Beer-sheba, which is in Judah, and left his servant there;
Transliteration: vayare vayakׇm vayelekhe el-nafeshvo vayavo veer sheva asher liyhudah vayanach et-naarvo sham

Hebrew: וְהֽוּא־הָלַ֤ךְ בַּמִּדְבָּר֙ דֶּ֣רֶךְ י֔וֹם וַיָּבֹ֕א וַיֵּ֕שֶׁב תַּ֖חַת רֹ֣תֶם (אחת) [אֶחָ֑ד] וַיִּשְׁאַ֤ל אֶת־נַפְשׁוֹ֙ לָמ֔וּת וַיֹּ֣אמֶר ׀ רַ֗ב עַתָּ֤ה יְהֹוָה֙ קַ֣ח נַפְשִׁ֔י כִּֽי־לֹא־ט֥וֹב אָנֹכִ֖י מֵאֲבֹתָֽי׃
Translated: he himself went a day’s journey into the wilderness. He came to a broom bush and sat down under it, and prayed that he might die. “Enough!” he cried. “Now, O E<small>TERNAL</small> One, take my life, for I am no better than my predecessors.”
Transliteration: vehu-halakhe vamidevar derekhe yvom vayavo vayeshev tachat rotem (cht) [echad] vayisheal et-nafeshvo lamut vayomer rav atah yehovah kach nafeshiy khiy-lo-tvov anokhiy meavotay

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׁכַּב֙ וַיִּישַׁ֔ן תַּ֖חַת רֹ֣תֶם אֶחָ֑ד וְהִנֵּה־זֶ֤ה מַלְאָךְ֙ נֹגֵ֣עַ בּ֔וֹ וַיֹּ֥אמֶר ל֖וֹ ק֥וּם אֱכֽוֹל׃
Translated: He lay down and fell asleep under a broom bush. Suddenly an angel touched him and said to him, “Arise and eat.”
Transliteration: vayishekhav vayiyshan tachat rotem echad vehineh-zeh maleakhe nogea vvo vayomer lvo kum ekhvol

Hebrew: וַיַּבֵּ֕ט וְהִנֵּ֧ה מְרַאֲשֹׁתָ֛יו עֻגַ֥ת רְצָפִ֖ים וְצַפַּ֣חַת מָ֑יִם וַיֹּ֣אכַל וַיֵּ֔שְׁתְּ וַיָּ֖שׇׁב וַיִּשְׁכָּֽב׃
Translated: He looked about; and there, beside his head, was a cake baked on hot stones and a jar of water! He ate and drank, and lay down again.
Transliteration: vayavet vehineh meraashotayv ugat retsafiym vetsafachat mayiim vayokhal vayeshete vayashׇv vayishekhav

Hebrew: וַיָּ֩שׇׁב֩ מַלְאַ֨ךְ יְהֹוָ֤ה <small>׀</small> שֵׁנִית֙ וַיִּגַּע־בּ֔וֹ וַיֹּ֖אמֶר ק֣וּם אֱכֹ֑ל כִּ֛י רַ֥ב מִמְּךָ֖ הַדָּֽרֶךְ׃
Translated: The angel of G<small>OD</small> came a second time and touched him and said, “Arise and eat, or the journey will be too much for you.”
Transliteration: vayashׇv maleakhe yehovah <small></small> sheniyt vayiga-vvo vayomer kum ekhol khiy rav mimekha hadarekhe

Hebrew: וַיָּ֖קׇם וַיֹּ֣אכַל וַיִּשְׁתֶּ֑ה וַיֵּ֜לֶךְ בְּכֹ֣חַ ׀ הָאֲכִילָ֣ה הַהִ֗יא אַרְבָּעִ֥ים יוֹם֙ וְאַרְבָּעִ֣ים לַ֔יְלָה עַ֛ד הַ֥ר הָאֱלֹהִ֖ים חֹרֵֽב׃
Translated: He arose and ate and drank; and with the strength from that meal he walked forty days and forty nights as far as the mountain of God at Horeb.
Transliteration: vayakׇm vayokhal vayisheteh vayelekhe vekhocha haakhiylah hahiy arevaiym yvom vearevaiym layelah ad har haElohim chorev

Hebrew: וַיָּבֹא־שָׁ֥ם אֶל־הַמְּעָרָ֖ה וַיָּ֣לֶן שָׁ֑ם וְהִנֵּ֤ה דְבַר־יְהֹוָה֙ אֵלָ֔יו וַיֹּ֣אמֶר ל֔וֹ מַה־לְּךָ֥ פֹ֖ה אֵלִיָּֽהוּ׃
Translated:
There he went into a cave, and there he spent the night.
Then the word of GOD came to him: “Why are you here, Elijah?”
Transliteration: vayavo-sham el-hamearah vayalen sham vehineh devar-yehovah elayv vayomer lvo mah-lekha foh eliyahu

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֩אמֶר֩ קַנֹּ֨א קִנֵּ֜אתִי לַיהֹוָ֣ה ׀ אֱלֹהֵ֣י צְבָא֗וֹת כִּֽי־עָזְב֤וּ בְרִֽיתְךָ֙ בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל אֶת־מִזְבְּחֹתֶ֣יךָ הָרָ֔סוּ וְאֶת־נְבִיאֶ֖יךָ הָרְג֣וּ בֶחָ֑רֶב וָאִוָּתֵ֤ר אֲנִי֙ לְבַדִּ֔י וַיְבַקְשׁ֥וּ אֶת־נַפְשִׁ֖י לְקַחְתָּֽהּ׃
Translated: He replied, “I am moved by zeal for the E<small>TERNAL</small>, the God of Hosts, for the Israelites have forsaken Your covenant, torn down Your altars, and put Your prophets to the sword. I alone am left, and they are out to take my life.”
Transliteration: vayomer kano kinetiy layhovah elohey tsevavot khiy-azevu veriytekha veney yisherael et-mizevechoteykha harasu veet-neviyeykha haregu vecharev vaivater aniy levadiy vayevakeshu et-nafeshiy lekachetah

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֗אמֶר צֵ֣א וְעָמַדְתָּ֣ בָהָר֮ לִפְנֵ֣י יְהֹוָה֒ וְהִנֵּ֧ה יְהֹוָ֣ה עֹבֵ֗ר וְר֣וּחַ גְּדוֹלָ֡ה וְחָזָ֞ק מְפָרֵק֩ הָרִ֨ים וּמְשַׁבֵּ֤ר סְלָעִים֙ לִפְנֵ֣י יְהֹוָ֔ה לֹ֥א בָר֖וּחַ יְהֹוָ֑ה וְאַחַ֤ר הָר֙וּחַ֙ רַ֔עַשׁ לֹ֥א בָרַ֖עַשׁ יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated:
“Come out,” He called, “and stand on the mountain before GOD.”
And lo, GOD passed by. There was a great and mighty wind, splitting mountains and shattering rocks by GOD’s power; but GOD was not in the wind. After the wind—an earthquake; but GOD was not in the earthquake.
Transliteration: vayomer tse veamadeta vahar lifeney yehovah vehineh yehovah over verucha gedvolah vechazak mefarek hariym umeshaver selaiym lifeney yehovah lo varucha yehovah veachar harucha raash lo varaash yehovah

Hebrew: וְאַחַ֤ר הָרַ֙עַשׁ֙ אֵ֔שׁ לֹ֥א בָאֵ֖שׁ יְהֹוָ֑ה וְאַחַ֣ר הָאֵ֔שׁ ק֖וֹל דְּמָמָ֥ה דַקָּֽה׃
Translated: After the earthquake—fire; but G<small>OD</small> was not in the fire. And after the fire—a soft murmuring sound.
Transliteration: veachar haraash esh lo vaesh yehovah veachar haesh kvol demamah dakah

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֣י ׀ כִּשְׁמֹ֣עַ אֵלִיָּ֗הוּ וַיָּ֤לֶט פָּנָיו֙ בְּאַדַּרְתּ֔וֹ וַיֵּצֵ֕א וַֽיַּעֲמֹ֖ד פֶּ֣תַח הַמְּעָרָ֑ה וְהִנֵּ֤ה אֵלָיו֙ ק֔וֹל וַיֹּ֕אמֶר מַה־לְּךָ֥ פֹ֖ה אֵלִיָּֽהוּ׃
Translated: When Elijah heard it, he wrapped his mantle about his face and went out and stood at the entrance of the cave. Then a voice addressed him: “Why are you here, Elijah?”
Transliteration: vayehiy khishemoa eliyahu vayalet fanayv veadaretvo vayetse vayaamod fetach hamearah vehineh elayv kvol vayomer mah-lekha foh eliyahu

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֩אמֶר֩ קַנֹּ֨א קִנֵּ֜אתִי לַיהֹוָ֣ה ׀ אֱלֹהֵ֣י צְבָא֗וֹת כִּֽי־עָזְב֤וּ בְרִֽיתְךָ֙ בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל אֶת־מִזְבְּחֹתֶ֣יךָ הָרָ֔סוּ וְאֶת־נְבִיאֶ֖יךָ הָרְג֣וּ בֶחָ֑רֶב וָאִוָּתֵ֤ר אֲנִי֙ לְבַדִּ֔י וַיְבַקְשׁ֥וּ אֶת־נַפְשִׁ֖י לְקַחְתָּֽהּ׃ {ס}
Translated: He answered, “I am moved by zeal for the E<small>TERNAL</small>, the God of Hosts; for the Israelites have forsaken Your covenant, torn down Your altars, and have put Your prophets to the sword. I alone am left, and they are out to take my life.”
Transliteration: vayomer kano kinetiy layhovah elohey tsevavot khiy-azevu veriytekha veney yisherael et-mizevechoteykha harasu veet-neviyeykha haregu vecharev vaivater aniy levadiy vayevakeshu et-nafeshiy lekachetah {s}

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר יְהֹוָה֙ אֵלָ֔יו לֵ֛ךְ שׁ֥וּב לְדַרְכְּךָ֖ מִדְבַּ֣רָה דַמָּ֑שֶׂק וּבָ֗אתָ וּמָשַׁחְתָּ֧ אֶת־חֲזָאֵ֛ל לְמֶ֖לֶךְ עַל־אֲרָֽם׃
Translated: G<small>OD</small> said to him, “Go back by the way you came, [and] on to the wilderness of Damascus. When you get there, anoint Hazael as king of Aram.
Transliteration: vayomer yehovah elayv lekhe shuv ledarekhekha midevarah damashek uvata umashacheta et-chazael lemelekhe al-aram

Hebrew: וְאֵת֙ יֵה֣וּא בֶן־נִמְשִׁ֔י תִּמְשַׁ֥ח לְמֶ֖לֶךְ עַל־יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל וְאֶת־אֱלִישָׁ֤ע בֶּן־שָׁפָט֙ מֵאָבֵ֣ל מְחוֹלָ֔ה תִּמְשַׁ֥ח לְנָבִ֖יא תַּחְתֶּֽיךָ׃
Translated: Also anoint Jehu son of Nimshi as king of Israel, and anoint Elisha son of Shaphat of Abel-meholah to succeed you as prophet.
Transliteration: veet eihu ven-nimeshiy timeshach lemelekhe al-yisherael veet-eliysha ven-shafat meavel mechvolah timeshach lenaviy tacheteykha

Hebrew: וְהָיָ֗ה הַנִּמְלָ֛ט מֵחֶ֥רֶב חֲזָאֵ֖ל יָמִ֣ית יֵה֑וּא וְהַנִּמְלָ֛ט מֵחֶ֥רֶב יֵה֖וּא יָמִ֥ית אֱלִישָֽׁע׃
Translated: Whoever escapes the sword of Hazael shall be slain by Jehu, and whoever escapes the sword of Jehu shall be slain by Elisha.
Transliteration: vehayah hanimelat mecherev chazael yamiyt eihu vehanimelat mecherev eihu yamiyt eliysha

Hebrew: וְהִשְׁאַרְתִּ֥י בְיִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל שִׁבְעַ֣ת אֲלָפִ֑ים כׇּל־הַבִּרְכַּ֗יִם אֲשֶׁ֤ר לֹא־כָֽרְעוּ֙ לַבַּ֔עַל וְכׇ֨ל־הַפֶּ֔ה אֲשֶׁ֥ר לֹֽא־נָשַׁ֖ק לֽוֹ׃
Translated: I will leave in Israel only seven thousand—every knee that has not knelt to Baal and every mouth that has not kissed him.”
Transliteration: vehishearetiy veyisherael shiveat alafiym khׇl-havirekhayiim asher lo-khareu lavaal vekhׇl-hafeh asher lo-nashak lvo

Hebrew: וַיֵּ֣לֶךְ מִ֠שָּׁ֠ם וַיִּמְצָ֞א אֶת־אֱלִישָׁ֤ע בֶּן־שָׁפָט֙ וְה֣וּא חֹרֵ֔שׁ שְׁנֵים־עָשָׂ֤ר צְמָדִים֙ לְפָנָ֔יו וְה֖וּא בִּשְׁנֵ֣ים הֶעָשָׂ֑ר וַיַּעֲבֹ֤ר אֵלִיָּ֙הוּ֙ אֵלָ֔יו וַיַּשְׁלֵ֥ךְ אַדַּרְתּ֖וֹ אֵלָֽיו׃
Translated: He set out from there and came upon Elisha son of Shaphat as he was plowing. There were twelve yoke of oxen ahead of him, and he was with the twelfth. Elijah came over to him and threw his mantle over him.
Transliteration: vayelekhe misham vayimetsa et-eliysha ven-shafat vehu choresh sheneym-ashar tsemadiym lefanayv vehu visheneym heashar vayaavor eliyahu elayv vayashelekhe adaretvo elayv

Hebrew: וַיַּעֲזֹ֣ב אֶת־הַבָּקָ֗ר וַיָּ֙רׇץ֙ אַחֲרֵ֣י אֵלִיָּ֔הוּ וַיֹּ֗אמֶר אֶשְּׁקָה־נָּא֙ לְאָבִ֣י וּלְאִמִּ֔י וְאֵלְכָ֖ה אַחֲרֶ֑יךָ וַיֹּ֤אמֶר לוֹ֙ לֵ֣ךְ שׁ֔וּב כִּ֥י מֶה־עָשִׂ֖יתִי לָֽךְ׃
Translated: He left the oxen and ran after Elijah, saying: “Let me kiss my father and mother good-by, and I will follow you.” And he answered him, “Go back. What have I done to you?”
Transliteration: vayaazov et-havakar vayarׇts acharey eliyahu vayomer eshekah-na leaviy uleimiy veelekhah achareykha vayomer lvo lekhe shuv khiy meh-ashiytiy lakhe

Hebrew: וַיָּ֨שׇׁב מֵאַחֲרָ֜יו וַיִּקַּ֣ח אֶת־צֶ֧מֶד הַבָּקָ֣ר וַיִּזְבָּחֵ֗הוּ וּבִכְלִ֤י הַבָּקָר֙ בִּשְּׁלָ֣ם הַבָּשָׂ֔ר וַיִּתֵּ֥ן לָעָ֖ם וַיֹּאכֵ֑לוּ וַיָּ֗קׇם וַיֵּ֛לֶךְ אַחֲרֵ֥י אֵלִיָּ֖הוּ וַֽיְשָׁרְתֵֽהוּ׃ {פ}
Translated: He turned back from him and took the yoke of oxen and slaughtered them; he boiled their meat with the gear of the oxen and gave it to the people, and they ate. Then he arose and followed Elijah and became his attendant.
Transliteration: vayashׇv meacharayv vayikach et-tsemed havakar vayizevachehu uvikheliy havakar vishelam havashar vayiten laam vayokhelu vayakׇm vayelekhe acharey eliyahu vayesharetehu {f}

Hebrew: וּבֶן־הֲדַ֣ד מֶלֶךְ־אֲרָ֗ם קָבַץ֙ אֶת־כׇּל־חֵיל֔וֹ וּשְׁלֹשִׁ֨ים וּשְׁנַ֥יִם מֶ֛לֶךְ אִתּ֖וֹ וְס֣וּס וָרָ֑כֶב וַיַּ֗עַל וַיָּ֙צַר֙ עַל־שֹׁ֣מְר֔וֹן וַיִּלָּ֖חֶם בָּֽהּ׃
Translated: King Ben-hadad of Aram gathered his whole army; thirty-two kings accompanied him with horses and chariots. He advanced against Samaria, laid siege to it, and attacked it.
Transliteration: uven-hadad melekhe-aram kavats et-khׇl-cheylvo usheloshiym ushenayiim melekhe itvo vesus varakhev vayaal vayatsar al-shomervon vayilachem vah

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׁלַ֧ח מַלְאָכִ֛ים אֶל־אַחְאָ֥ב מֶלֶךְ־יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל הָעִֽירָה׃
Translated: And he sent messengers to Ahab inside the city
Transliteration: vayishelach maleakhiym el-acheav melekhe-yisherael haiyrah

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר ל֗וֹ כֹּ֚ה אָמַ֣ר בֶּן־הֲדַ֔ד כַּסְפְּךָ֥ וּֽזְהָבְךָ֖ לִי־ה֑וּא וְנָשֶׁ֧יךָ וּבָנֶ֛יךָ הַטּוֹבִ֖ים לִי־הֵֽם׃
Translated: to say to him, “Thus said Ben-hadad: Your silver and gold are mine, and your beautiful wives and children are mine.”
Transliteration: vayomer lvo khoh amar ven-hadad khasefekha uzehavekha liy-hu venasheykha uvaneykha hatvoviym liy-hem

Hebrew: וַיַּ֤עַן מֶֽלֶךְ־יִשְׂרָאֵל֙ וַיֹּ֔אמֶר כִּדְבָרְךָ֖ אֲדֹנִ֣י הַמֶּ֑לֶךְ לְךָ֥ אֲנִ֖י וְכׇל־אֲשֶׁר־לִֽי׃
Translated: The king of Israel replied, “As you say, my lord king: I and all I have are yours.”
Transliteration: vayaan melekhe-yisherael vayomer khidevarekha adoniy hamelekhe lekha aniy vekhׇl-asher-liy

Hebrew: וַיָּשֻׁ֙בוּ֙ הַמַּלְאָכִ֔ים וַיֹּ֣אמְר֔וּ כֹּה־אָמַ֥ר בֶּן־הֲדַ֖ד לֵאמֹ֑ר כִּֽי־שָׁלַ֤חְתִּי אֵלֶ֙יךָ֙ לֵאמֹ֔ר כַּסְפְּךָ֧ וּֽזְהָבְךָ֛ וְנָשֶׁ֥יךָ וּבָנֶ֖יךָ לִ֥י תִתֵּֽן׃
Translated: Then the messengers came again and said, “Thus said Ben-hadad: When I sent you the order to give me your silver and gold, and your wives and children,
Transliteration: vayashuvu hamaleakhiym vayomeru khoh-amar ven-hadad lemor khiy-shalachetiy eleykha lemor khasefekha uzehavekha venasheykha uvaneykha liy titen

Hebrew: כִּ֣י ׀ אִם־כָּעֵ֣ת מָחָ֗ר אֶשְׁלַ֤ח אֶת־עֲבָדַי֙ אֵלֶ֔יךָ וְחִפְּשׂוּ֙ אֶת־בֵּ֣יתְךָ֔ וְאֵ֖ת בָּתֵּ֣י עֲבָדֶ֑יךָ וְהָיָה֙ כׇּל־מַחְמַ֣ד עֵינֶ֔יךָ יָשִׂ֥ימוּ בְיָדָ֖ם וְלָקָֽחוּ׃
Translated: I meant that tomorrow at this time I will send my servants to you and they will search your house and the houses of your courtiers and seize everything you prize and take it away.”
Transliteration: khiy im-khaet machar eshelach et-avaday eleykha vechifeshu et-veytekha veet vatey avadeykha vehayah khׇl-machemad eyneykha yashiymu veyadam velakachu

Hebrew: וַיִּקְרָ֤א מֶֽלֶךְ־יִשְׂרָאֵל֙ לְכׇל־זִקְנֵ֣י הָאָ֔רֶץ וַיֹּ֙אמֶר֙ דְּעוּ־נָ֣א וּרְא֔וּ כִּ֥י רָעָ֖ה זֶ֣ה מְבַקֵּ֑שׁ כִּֽי־שָׁלַ֨ח אֵלַ֜י לְנָשַׁ֤י וּלְבָנַי֙ וּלְכַסְפִּ֣י וְלִזְהָבִ֔י וְלֹ֥א מָנַ֖עְתִּי מִמֶּֽנּוּ׃
Translated: Then the king of Israel summoned all the elders of the land, and he said, “See for yourselves how that man is bent on evil! For when he demanded my wives and my children, my silver and my gold, I did not refuse him.”
Transliteration: vayikera melekhe-yisherael lekhׇl-zikeney haarets vayomer deu-na ureu khiy raah zeh mevakesh khiy-shalach elay lenashay ulevanay ulekhasefiy velizehaviy velo manaetiy mimenu

Hebrew: וַיֹּאמְר֥וּ אֵלָ֛יו כׇּל־הַזְּקֵנִ֖ים וְכׇל־הָעָ֑ם אַל־תִּשְׁמַ֖ע וְל֥וֹא תֹאבֶֽה׃
Translated: All the elders and all the people said, “Do not obey and do not submit!”
Transliteration: vayomeru elayv khׇl-hazekeniym vekhׇl-haam al-tishema velvo toveh

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֜אמֶר לְמַלְאֲכֵ֣י בֶן־הֲדַ֗ד אִמְר֞וּ לַאדֹנִ֤י הַמֶּ֙לֶךְ֙ כֹּל֩ אֲשֶׁר־שָׁלַ֨חְתָּ אֶל־עַבְדְּךָ֤ בָרִֽאשֹׁנָה֙ אֶעֱשֶׂ֔ה וְהַדָּבָ֣ר הַזֶּ֔ה לֹ֥א אוּכַ֖ל לַעֲשׂ֑וֹת וַיֵּֽלְכוּ֙ הַמַּלְאָכִ֔ים וַיְשִׁבֻ֖הוּ דָּבָֽר׃
Translated: So he said to Ben-hadad’s messengers, “Tell my lord the king: All that you first demanded of your servant I shall do, but this thing I cannot do.” The messengers went and reported this to him.
Transliteration: vayomer lemaleakhey ven-hadad imeru ladoniy hamelekhe khol asher-shalacheta el-avedekha varishonah eesheh vehadavar hazeh lo ukhal laashvot vayelekhu hamaleakhiym vayeshivuhu davar

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׁלַ֤ח אֵלָיו֙ בֶּן־הֲדַ֔ד וַיֹּ֕אמֶר כֹּה־יַעֲשׂ֥וּן לִ֛י אֱלֹהִ֖ים וְכֹ֣ה יוֹסִ֑פוּ אִם־יִשְׂפֹּק֙ עֲפַ֣ר שֹׁמְר֔וֹן לִשְׁעָלִ֕ים לְכׇל־הָעָ֖ם אֲשֶׁ֥ר בְּרַגְלָֽי׃
Translated: Thereupon Ben-hadad sent him this message: “May the gods do thus to me and even more, if the dust of Samaria will provide even a handful for each of the men who are right behind me!”
Transliteration: vayishelach elayv ven-hadad vayomer khoh-yaashun liy Elohim vekhoh yvosifu im-yishefok afar shomervon lishealiym lekhׇl-haam asher veragelay

Hebrew: וַיַּ֤עַן מֶֽלֶךְ־יִשְׂרָאֵל֙ וַיֹּ֣אמֶר דַּבְּר֔וּ אַל־יִתְהַלֵּ֥ל חֹגֵ֖ר כִּמְפַתֵּֽחַ׃
