Translated: The king of Israel replied, “Tell him: Let not him who girds on his sword boast like him who ungirds it!”
Transliteration: vayaan melekhe-yisherael vayomer daveru al-yitehalel choger khimefatecha

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֗י כִּשְׁמֹ֙עַ֙ אֶת־הַדָּבָ֣ר הַזֶּ֔ה וְה֥וּא שֹׁתֶ֛ה ה֥וּא וְהַמְּלָכִ֖ים בַּסֻּכּ֑וֹת וַיֹּ֤אמֶר אֶל־עֲבָדָיו֙ שִׂ֔ימוּ וַיָּשִׂ֖ימוּ עַל־הָעִֽיר׃
Translated: On hearing this reply—while he and the other kings were drinking together at Succoth—Ben-hadad commanded his followers, “Advance!” And they advanced against the city.
Transliteration: vayehiy khishemoa et-hadavar hazeh vehu shoteh hu vehamelakhiym vasukhvot vayomer el-avadayv shiymu vayashiymu al-haiyr

Hebrew: וְהִנֵּ֣ה ׀ נָבִ֣יא אֶחָ֗ד נִגַּשׁ֮ אֶל־אַחְאָ֣ב מֶלֶךְ־יִשְׂרָאֵל֒ וַיֹּ֗אמֶר כֹּ֚ה אָמַ֣ר יְהֹוָ֔ה הֲֽרָאִ֔יתָ אֵ֛ת כׇּל־הֶהָמ֥וֹן הַגָּד֖וֹל הַזֶּ֑ה הִנְנִ֨י נֹתְנ֤וֹ בְיָֽדְךָ֙ הַיּ֔וֹם וְיָדַעְתָּ֖ כִּֽי־אֲנִ֥י יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: Then a certain prophet went up to King Ahab of Israel and said, “Thus said G<small>OD</small>: Do you see that great host? I will deliver it into your hands today, and you shall know that I am G<small>OD</small>.”
Transliteration: vehineh naviy echad nigash el-acheav melekhe-yisherael vayomer khoh amar yehovah haraiyta et khׇl-hehamvon hagadvol hazeh hineniy notenvo veyadekha hayyvom veyadaeta khiy-aniy yehovah

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר אַחְאָב֙ בְּמִ֔י וַיֹּ֙אמֶר֙ כֹּה־אָמַ֣ר יְהֹוָ֔ה בְּנַעֲרֵ֖י שָׂרֵ֣י הַמְּדִינ֑וֹת וַיֹּ֛אמֶר מִי־יֶאְסֹ֥ר הַמִּלְחָמָ֖ה וַיֹּ֥אמֶר אָֽתָּה׃
Translated: “Through whom?” asked Ahab. He answered, “Thus said G<small>OD</small>: Through the aides of the provincial governors.” He asked, “Who shall begin the battle?” And he answered, “You.”
Transliteration: vayomer acheav vemiy vayomer khoh-amar yehovah venaarey sharey hamediynvot vayomer miy-yeesor hamilechamah vayomer atah

Hebrew: וַיִּפְקֹ֗ד אֶֽת־נַעֲרֵי֙ שָׂרֵ֣י הַמְּדִינ֔וֹת וַיִּהְי֕וּ מָאתַ֖יִם שְׁנַ֣יִם וּשְׁלֹשִׁ֑ים וְאַחֲרֵיהֶ֗ם פָּקַ֧ד אֶת־כׇּל־הָעָ֛ם כׇּל־בְּנֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל שִׁבְעַ֥ת אֲלָפִֽים׃
Translated: So he mustered the aides of the provincial governors, 232 strong, and then he mustered all the troops—all the Israelites—7,000 strong.
Transliteration: vayifekod et-naarey sharey hamediynvot vayiheyu matayiim shenayiim usheloshiym veachareyhem fakad et-khׇl-haam khׇl-veney yisherael shiveat alafiym

Hebrew: וַיֵּצְא֖וּ בַּֽצׇּהֳרָ֑יִם וּבֶן־הֲדַד֩ שֹׁתֶ֨ה שִׁכּ֜וֹר בַּסֻּכּ֗וֹת ה֧וּא וְהַמְּלָכִ֛ים שְׁלֹשִֽׁים־וּשְׁנַ֥יִם מֶ֖לֶךְ עֹזֵ֥ר אֹתֽוֹ׃
Translated: They marched out at noon, while Ben-hadad was drinking himself drunk at Succoth together with the thirty-two kings allied with him.
Transliteration: vayetseu vatsׇhorayiim uven-hadad shoteh shikhvor vasukhvot hu vehamelakhiym sheloshiym-ushenayiim melekhe ozer otvo

Hebrew: וַיֵּצְא֗וּ נַעֲרֵ֛י שָׂרֵ֥י הַמְּדִינ֖וֹת בָּרִֽאשֹׁנָ֑ה וַיִּשְׁלַ֣ח בֶּן־הֲדַ֗ד וַיַּגִּ֤ידוּ לוֹ֙ לֵאמֹ֔ר אֲנָשִׁ֕ים יָצְא֖וּ מִשֹּׁמְרֽוֹן׃
Translated: The aides of the provincial governors rushed out first. Ben-hadad sent [scouts], who told him, “Some men have come out from Samaria.”
Transliteration: vayetseu naarey sharey hamediynvot varishonah vayishelach ven-hadad vayagiydu lvo lemor anashiym yatseu mishomervon

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֛אמֶר אִם־לְשָׁל֥וֹם יָצָ֖אוּ תִּפְשׂ֣וּם חַיִּ֑ים וְאִ֧ם לְמִלְחָמָ֛ה יָצָ֖אוּ חַיִּ֥ים תִּפְשֽׂוּם׃
Translated: He said, “If they have come out to surrender, take them alive; and if they have come out for battle, take them alive anyhow.”
Transliteration: vayomer im-leshalvom yatsau tifeshum chayiym veim lemilechamah yatsau chayiym tifeshum

Hebrew: וְאֵ֙לֶּה֙ יָצְא֣וּ מִן־הָעִ֔יר נַעֲרֵ֖י שָׂרֵ֣י הַמְּדִינ֑וֹת וְהַחַ֖יִל אֲשֶׁ֥ר אַחֲרֵיהֶֽם׃
Translated: But the others—the aides of the provincial governors, with the army behind them—had already rushed out of the city,
Transliteration: veeleh yatseu min-haiyr naarey sharey hamediynvot vehachayiil asher achareyhem

Hebrew: וַיַּכּוּ֙ אִ֣ישׁ אִישׁ֔וֹ וַיָּנֻ֣סֽוּ אֲרָ֔ם וַֽיִּרְדְּפֵ֖ם יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל וַיִּמָּלֵ֗ט בֶּן־הֲדַד֙ מֶ֣לֶךְ אֲרָ֔ם עַל־ס֖וּס וּפָרָשִֽׁים׃
Translated: and each of them struck down his opponent. The Arameans fled, and Israel pursued them; but King Ben-hadad of Aram escaped on a horse with other riders.
Transliteration: vayakhu iysh iyshvo vayanusu aram vayiredefem yisherael vayimalet ven-hadad melekhe aram al-sus ufarashiym

Hebrew: וַיֵּצֵא֙ מֶ֣לֶךְ יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל וַיַּ֥ךְ אֶת־הַסּ֖וּס וְאֶת־הָרָ֑כֶב וְהִכָּ֥ה בַאֲרָ֖ם מַכָּ֥ה גְדוֹלָֽה׃
Translated: The king of Israel came out and attacked the horses and chariots, and inflicted a great defeat on the Arameans.
Transliteration: vayetse melekhe yisherael vayakhe et-hasus veet-harakhev vehikhah vaaram makhah gedvolah

Hebrew: וַיִּגַּ֤שׁ הַנָּבִיא֙ אֶל־מֶ֣לֶךְ יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל וַיֹּ֤אמֶר לוֹ֙ לֵ֣ךְ הִתְחַזַּ֔ק וְדַ֥ע וּרְאֵ֖ה אֵ֣ת אֲשֶׁר־תַּעֲשֶׂ֑ה כִּ֚י לִתְשׁוּבַ֣ת הַשָּׁנָ֔ה מֶ֥לֶךְ אֲרָ֖ם עֹלֶ֥ה עָלֶֽיךָ׃ {פ}
Translated: Then the prophet approached the king of Israel and said to him, “Go, keep up your efforts, and consider well what you must do; for the king of Aram will attack you at the turn of the year.”
Transliteration: vayigash hanaviy el-melekhe yisherael vayomer lvo lekhe hitechazak veda ureeh et asher-taasheh khiy liteshuvat hashanah melekhe aram oleh aleykha {f}

Hebrew: וְעַבְדֵ֨י מֶלֶךְ־אֲרָ֜ם אָמְר֣וּ אֵלָ֗יו אֱלֹהֵ֤י הָרִים֙ אֱלֹ֣הֵיהֶ֔ם עַל־כֵּ֖ן חָזְק֣וּ מִמֶּ֑נּוּ וְאוּלָ֗ם נִלָּחֵ֤ם אִתָּם֙ בַּמִּישׁ֔וֹר אִם־לֹ֥א נֶחֱזַ֖ק מֵהֶֽם׃
Translated: Now the ministers of the king of Aram said to him, “Their God is a God of mountains; that is why they got the better of us. But if we fight them in the plain, we will surely get the better of them.
Transliteration: veavedey melekhe-aram ameru elayv elohey hariym eloheyhem al-khen chazeku mimenu veulam nilachem itam vamiyshvor im-lo nechezak mehem

Hebrew: וְאֶת־הַדָּבָ֥ר הַזֶּ֖ה עֲשֵׂ֑ה הָסֵ֤ר הַמְּלָכִים֙ אִ֣ישׁ מִמְּקֹמ֔וֹ וְשִׂ֥ים פַּח֖וֹת תַּחְתֵּיהֶֽם׃
Translated: Do this: Remove all the kings from their posts and appoint governors in their place.
Transliteration: veet-hadavar hazeh asheh haser hamelakhiym iysh mimekomvo veshiym fachvot tacheteyhem

Hebrew: וְאַתָּ֣ה תִֽמְנֶֽה־לְךָ֣ ׀ חַ֡יִל כַּחַ֩יִל֩ הַנֹּפֵ֨ל מֵאוֹתָ֜ךְ וְס֥וּס כַּסּ֣וּס ׀ וְרֶ֣כֶב כָּרֶ֗כֶב וְנִֽלָּחֲמָ֤ה אוֹתָם֙ בַּמִּישׁ֔וֹר אִם־לֹ֥א נֶחֱזַ֖ק מֵהֶ֑ם וַיִּשְׁמַ֥ע לְקֹלָ֖ם וַיַּ֥עַשׂ כֵּֽן׃ {פ}
Translated: Then muster for yourself an army equal to the army you lost, horse for horse and chariot for chariot. And let us fight them in the plain, and we will surely get the better of them.” He took their advice and acted accordingly.
Transliteration: veatah timeneh-lekha chayiil khachayiil hanofel mevotakhe vesus khasus verekhev kharekhev venilachamah votam vamiyshvor im-lo nechezak mehem vayishema lekolam vayaash khen {f}

Hebrew: וַֽיְהִי֙ לִתְשׁוּבַ֣ת הַשָּׁנָ֔ה וַיִּפְקֹ֥ד בֶּן־הֲדַ֖ד אֶת־אֲרָ֑ם וַיַּ֣עַל אֲפֵ֔קָה לַמִּלְחָמָ֖ה עִם־יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated: At the turn of the year, Ben-hadad mustered the Arameans and advanced on Aphek to fight Israel.
Transliteration: vayehiy liteshuvat hashanah vayifekod ven-hadad et-aram vayaal afekah lamilechamah im-yisherael

Hebrew: וּבְנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֗ל הׇתְפָּקְדוּ֙ וְכׇלְכְּל֔וּ וַיֵּלְכ֖וּ לִקְרָאתָ֑ם וַיַּחֲנ֨וּ בְנֵי־יִשְׂרָאֵ֜ל נֶגְדָּ֗ם כִּשְׁנֵי֙ חֲשִׂפֵ֣י עִזִּ֔ים וַאֲרָ֖ם מִלְא֥וּ אֶת־הָאָֽרֶץ׃
Translated: Now the Israelites had been mustered and provisioned, and they went out against them; but when the Israelites encamped against them, they looked like two flocks of goats, while the Arameans covered the land.
Transliteration: uveney yisherael hׇtefakedu vekhׇlekhelu vayelekhu likeratam vayachanu veney-yisherael negedam khisheney chashifey iziym vaaram mileu et-haarets

Hebrew: וַיִּגַּ֞שׁ אִ֣ישׁ הָאֱלֹהִ֗ים וַיֹּ֘אמֶר֮ אֶל־מֶ֣לֶךְ יִשְׂרָאֵל֒ וַיֹּ֜אמֶר כֹּֽה־אָמַ֣ר יְהֹוָ֗ה יַ֠עַן אֲשֶׁ֨ר אָמְר֤וּ אֲרָם֙ אֱלֹהֵ֤י הָרִים֙ יְהֹוָ֔ה וְלֹֽא־אֱלֹהֵ֥י עֲמָקִ֖ים ה֑וּא וְ֠נָתַתִּ֠י אֶת־כׇּל־הֶהָמ֨וֹן הַגָּד֤וֹל הַזֶּה֙ בְּיָדֶ֔ךָ וִידַעְתֶּ֖ם כִּֽי־אֲנִ֥י יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: Then the agent of God approached and spoke to the king of Israel, “Thus said G<small>OD</small>: Because the Arameans have said, ‘G<small>OD</small> is a God of mountains—but not a God of lowlands,’ I will deliver that great host into your hands; and you shall know that I am G<small>OD</small>.”
Transliteration: vayigash iysh haElohim vayomer el-melekhe yisherael vayomer khoh-amar yehovah yaan asher ameru aram elohey hariym yehovah velo-elohey amakiym hu venatatiy et-khׇl-hehamvon hagadvol hazeh veyadekha viydaetem khiy-aniy yehovah

Hebrew: וַֽיַּחֲנ֧וּ אֵ֦לֶּה נֹֽכַח־אֵ֖לֶּה שִׁבְעַ֣ת יָמִ֑ים וַיְהִ֣י ׀ בַּיּ֣וֹם הַשְּׁבִיעִ֗י וַתִּקְרַב֙ הַמִּלְחָמָ֔ה וַיַּכּ֨וּ בְנֵי־יִשְׂרָאֵ֧ל אֶת־אֲרָ֛ם מֵאָה־אֶ֥לֶף רַגְלִ֖י בְּי֥וֹם אֶחָֽד׃
Translated: For seven days they were encamped opposite each other. On the seventh day, the battle was joined and the Israelites struck down 100,000 Aramean foot soldiers in one day.
Transliteration: vayachanu eleh nokhach-eleh shiveat yamiym vayehiy vayyvom hasheviyiy vatikerav hamilechamah vayakhu veney-yisherael et-aram meah-elef rageliy veyvom echad

Hebrew: וַיָּנֻ֨סוּ הַנּוֹתָרִ֥ים <small>׀</small> אֲפֵ֘קָה֮ אֶל־הָעִיר֒ וַתִּפֹּל֙ הַחוֹמָ֔ה עַל־עֶשְׂרִ֨ים וְשִׁבְעָ֥ה אֶ֛לֶף אִ֖ישׁ הַנּוֹתָרִ֑ים וּבֶן־הֲדַ֣ד נָ֔ס וַיָּבֹ֥א אֶל־הָעִ֖יר חֶ֥דֶר בְּחָֽדֶר׃
Translated:
The survivors fled to Aphek, inside the town, and the wall fell on the 27,000 survivors.
Ben-hadad also fled and took refuge inside the town, in an inner chamber.
Transliteration: vayanusu hanvotariym <small></small> afekah el-haiyr vatifol hachvomah al-esheriym veshiveah elef iysh hanvotariym uven-hadad nas vayavo el-haiyr cheder vechader

Hebrew: וַיֹּאמְר֣וּ אֵלָיו֮ עֲבָדָיו֒ הִנֵּה־נָ֣א שָׁמַ֔עְנוּ כִּ֗י מַלְכֵי֙ בֵּ֣ית יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל כִּֽי־מַלְכֵ֥י חֶ֖סֶד הֵ֑ם נָשִׂ֣ימָה נָּא֩ שַׂקִּ֨ים בְּמׇתְנֵ֜ינוּ וַחֲבָלִ֣ים בְּרֹאשֵׁ֗נוּ וְנֵצֵא֙ אֶל־מֶ֣לֶךְ יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל אוּלַ֖י יְחַיֶּ֥ה אֶת־נַפְשֶֽׁךָ׃
Translated: His ministers said to him, “We have heard that the kings of the House of Israel are magnanimous kings. Let us put sackcloth on our loins and ropes on our heads, and surrender to the king of Israel; perhaps he will spare your life.”
Transliteration: vayomeru elayv avadayv hineh-na shamaenu khiy malekhey veyt yisherael khiy-malekhey chesed hem nashiymah na shakiym vemׇteneynu vachavaliym veroshenu venetse el-melekhe yisherael ulay yechayeh et-nafeshekha

Hebrew: וַיַּחְגְּרוּ֩ שַׂקִּ֨ים בְּמׇתְנֵיהֶ֜ם וַחֲבָלִ֣ים בְּרָאשֵׁיהֶ֗ם וַיָּבֹ֙אוּ֙ אֶל־מֶ֣לֶךְ יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל וַיֹּ֣אמְר֔וּ עַבְדְּךָ֧ בֶן־הֲדַ֛ד אָמַ֖ר תְּחִי־נָ֣א נַפְשִׁ֑י וַיֹּ֛אמֶר הַעוֹדֶ֥נּוּ חַ֖י אָחִ֥י הֽוּא׃
Translated: So they girded sackcloth on their loins and wound ropes around their heads, and came to the king of Israel and said, “Your servant Ben-hadad says, ‘I beg you, spare my life.’” He replied, “Is he still alive? He is my brother.”
Transliteration: vayachegeru shakiym vemׇteneyhem vachavaliym verasheyhem vayavou el-melekhe yisherael vayomeru avedekha ven-hadad amar techiy-na nafeshiy vayomer havodenu chay achiy hu

Hebrew: וְהָאֲנָשִׁים֩ יְנַחֲשׁ֨וּ וַֽיְמַהֲר֜וּ וַיַּחְלְט֣וּ הֲמִמֶּ֗נּוּ וַיֹּֽאמְרוּ֙ אָחִ֣יךָ בֶן־הֲדַ֔ד וַיֹּ֖אמֶר בֹּ֣אוּ קָחֻ֑הוּ וַיֵּצֵ֤א אֵלָיו֙ בֶּן־הֲדַ֔ד וַֽיַּעֲלֵ֖הוּ עַל־הַמֶּרְכָּבָֽה׃
Translated: The men divined his meaning and quickly caught the word from him, saying, “Yes, Ben-hadad is your brother.” “Go, bring him,” he said. Ben-hadad came out to him, and he invited him into his chariot.
Transliteration: vehaanashiym yenachashu vayemaharu vayacheletu hamimenu vayomeru achiykha ven-hadad vayomer vou kachuhu vayetse elayv ven-hadad vayaalehu al-hamerekhavah

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר אֵלָ֡יו הֶעָרִ֣ים אֲשֶׁר־לָֽקַח־אָבִי֩ מֵאֵ֨ת אָבִ֜יךָ אָשִׁ֗יב וְ֠חֻצ֠וֹת תָּשִׂ֨ים לְךָ֤ בְדַמֶּ֙שֶׂק֙ כַּֽאֲשֶׁר־שָׂ֤ם אָבִי֙ בְּשֹׁ֣מְר֔וֹן וַאֲנִ֖י בַּבְּרִ֣ית אֲשַׁלְּחֶ֑ךָּ וַיִּכְרׇת־ל֥וֹ בְרִ֖ית וַֽיְשַׁלְּחֵֽהוּ׃ {ס}
Translated: Ben-hadad said to him, “I will give back the towns that my father took from your father, and you may set up bazaars for yourself in Damascus as my father did in Samaria.” “And I, for my part,” [said Ahab,] “will let you go home under these terms.” So he made a treaty with him and dismissed him.
Transliteration: vayomer elayv heariym asher-lakach-aviy meet aviykha ashiyv vechutsvot tashiym lekha vedameshek khaasher-sham aviy veshomervon vaaniy vaveriyt ashalechekha vayikherׇt-lvo veriyt vayeshalechehu {s}

Hebrew: וְאִ֨ישׁ אֶחָ֜ד מִבְּנֵ֣י הַנְּבִיאִ֗ים אָמַ֧ר אֶל־רֵעֵ֛הוּ בִּדְבַ֥ר יְהֹוָ֖ה הַכֵּ֣ינִי נָ֑א וַיְמָאֵ֥ן הָאִ֖ישׁ לְהַכֹּתֽוֹ׃
Translated: A certain man, a disciple of the prophets, said to another, at the word of G<small>OD</small>, “Strike me”; but the man refused to strike him.
Transliteration: veiysh echad miveney haneviyiym amar el-reehu videvar yehovah hakheyniy na vayemaen haiysh lehakhotvo

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר ל֗וֹ יַ֚עַן אֲשֶׁ֤ר לֹא־שָׁמַ֙עְתָּ֙ בְּק֣וֹל יְהֹוָ֔ה הִנְּךָ֤ הוֹלֵךְ֙ מֵֽאִתִּ֔י וְהִכְּךָ֖ הָאַרְיֵ֑ה וַיֵּ֙לֶךְ֙ מֵֽאֶצְל֔וֹ וַיִּמְצָאֵ֥הוּ הָאַרְיֵ֖ה וַיַּכֵּֽהוּ׃
Translated: He said to him, “Because you have not obeyed G<small>OD</small>, a lion will strike you dead as soon as you leave me.” And when he left, a lion came upon him and killed him.
Transliteration: vayomer lvo yaan asher lo-shamaeta vekvol yehovah hinekha hvolekhe meitiy vehikhekha haareeih vayelekhe meetselvo vayimetsaehu haareeih vayakhehu

Hebrew: וַיִּמְצָא֙ אִ֣ישׁ אַחֵ֔ר וַיֹּ֖אמֶר הַכֵּ֣ינִי נָ֑א וַיַּכֵּ֥הוּ הָאִ֖ישׁ הַכֵּ֥ה וּפָצֹֽעַ׃
Translated: Then he met another man and said, “Come, strike me.” So the man struck him and wounded him.
Transliteration: vayimetsa iysh acher vayomer hakheyniy na vayakhehu haiysh hakheh ufatsoa

Hebrew: וַיֵּ֙לֶךְ֙ הַנָּבִ֔יא וַיַּעֲמֹ֥ד לַמֶּ֖לֶךְ עַל־הַדָּ֑רֶךְ וַיִּתְחַפֵּ֥שׂ בָּאֲפֵ֖ר עַל־עֵינָֽיו׃
Translated: Then the prophet, disguised by a cloth over his eyes, went and waited for the king by the road.
Transliteration: vayelekhe hanaviy vayaamod lamelekhe al-hadarekhe vayitechafesh vaafer al-eynayv

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֤י הַמֶּ֙לֶךְ֙ עֹבֵ֔ר וְה֖וּא צָעַ֣ק אֶל־הַמֶּ֑לֶךְ וַיֹּ֜אמֶר עַבְדְּךָ֣ ׀ יָצָ֣א בְקֶרֶב־הַמִּלְחָמָ֗ה וְהִנֵּֽה־אִ֨ישׁ סָ֜ר וַיָּבֵ֧א אֵלַ֣י אִ֗ישׁ וַיֹּ֙אמֶר֙ שְׁמֹר֙ אֶת־הָאִ֣ישׁ הַזֶּ֔ה אִם־הִפָּקֵד֙ יִפָּקֵ֔ד וְהָיְתָ֤ה נַפְשְׁךָ֙ תַּ֣חַת נַפְשׁ֔וֹ א֥וֹ כִכַּר־כֶּ֖סֶף תִּשְׁקֽוֹל׃
Translated: As the king passed by, he cried out to the king and said, “Your servant went out into the thick of the battle. Suddenly someone came over and brought a man to me, saying, ‘Guard this man! If he goes missing, it will be your life for his, or you will have to pay a talent of silver.’
Transliteration: vayehiy hamelekhe over vehu tsaak el-hamelekhe vayomer avedekha yatsa vekerev-hamilechamah vehineh-iysh sar vayave elay iysh vayomer shemor et-haiysh hazeh im-hifaked yifaked vehayetah nafeshekha tachat nafeshvo vo khikhar-khesef tishekvol

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֣י עַבְדְּךָ֗ עֹשֵׂ֥ה הֵ֛נָּה וָהֵ֖נָּה וְה֣וּא אֵינֶ֑נּוּ וַיֹּ֨אמֶר אֵלָ֧יו מֶלֶךְ־יִשְׂרָאֵ֛ל כֵּ֥ן מִשְׁפָּטֶ֖ךָ אַתָּ֥ה חָרָֽצְתָּ׃
Translated: While your servant was busy here and there, he got away.” The king of Israel responded, “You have your verdict; you pronounced it yourself.”
Transliteration: vayehiy avedekha osheh henah vahenah vehu eynenu vayomer elayv melekhe-yisherael khen mishefatekha atah charatseta

Hebrew: וַיְמַהֵ֕ר וַיָּ֙סַר֙ אֶת־הָ֣אֲפֵ֔ר (מעל) [מֵעֲלֵ֖י] עֵינָ֑יו וַיַּכֵּ֤ר אֹתוֹ֙ מֶ֣לֶךְ יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל כִּ֥י מֵהַנְּבִיאִ֖ים הֽוּא׃
Translated: Quickly he removed the cloth from his eyes, and the king recognized him as one of the prophets.
Transliteration: vayemaher vayasar et-haafer (ml) [mealey] eynayv vayakher otvo melekhe yisherael khiy mehaneviyiym hu

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר אֵלָ֗יו כֹּ֚ה אָמַ֣ר יְהֹוָ֔ה יַ֛עַן שִׁלַּ֥חְתָּ אֶת־אִישׁ־חֶרְמִ֖י מִיָּ֑ד וְהָיְתָ֤ה נַפְשְׁךָ֙ תַּ֣חַת נַפְשׁ֔וֹ וְעַמְּךָ֖ תַּ֥חַת עַמּֽוֹ׃
Translated: He said to him, “Thus said G<small>OD</small>: Because you have set free the man whom I doomed, your life shall be forfeit for his life and your people for his people.”
Transliteration: vayomer elayv khoh amar yehovah yaan shilacheta et-iysh-cheremiy miyad vehayetah nafeshekha tachat nafeshvo veamekha tachat amvo

Hebrew: וַיֵּ֧לֶךְ מֶלֶךְ־יִשְׂרָאֵ֛ל עַל־בֵּית֖וֹ סַ֣ר וְזָעֵ֑ף וַיָּבֹ֖א שֹׁמְרֽוֹנָה׃ {פ}
Translated: Dispirited and sullen, the king of Israel left for home and came to Samaria.
Transliteration: vayelekhe melekhe-yisherael al-veytvo sar vezaef vayavo shomervonah {f}

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֗י אַחַר֙ הַדְּבָרִ֣ים הָאֵ֔לֶּה כֶּ֧רֶם הָיָ֛ה לְנָב֥וֹת הַיִּזְרְעֵאלִ֖י אֲשֶׁ֣ר בְּיִזְרְעֶ֑אל אֵ֚צֶל הֵיכַ֣ל אַחְאָ֔ב מֶ֖לֶךְ שֹׁמְרֽוֹן׃
Translated: [The following events] occurred some time afterward: Naboth the Jezreelite owned a vineyard in Jezreel, adjoining the palace of King Ahab of Samaria.
Transliteration: vayehiy achar hadevariym haeleh kherem hayah lenavvot hayizereeliy asher veyizereel etsel heykhal acheav melekhe shomervon

Hebrew: וַיְדַבֵּ֣ר אַחְאָ֣ב אֶל־נָב֣וֹת <small>׀</small> לֵאמֹר֩ <small>׀</small> תְּנָה־לִּ֨י אֶֽת־כַּרְמְךָ֜ וִיהִי־לִ֣י לְגַן־יָרָ֗ק כִּ֣י ה֤וּא קָרוֹב֙ אֵ֣צֶל בֵּיתִ֔י וְאֶתְּנָ֤ה לְךָ֙ תַּחְתָּ֔יו כֶּ֖רֶם ט֣וֹב מִמֶּ֑נּוּ אִ֚ם ט֣וֹב בְּעֵינֶ֔יךָ אֶתְּנָֽה־לְךָ֥ כֶ֖סֶף מְחִ֥יר זֶֽה׃
Translated: Ahab said to Naboth, “Give me your vineyard, so that I may have it as a vegetable garden, since it is right next to my palace. I will give you a better vineyard in exchange; or, if you prefer, I will pay you the price in money.”
Transliteration: vayedaver acheav el-navvot <small></small> lemor <small></small> tenah-liy et-kharemekha viyhiy-liy legan-yarak khiy hu karvov etsel veytiy veetenah lekha tachetayv kherem tvov mimenu im tvov veeyneykha etenah-lekha khesef mechiyr zeh

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֥אמֶר נָב֖וֹת אֶל־אַחְאָ֑ב חָלִ֤ילָה לִּי֙ מֵֽיְהֹוָ֔ה מִתִּתִּ֛י אֶת־נַחֲלַ֥ת אֲבֹתַ֖י לָֽךְ׃
Translated: But Naboth replied, “G<small>OD</small> forbid that I should give up to you what I have inherited from my fathers!”
Transliteration: vayomer navvot el-acheav chaliylah liy meyehovah mititiy et-nachalat avotay lakhe

Hebrew: וַיָּבֹא֩ אַחְאָ֨ב אֶל־בֵּית֜וֹ סַ֣ר וְזָעֵ֗ף עַל־הַדָּבָר֙ אֲשֶׁר־דִּבֶּ֣ר אֵלָ֗יו נָבוֹת֙ הַיִּזְרְעֵאלִ֔י וַיֹּ֕אמֶר לֹא־אֶתֵּ֥ן לְךָ֖ אֶת־נַחֲלַ֣ת אֲבוֹתָ֑י וַיִּשְׁכַּב֙ עַל־מִטָּת֔וֹ וַיַּסֵּ֥ב אֶת־פָּנָ֖יו וְלֹא־אָ֥כַל לָֽחֶם׃
Translated: Ahab went home dispirited and sullen because of the answer that Naboth the Jezreelite had given him: “I will not give up to you what I have inherited from my fathers!” He lay down on his bed and turned away his face, and he would not eat.
Transliteration: vayavo acheav el-veytvo sar vezaef al-hadavar asher-diver elayv navvot hayizereeliy vayomer lo-eten lekha et-nachalat avvotay vayishekhav al-mitatvo vayasev et-fanayv velo-akhal lachem

Hebrew: וַתָּבֹ֥א אֵלָ֖יו אִיזֶ֣בֶל אִשְׁתּ֑וֹ וַתְּדַבֵּ֣ר אֵלָ֗יו מַה־זֶּה֙ רוּחֲךָ֣ סָרָ֔ה וְאֵינְךָ֖ אֹכֵ֥ל לָֽחֶם׃
Translated: His wife Jezebel came to him and asked him, “Why are you so dispirited that you won’t eat?”
Transliteration: vatavo elayv iyzevel ishetvo vatedaver elayv mah-zeh ruchakha sarah veeynekha okhel lachem

Hebrew: וַיְדַבֵּ֣ר אֵלֶ֗יהָ כִּֽי־אֲ֠דַבֵּ֠ר אֶל־נָב֨וֹת הַיִּזְרְעֵאלִ֜י וָאֹ֣מַר ל֗וֹ תְּנָה־לִּ֤י אֶֽת־כַּרְמְךָ֙ בְּכֶ֔סֶף א֚וֹ אִם־חָפֵ֣ץ אַתָּ֔ה אֶתְּנָֽה־לְךָ֥ כֶ֖רֶם תַּחְתָּ֑יו וַיֹּ֕אמֶר לֹא־אֶתֵּ֥ן לְךָ֖ אֶת־כַּרְמִֽי׃
Translated: So he told her, “I spoke to Naboth the Jezreelite and proposed to him, ‘Sell me your vineyard for money, or if you prefer, I’ll give you another vineyard in exchange’; but he answered, ‘I will not give my vineyard to you.’”
Transliteration: vayedaver eleyha khiy-adaver el-navvot hayizereeliy vaomar lvo tenah-liy et-kharemekha vekhesef vo im-chafets atah etenah-lekha kherem tachetayv vayomer lo-eten lekha et-kharemiy

Hebrew: וַתֹּ֤אמֶר אֵלָיו֙ אִיזֶ֣בֶל אִשְׁתּ֔וֹ אַתָּ֕ה עַתָּ֛ה תַּעֲשֶׂ֥ה מְלוּכָ֖ה עַל־יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל ק֤וּם אֱכׇל־לֶ֙חֶם֙ וְיִטַ֣ב לִבֶּ֔ךָ אֲנִי֙ אֶתֵּ֣ן לְךָ֔ אֶת־כֶּ֖רֶם נָב֥וֹת הַיִּזְרְעֵאלִֽי׃
Translated: His wife Jezebel said to him, “Now is the time to show yourself king over Israel. Rise and eat something, and be cheerful; I will get the vineyard of Naboth the Jezreelite for you.”
Transliteration: vatomer elayv iyzevel ishetvo atah atah taasheh melukhah al-yisherael kum ekhׇl-lechem veyitav livekha aniy eten lekha et-kherem navvot hayizereeliy

Hebrew: וַתִּכְתֹּ֤ב סְפָרִים֙ בְּשֵׁ֣ם אַחְאָ֔ב וַתַּחְתֹּ֖ם בְּחֹתָמ֑וֹ וַתִּשְׁלַ֣ח (הספרים) [סְפָרִ֗ים] אֶל־הַזְּקֵנִ֤ים וְאֶל־הַחֹרִים֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר בְּעִיר֔וֹ הַיֹּשְׁבִ֖ים אֶת־נָבֽוֹת׃
Translated: So she wrote letters in Ahab’s name and sealed them with his seal, and sent the letters to the elders and the nobles who lived in the same town with Naboth.
Transliteration: vatikhetov sefariym veshem acheav vatachetom vechotamvo vatishelach (hsfrym) [sefariym] el-hazekeniym veel-hachoriym asher veiyrvo hayosheviym et-navvot

Hebrew: וַתִּכְתֹּ֥ב בַּסְּפָרִ֖ים לֵאמֹ֑ר קִֽרְאוּ־צ֔וֹם וְהֹשִׁ֥יבוּ אֶת־נָב֖וֹת בְּרֹ֥אשׁ הָעָֽם׃
Translated: In the letters she wrote as follows: “Proclaim a fast and seat Naboth at the front of the assembly.
Transliteration: vatikhetov vasefariym lemor kireu-tsvom vehoshiyvu et-navvot verosh haam

Hebrew: וְ֠הוֹשִׁ֠יבוּ שְׁנַ֨יִם אֲנָשִׁ֥ים בְּנֵֽי־בְלִיַּ֘עַל֮ נֶגְדּוֹ֒ וִיעִדֻ֣הוּ לֵאמֹ֔ר בֵּרַ֥כְתָּ אֱלֹהִ֖ים וָמֶ֑לֶךְ וְהוֹצִיאֻ֥הוּ וְסִקְלֻ֖הוּ וְיָמֹֽת׃
Translated: And seat two scoundrels opposite him, and let them testify against him: ‘You have reviled God and king!’ Then take him out and stone him to death.”
Transliteration: vehvoshiyvu shenayiim anashiym veney-veliyaal negedvo viyiduhu lemor verakheta Elohim vamelekhe vehvotsiyuhu vesikeluhu veyamot

Hebrew: וַיַּעֲשׂוּ֩ אַנְשֵׁ֨י עִיר֜וֹ הַזְּקֵנִ֣ים וְהַחֹרִ֗ים אֲשֶׁ֤ר הַיֹּֽשְׁבִים֙ בְּעִיר֔וֹ כַּאֲשֶׁ֛ר שָׁלְחָ֥ה אֲלֵיהֶ֖ם אִיזָ֑בֶל כַּאֲשֶׁ֤ר כָּתוּב֙ בַּסְּפָרִ֔ים אֲשֶׁ֥ר שָׁלְחָ֖ה אֲלֵיהֶֽם׃
Translated: The people of his town—the elders and nobles who lived in his town—did as Jezebel had instructed them, just as was written in the letters she had sent them:
Transliteration: vayaashu aneshey iyrvo hazekeniym vehachoriym asher hayosheviym veiyrvo khaasher shalechah aleyhem iyzavel khaasher khatuv vasefariym asher shalechah aleyhem

Hebrew: קָרְא֖וּ צ֑וֹם וְהֹשִׁ֥יבוּ אֶת־נָב֖וֹת בְּרֹ֥אשׁ הָעָֽם׃
Translated: They proclaimed a fast and seated Naboth at the front of the assembly.
Transliteration: kareu tsvom vehoshiyvu et-navvot verosh haam

Hebrew: וַ֠יָּבֹ֠אוּ שְׁנֵ֨י הָאֲנָשִׁ֥ים בְּנֵֽי־בְלִיַּ֘עַל֮ וַיֵּשְׁב֣וּ נֶגְדּוֹ֒ וַיְעִדֻ֩הוּ֩ אַנְשֵׁ֨י הַבְּלִיַּ֜עַל אֶת־נָב֗וֹת נֶ֤גֶד הָעָם֙ לֵאמֹ֔ר בֵּרַ֥ךְ נָב֛וֹת אֱלֹהִ֖ים וָמֶ֑לֶךְ וַיֹּצִאֻ֙הוּ֙ מִח֣וּץ לָעִ֔יר וַיִּסְקְלֻ֥הוּ בָאֲבָנִ֖ים וַיָּמֹֽת׃
Translated: Then the two scoundrels came and sat down opposite him; and those scoundrels testified against Naboth publicly as follows: “Naboth has reviled God and king.” Then they took him outside the town and stoned him to death.
Transliteration: vayavou sheney haanashiym veney-veliyaal vayeshevu negedvo vayeiduhu aneshey haveliyaal et-navvot neged haam lemor verakhe navvot Elohim vamelekhe vayotsiuhu michuts laiyr vayisekeluhu vaavaniym vayamot

Hebrew: וַֽיִּשְׁלְח֖וּ אֶל־אִיזֶ֣בֶל לֵאמֹ֑ר סֻקַּ֥ל נָב֖וֹת וַיָּמֹֽת׃
Translated: Word was sent to Jezebel: “Naboth has been stoned to death.”
Transliteration: vayishelechu el-iyzevel lemor sukal navvot vayamot

Hebrew: וַֽיְהִי֙ כִּשְׁמֹ֣עַ אִיזֶ֔בֶל כִּי־סֻקַּ֥ל נָב֖וֹת וַיָּמֹ֑ת וַתֹּ֨אמֶר אִיזֶ֜בֶל אֶל־אַחְאָ֗ב ק֣וּם רֵ֞שׁ אֶת־כֶּ֣רֶם ׀ נָב֣וֹת הַיִּזְרְעֵאלִ֗י אֲשֶׁ֤ר מֵאֵן֙ לָתֶת־לְךָ֣ בְכֶ֔סֶף כִּ֣י אֵ֥ין נָב֛וֹת חַ֖י כִּי־מֵֽת׃
Translated: As soon as Jezebel heard that Naboth had been stoned to death, she said to Ahab, “Go and take possession of the vineyard that Naboth the Jezreelite refused to sell you for money; for Naboth is no longer alive, he is dead.”
Transliteration: vayehiy khishemoa iyzevel khiy-sukal navvot vayamot vatomer iyzevel el-acheav kum resh et-kherem navvot hayizereeliy asher meen latet-lekha vekhesef khiy eyn navvot chay khiy-met

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֛י כִּשְׁמֹ֥עַ אַחְאָ֖ב כִּ֣י מֵ֣ת נָב֑וֹת וַיָּ֣קׇם אַחְאָ֗ב לָרֶ֛דֶת אֶל־כֶּ֛רֶם נָב֥וֹת הַיִּזְרְעֵאלִ֖י לְרִשְׁתּֽוֹ׃ {פ}
Translated: When Ahab heard that Naboth was dead, Ahab set out for the vineyard of Naboth the Jezreelite to take possession of it.
Transliteration: vayehiy khishemoa acheav khiy met navvot vayakׇm acheav laredet el-kherem navvot hayizereeliy lerishetvo {f}

Hebrew: וַֽיְהִי֙ דְּבַר־יְהֹוָ֔ה אֶל־אֵלִיָּ֥הוּ הַתִּשְׁבִּ֖י לֵאמֹֽר׃
Translated: Then the word of G<small>OD</small> came to Elijah the Tishbite:
Transliteration: vayehiy devar-yehovah el-eliyahu hatisheviy lemor

Hebrew: ק֣וּם רֵ֗ד לִקְרַ֛את אַחְאָ֥ב מֶלֶךְ־יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל אֲשֶׁ֣ר בְּשֹׁמְר֑וֹן הִנֵּה֙ בְּכֶ֣רֶם נָב֔וֹת אֲשֶׁר־יָ֥רַד שָׁ֖ם לְרִשְׁתּֽוֹ׃
Translated: “Go down and confront King Ahab of Israel who [resides] in Samaria. He is now in Naboth’s vineyard; he has gone down there to take possession of it.
Transliteration: kum red likerat acheav melekhe-yisherael asher veshomervon hineh vekherem navvot asher-yarad sham lerishetvo

Hebrew: וְדִבַּרְתָּ֨ אֵלָ֜יו לֵאמֹ֗ר כֹּ֚ה אָמַ֣ר יְהֹוָ֔ה הֲרָצַ֖חְתָּ וְגַם־יָרָ֑שְׁתָּ וְדִבַּרְתָּ֨ אֵלָ֜יו לֵאמֹ֗ר כֹּ֚ה אָמַ֣ר יְהֹוָ֔ה בִּמְק֗וֹם אֲשֶׁ֨ר לָקְק֤וּ הַכְּלָבִים֙ אֶת־דַּ֣ם נָב֔וֹת יָלֹ֧קּוּ הַכְּלָבִ֛ים אֶת־דָּמְךָ֖ גַּם־אָֽתָּה׃
Translated: Say to him, ‘Thus said G<small>OD</small>: Would you murder and take possession? Thus said G<small>OD</small>: In the very place where the dogs lapped up Naboth’s blood, the dogs will lap up your blood too.’”
Transliteration: vedivareta elayv lemor khoh amar yehovah haratsacheta vegam-yarasheta vedivareta elayv lemor khoh amar yehovah vimekvom asher lakeku hakhelaviym et-dam navvot yaloku hakhelaviym et-damekha gam-atah

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר אַחְאָב֙ אֶל־אֵ֣לִיָּ֔הוּ הַֽמְצָאתַ֖נִי אֹֽיְבִ֑י וַיֹּ֣אמֶר מָצָ֔אתִי יַ֚עַן הִתְמַכֶּרְךָ֔ לַעֲשׂ֥וֹת הָרַ֖ע בְּעֵינֵ֥י יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: Ahab said to Elijah, “So you have found me, my enemy?” “Yes, I have found you,” he replied. “Because you have committed yourself to doing what is evil in G<small>OD</small>’s sight,
Transliteration: vayomer acheav el-eliyahu hametsataniy oyeviy vayomer matsatiy yaan hitemakherekha laashvot hara veeyney yehovah

Hebrew: הִנְנִ֨י מֵבִ֤י אֵלֶ֙יךָ֙ רָעָ֔ה וּבִעַרְתִּ֖י אַחֲרֶ֑יךָ וְהִכְרַתִּ֤י לְאַחְאָב֙ מַשְׁתִּ֣ין בְּקִ֔יר וְעָצ֥וּר וְעָז֖וּב בְּיִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated: I will bring disaster upon you. I will make a clean sweep of you, I will cut off from Israel every male belonging to Ahab, bond and free.
Transliteration: hineniy meviy eleykha raah uviaretiy achareykha vehikheratiy leacheav mashetiyn vekiyr veatsur veazuv veyisherael

Hebrew: וְנָתַתִּ֣י אֶת־בֵּיתְךָ֗ כְּבֵית֙ יָרׇבְעָ֣ם בֶּן־נְבָ֔ט וּכְבֵ֖ית בַּעְשָׁ֣א בֶן־אֲחִיָּ֑ה אֶל־הַכַּ֙עַס֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר הִכְעַ֔סְתָּ וַֽתַּחֲטִ֖א אֶת־יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated: And I will make your house like the House of Jeroboam son of Nebat and like the House of Baasha son of Ahijah, because of the provocation you have caused by leading Israel to sin.
Transliteration: venatatiy et-veytekha kheveyt yarׇveam ven-nevat ukheveyt vaesha ven-achiyah el-hakhaas asher hikheaseta vatachati et-yisherael

Hebrew: וְגַ֨ם־לְאִיזֶ֔בֶל דִּבֶּ֥ר יְהֹוָ֖ה לֵאמֹ֑ר הַכְּלָבִ֛ים יֹאכְל֥וּ אֶת־אִיזֶ֖בֶל בְּחֵ֥ל יִזְרְעֶֽאל׃
Translated: And G<small>OD</small> has also spoken concerning Jezebel: ‘The dogs shall devour Jezebel in the field of Jezreel.
Transliteration: vegam-leiyzevel diver yehovah lemor hakhelaviym yokhelu et-iyzevel vechel yizereel

Hebrew: הַמֵּ֤ת לְאַחְאָב֙ בָּעִ֔יר יֹאכְל֖וּ הַכְּלָבִ֑ים וְהַמֵּת֙ בַּשָּׂדֶ֔ה יֹאכְל֖וּ ע֥וֹף הַשָּׁמָֽיִם׃
Translated: All of Ahab’s line who die in the town shall be devoured by dogs, and all who die in the open country shall be devoured by the birds of the sky.’”
Transliteration: hamet leacheav vaiyr yokhelu hakhelaviym vehamet vashadeh yokhelu vof hashamayiim

Hebrew: רַ֚ק לֹא־הָיָ֣ה כְאַחְאָ֔ב אֲשֶׁ֣ר הִתְמַכֵּ֔ר לַעֲשׂ֥וֹת הָרַ֖ע בְּעֵינֵ֣י יְהֹוָ֑ה אֲשֶׁר־הֵסַ֥תָּה אֹת֖וֹ אִיזֶ֥בֶל אִשְׁתּֽוֹ׃
Translated: (Indeed, there never was anyone like Ahab, who committed himself to doing what was displeasing to G<small>OD</small>, at the instigation of his wife Jezebel.
Transliteration: rak lo-hayah kheacheav asher hitemakher laashvot hara veeyney yehovah asher-hesatah otvo iyzevel ishetvo

Hebrew: וַיַּתְעֵ֣ב מְאֹ֔ד לָלֶ֖כֶת אַחֲרֵ֣י הַגִּלֻּלִ֑ים כְּכֹל֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר עָשׂ֣וּ הָאֱמֹרִ֔י אֲשֶׁר֙ הוֹרִ֣ישׁ יְהֹוָ֔ה מִפְּנֵ֖י בְּנֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃ {פ}
Translated: He acted most abominably, straying after the fetishes just like the Amorites, whom G<small>OD</small> had dispossessed before the Israelites.)
Transliteration: vayateev meod lalekhet acharey hagiluliym khekhol asher ashu haemoriy asher hvoriysh yehovah mifeney veney yisherael {f}

Hebrew: וַיְהִי֩ כִשְׁמֹ֨עַ אַחְאָ֜ב אֶת־הַדְּבָרִ֤ים הָאֵ֙לֶּה֙ וַיִּקְרַ֣ע בְּגָדָ֔יו וַיָּשֶׂם־שַׂ֥ק עַל־בְּשָׂר֖וֹ וַיָּצ֑וֹם וַיִּשְׁכַּ֣ב בַּשָּׂ֔ק וַיְהַלֵּ֖ךְ אַֽט׃ {פ}
Translated: When Ahab heard these words, he rent his clothes and put sackcloth on his body. He fasted and lay in sackcloth and walked about subdued.
Transliteration: vayehiy khishemoa acheav et-hadevariym haeleh vayikera vegadayv vayashem-shak al-vesharvo vayatsvom vayishekhav vashak vayehalekhe at {f}

Hebrew: וַֽיְהִי֙ דְּבַר־יְהֹוָ֔ה אֶל־אֵלִיָּ֥הוּ הַתִּשְׁבִּ֖י לֵאמֹֽר׃
Translated: Then the word of G<small>OD</small> came to Elijah the Tishbite:
Transliteration: vayehiy devar-yehovah el-eliyahu hatisheviy lemor

Hebrew: הֲֽרָאִ֔יתָ כִּֽי־נִכְנַ֥ע אַחְאָ֖ב מִלְּפָנָ֑י יַ֜עַן כִּֽי־נִכְנַ֣ע מִפָּנַ֗י לֹֽא־אָבִ֤י הָרָעָה֙ בְּיָמָ֔יו בִּימֵ֣י בְנ֔וֹ אָבִ֥יא הָרָעָ֖ה עַל־בֵּיתֽוֹ׃
Translated: “Have you seen how Ahab has humbled himself before Me? Because he has humbled himself before Me, I will not bring the disaster in his lifetime; I will bring the disaster upon his house in his son’s time.”
Transliteration: haraiyta khiy-nikhena acheav milefanay yaan khiy-nikhena mifanay lo-aviy haraah veyamayv viymey venvo aviy haraah al-veytvo

Hebrew: וַיֵּשְׁב֖וּ שָׁלֹ֣שׁ שָׁנִ֑ים אֵ֚ין מִלְחָמָ֔ה בֵּ֥ין אֲרָ֖ם וּבֵ֥ין יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃ {פ}
Translated: There was a lull of three years, with no war between Aram and Israel.
Transliteration: vayeshevu shalosh shaniym eyn milechamah veyn aram uveyn yisherael {f}

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֖י בַּשָּׁנָ֣ה הַשְּׁלִישִׁ֑ית וַיֵּ֛רֶד יְהוֹשָׁפָ֥ט מֶלֶךְ־יְהוּדָ֖ה אֶל־מֶ֥לֶךְ יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated: In the third year, King Jehoshaphat of Judah came to visit the king of Israel.
Transliteration: vayehiy vashanah hasheliyshiyt vayered yehvoshafat melekhe-yehudah el-melekhe yisherael

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר מֶֽלֶךְ־יִשְׂרָאֵל֙ אֶל־עֲבָדָ֔יו הַיְדַעְתֶּ֕ם כִּי־לָ֖נוּ רָמֹ֣ת גִּלְעָ֑ד וַאֲנַ֣חְנוּ מַחְשִׁ֔ים מִקַּ֣חַת אֹתָ֔הּ מִיַּ֖ד מֶ֥לֶךְ אֲרָֽם׃
Translated: The king of Israel said to his courtiers, “You know that Ramoth-gilead belongs to us, and yet we do nothing to recover it from the hands of the king of Aram.”
Transliteration: vayomer melekhe-yisherael el-avadayv hayedaetem khiy-lanu ramot gilead vaanachenu macheshiym mikachat otah miyad melekhe aram

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֙אמֶר֙ אֶל־יְה֣וֹשָׁפָ֔ט הֲתֵלֵ֥ךְ אִתִּ֛י לַמִּלְחָמָ֖ה רָמֹ֣ת גִּלְעָ֑ד וַיֹּ֤אמֶר יְהֽוֹשָׁפָט֙ אֶל־מֶ֣לֶךְ יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל כָּמ֧וֹנִי כָמ֛וֹךָ כְּעַמִּ֥י כְעַמֶּ֖ךָ כְּסוּסַ֥י כְּסוּסֶֽיךָ׃
Translated: And he said to Jehoshaphat, “Will you come with me to battle at Ramoth-gilead?” Jehoshaphat answered the king of Israel, “I will do what you do; my troops shall be your troops, my horses shall be your horses.”
Transliteration: vayomer el-yehvoshafat hatelekhe itiy lamilechamah ramot gilead vayomer yehvoshafat el-melekhe yisherael khamvoniy khamvokha kheamiy kheamekha khesusay khesuseykha

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֥אמֶר יְהוֹשָׁפָ֖ט אֶל־מֶ֣לֶךְ יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל דְּרׇשׁ־נָ֥א כַיּ֖וֹם אֶת־דְּבַ֥ר יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: But Jehoshaphat said further to the king of Israel, “Please, first inquire of G<small>OD</small>.”
Transliteration: vayomer yehvoshafat el-melekhe yisherael derׇsh-na khayyvom et-devar yehovah

Hebrew: וַיִּקְבֹּ֨ץ מֶלֶךְ־יִשְׂרָאֵ֥ל אֶֽת־הַנְּבִיאִים֮ כְּאַרְבַּ֣ע מֵא֣וֹת אִישׁ֒ וַיֹּ֣אמֶר אֲלֵהֶ֗ם הַאֵלֵ֞ךְ עַל־רָמֹ֥ת גִּלְעָ֛ד לַמִּלְחָמָ֖ה אִם־אֶחְדָּ֑ל וַיֹּאמְר֣וּ עֲלֵ֔ה וְיִתֵּ֥ן אֲדֹנָ֖י בְּיַ֥ד הַמֶּֽלֶךְ׃
Translated: So the king of Israel gathered the prophets, about four hundred of them, and asked them, “Shall I march upon Ramoth-gilead for battle, or shall I not?” “March,” they said, “and the Sovereign will deliver it into Your Majesty’s hands.”
Transliteration: vayikevots melekhe-yisherael et-haneviyiym kheareva mevot iysh vayomer alehem haelekhe al-ramot gilead lamilechamah im-echedal vayomeru aleh veyiten adonay veyad hamelekhe

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֙אמֶר֙ יְה֣וֹשָׁפָ֔ט הַאֵ֨ין פֹּ֥ה נָבִ֛יא לַֽיהֹוָ֖ה ע֑וֹד וְנִדְרְשָׁ֖ה מֵאֹתֽוֹ׃
Translated: Then Jehoshaphat asked, “Isn’t there another prophet of G<small>OD</small> here through whom we can inquire?”
Transliteration: vayomer yehvoshafat haeyn foh naviy layhovah vod venidereshah meotvo

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר מֶלֶךְ־יִשְׂרָאֵ֣ל <small>׀</small> אֶֽל־יְהוֹשָׁפָ֡ט ע֣וֹד אִישׁ־אֶחָ֡ד לִדְרֹשׁ֩ אֶת־יְהֹוָ֨ה מֵאֹת֜וֹ וַאֲנִ֣י שְׂנֵאתִ֗יו כִּ֠י לֹא־יִתְנַבֵּ֨א עָלַ֥י טוֹב֙ כִּ֣י אִם־רָ֔ע מִיכָ֖יְהוּ בֶּן־יִמְלָ֑ה וַיֹּ֙אמֶר֙ יְה֣וֹשָׁפָ֔ט אַל־יֹאמַ֥ר הַמֶּ֖לֶךְ כֵּֽן׃
Translated: And the king of Israel answered Jehoshaphat, “There is one more through whom we can inquire of G<small>OD</small>; but I hate him, because he never prophesies anything good for me, but only misfortune—Micaiah son of Imlah.” But King Jehoshaphat said, “Don’t say that, Your Majesty.”
Transliteration: vayomer melekhe-yisherael <small></small> el-yehvoshafat vod iysh-echad liderosh et-yehovah meotvo vaaniy shenetiyv khiy lo-yitenave alay tvov khiy im-ra miykhayehu ven-yimelah vayomer yehvoshafat al-yomar hamelekhe khen

Hebrew: וַיִּקְרָא֙ מֶ֣לֶךְ יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל אֶל־סָרִ֖יס אֶחָ֑ד וַיֹּ֕אמֶר מַהֲרָ֖ה מִיכָ֥יְהוּ בֶן־יִמְלָֽה׃
Translated: So the king of Israel summoned an officer and said, “Bring Micaiah son of Imlah at once.”
Transliteration: vayikera melekhe yisherael el-sariys echad vayomer maharah miykhayehu ven-yimelah

Hebrew: וּמֶ֣לֶךְ יִשְׂרָאֵ֡ל וִיהוֹשָׁפָ֣ט מֶלֶךְ־יְהוּדָ֡ה יֹשְׁבִים֩ אִ֨ישׁ עַל־כִּסְא֜וֹ מְלֻבָּשִׁ֤ים בְּגָדִים֙ בְּגֹ֔רֶן פֶּ֖תַח שַׁ֣עַר שֹׁמְר֑וֹן וְכׇ֨ל־הַנְּבִיאִ֔ים מִֽתְנַבְּאִ֖ים לִפְנֵיהֶֽם׃
Translated: The king of Israel and King Jehoshaphat of Judah were seated on their thrones, arrayed in their robes, on the threshing floor at the entrance of the gate of Samaria; and all the prophets were prophesying before them.
Transliteration: umelekhe yisherael viyhvoshafat melekhe-yehudah yosheviym iysh al-khisevo meluvashiym vegadiym vegoren fetach shaar shomervon vekhׇl-haneviyiym mitenaveiym lifeneyhem

Hebrew: וַיַּ֥עַשׂ ל֛וֹ צִדְקִיָּ֥ה בֶֽן־כְּנַעֲנָ֖ה קַרְנֵ֣י בַרְזֶ֑ל וַיֹּ֙אמֶר֙ כֹּה־אָמַ֣ר יְהֹוָ֔ה בְּאֵ֛לֶּה תְּנַגַּ֥ח אֶת־אֲרָ֖ם עַד־כַּלֹּתָֽם׃
Translated: Zedekiah son of Chenaanah had provided himself with iron horns; and he said, “Thus said G<small>OD</small>: With these you shall gore the Arameans till you make an end of them.”
Transliteration: vayaash lvo tsidekiyah ven-khenaanah kareney varezel vayomer khoh-amar yehovah veeleh tenagach et-aram ad-khalotam

Hebrew: וְכׇ֨ל־הַנְּבִאִ֔ים נִבְּאִ֥ים כֵּ֖ן לֵאמֹ֑ר עֲלֵ֞ה רָמֹ֤ת גִּלְעָד֙ וְהַצְלַ֔ח וְנָתַ֥ן יְהֹוָ֖ה בְּיַ֥ד הַמֶּֽלֶךְ׃
Translated: And all the other prophets were prophesying similarly, “March upon Ramoth-gilead and triumph! G<small>OD</small> will deliver it into Your Majesty’s hands.”
Transliteration: vekhׇl-haneviiym niveiym khen lemor aleh ramot gilead vehatselach venatan yehovah veyad hamelekhe

Hebrew: וְהַמַּלְאָ֞ךְ אֲשֶׁר־הָלַ֣ךְ ׀ לִקְרֹ֣א מִיכָ֗יְהוּ דִּבֶּ֤ר אֵלָיו֙ לֵאמֹ֔ר הִנֵּה־נָ֞א דִּבְרֵ֧י הַנְּבִיאִ֛ים פֶּה־אֶחָ֥ד ט֖וֹב אֶל־הַמֶּ֑לֶךְ יְהִי־נָ֣א (דבריך) [דְבָרְךָ֗] כִּדְבַ֛ר אַחַ֥ד מֵהֶ֖ם וְדִבַּ֥רְתָּ טּֽוֹב׃
Translated: The messenger who had gone to summon Micaiah said to him: “Look, the words of the prophets are with one accord favorable to the king. Let your word be like that of the rest of them; speak a favorable word.”
Transliteration: vehamaleakhe asher-halakhe likero miykhayehu diver elayv lemor hineh-na diverey haneviyiym feh-echad tvov el-hamelekhe yehiy-na (dvrykh) [devarekha] khidevar achad mehem vedivareta tvov

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֖אמֶר מִיכָ֑יְהוּ חַי־יְהֹוָ֕ה כִּ֠י אֶת־אֲשֶׁ֨ר יֹאמַ֧ר יְהֹוָ֛ה אֵלַ֖י אֹת֥וֹ אֲדַבֵּֽר׃
Translated: “As G<small>OD</small> lives,” Micaiah answered, “I will speak only what G<small>OD</small> tells me.”
Transliteration: vayomer miykhayehu chay-yehovah khiy et-asher yomar yehovah elay otvo adaver

Hebrew: וַיָּבוֹא֮ אֶל־הַמֶּ֒לֶךְ֒ וַיֹּ֨אמֶר הַמֶּ֜לֶךְ אֵלָ֗יו מִיכָ֙יְהוּ֙ הֲנֵלֵ֞ךְ אֶל־רָמֹ֥ת גִּלְעָ֛ד לַמִּלְחָמָ֖ה אִם־נֶחְדָּ֑ל וַיֹּ֤אמֶר אֵלָיו֙ עֲלֵ֣ה וְהַצְלַ֔ח וְנָתַ֥ן יְהֹוָ֖ה בְּיַ֥ד הַמֶּֽלֶךְ׃
Translated: When he came before the king, the king said to him, “Micaiah, shall we march upon Ramoth-gilead for battle, or shall we not?” He answered him, “March and triumph! G<small>OD</small> will deliver [it] into Your Majesty’s hands.”
Transliteration: vayavvo el-hamelekhe vayomer hamelekhe elayv miykhayehu hanelekhe el-ramot gilead lamilechamah im-nechedal vayomer elayv aleh vehatselach venatan yehovah veyad hamelekhe

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר אֵלָיו֙ הַמֶּ֔לֶךְ עַד־כַּמֶּ֥ה פְעָמִ֖ים אֲנִ֣י מַשְׁבִּיעֶ֑ךָ אֲ֠שֶׁ֠ר לֹֽא־תְדַבֵּ֥ר אֵלַ֛י רַק־אֱמֶ֖ת בְּשֵׁ֥ם יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: The king said to him, “How many times must I adjure you to tell me nothing but the truth in the name of G<small>OD</small>?”
Transliteration: vayomer elayv hamelekhe ad-khameh feamiym aniy masheviyekha asher lo-tedaver elay rak-emet veshem yehovah

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֗אמֶר רָאִ֤יתִי אֶת־כׇּל־יִשְׂרָאֵל֙ נְפֹצִ֣ים אֶל־הֶהָרִ֔ים כַּצֹּ֕אן אֲשֶׁ֥ר אֵין־לָהֶ֖ם רֹעֶ֑ה וַיֹּ֤אמֶר יְהֹוָה֙ לֹֽא־אֲדֹנִ֣ים לָאֵ֔לֶּה יָשׁ֥וּבוּ אִישׁ־לְבֵית֖וֹ בְּשָׁלֽוֹם׃
Translated: Then he said, “I saw all Israel scattered over the hills like sheep without a shepherd; and G<small>OD</small> said, ‘These have no master; let everyone return home in safety.’”
Transliteration: vayomer raiytiy et-khׇl-yisherael nefotsiym el-hehariym khatson asher eyn-lahem roeh vayomer yehovah lo-adoniym laeleh yashuvu iysh-leveytvo veshalvom

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֥אמֶר מֶלֶךְ־יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל אֶל־יְהוֹשָׁפָ֑ט הֲלוֹא֙ אָמַ֣רְתִּי אֵלֶ֔יךָ לוֹא־יִתְנַבֵּ֥א עָלַ֛י ט֖וֹב כִּ֥י אִם־רָֽע׃ {ס}
Translated: “Didn’t I tell you,” said the king of Israel to Jehoshaphat, “that he would not prophesy good fortune for me, but only misfortune?”
Transliteration: vayomer melekhe-yisherael el-yehvoshafat halvo amaretiy eleykha lvo-yitenave alay tvov khiy im-ra {s}

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֕אמֶר לָכֵ֖ן שְׁמַ֣ע דְּבַר־יְהֹוָ֑ה רָאִ֤יתִי אֶת־יְהֹוָה֙ יֹשֵׁ֣ב עַל־כִּסְא֔וֹ וְכׇל־צְבָ֤א הַשָּׁמַ֙יִם֙ עֹמֵ֣ד עָלָ֔יו מִֽימִינ֖וֹ וּמִשְּׂמֹאלֽוֹ׃
Translated: But [Micaiah] said, “I call upon you to hear the word of G<small>OD</small>! I saw G<small>OD</small> seated upon a throne, with all the host of heaven standing in attendance to the right and to the left.
Transliteration: vayomer lakhen shema devar-yehovah raiytiy et-yehovah yoshev al-khisevo vekhׇl-tseva hashamayiim omed alayv miymiynvo umishemolvo

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר יְהֹוָ֗ה מִ֤י יְפַתֶּה֙ אֶת־אַחְאָ֔ב וְיַ֕עַל וְיִפֹּ֖ל בְּרָמֹ֣ת גִּלְעָ֑ד וַיֹּ֤אמֶר זֶה֙ בְּכֹ֔ה וְזֶ֥ה אֹמֵ֖ר בְּכֹֽה׃
Translated: G<small>OD</small> asked, ‘Who will entice Ahab so that he will march and fall at Ramoth-gilead?’ Then one said thus and another said thus,
Transliteration: vayomer yehovah miy yefateh et-acheav veyaal veyifol veramot gilead vayomer zeh vekhoh vezeh omer vekhoh

Hebrew: וַיֵּצֵ֣א הָר֗וּחַ וַֽיַּעֲמֹד֙ לִפְנֵ֣י יְהֹוָ֔ה וַיֹּ֖אמֶר אֲנִ֣י אֲפַתֶּ֑נּוּ וַיֹּ֧אמֶר יְהֹוָ֛ה אֵלָ֖יו בַּמָּֽה׃
Translated: until a certain spirit came forward and stood before G<small>OD</small> and said, ‘I will entice him.’ ‘How?’ G<small>OD</small> asked him.
Transliteration: vayetse harucha vayaamod lifeney yehovah vayomer aniy afatenu vayomer yehovah elayv vamah

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֗אמֶר אֵצֵא֙ וְהָיִ֙יתִי֙ ר֣וּחַ שֶׁ֔קֶר בְּפִ֖י כׇּל־נְבִיאָ֑יו וַיֹּ֗אמֶר תְּפַתֶּה֙ וְגַם־תּוּכָ֔ל צֵ֖א וַעֲשֵׂה־כֵֽן׃
Translated: And he replied, ‘I will go out and be a lying spirit in the mouth of all his prophets.’ Then [God] said, ‘You will entice and you will prevail. Go out and do it.’
Transliteration: vayomer etse vehayiytiy rucha sheker vefiy khׇl-neviyayv vayomer tefateh vegam-tukhal tse vaasheh-khen

Hebrew: וְעַתָּ֗ה הִנֵּ֨ה נָתַ֤ן יְהֹוָה֙ ר֣וּחַ שֶׁ֔קֶר בְּפִ֖י כׇּל־נְבִיאֶ֣יךָ אֵ֑לֶּה וַֽיהֹוָ֔ה דִּבֶּ֥ר עָלֶ֖יךָ רָעָֽה׃
Translated: So G<small>OD</small> has put a lying spirit in the mouth of all these prophets of yours; for G<small>OD</small> has decreed disaster upon you.”
Transliteration: veatah hineh natan yehovah rucha sheker vefiy khׇl-neviyeykha eleh vayhovah diver aleykha raah

Hebrew: וַיִּגַּשׁ֙ צִדְקִיָּ֣הוּ בֶֽן־כְּנַעֲנָ֔ה וַיַּכֶּ֥ה אֶת־מִיכָ֖יְהוּ עַל־הַלֶּ֑חִי וַיֹּ֕אמֶר אֵי־זֶ֨ה עָבַ֧ר רֽוּחַ־יְהֹוָ֛ה מֵאִתִּ֖י לְדַבֵּ֥ר אוֹתָֽךְ׃
Translated: Thereupon Zedekiah son of Chenaanah stepped up and struck Micaiah on the cheek, and demanded, “Which way did the spirit of G<small>OD</small> pass from me to speak with you?”
Transliteration: vayigash tsidekiyahu ven-khenaanah vayakheh et-miykhayehu al-halechiy vayomer ey-zeh avar rucha-yehovah meitiy ledaver votakhe

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר מִיכָ֔יְהוּ הִנְּךָ֥ רֹאֶ֖ה בַּיּ֣וֹם הַה֑וּא אֲשֶׁ֥ר תָּבֹ֛א חֶ֥דֶר בְּחֶ֖דֶר לְהֵחָבֵֽה׃
Translated: And Micaiah replied, “You’ll find out on the day when you try to hide in the innermost room.”
Transliteration: vayomer miykhayehu hinekha roeh vayyvom hahu asher tavo cheder vecheder lehechaveh

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֙אמֶר֙ מֶ֣לֶךְ יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל קַ֚ח אֶת־מִיכָ֔יְהוּ וַהֲשִׁיבֵ֖הוּ אֶל־אָמֹ֣ן שַׂר־הָעִ֑יר וְאֶל־יוֹאָ֖שׁ בֶּן־הַמֶּֽלֶךְ׃
Translated: Then the king of Israel said, “Take Micaiah and turn him over to Amon, the city’s governor, and to Prince Joash,
Transliteration: vayomer melekhe yisherael kach et-miykhayehu vahashiyvehu el-amon shar-haiyr veel-yvoash ven-hamelekhe

Hebrew: וְאָמַרְתָּ֗ כֹּ֚ה אָמַ֣ר הַמֶּ֔לֶךְ שִׂ֥ימוּ אֶת־זֶ֖ה בֵּ֣ית הַכֶּ֑לֶא וְהַאֲכִלֻ֜הוּ לֶ֤חֶם לַ֙חַץ֙ וּמַ֣יִם לַ֔חַץ עַ֖ד בֹּאִ֥י בְשָׁלֽוֹם׃
Translated: and say, ‘The king’s orders are: Put this fellow in prison, and let his fare be scant bread and scant water until I come home safe.’”
Transliteration: veamareta khoh amar hamelekhe shiymu et-zeh veyt hakhele vehaakhiluhu lechem lachats umayiim lachats ad voiy veshalvom

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר מִיכָ֔יְהוּ אִם־שׁ֤וֹב תָּשׁוּב֙ בְּשָׁל֔וֹם לֹא־דִבֶּ֥ר יְהֹוָ֖ה בִּ֑י וַיֹּ֕אמֶר שִׁמְע֖וּ עַמִּ֥ים כֻּלָּֽם׃
Translated: To which Micaiah retorted, “If you ever come home safe, G<small>OD</small> has not spoken through me.” He said further, “Listen, all you peoples!”
Transliteration: vayomer miykhayehu im-shvov tashuv veshalvom lo-diver yehovah viy vayomer shimeu amiym khulam

Hebrew: וַיַּ֧עַל מֶלֶךְ־יִשְׂרָאֵ֛ל וִיהוֹשָׁפָ֥ט מֶלֶךְ־יְהוּדָ֖ה רָמֹ֥ת גִּלְעָֽד׃
Translated: So the king of Israel and King Jehoshaphat of Judah marched upon Ramoth-gilead.
Transliteration: vayaal melekhe-yisherael viyhvoshafat melekhe-yehudah ramot gilead

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֩אמֶר֩ מֶ֨לֶךְ יִשְׂרָאֵ֜ל אֶל־יְהוֹשָׁפָ֗ט הִתְחַפֵּשׂ֙ וָבֹ֣א בַמִּלְחָמָ֔ה וְאַתָּ֖ה לְבַ֣שׁ בְּגָדֶ֑יךָ וַיִּתְחַפֵּשׂ֙ מֶ֣לֶךְ יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל וַיָּב֖וֹא בַּמִּלְחָמָֽה׃
Translated: The king of Israel said to Jehoshaphat, “I will disguise myself and go into the battle; but you, wear your robes.” So the king of Israel went into the battle disguised.
Transliteration: vayomer melekhe yisherael el-yehvoshafat hitechafesh vavo vamilechamah veatah levash vegadeykha vayitechafesh melekhe yisherael vayavvo vamilechamah

Hebrew: וּמֶ֣לֶךְ אֲרָ֡ם צִוָּ֣ה אֶת־שָׂרֵי֩ הָרֶ֨כֶב אֲשֶׁר־ל֜וֹ שְׁלֹשִׁ֤ים וּשְׁנַ֙יִם֙ לֵאמֹ֔ר לֹ֚א תִּלָּ֣חֲמ֔וּ אֶת־קָטֹ֖ן וְאֶת־גָּד֑וֹל כִּ֛י אִֽם־אֶת־מֶ֥לֶךְ יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל לְבַדּֽוֹ׃
Translated: Now the king of Aram had instructed his thirty-two chariot officers: “Don’t attack anyone, small or great, except the king of Israel.”
Transliteration: umelekhe aram tsivah et-sharey harekhev asher-lvo sheloshiym ushenayiim lemor lo tilachamu et-katon veet-gadvol khiy im-et-melekhe yisherael levadvo

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֡י כִּרְאוֹת֩ שָׂרֵ֨י הָרֶ֜כֶב אֶת־יְהוֹשָׁפָ֗ט וְהֵ֤מָּה אָֽמְרוּ֙ אַ֣ךְ מֶלֶךְ־יִשְׂרָאֵ֣ל ה֔וּא וַיָּסֻ֥רוּ עָלָ֖יו לְהִלָּחֵ֑ם וַיִּזְעַ֖ק יְהוֹשָׁפָֽט׃
Translated: So when the chariot officers saw Jehoshaphat, whom they took for the king of Israel, they turned upon him to attack him, and Jehoshaphat cried out.
Transliteration: vayehiy khirevot sharey harekhev et-yehvoshafat vehemah ameru akhe melekhe-yisherael hu vayasuru alayv lehilachem vayizeak yehvoshafat

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֗י כִּרְאוֹת֙ שָׂרֵ֣י הָרֶ֔כֶב כִּי־לֹא־מֶ֥לֶךְ יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל ה֑וּא וַיָּשׁ֖וּבוּ מֵאַחֲרָֽיו׃
Translated: And when the chariot officers became aware that he was not the king of Israel, they turned back from pursuing him.
Transliteration: vayehiy khirevot sharey harekhev khiy-lo-melekhe yisherael hu vayashuvu meacharayv

Hebrew: וְאִ֗ישׁ מָשַׁ֤ךְ בַּקֶּ֙שֶׁת֙ לְתֻמּ֔וֹ וַיַּכֶּה֙ אֶת־מֶ֣לֶךְ יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל בֵּ֥ין הַדְּבָקִ֖ים וּבֵ֣ין הַשִּׁרְיָ֑ן וַיֹּ֣אמֶר לְרַכָּב֗וֹ הֲפֹ֥ךְ יָדְךָ֛ וְהוֹצִיאֵ֥נִי מִן־הַֽמַּחֲנֶ֖ה כִּ֥י הׇחֳלֵֽיתִי׃
Translated: Then another man drew his bow at random and he hit the king of Israel between the plates of the armor; and he said to his charioteer, “Turn the horses around and get me behind the lines; I’m wounded.”
Transliteration: veiysh mashakhe vakeshet letumvo vayakheh et-melekhe yisherael veyn hadevakiym uveyn hashireyan vayomer lerakhavvo hafokhe yadekha vehvotsiyeniy min-hamachaneh khiy hׇcholeytiy

Hebrew: וַתַּעֲלֶ֤ה הַמִּלְחָמָה֙ בַּיּ֣וֹם הַה֔וּא וְהַמֶּ֗לֶךְ הָיָ֧ה מׇעֳמָ֛ד בַּמֶּרְכָּבָ֖ה נֹ֣כַח אֲרָ֑ם וַיָּ֣מׇת בָּעֶ֔רֶב וַיִּ֥צֶק דַּֽם־הַמַּכָּ֖ה אֶל־חֵ֥יק הָרָֽכֶב׃
Translated: The battle raged all day long, and the king remained propped up in the chariot facing Aram; the blood from the wound ran down into the hollow of the chariot, and at dusk he died.
Transliteration: vataaleh hamilechamah vayyvom hahu vehamelekhe hayah mׇomad vamerekhavah nokhach aram vayamׇt vaerev vayitsek dam-hamakhah el-cheyk harakhev

Hebrew: וַיַּעֲבֹ֤ר הָֽרִנָּה֙ בַּֽמַּחֲנֶ֔ה כְּבֹ֥א הַשֶּׁ֖מֶשׁ לֵאמֹ֑ר אִ֥ישׁ אֶל־עִיר֖וֹ וְאִ֥ישׁ אֶל־אַרְצֽוֹ׃
Translated: As the sun was going down, a shout went through the army: “Every man to his own town! Every man to his own district.”
Transliteration: vayaavor harinah vamachaneh khevo hashemesh lemor iysh el-iyrvo veiysh el-aretsvo

Hebrew: וַיָּ֣מׇת הַמֶּ֔לֶךְ וַיָּב֖וֹא שֹׁמְר֑וֹן וַיִּקְבְּר֥וּ אֶת־הַמֶּ֖לֶךְ בְּשֹׁמְרֽוֹן׃
Translated: So the king died and was brought to Samaria. They buried the king in Samaria,
Transliteration: vayamׇt hamelekhe vayavvo shomervon vayikeveru et-hamelekhe veshomervon

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׁטֹ֨ף אֶת־הָרֶ֜כֶב עַ֣ל ׀ בְּרֵכַ֣ת שֹׁמְר֗וֹן וַיָּלֹ֤קּוּ הַכְּלָבִים֙ אֶת־דָּמ֔וֹ וְהַזֹּנ֖וֹת רָחָ֑צוּ כִּדְבַ֥ר יְהֹוָ֖ה אֲשֶׁ֥ר דִּבֵּֽר׃
Translated: and they flushed out the chariot at the pool of Samaria. Thus the dogs lapped up his blood and the whores bathed [in it], in accordance with the word that G<small>OD</small> had spoken.
Transliteration: vayishetof et-harekhev al verekhat shomervon vayaloku hakhelaviym et-damvo vehazonvot rachatsu khidevar yehovah asher diver

Hebrew: וְיֶ֩תֶר֩ דִּבְרֵ֨י אַחְאָ֜ב וְכׇל־אֲשֶׁ֣ר עָשָׂ֗ה וּבֵ֤ית הַשֵּׁן֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר בָּנָ֔ה וְכׇל־הֶעָרִ֖ים אֲשֶׁ֣ר בָּנָ֑ה הֲלוֹא־הֵ֣ם כְּתוּבִ֗ים עַל־סֵ֛פֶר דִּבְרֵ֥י הַיָּמִ֖ים לְמַלְכֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated: The other events of Ahab’s reign, and all his actions—the ivory palace that he built and all the towns that he fortified—are all recorded in the Annals of the Kings of Israel.
Transliteration: veyeter diverey acheav vekhׇl-asher ashah uveyt hashen asher vanah vekhׇl-heariym asher vanah halvo-hem khetuviym al-sefer diverey hayamiym lemalekhey yisherael

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׁכַּ֥ב אַחְאָ֖ב עִם־אֲבֹתָ֑יו וַיִּמְלֹ֛ךְ אֲחַזְיָ֥הוּ בְנ֖וֹ תַּחְתָּֽיו׃ {פ}
Translated: Ahab rested with his ancestors, and his son Ahaziah succeeded him as king.
Transliteration: vayishekhav acheav im-avotayv vayimelokhe achazeyahu venvo tachetayv {f}

Hebrew: וִיהֽוֹשָׁפָט֙ בֶּן־אָסָ֔א מָלַ֖ךְ עַל־יְהוּדָ֑ה בִּשְׁנַ֣ת אַרְבַּ֔ע לְאַחְאָ֖ב מֶ֥לֶךְ יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated: Jehoshaphat son of Asa had become king of Judah in the fourth year of King Ahab of Israel.
Transliteration: viyhvoshafat ven-asa malakhe al-yehudah vishenat areva leacheav melekhe yisherael

Hebrew: יְהוֹשָׁפָ֗ט בֶּן־שְׁלֹשִׁ֨ים וְחָמֵ֤שׁ שָׁנָה֙ בְּמׇלְכ֔וֹ וְעֶשְׂרִ֤ים וְחָמֵשׁ֙ שָׁנָ֔ה מָלַ֖ךְ בִּירוּשָׁלָ֑͏ִם וְשֵׁ֣ם אִמּ֔וֹ עֲזוּבָ֖ה בַּת־שִׁלְחִֽי׃
Translated: Jehoshaphat was thirty-five years old when he became king, and he reigned in Jerusalem for twenty-five years. His mother’s name was Azubah daughter of Shilhi.
Transliteration: yehvoshafat ven-sheloshiym vechamesh shanah vemׇlekhvo veesheriym vechamesh shanah malakhe viyrushala͏im veshem imvo azuvah vat-shilechiy

Hebrew: וַיֵּ֗לֶךְ בְּכׇל־דֶּ֛רֶךְ אָסָ֥א אָבִ֖יו לֹא־סָ֣ר מִמֶּ֑נּוּ לַעֲשׂ֥וֹת הַיָּשָׁ֖ר בְּעֵינֵ֥י יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: He followed closely the course of his father Asa and did not deviate from it, doing what was pleasing to G<small>OD</small>.
Transliteration: vayelekhe vekhׇl-derekhe asa aviyv lo-sar mimenu laashvot hayashar veeyney yehovah

Hebrew: אַ֥ךְ הַבָּמ֖וֹת לֹא־סָ֑רוּ ע֥וֹד הָעָ֛ם מְזַבְּחִ֥ים וּֽמְקַטְּרִ֖ים בַּבָּמֽוֹת׃
Translated: However, the shrines did not cease to function; the people still sacrificed and offered at the shrines.
Transliteration: akhe havamvot lo-saru vod haam mezavechiym umekateriym vavamvot

Hebrew: וַיַּשְׁלֵ֥ם יְהוֹשָׁפָ֖ט עִם־מֶ֥לֶךְ יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated: And further, Jehoshaphat submitted to the king of Israel.
Transliteration: vayashelem yehvoshafat im-melekhe yisherael

Hebrew: וְיֶ֨תֶר דִּבְרֵ֧י יְהוֹשָׁפָ֛ט וּגְבוּרָת֥וֹ אֲשֶׁר־עָשָׂ֖ה וַאֲשֶׁ֣ר נִלְחָ֑ם הֲלֹא־הֵ֣ם כְּתוּבִ֗ים עַל־סֵ֛פֶר דִּבְרֵ֥י הַיָּמִ֖ים לְמַלְכֵ֥י יְהוּדָֽה׃
Translated: As for the other events of Jehoshaphat’s reign and the valor he displayed in battle, they are recorded in the Annals of the Kings of Judah.
Transliteration: veyeter diverey yehvoshafat ugevuratvo asher-ashah vaasher nilecham halo-hem khetuviym al-sefer diverey hayamiym lemalekhey yehudah

Hebrew: וְיֶ֙תֶר֙ הַקָּדֵ֔שׁ אֲשֶׁ֣ר נִשְׁאַ֔ר בִּימֵ֖י אָסָ֣א אָבִ֑יו בִּעֵ֖ר מִן־הָאָֽרֶץ׃
Translated: (He also stamped out the remaining consecrated workers who had survived in the land from the time of his father Asa.)
Transliteration: veyeter hakadesh asher nishear viymey asa aviyv vier min-haarets

Hebrew: וּמֶ֥לֶךְ אֵ֛ין בֶּאֱד֖וֹם נִצָּ֥ב מֶֽלֶךְ׃
Translated: There was no king in Edom; a viceroy acted as king.
Transliteration: umelekhe eyn veedvom nitsav melekhe

Hebrew: יְהוֹשָׁפָ֡ט (עשר) [עָשָׂה֩] אֳנִיּ֨וֹת תַּרְשִׁ֜ישׁ לָלֶ֧כֶת אֹפִ֛ירָה לַזָּהָ֖ב וְלֹ֣א הָלָ֑ךְ כִּֽי־[נִשְׁבְּר֥וּ] (נשברה) אֳנִיּ֖וֹת בְּעֶצְי֥וֹן גָּֽבֶר׃
Translated: Jehoshaphat constructed Tarshish ships to sail to Ophir for gold. But he did not sail because the ships were wrecked at Ezion-geber.
Transliteration: yehvoshafat (shr) [ashah] oniyyvot tareshiysh lalekhet ofiyrah lazahav velo halakhe khiy-[nisheveru] (nshvrh) oniyyvot veetseyvon gaver

Hebrew: אָ֠ז אָמַ֞ר אֲחַזְיָ֤הוּ בֶן־אַחְאָב֙ אֶל־יְה֣וֹשָׁפָ֔ט יֵלְכ֧וּ עֲבָדַ֛י עִם־עֲבָדֶ֖יךָ בׇּאֳנִיּ֑וֹת וְלֹ֥א אָבָ֖ה יְהוֹשָׁפָֽט׃
Translated: Then Ahaziah son of Ahab proposed to Jehoshaphat, “Let my servants sail on the ships with your servants”; but Jehoshaphat would not agree.
Transliteration: az amar achazeyahu ven-acheav el-yehvoshafat eilekhu avaday im-avadeykha vׇoniyyvot velo avah yehvoshafat

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׁכַּ֤ב יְהוֹשָׁפָט֙ עִם־אֲבֹתָ֔יו וַיִּקָּבֵר֙ עִם־אֲבֹתָ֔יו בְּעִ֖יר דָּוִ֣ד אָבִ֑יו וַיִּמְלֹ֛ךְ יְהוֹרָ֥ם בְּנ֖וֹ תַּחְתָּֽיו׃ {ס}
Translated: Jehoshaphat rested with his ancestors and was buried with his ancestors in the city of his forefather David, and his son Jehoram succeeded him as king.
Transliteration: vayishekhav yehvoshafat im-avotayv vayikaver im-avotayv veiyr david aviyv vayimelokhe yehvoram venvo tachetayv {s}

Hebrew: אֲחַזְיָ֣הוּ בֶן־אַחְאָ֗ב מָלַ֤ךְ עַל־יִשְׂרָאֵל֙ בְּשֹׁ֣מְר֔וֹן בִּשְׁנַת֙ שְׁבַ֣ע עֶשְׂרֵ֔ה לִיהוֹשָׁפָ֖ט מֶ֣לֶךְ יְהוּדָ֑ה וַיִּמְלֹ֥ךְ עַל־יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל שְׁנָתָֽיִם׃
Translated: [Meanwhile,] Ahaziah son of Ahab had become king of Israel, in Samaria, in the seventeenth year of King Jehoshaphat of Judah; he reigned over Israel two years.
Transliteration: achazeyahu ven-acheav malakhe al-yisherael veshomervon vishenat sheva eshereh liyhvoshafat melekhe yehudah vayimelokhe al-yisherael shenatayiim

Hebrew: וַיַּ֥עַשׂ הָרַ֖ע בְּעֵינֵ֣י יְהֹוָ֑ה וַיֵּ֗לֶךְ בְּדֶ֤רֶךְ אָבִיו֙ וּבְדֶ֣רֶךְ אִמּ֔וֹ וּבְדֶ֙רֶךְ֙ יָרׇבְעָ֣ם בֶּן־נְבָ֔ט אֲשֶׁ֥ר הֶחֱטִ֖יא אֶת־יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated: He did what was displeasing to G<small>OD</small>, following in the footsteps of his father and his mother, and in those of Jeroboam son of Nebat who had caused Israel to sin.
Transliteration: vayaash hara veeyney yehovah vayelekhe vederekhe aviyv uvederekhe imvo uvederekhe yarׇveam ven-nevat asher hechetiy et-yisherael

Hebrew: וַֽיַּעֲבֹד֙ אֶת־הַבַּ֔עַל וַיִּֽשְׁתַּחֲוֶ֖ה ל֑וֹ וַיַּכְעֵ֗ס אֶת־יְהֹוָה֙ אֱלֹהֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל כְּכֹ֥ל אֲשֶׁר־עָשָׂ֖ה אָבִֽיו׃
Translated: He worshiped Baal and bowed down to him; he provoked the anger of the E<small>TERNAL</small>, the God of Israel, just as his father had done.
Transliteration: vayaavod et-havaal vayishetachaveh lvo vayakhees et-yehovah elohey yisherael khekhol asher-ashah aviyv
